Name: Michael Simonton
Comment: Professor Simonton's ANT 201 is the easiest class you will ever take. Class attendance is not required. The class discussions and ePaper are graded on completion. The Exam questions and answers are posted word for word on study guides, and these exams are taken online. Do not pass up the opportunity for an 100 in your GPA.

Easiest class I have taken so far. This was online and I probably spent 10 mins per discussion and an hour max preparing and taking each exam. The study guides are identical to the exam so if you study them you should get a 100% without an issue. Simonton clearly cares about what he teaches and is passionate about students.

TAKE TAKE TAKE. Easy GEN-ED, Simonton is a very great professor. His tests and quizzes are very easy and he has study guides that help a lot. You would be hurting yourself if you didn't take his class.
He is very passionate about his subjects, but every class is just lecturing, which can get pretty boring. Most people don't show up to class, tests and coursework are very easy, and he is funny.

I LOVE HIM! I had him first semester and I have him again this semester. He's very passionate about the content of lectures and very engaging. He is absolutely hilarious and always finds a way to relate to our humor. His class is an easy A as long as you use the notes he puts on canvas :)
One of the best professors at NKU.

Honestly, even the "show up and pass" is an overestimation of how easy his class is. He gives the students the option to learn the course material or not. He gives you all the tools and information to learn, but he also will give you an A if you don't even do more than an hour of work for the class.

This professor is great! First, he gives extra credits if number of people in the class is less then 15 people. ( I got 100 extra credit points thanks to this, it's equal to "writing assignment"). Before every exam he give study guide or condensed notes which is copy paste of actual exam. You just have to remember what on those notes. He is great!

Took this class online, was the easiest class on my schedule all semester. At your own pace all you have to do is take 3 quizzes which are all on Quizlet. And there is one research are which was cake I got a 100. easiest gen ed I've taken. high recommend if you want an easy A and credit.

I took this class cause I needed another class to add to be full time. Professor Simonton responds quickly to emails and this class was graded by 3 exams and 1 paper. All exam questions are on quizlet. It says you need the book to read every week but I didnt read anything out of the book and still ended up with an A.
He is a great professor and the class was very interesting!

Dr. Simonton is an amazing professor! His lectures are so interesting, and you only really need the book for personal study. Just show up and take notes and you'll pass. His review days before the exam are great too! You'd be fine if you only attended those, though attendance is an extra-credit opportunity.
I had this class online. The review material really helps when taking an exam. Also, had interesting topics for the one paper we had to do. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

If you show up to class and there are less than 15% of students, you get extra credit. I ended with a 105% . He is a sweet older guy and very nice and caring. The class period before an exam he give the answers to the test, reads questions off the test mostly in order.

It was a super easy class, though his grading method is weird. I am yet to receive my final grade, but I got a 100% on two/three assignments and a 98% on the other because it was so easy. Just do the work and dont stress too much like I did! He also responds to questions super fast. A textbook was a requirement but I did not buy it.

I LOVE HIM! He is HILARIOUS! Class is so easy; he gives more extra credit than any professor I've had; he goes over and all but gives you the answers to the test. The content is actually interesting (sometimes - cash crops were NOT) and his explantions are well thought out and funny. I thoroughly enjoyed this class and reccommend it.
He was a great easy teacher.

Dr. Simonton is amazing!! He's so down-to-earth and he's super funny. Lectures are pretty interesting and he knows a lot of random interesting information that he slips into his lectures. Super kind, 100000% recommend taking his classes!!
He was amazing and I learned a lot from him. There aren't many assignments so you need to be on top of things otherwise you can fail easily.
His lectures are pretty boring and used the ENTIRE 30 minutes. As long as you show up on the review days you will pass the class. Easiest class that Ive ever had.

Name: Charlie Roetting
Comment: I CANT DESCRIBE THE LOVE I HAVE FOR THIS MAN  he is the best professor at NKU hes hilarious and Im taking TAR110 now and I look forward to it every day I love the class so much even tho it was online he made the best out of it

Charlie's class was honestly the best part of my week. If you show up, do the work, and try your best, you'll do well. I am not an actress and have since left the theater department, but I still learned a lot about myself as a writer and director in his class. He genuinely cares about his students and I would highly recommend him.

I have since changed my major, but I had Charlie for a lot of classes my freshmen and sophomore year. He was always very caring, hilarious, and made me want to be not only a better actor, but a better person. Sometimes I think I majored in MT just to have him as a professor because he was that great.

Show up and put real thought into your participation and you'll be fine. Professor Roetting was one of my favorite instructors as a freshman and every now and then I'll see him at the place where I work- he still remembers me! I learned so many valuable things that will take me far as an actress; his lectures are in-depth, inspirational, and funny.

Being a theatre major but not at all an actor, Charlie took that into account and still made the class easy. Probably one of the easiest, most fun classes you could take, and he's hilarious! He has a million stories to tell, and he's a really great person. The only assignments were seeing 3 NKU shows, a midterm monologue, and a final scene.

Very easy course, and Charlie tries to make every student feel comfortable in class. The only purchases required were mandatory tickets to see plays. Only a handful of assignments all semester, but most were based on participation.
this is a great man

Charlie is a great guy. He was very forgiving for my attendance and homework assignments due to a special circumstance. Not only that, but is class was always fun and engaging. Even though I am a CIT major, I enjoyed his class a lot and it did reignite a spark for acting I forgot about. PLEASE take this instead of public speaking, way better 100%.

Charlie was amazing! I enjoyed going to his classes, he is easy to talk to, understanding, funny, and overall a really good professor. We had a decent amount of work, but it wasn't overwhelming at all.. mostly small papers/responses to plays. I would definitely take his class again.
Charlie is by far one of my favorite professors. Just pay attention, be respectful, and be yourself and you will be good to go.
Great teacher
Charlie is one awesome dude. He gives great advice and tells great, super funny stories. Amazing professor for theatre and non-theatre majors.
I loved his teaching so much I made him my adviser!

He's a smart, funny, interesting professor, that has some amazing stories. If you have any problems with his class, college, or life in general he has some of the best advise you could get. He's really chill but make sure not to talk while he's taking. It's his pet peeve and also it's rude. Besides you defiantly wanna hear what he has to say.

This class requires to things to absolutely ace it: attendance and participation. You don't need to be enthusiastic, just show up and when he calls you follow along. It's mostly fun games with a couple assignments, a pretty easy class and very fun.

Great guy! Fun class, will challenge you appropriately to your level, great feedback, I could go on and on. I took this as a 9 AM and it was completely worth waking up early for.  Recommend for both Theatre and non-Theatre majors.

There's this new thing he did this semester, where you have to see or read 15 plays and write like a paragraph about it, it sounds hard but it's super easy. And he tells the best stories. If you get a chance, take as many of his classes as possible. When you do scenes he has the best advice. Great guy and easy to talk to!

Wonderfully talented and amazing professor. Has a vast world of experience and stories that are insightful and hilarious and he will share all of them with you. Respect his time and he will make the class go by so fast. Could not have had a better class!

Name: James Skaggs
Comment: super fun class and prof. lose points for uhm, like etc but this wasnt a big problem for me. 6 speechs, intro speech you introduce a random person in the class, 2 info 2 persuasive (any topic). last speech class picks topics and you randomly get one and have to give speech off top. there was supposed to be attendance grade be he didnt take it

Mandatory attendance and 6 total speeches. Easy grader on speeches, but the lectures leading up to speeches were brutal. Lectures were really stories he usually repeated, but they were very entertaining. Required to print a copy for him on speech day, but you could read straight from it if you wanted. 1 intro, 2 info, 2 pers. 1 impromptu.

Very nice and easy grading. But beware, most of the lectures are political rants and personal stories that he will tell several more times throughout the semester. He gives his side of politics and his side only. Very outspoken about his hatred against certain Presidents and holds religion in contempt.
He likes to listen to himself talk about himself. His photography is not that good, but he does not know this. His book is self-published, so there you go!

He is an interesting teacher with lots of stories (many boring) to tell during his mandatory classes. He mostly just talks about himself during class. The coursework is fairly easy, just do the ebook modules and don't mess up the guidelines of the speech. (saying uh or um) He is a pretty tough grader when it comes to speeches.

My favorite professor this semester. Skaggs is an easy grader, there is 4 speeches that you have to do and one easy paper. The rest of the class is him telling hilarious stories about his life and easy online modules.

Skaggs is probably one of the best professors I've had. He makes class fun and enjoyable and always has a story. He loves teaching and loves his students. He lets you know what's on the test and they're all open note and open book. Every paper you turn in is an easy 100% as long as you meet the page requirement which is usually 1-2 pages.
Very lecture heavy, but he adds a lot if personal stories to make them enjoyable. Easy A if you do all the work and meet the criteria for the speeches.
Tells a lot of great stories, easy grader.

Skaggs typically tells alot of his own personal life stories and he tends to be very understanding and easy going when it come to people giving speeches. He gives maybe 2 exams at best but the main grade is from speeches. study the chapters for the final exam and mid-term and you should be fine
loved Skaggs! great professor and a pretty easy class.

Professor Skaggs was a generally easy professor, he was very understanding and willing to work with me on extensions. There are a lot of papers but generally as long as you do them right and turn them in you get credit. He goes over midterm/final questions w/ the class but changes the wording so much on the exam it throws you off.

Professor Skaggs is amazing! He is very knowledgeable, cares about his students, and loves to tell stories. He lets you pick all of your speech topics and gives great feedback. I highly recommend taking his courses. He was my favorite professor in my first freshman semester.
He was amazing! I had different things going on in my life and he was super understanding. The speeches were not difficult, take his class!

I had to take his public speaking class online due to covid, which made this class easier for me. I love him and he had the best stories. He never tried to sell any of his photography to us as other comments say. He was really caring. The bookwork is tedious though but other than that, just follow the requirements for your speech and its an easy A

Professor Skaggs creates a very fun and comfortable environment, which makes giving speeches less daunting. The guideline for each speech is clear and as long as you meet them you can get an A every time. The tests are based on the textbook and pretty easy as well. He tells a lot of personal stories and is always interested in what his students say

Although Skaggs lectures a lot and tells many stories on his own personal life that can be lengthy his class really is an easy A. Follow the guidelines concerning each speech and show up and the test are super easy all of the answers are in the textbook.

Skaggs is unfit to teach in my opinion. He doesn't explain criteria/subject matter clearly, constantly wastes our time by having the same tech issues every week, & makes uncomfortable remarks. He pushes his (mediocre) photography work on us and the extra credit options are to go support his exhibitions. He's very boring & says inappropriate things!
Professor Skaggs is easy going and keeps your attention in class. Hes an easy grader and will tell you what he expects.

Prof is a very nice and funny guy. He does like to express his opinion more so than hearing, but he grades fair. His class is super easy, you mainly watch movies and discuss. His tests are pretty hard, but nothing that you cant still get an easy A. There are several papers but they don't take long at all and they are very easy.

Name: Marissa McKinley
Comment: She is a good teacher and its an easy class. She breaks down the writing assignments so it doesn't seem like your doing a lot of work. She builds connections with her students and she is super relatable.

Marissa is a very genuine person, which makes her a wonderful professor. She gives credit where credit is due, and will grade you honestly. She is empathetic and kind, do not take advantage of her authentic teaching style.  Go to class, and do what she asks of you in the assignments, and you will not have a problem.
Loves her job & her students. Lets you redo your papers for a higher grade. Very down to earth & will go out of her way to see you succeed.
She is the best professor i have ever had. She is so understanding and truly cares about her students. I made sure to take her for ENG101

Marissa is one of the best English professors I ever had.  She pushes you to become better, but always has the best intentions and helps you all along the way.  She is very supportive and will go out of her way to help you.  She's also really laid back and funny in class. Loves teaching! Definitely recommend taking her!

This is my favorite class I have taken so far! Marissa is so nice and extremely helpful! We complained that we did not like the quizzes so guess what? We haven't taken a quiz yet! We sometimes just sit and talk in class when we have completed all of our readings. This is a must take class I truely wish i did not have to leave this class!

Name: Kenneth Lowe
Comment: Ken Lowe is easily one of the best professors in the engineering program. He makes the material very easy to comprehend by using real-life examples from his own experience as an engineer, as well as doing hands-on activities almost every class. His tests and assignments are very straightforward. If you go to class every week, you'll get an easy A.

Mr. Lowe is a new part time teacher. His teaching methods are one of the best in the program though because he believes in teaching from application. Instead of teaching right from the book we watched actual videos of processes and then would do them in the lab. Then tests were open book. Great guy, great teacher.
one of the best professors ever. exams very easy, very helpful. take him without any doubts.

Name: Karim Halty
Comment: Hands down one of the best professors I've ever had.

The professor Karim truly cares about his students and is incredibly kind. Arabic is a challenging language to learn, but Karim makes it enjoyable. He is one of the best professionals I've ever had. I highly recommend taking his class.
Arabic is not an easy language to learn, but he is a good professor. I would recommend taking him, you will have to put some effort and you will get an A+

Professor Halty is one of the best professors that I have ever had! Its not easy leaning new language especially with the pandemic. Hes very help full and understandable. Professor Halty does his very best to make sure that we are all understand the topics. Hes goes beyond limits to make sure the class remains enjoyable and interesting 4 everyon

Professor Halty is by far the best professor I have ever had. His primary focus is you learning which is incredibly important when taking a language like Arabic. I have taken languages before with varying degrees of success. Professor Halty's methodology has proven to be the best and most effective by far. I highly recommend his classes.

Professor Halty is the best professor that I have ever had! There is fantastic discussion in his classes and he really gets you thinking about the concepts. You don't just read boring textbooks, you read books that helps you to develop your language skills . If I could take every class with Dr. Halty I would no doubt. He is funny and he really res
professor halty in one of the best professors at nku. he will do his best for his students to succeed in the class. its a language class so attendance matters.

Name: Tara McLendon
Comment: This professor was the most amazing I have had since attending NKU. She is sure to help you out with any questions you have throughout the course. She also has a quick response time when communicating with her students. She organizes the course perfectly and I learned so much about social work from taking her course. It was extremely beneficial!
AMAZING PROFESSOR!!! IF YOU HAVE THE CHANCE TAKE HER AS MUCH AS YOU CAN!
Dr. Lendon, is a caring and unique professor that her passion for her profession shines.

Tara, is THE MOST AMAZING professor in the Social Work Program at NKU. NKU is SO blessed to have her as a professor and to be working with such an amazing woman. TAKE HER if you're in the SWK program!
Dr. McLendon is quick to grade assignments and gives great feedback. Her passion for social work shows in her classes.

Tara is one of the coolest and most down to earth professors at NKU. She is always there for you if you are having an issue in her class or on assignments. She makes time to talk with the class rather than just giving lectures the entire time. I would take her any time possible. No textbook either!

Tara is awesomw she really wants everyone to be a success. Her and her husband created a new assesment tool to help aid in the intake process in family structured therapy, How intelligent. Tara is a knowledgeable and task driven instructor she applies assignments to the lectures in class, and is very well organized.
Great professor! She will go out of her way to help you understand the material.
Wonderful professor and very easy to learn from. I have had her for 3 other classes and loved each class.
She is amazing and really cares about her students and the subject! If you haven't taken her, DO IT!
Dr. McLendon is a great professor! Very fun and entertaining class. Never picked up a book! Had guest speakers and or a video every day!
This is the best class I have ever taken. I am in two of her classes next semester and I cannot wait. She makes me excited to learn.
She's AMAZING. best professor I have ever had. ever.

I had Dr. McLendon for both 305 and 310. Dr. McLendon is one of the sweetest professors you'll ever meet. She cares a lot about her students success and actually legitimately listens to student suggestions. The class definitely requires textbook use, and there are a lot of quizzes, but it all really helps for licensure exam preparation.

Name: Kim Johnson-Spratt
Comment: She was a very understanding person when there were issues that effected getting to class or papers being turned in

Amazing class, and amazing professor. Homework isnt excessive, she is fair, and you learn a lot, no matter your major. I would take all her classes if I could, theyre amazing. Do not take these classes if youre a republican, sociology is a very liberal subject!
Super nice and she will always help anyone that asks for help. She is very detailed and will give a great review before tests. Make sure to take notes! She gives a lot of useful information.

LOVE this professor. Lectures are very interesting, and she tells you exactly what to expect on both the midterm and final exams. A few online assignments throughout, which are easy ways to boost your grade. One project for the final, involves interviewing someone who has lived in the U.S. for less than 5 years.
Awesome professor. I suggest students take her. There is some homework, a midterm, and final. However, she reviews and helps students.

She is an awesome teacher! She is always so excited to be in class. If you just do the assignments and actually try on them you will get a good grade. She gives you a list of test terms prior to each test. Super sweet lady. Everyone should take her class! LOVED IT!!

She is a very sweet, understanding and interesting professor. Very few assignments, mostly just lectures and watching documentaries, but she makes them fun. She gives a list of topics to study before each test, some test answers are word-for-word in your notes or the textbook. Overall an easy class if you study and do your interview assignment.
Kim is great, my very first professor. Thankfully, she help's whenever she can, and tries to make it easy on you, she understands that college isn't always easy!
A very easy class if you attend...which shouldn't be a problem, because Kim is awesome. Loved every minute.

Kim is an amazing Prof! she is so helpful and teaches very well. she will break things down for you if you don't "get it". I had her for JUS 231 and she explained so much and taught me things that I didn't know. I listened so closely in her class. She gives easy tests and doesn't grade papers hard.
Great professor. She keeps the class interesting. I found myself listening to her so closely that I forgot to take notes! She gives easy tests and papers and is always willing to help you with them.
Kim creates an awesome classroom environment. She understands that college can be stressful and does a great job of creating a stress free environment as well. Go to class and take notes!

She is a great professor! The class material isn't too hard as it is but she makes it even easier. She tells you exactly what she wants you to do. She also creates a very comfortable environment. You must go to class though, all of your grades will come from attendence and exams...which come from the notes!

GREAT PROFESSOR!!! The good thing about kim is that you know exactly what she wants. On the essays on test she goes by the "If you are in the ball park you get the credit" and She gives you a list of everything on the test! if you look up the terms you are sure to get an "A" GO TO CLASS! The tests are straigt off the notes! DID I SAY EASY "A"!!!
EXTREMLY tough

Name: Christopher Miller
Comment: I am an international student, I am not used to doing tons of assignments. I really liked how he emphasized things that matter. I had passed a few deadlines for assignments, he was generous enough to let me do it later. He's very friendly and grades you appropriately. He's a really good professor! 100% recommended

The best professor I have ever had in my life. 
He always gives his best for the class and he will do everything to help students excel.
Respectful, funny, nice, and helpful.
Amazing personality and a great professor.
Seriously my favorite professor, he is the WHOLE vibe. Does a great job at being relatable and interacting with his students while also teaching his class effectively.

Chris is a super fun professor and is funny in my opinion. He is super understanding of your personal needs/ accommodates to them and is accepting. He has specific grading criteria (although not a harsh grader). gives everyone a chance to share and gives really good feedback. if you do the work its a fairly easy A so definitely take his class!!!

Professor Miller aka 'Chris' is great. Chris was engaging and often had the whole class participating making it seem as if you were chatting with friends. He didn't give much homework, the class was fun, and he cares about you as a student.

I absolutely loved Chris' class. I had him for Public Speaking - OC. He really took the time to get to know all of us. He answers his texts really fast, too! There were 4 major speeches and as long as you attempted them, you're pretty much going to pass with a high grade. He also gives some online chapter assignments, but they're super easy!

Name: Alyssa Appelman
Comment: Took this class on a whim for a 7-week course. I have never taken a journalism class before and this class was super easy to learn and navigate. Dr. Appelman was incredible about making the class accessible and easy.

She references the textbook, but you don't need it. You can review it on Google Books if you need, but can complete the course without. She provides slide decks with helpful information, and quizzes every week. Very kind prof.

TAKE THIS CLASS NOW! I honestly went into it just looking for an easy A, which it was, but the material was fun to learn about it didn't feel like a hassle at all and I was genuinely interested! The deadlines were SO easy to balance without taking away from enjoying my summer. Not to mention Alyssa was accommodating and easy to communicate with!

I took this class online for easy credits and it was a breeze. Weekly assignments/quizzes that weren't hard at all. Prof grades very quickly and gives PowerPoints every week with all needed info. Didn't even need to buy the book. Do the work and you'll pass. Study weekly quizzes as questions reappear on midterm and final. Def recommend. Take it!

This was my second time taking a class with Alyssa. She's great. There are no tests or exams in JOU 220, but there is still a lot of work. At the end of the semester, you write three articles. The class is easy, even if you aren't a JOU major--or a great writer. Alyssa is always willing to help and answer questions.

Alyssa truly cares, but this was her first semester teaching Data Journalism--and it was obvious. She wasn't adept in the course material and we didn't learn content we should have learned. Nothing about vizualization or statistical accuracy, just mostly math review and editing data-driven pieces for clarity and accuracy. Loves to take off points.

Alyssa has become my favorite professor in the journalism department at NKU. She is always willing to help and gives great feedback on all assignments. Her classes are laid back, as long as you show up, you will get the information you need for quizzes. She also puts all of her notes on blackboard which is helpful if you miss class. Take her class!

Alyssa is a great professor. She cares about her students, and wants everyone to succeed--even if they aren't a Journalism major. She's younger, so she understands what a college student is going through. Her class is easy, and she's more than willing to answer questions. 4 quizzes, 3 papers, 1 mid-term, and 1 final exam.

You dont need to buy the textbook for this class. You can share with someone else or just borrow someones for the paper you have to use it for. She only gives 4 quizzes, 2 tests, and 3 papers. all the tests have the exact questions from the quizzes in them. She is super nice but the classes seem long because theres not that much content. Easy class

I had to take this class for my JOU minor, but she made the class fun! She doesn't lecture a ton in this class, but when she does she shows a funny video that keeps us engaged. Since I do like writing, it was fun for me that she assigned us 3 bigger articles for the bulk of our grade. After this class I was inspired to become a double major in JOU.

I had to take this class as a Gen Ed, just like the majority of the class. But, she made it interesting (funny youtube videos that relate)! She didn't assign a lot of homework other than that though, and there is a lot of reading that she wants you to do, but if you & pay attention in class, you'll be fine without reading.

She's a newer teacher and understands how much work students have. There's not a lot of work and its all simple and easy. She goes slow and repeats herself so everyone understands. We often got out of class early too.

Loved this class! Alyssa was super helpful and always willing to help at any time. She does not give tests, only quizzes which are easy and helpful. You write a lot but she makes writing fun. I would take this class over and over. Excellent professor. Take this class if you are a JOU major because she is awesome and there for her students!

This was her first time teaching her own class and she was great! As long as she could see you were trying, she would give you help. Very understanding and willing to work with you. I absolutely loved her class and learned how good of a writer I actually am. Only advice: I hope she toughens up a little so no one can walk over her. GREAT PROFESSOR

Name: Sam Lapin
Comment: Mr.Lapin was a pretty good guy! I liked his way of teaching and wasn't a hard grader, however those McGraw Hill modules I always dreaded. Makes class fun and interesting, has a good personality for teaching
Professor Lapin was one of my first college professors, and I know for a fact no one will ever compare to him.  Not only is Lapin an outstanding professor, but he genuinely cares about his students.

The speeches helped me with my nervousness around speaking in front of people. I definitely saw improvement in not only my performances throughout the semester, but also my classmates. Great teacher, great class. Would recommend.

He's a really generous and kind person. If you put in the work you'll succeed. He's funny and he really puts in work to make classes fun. He gives out really fun prizes when we do in-class competitions. 10/10 professor, and although the class was mandatory, it's a really enjoyable class.
Great professor! I really suck at public speaking, but his class made me grow so much. Hes very caring, funny, and fair. Definitely recommend!
Super sweet and works with you on deadlines if you participate. Super funny and down to earth. Favorite candy bar is Paydays

10/10 would recommend Professor Lapin. He understands that everyone has speech anxiety and takes that into consideration. There are only 4 main speeches throughout the semester and 1 impromptu. My speech class from another school didn't transfer and he was definitely a better professor than my previous one.
This man is the absolute GOAT. He is hilarious and engaging. Even if you're bad at public speaking he makes the class enjoyable.

Mr. Lapin made speech class fun. He gave great feedback on everything we did and it really helped me through the class. He also seemed like one of those professors that really cared about you individually and how you were doing and that was a great feeling. Definitely one of my favorite teachers of all time. 10/10 would recomend :))).
10/10 would reccomend
He's an awesome guy.
He's great!
Mr. Lapin makes speech fun.  He is hilarious, practical and takes the pressure out of public speaking.
GREAT professor. He made public speaking fun! (Which is something I never thought I would say) He was always super nice, and ALWAYS beyond helpful! Take him if at all possible!!!
Great professor
He is very clear when it comes to the topic of the lecture. He is very helpful whenever you need help.
Great teacher. He was really energetic and enthusiastic about the subject. Gave speech assignments that were actually enjoyable. He gives great feedback and is big on peer reviewing.
Great approach to this class.  Promotes peer review and support.
So far the best professor. He is so helpful, and extremely funny.

Great professor, really into what he does. Slapin is funny, but is still serious about class. He has a weird sense of humor that many may not get, but if you do you'll love his class. He's also a great radio contestant!

Name: Joetta Browning
Comment: Class was super easy and I did good on quizzes but always struggled with the tests. She for some reason made the tests way harder than the homework or the quizzes.

I hadn't taken any math classes in over 16 years so I was super nervous about having to take this class. Jo is so caring and helpful. She is always willing to work with you outside of class hours and is great at explaining things in different ways. She is funny and sweet. She is an amazing teacher. She really knows and loves this subject.

Abosolutely so compasstionate. I had a panic attack during the final and she helped me through it and the problems I couldn't figure out. I Dealt with a lot of depression and she was so patient and helped make sure I still passed while not dumping a bunch of late assignments on me. Totally wonderful!

She helped me gain confidence in my math skills and prepared me for my pre-calculus course, which I passed with an -A. A real gem of a professor, she took the time outside of class to help explain concepts to me that I didn't immediately understand during the class. If you don't understand something then ask, she will explain it until you get it!

Joetta is the best teacher I have ever had. Math is definitely my worst subject, but she found ways to make it make sense. She was always available to help with homework and go over any questions. She is so friendly and patient and funny. I wish I could take her for every math class I ever have to take.
One of the most amazing Professors i've ever had. So incredibly sweet and understanding and tries her best to make what she talks about fun and understandable. 10/10 would recommend.
All I can say is--- she is the best teacher here at NKU and the most caring human being you will ever meet

She quickly got to know me, gave plenty of homework, is approachable enough to feel comfortable raising your hand and asking questions, and always gave extra credit especially when the problem was done correctly minus a -/+ being wrong. She's even letting me take her class even though it's full! She's the best math teacher you can get!

Joetta is great! I would not have been able to learn material as well as I did without her help. She's very outgoing/friendly and was always willing to help me with anything I needed. We used ALEKS to complete homework and I LOVED it. One of the best learning programs I've ever used.
She is very sweet, and cares about her students. She wants to make sure you pass.

I have never been good at any form of math, but thanks to this professor I received the first A of my life. She rewards hard work, as she exempted me from the final exam for maintaining an A all semester. She is always willing to help students, and she is understanding if you can't always attend class because life happens.

Best teacher!!! So laid back and will answer any questions you have!!! Literally! She won't get mad she's always happy! You can't fail her class. Almost impossible to get a c if you come to class! She won't let you down or do bad in her class because she is soo helpful with a positive attitude ALWAYS! Wish she taught all classes!
Would totally take her again to bad she doesn't teach any other class. :( Highly recommend her!
The best teacher in the world
SHE IS AWESOME, YOU JUST NEED TO ATTEND CLASS AND HAVE THE BOOK, BUT DOESN NOT REQUIRE AN ACCESS CODE, ITS OPTIONAL. i LOVE HER
This is the best Math Teacher I have ever had. If you have to take 095 or 099 taker her class in the summer.

I have to say for a math class it's the most fun i've ever had! (if that's possible for math to have fun) She is the best math teacher i have personally ever had!  She's nice and offers all kinds of help if you ask!  She also works as a high school teacher so i think that may be why she is so good at Explaining!  Great Teacher! Highley Recommended

she is the best math teacher i've ever had. she really explains things to where i can understand them. I have always struggled with math, and even missed a lot of class because of illness, and i'm still doing well. she is awesome!

Amazing teacher, I'm an older adult now pushing into the 30s.  Some teachers just don't understand that we have lives, and learn a bit slower.  She made learning really easy and didn't require 100s of pages of homework to be done (I've actually had this happen in a class).  My wrist was spared and I learned a lot.
The best teacher walking the earth bottom line!

Name: Eric Bates
Comment: He was a very good professor and kept my attention. He taught his subject well and was not a harsh grader.

Professor Bates is an amazing teacher. He made the class so interesting and fun and I learned a lot. He is very fair in grading and giving opportunities for extra credit. I learned so much and would love to take another class with him.
He is very passionate about this class, and it helped me really get into the subject  knowing he enjoyed what he was teaching us! my favorite class i have taken so far!

Bates is a good professor. His tests are easy, and you watch alot of films. The book was free through the library but the papers you wrote every week were weighted pretty low, so your grade would never go up. Also, assignments had no due date on Canvas, which made things a little hard to follow. Pay attention and work hard, and you'll get an A.

Everything about this class is easy! Tests are easy, Lectures are easy to follow, and you only have one research paper to type that is about 1500 words. Eric is a very respectful teacher although he expects students to show up on time to class and be present. He will give extra credit opportunities very frequently!

This class was one of Dr. Bates' first online classes he taught, but he did a very good job. LOTS of reading, and then essay writing on the books that you read, with a final paper over all of the books that you read. But he is very honest, gives great feedback, and will work with you to help get your paper to be the best it can be.
HE IS AMAZING PERIOD!
This class was a gen. ed. for me. It was okay, but the material got pretty boring since it was online. Nothing too special.

This guy is an absolute legend. Super easy class to take and honestly very interesting. 100% would take it again and definitely would recommend it to a friend. Bates is super laid back and all-around an awesome guy.
Fun and engaging class. Helps explain missed question and always gives good feed back on your reading responses.

I'm a politically conservative student, but I enjoyed being challenged by this class. If you're worried about political bias and need to take a gen-ed class this is the one to take because Mr. Bates will not try to crush you or force you to think his way and dock your grade if you don't.

Eric is a professor I would recommend to anyone whether you're an anthropology major or not. There is a midterm and final that are pretty easy if you go to class and pay attention at all. Lectures are very interesting and insightful! Very respectful and a chill guy.

Not your average professor, very friendly and inviting atmosphere. Have multiple of his classes and have enjoyed them. Would highly recommend for any one of all majors, this is the prof you want to learn anthropology from and Native Indian studies (231) is a course everyone should take!

Lectures are very interesting. He is very knowledgeable and passionate about the subjects he teaches on so it makes you want to learn more. Tests aren't hard at all if you pay attention in lecture and study. Final paper wasn't anything to stress over. Easy class with a laid back professor.

Excellent class. An easy A because of the high quality of the instruction, not because the professor doesn't care. Grades tests on a curve, very reasonable, and plenty of opportunities to make up work.

I loved this class so much! It was my favorite one this semester. Eric didn't make the lectures boring which made it easier to learn. The class was a lot of fun and I would totally take it again because I learned so much!

Eric is one of the best teachers I've had! He's so nice, and so funny. Not to mention, a great lecturer and easy grader. We had 3 tests all year, and one presentation/paper, but he was really generous on all of them and gave curves. He doesn't take attendance, but all of his notes are only on the board during class lectures. So go to class!

One of the best what NKU can offer! The lectures are always useful discussions after watching a short documentary and you only have to write a short reading response once a week. Great teacher (Multi talented) and very beneficial information about different aspects of life.
Excellent class on cultural anthropology. Very thought-provoking. Learned a lot.
Personable

Name: Sharlotte Neely
Comment: Dr. Neely was great. Her lectures were very interesting and she is passionate about what she does. Assignments weren't difficult.

I took this class online. It is definitely an easy A, but you have to go through the content to get the A, so you do learn. Every time I have emailed her she has responded quickly and is very helpful. From hearing her in the tegrity lectures she is definitely very passionate about what she is teaching. I recommend this professor and class.

We were required to read two fairly hefty novels, but they were at least enjoyable. Very clear rubric for assignments, and an "essay" was basically a few very informal paragraphs. If you read and watch the assigned material, and write thoughtful and honest opinions, you'll do well.

The syllabus:  2 tests worth 200 points 1 paper worth 80 points Attendance 10 points "Extra" Credit 10 points.  The problem is 1) The extra credit isn't really extra, it counts against you if you don't do it. 2) All you do is watch films, and she rarely expands on them.  Since you only have 2 tests, if you do bad on one, you grade will suffer.

She is a gem. This was her first time back teaching this class again, so she was fiery giddy and all over the place. Not a tough class, if you read the syllabus, make your own notes, and skim the readings (not very long). The only thing you really need to make sure you do is EXTRA CREDIT. It's 10 points, but included in your final grade (total).
If you like sci fi, this course on the anthropology of sci fi is for you.  It's a fun, summer, online course.  The professor is crystal clear about what you need to do to make an "A."

loved this class! she is a great professor. there are only two graded assignments which are the midterm and the final exam. attendance is a must because you will be extra credit if you dont miss more then 2  classes each section. exams are easy. also get extra credit opportunity that equal to another exam to help out your grade.no textbook!
Passionate, caring, awesome in every way.  Students love her!
I like that grades are not just based on tests. Writing assignments can be on readings, museum exhibits, guest speakers, movies, etc.
Dr. Neely is an amazing instructor. I didn't think I would like her class at all. It turned out to be one of my favorite classes.  Her stories beautifully illustrate her lectures.
AWFUL. Do not take here unless you are very interested in the subject matter. She goes off topic all the time and her stories aren't interesting or funny. Terrible class.
She's so nice, but it gets a little boring. Honestly, if you read the 2 novels she assigns and pay attention, you'll do absolutely fine! She's very willing to help if you ask any kind of questions.
Easy class, friendly professor :) very helpful
I think Dr. Neely and all the anthropologists are great!  I hope NKU does not get rid of the anthropology program.
Great professor that never has any surprises.  Only two tests and she is very clear what will be on them.  Lecture is informative and accompanied by videos.

Dr. Neely is an amazing instructor. I didn't think I would like her class at all. It was one of my favorite classes that I took this semester. The class is always lecture or a movie based off of the lecture. There were two exams and you had to read four books. You have to write your own notes. Clas can be boring, but overall very good class!!

Dr. Neely is an amazing instructor. I didn't think I would like her class at all. It was one of my favorite classes that I took this semester. The class is always lecture or a movie based off of the lecture. There were two exams and you had to read four books. You have to write your own notes. Clas can be boring, but overall very good class!!
Interesting class

VERY PASSIONATE PROFESSOR. She really hits home the importance of Anthropology. Interesting Gen Ed to take if you need one. Online textbook and two literary readings required. Books were interesting. Attendance isn't mandatory and you can skim by without going. I never missed a class though. Extra Credit offered. Neely is very flexible as well.

great teacher loves what she is teaching. never takes atttendance. emails you when tests will be soon. always lets you make up anything you missed. offers alot of extra credit. take her is you get a chance easy A.

Name: Chris Christensen
Comment: Dr. Christensen is simply one of the best math professors at NKU hands down and it shows. He is very helpful one-on-one if needed.

Professor Christensen was an outstanding professor. Attendance was not mandatory but the material is better understood with consistent attendance. There is homework about three times a week but due dates are not hard and he grades not entirely by accuracy. I would recommend Professor Christensen to anyone preparing to take mat229.

Best professor I have ever had. Goes slow during lectures so his students understand. Very few points in the class, so DO GOOD on the tests!!(If you study you should be fine, study guides just like tests) He's a great professor, he's understanding, and he's nice. Not much else to say. Would take him for all my math classes in the future if I could.
Great instructor. He explains things clearly and he is very patient. Light homework/

We called him C^2. No frills, no tech, just a chalkboard and calculus. He goes slow, explains everything clearly, and has very concise homework that prepares you well for the tests. He's an old school math professor who can seem boring at times, but he covers the content well and makes it easy to learn.

Dr. Christensen is the best professor in the math department. He explains everything clearly and concisely. His homework was balanced and fairly easy if you read the material. The exams were take home so they were very easy. Overall a fun class by a great professor.

I love Christensen, but his voice is so monotoned. His lectures can be so boring, but very informational. He explains things very well, if you can stay focused. Overall, sweet man, and I would take his class again because I found it to be an easy A

I have had a lot of bad math teachers, from a pair of long term subs, to overly hard teachers, to overly easy teachers, so the bar was low, but Prof Christensen is truly amazing. He answers everyone's questions thoroughly, no matter how 'dumb', and he's truly caring for his students. He also rounded my grade up which was truly a life saver.

Do the hw and you get full credit and it is worth over 33% of your grade. Late work  100% as long as it's before the exam for the unit. I could've gotten an A but I didn't try after midterm. I am hoping he teaches Linear Algebra so I can have a great professor. Tests have very few questions but you will be well prepared for it. STRONGLY RECOMMEND

The best math teacher I have ever had. Explains concepts very clearly and takes time to answer every question a student has. He gives a significant amount of homework, but the due date is always the day of the exams so you can complete it as you see fit. My only complaint is that he is monotone. I would HIGHLY recommend professor Christensen.

Dr. Christensen is a fantastic professor and is extremely clear with his explanations. He is a tough grader on exams, but his exam format is very similar to the review he posts (they're just old tests). He can be very slow in his explanations and examples, but that makes it really easy to grasp.

Dr. Christensen is a really nice guy and a fantastic math professor, one of the best Ive had. He's very good at explaining Calculus concepts in a digestible manner. Aside from his teaching quality, I really liked that he was flexible on homework due dates. He assigns 2-3 reasonable assignments per week, but will accept them late up to the exam. Hi

This was hands down the best professor I have ever had. The explanations are start simple and build up. Instead of a rigid formal explanation he gives insight as to the thought process that led up to the current concept. Lectures were great and the material could not have been better explained. The homework policy gives time to actually learn.

Professor Christensen is my favorite professor and I took this class specifically so I could have him again. He's very monotone but is a great lecturer. This class in particular is not that hard and is a unique and interesting concept, especially if you're interested in security and ciphers.

Took MAT128 which is my Gen-Ed calculus with him. My only concern is that the tests are very short but they consist of a large portion of your overall grade. However, he's a great guy and good at lecturing. He goes over homework in class and I do recommend him.

I had always heard great things about him, and after having him this semester I can verify that the hype is real. He is not super loud or expressive but he still manages to keep my attention. His explanations are so clear and repeated so many times that it would be impossible to not understand. Really excellent professor.

Amazing professor.  Extremely clear about concepts and posts review for tests online that is basically the same format as the actual test.  He has a very monotone voice but he's super chill and laid back.  Highly recommend.
awesome professor. very helpful. great clarity.

I've taken him 3 times and I love him! He gives a LOT of homework assignments, but technically none of them are due until the following test. He is extremely helpful no matter what your excuse is (he leaves nobody behind!) His tests aren't hard at all (IF YOU STUDY) because he posts study guides and all his previous semester tests online to study.
Great calc teacher! He is a lenient grader in that he will accept an answer if you chose a different solution, but took all the steps correctly.

Name: John Alberti
Comment: Literature & Film. I actually took it last spring, but this class was amazing. The profs really made this class soo much fun. The whole class was about Harry Potter. We read all of the books and movies. Some quizzes (online and very easy if you read the books), some papers, and a super fun project. Lots of laughs and good memories. Would retake! :)

Dr. Alberti is by far one of the best faculty at NKU. He is always willing to help and really listens when you talk to him. I've had him for two different classes and both have been very worthwhile. Do yourself a favor and register for one of his classes.
Just a really nice man and a wonderful professor,the class was one of the best I have taken.
He is such a cool teacher! He has a very unique perspective on the subject matter than most of the other professors.
I postponed taking this class because I thought it would be boring.  Dr. Alberti made it anything but boring.  Excellent lecturer,, always kept it interesting. Ire ally enjoyed this class.
Dr. Alberti is one of the  best professors I've ever had at NKU. I was dreading ENG 350 but I am so glad I was able to take the class with him. He is very funny and fair with his assignments.

I LOVE Dr. Alberti! One of the best professors at NKU, He makes literary criticism interesting and fun, taking him again next semester! He is very knowledgable and understanding, works with you on late assignments, just a really nice guy!

A lot of Discussion board posts, but easy. You watch a movie almost everyday, and that is what the posts are over.  A few papers and quizzes over books, but overall easy way to get your literature credit if you need one.  Definitely not your norm. class. Prepare for black and white films.
very nice but o my the man is a talker, i took it as a night class and he used the entire time he could to talking, every bit never lets out early...very nice and helpful...but he TALKS nonstop

I could listen to this guy talk for hours. He doesn't ramble; he has a point. Alberti orchestrates a fantastic lecture and I'm upset the class I want to take this semester is all filled up because I've learned a lot from him. Just take his class even if it's an elective. I recommend taking any class he instructs. Helpful, kind, and very intelligent
Friendly, but into himself and a real talker. Has lots of time to talk to students, and boy can he talk!

Great class and very interesting. He grades based on work completed (quantity over quality) so it is easy...but you HAVE to post all your responses on blackboard on time to get an A. Worth going to every class.

Dr. Alberti didn't make any sense at all in this class, but it didn't matter. Your grade depends only on if you turn in the work or not. Turn in everything and get and A, turn in four papers and a final, get a B and so on.

The things he says in class really make you think; but . . . they really don't pertain at all the class. Therefore I find it challenging to go to a class sometimes were we don't really talk about the subject.

Literary Criticism isn't the easiest subject to grasp, but he made it really interesting and manageable. You do a reading log for everything you read, and have some short papers during the semester and a paper as a final that's 10-15 pages, but there are no tests and as long as you write intelligently you're going to get a good grade.
Easy
Guides discussion very nicely and makes the topics more interesting.

Film Noir. Cool class if you are open to genre. Great prof., easy going, fun! Required write ups on each film (1-2pgs) can do skim reading (for brief discussion) and get an A. Class is 70% in class watching films, 15% lecture/discussion (30 mins of class) & 15% homework which includes reading short novel/write ups. Overall easy A & VERY interesting!
No Comments
So nice and helpful with everything, great teacher!

Name: Caroline Braden
Comment: Her class was straightforward and held no surprises. Do the work, participate in the discussions and you'll do well.

She is by far the best professor ever! Prof. Braden always stressed if anyone needed help with anything to call or email her. She is very willing to accept late work but the work is so easy that it shouldn't be late. Any time I have a problem she always helps me find a solution. Class is super easy, I would love to have her again.

She is always more than willing to answer any questions. Her online lectures were great and her PowerPoints were equally as helpful. She can be difficult to read personality wise, as it is an online class, but if you are able to stop by her office she is super friendly and eager to help her students to succeed. Its very obvious that she loves PAD.

Name: Susan Vanlandingham
Comment: Susan is a gem and a great professor. The course is set up with no exams, just mini chapter quizzes that you take on your own. Throughout the semester you work on these practicals for building a crime scene. It sounds very hard at first but once you get the hang of it its a breeze. She also provides very great feedback for the final project.
Great teacher! She goes out her way to help you with any problem you come across. Tests are extremely hard.

Vanlandingham is by far one of the most inspirational professors I have ever had. Her lectures were mostly real world accounts of her career as a crime scene analyst and her work with the KY State Police. She really goes out of her way to connect with students and is available to help all the time! Love her!

I almost didn't take this class because I didn't know Susan, and Jill Shelley is such a great teacher.But honestly I'm glad that I decided to take a class with her, as she has made this class absolutely fascinating.She brings in things from her work, which is a forensic lab, and is very passionate about this subject.  Best JUS class I've taken.

Excellent instructor. She is passionate and knowledgeable about the material and also brings a wealth of practical knowledge from her years as a forensic scientist. She is also funny. Best class so far at NKU.

This class is one of the best justice classes I've taken so far. She is extremely helpful, and also uses a lot of visuals in the lessons (with pictures and physically bringing in items from the lab she works at).  Prof. Van also is passionate about the course material, which helps me hold interest in class. Take her if you have the opportunity! :)

I would strongly recommend taking this class! She is an awesome professor, very kind, & really cares about her students. She goes above & beyond to help you if you need it and makes class fun and intriguing. I've never had a professor care so much about student success. This was my favorite class this semester & she is my favorite professor by far!

Excellent professor! Not only does she know her stuff, but she is extremely active in the profession and 100% professional. She is also fun to talk to, leads intriguing discussions, and has an excellent sense of humor!

Name: Steven Weiss
Comment: Hilarious guy. Just do the work and you'll get an A, easy.

Great man, not strict on due dates, not a lot of assignments. Not the most clear on what he expects from assignments but won't leave you with a bad grade if you don't want it. Kinda confusing especially towards finals but a cool chill dude.
This was a class for my minor. The class was very easy and fun and the environment was great. The professor is very laid back and understanding and I would definitely take the class again!

Very lax. 4 papers but he drops your lowest grade and doubles your highest. No strict due dates. Gets side tracked during lectures. He is very knowledgeable about politics so he can really help you understand what is going on in current politics. Pace yourself with the papers and you will be fine. Only two are research based and all are easy.

I took his class online synchronized because of COVID. He was a really great guy, super understanding of students, relaxed environment, not a huge amount of work. If you go to class and participate it's not hard to do well. A little unorganized at times, but overall great professor.
Super easy class. His lectures were interesting and as long as you showed up and did your work, you passed.
Very knowledgeable and nice professor. Planning to take him again.

Incredibly nice professor with years of experience and knowledge (and it shows). He is a true friend to the student, and wants you to get the most out of college. I also think he has a great sense of humor. Totally respects students as human beings.
Weiss is awesome. He really wants you to pass. You won't get under a C on anything as long as you try.
Weiss is one of the best professors I've had here during my time at NKU.
My favorite NKU prof by far. Hilarious.

He is extremely good looking. Used to smoke while he taught back in the day but he's done with that now. Triggers people quite often, but very intelligent. He is seriously incredibly attractive. 10/10 would recommend to a friend. Take this class even if you don't need to because of how attractive he is.

Best in-class discussions of my college career. Took 2 courses with him this semester, will take 2 more next. One of NKU's best. Could teach at any U in the country, but picked here. How lucky for us! His feedback can be brutally honest, but isn't that what I paid for? Truly Socratic in his teaching styles. Believes we must learn together.

This was my first class with Mr. Weiss.  I hope it won't be my last.  He really likes and genuinely cares about each student.  You should definitely take him for Arg and Debate, as he's an expert and you get your money's worth.  The class was never dull.  His work load is not heavy, but you better do the assignments like he wants them!

Fourth class with him.  Awesome is an understatement.  Smart, caring.  Love the interaction in his classes.  Amazing discussions.  The guy really loves teaching.  Can only take one more class with him.  I've exhausted everything he teaches.  Widely known as one of NKU's best profs, and highly deserved.  Great sense of humor too.  Class rarely dull.

Learn how to debate, debate, reflect on how you debated. Easy A if you do the 5 assignments with any kind of effort. Weiss is funny and direct. He won't pull punches but isn't mean so take the feedback. Attendance isn't graded but be careful not to miss too much time or you won't learn anything. Classes are mostly watching examples and discussing.

Weiss will gladly help you out if you need it. MUST pay attention to due dates in this class because you only have 5 assignments and they are all very spaced out! Didn't even turn anything in until the end of the semester, so it's easy to forget about this class. Textbook is cheap, and tests are essay based. Stay organized and you'll be fine.

He is Awesome!  I am taking him again this semester. His test are all knowledge based, so what do you know. He doesnt care to much about attendance as long as you are there for the debates and due dates. Overall he is bad ass!

Weiss has been my favorite professor at NKU, which is a tough thing to say because all of my professors have been more than helpful; he educates our students in such a way that allows freedom and growth. His classes allow you to study topics you are interested in and his teaching style allows students to flourish in their own individual way.

Went in thinking I would hate this class, since I don't  like to argue.  It ended up being my favorite class in college.  Great professor who loves teaching and it shows.  Great sense of humor, inspirational. really respects students and their opinions.  Always  looked forward to fun, high energy classes.

Name: Tom Edwards
Comment: I have no idea why Mr. Edwards got such bad reviews. He goes above and beyond to ensure everything is understood and is great with communication. Every time I wrote Mr. Edwards, he answered within the day and really does care about how well you do in the class. I would definitely recommend taking his course.

Easy class as long as you don't procrastinate! The syllabus is vague, cookie cutter with no dates for weekly assignments. This created confusion regrading assignment due dates. But, he allowed late submissions without affecting grade. Slow to grade assignments. Over, very easy class.

This class is easy. Weekly discussion board posts and quizzes, 1 midterm, 1 final, and 4 assessments that take awhile but aren't hard. There is also 1 group project at the end; it isn't bad as long as your group does their work. He takes FOREVER to grade, but as long as you do the work, you'll be fine. Need the textbook. Easy A, take it.

Professor Tom does not have too many assignments, however his midterm and exam are ridiculous - 150 + questions, 2 + hours to take!  Therefore, you can get an A on every assignment but not do so well on the exams and get a lower grade than you expected. Prepare to read and know your stuff!

Professor Edwards needs to retire or learn how to use email, because if you don't contact the head of his department he absolutely will not answer you. I learned a whole lot of nothing in this class, but it was easy and I got an A, so there's that...

He's an amazing teacher and  understands we have a life outside of school.  He posts the assignments so you can work ahead if needed. Very understanding and caring. He's just a little slow at grading.  This is my 3rd class that I've had with him and I hope to have more.
Good online class with great tips on leadership. Late on grading assignments. BB assignments conflicted with syllabus. I should have an A in the class but grades not posted yet.

This is my first online class. LOVED IT! soo easy..everything is straight from the book.  All work is due every monday by 11pm.  I always spent my sunday night doing the work. You read two chapters and then take two quizzes.  Every so often there is a short movie to watch and then write about. NICE professor, EASY CLASS!
Seriously easy online class! Just do the work every week and you will be guaranteed an A! He is very helpful, but the downside is he takes a long time to grade assignments. Great professor!

Tom is a great professor! He is extremely encouraging and really works hard to help you succeed.  I truly enjoyed the videos and the textbook, The Art of Leadership.  He grades kindly and if you do the work you can definitely get an "A"!  I am taking my third class this semester with Tom as the professor and hope to have more!

"Managing Human Resources"... Not the most interesting of topics but easy class, nonetheless. Keep up with your case studies and small written assignments and you will pass. Everything comes straight from the book so there is NO reason  to get something wrong.
Awesome professor. Really knows his stuff and makes class fun as well. I highly recommend his class.
This guy is incredible.  He really sees his students as individuals and respects your time.  Highly recommend this professor and this course!!

Tom is a nice guy and has real world stories that KINDA relate to the subject at hand.  I'd rather spend more time on the material than stories relating to it.  Also, he is VERY hard to got a hold of if you have questions.
Online class, pretty easy as long as you keep up with the work. Discussion boards every week, along with book work. Not too bad considering I wasn't interested in HR at all prior to this course.

Tom, is a great guy if you ever need a job he is the one to go to he knows EVERYONE! I would take any of his classes just to start networking. He does give extra credit and all his exams are online which are nice and he is very fexible which is really really nice for those that work plus go to school

Mr.Edwards needs to retire.  The text is a great book, but he hardly uses it at all.  Except for the open book online tests that are pretty easy when he can remember how to get them posted.  He's friendly and personable enough, but I feel like my time and money are being wasted.
What a joke.  I took this course in person b/c I thought I would learn a lot YEAH right I learned NOTHING. Total joke. Waste of time and money. The only good thing was my A++
This class was awesome and interesting. I love this guy and he class was really easy. Easy A plus a fun time. TAKE THIS CLASS!!!

By far, the best teacher I have ever had. If you need an extra credit class take one of his. He is very laid back and he definitly know the aviation industry.  His stories and jokes are funny and he keeps the class lively. I highly recommend his classes.

Name: Katherine Kurk
Comment: Dr. Kurk was an amazing French professor. She had a spry sense of humor and jazzed up everyday activities with something new almost every time. She was really chill and listened to you well if you needed help. I miss her now that she's retired. :(
The sweetest woman and so passionate about French!
She is seriously amazing and helpful. She teaches slowly so everyone understands. She gives extra credit and her tests are easy.
Show up and ask for help. She refuses to use Blackboard. She is flexible with due dates.

Dr. Kurk is an amazing professor! I had her for both 101 & 102. She is friendly, helpful and funny! She makes learning fun and conduced a comfortable environment where when you had to speak French, if you mess up, it was okay. It's about trying, practicing and trial & error. No one would feel embarrassed if they got it wrong. Very passionate!
Be sure to study and show up and you will be fine!
take home-quizzes are very helpful if you are not a good test taker. SHE WANTS TO HELP YOU!! It is foreign language so it's not easy but if you do the work you will get a good grade.
She is the most amazing  professor I have ever had and one of the sweetest too
Don`t take her class, her exam is so hard. I did not miss any class and I worked hard  and I got B. Also I gave her all the extra work she ask. again don`t take her class.
Great experience with an awesome teacher. She is passionate about the language, and shares that with her students!

Have been with her now for six classes.  Show up, do the assignments fully, keep your notebook up to date, you'll be fully prepared for take-home exams, which will be reasonably easy, assuming you did everything else.  She's very easy-going personally, but there's plenty of work.  Do it carefully, you'll see A's for grades.
Fantastic professor!  Funny, helpful, friendly!  Also, VERY easy to get an A as long as you show up!
Is really good!
Attend class and pay attention and it's an easy A. She's entertaining and friendly.

Each class was entertaining. Only two tests during the 5-week summer session and the midterm was take home and the final was half take home, half open notes. She was big on group work and there one was presentation required which was no biggie. Overall a very great professor that is passionate about Western World Literature!

Dr. Kurk is such an amazing professor and person!  I've never skipped her class because it is so much fun!  For instance, we did our studies from a French children's book!  I recommend her for a fabulous French learning experience!
easy teacher...very nice and helpful....I wouldnt recommend her if you plan on majoring in french because you only get through 3 chapters of the book
Dr. Kurk is an amazing professor.  She made learning French so easy!  I enjoyed the class.  Just be sure to attend class often.  It was an easy A.
Awesome!!! Super helpful, she explains everything so clearly. I was dreading taking this class but I had to and I love it, she is the only teacher I would take if learning French!
Super easy teacher!  Just go to class, and do the homework.  All tests were part take home.  Final was part open book.

Name: Marissa Bowman
Comment: Easily the best professor in NKU's College of Informatics. No one is as smart, witty and caring as her. Every class feels like one where you leave as a more knowledgeable student. A honest to god tragedy that she is not a full time staff member over some of the other professor's who oftentimes feel disconnected from the courses they teach.

by far the best professor I have ever had in all my years at Nku. it is an absolute crime that she is not a full-time teacher. She is funny, and relatable but will challenge and encourage you to fulfill your potential. if you need to take writing for the media or media studies, DEFINITELY choose Marissa
She's goated, easily the best professor I had at NKU.

Prof. Bowman is such a good professor. She is super funny and caring to everyone. Her classes are an all around good time, yet at the same time, you always leave having learned something new. If you are into the subject matter, you will be very interested in the class and she is a great choice to teach it.

Name: Barclay Green
Comment: Clearly loves his job and cares about students, loved the class and the discussions. Expectations are very clear, and class mostly consisted of doing the readings and talking about them with the occasional open-book exam. Yes, you need to read a bit because it's an English class, but it's a perfectly reasonable amount w short stories, poems, plays.

Dr. Green is so fun and happy! He gives you time to work on essays in class, with a brainstorming day, a draft day, and a peer review day before you have to submit. 4 writing pieces, each 200 points. Very lenient. Cancelled many classes my semester. Homework is reading over excerpts from books, which we then discuss in thoughtful conversations.

You will have 4 grades and that is your "exams". His exams are literally 10 short answers and 2 extended responses. They will be over the genre you are reading and the stories you read. It is a very easy class. Classes were just topics. No homework except the online exams.

It was the coolest English course I've ever taken. Every lecture was filled with interesting and hilarious discussions. Often shared personal stories and made almost every story/poem intriguing. We often referred to him as a CHAD.

He's the coolest English professor I've ever encountered, and every class is filled with countless discussions on interesting topics inside and outside of textbook context. Not many assignments, and gives meaningful feedback on exams.

Everyone says this, but BG really is hillarious. 
It's a pretty straightforward class- read something, discuss it, and he guides you to a reasonable conclusion about what the story/poem means. The classes do get pretty tedious sometimes, though. Often felt like 20-30min could have been cut off pretty easily.
Turn everything in on time and you''ll be okay. He's very easy to talk to and great to ask for help. Attendance is graded.

I took class online and everything was organized and clear. There were three papers for the full semester each had three drafts which made it easier to fix mistakes along the way. There are helpful videos explaining the writing projects.
An amazing professor. His humor is different, in a weird funny way. I love it. SUPER lenient; I turned in almost all of my papers late. Not a super hard grader, also always responds to emails!

The text required to read throughout this course can be found online for FREE!! Dr. Green is a great professor and makes the class a lot more enjoyable. There aren't many assignments which means the few tests given are what make your grade.

Great guy! Really passionate about Shakespeare. Each class is guided through what we read between classes. Cool Professor, lots of fun! Graded on a couple of papers and small quizzes he gives verbally.

MR GREEN GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK AND DEFINITELY CARES ABOUT STUDENTS GRADES. HE GAVE 3 WRITING PROJECTS BUT WOULD HAVE A BRAINSTORMING, ROUGH DRAFT AND MID DRAFT BEFORE THE FINAL DRAFT. ALL THIS WAS JUST TO HELP PREPARE YOU FOR THW WRITING ASSISGNMENT

Prof Green is a great professor. He only gives us 2 discussion board replies per week. His instructions videos are helpful and easy to understand. There are 4 exams but it's easy to receive good grades if you pay attention to the videos and discussion board replies

I loved having professor green! He is very sweet and friendly. He gives good feedback on your papers and only wants the best for you. I would take him again. You do need the textbook as a lot of assignments need the book, but all assignments are very easy to complete. Work wasn't tough and it wasn't a big overload of work.

Dr. Green is a wonderful professor, even if you arent an English major I highly suggest taking one of his courses just to have him as an instructor! The grading is consistent and the assignments are clear and to the point. He is understanding and makes class fun. Definitely take him if you can!

I absolutely loved this professor. This class was so easy, as long as you showed up to class and took good notes, you will pass. He really cared about the material he was teaching and our class as a whole. The only grades you have to worry about is coming into class and taking three or four exams. I am really glad I took this course with him.
I loved him very light and up front makes you actually interested in the topic!
Wonderful professor! Made the class interesting and as long as you show up and do the work (which is easy) you will pass with no problem.

He is very energetic and always open to ideas/opinions that students have about the novels that we read. He sticks to the syllabus really well. The only out of class homework is reading. He always makes sure to give notes on what is going to be on a quiz. Only two essay papers are required--midterm and final. Doesn't post grades on canvas.

Awesome prof, he really guides the discussions and helps make sense of the potentially challenging language in the readings. My biggest advice: GO. TO. CLASS. You seriously dont even have to read anything if you go to class, he explains the themes entirely. He wont randomly call on people either, so dont worry about getting exposed for not reading

Name: Seyed Din Allameh
Comment: The lecture videos are mostly 10 years old at least. He assigned a midterm exam on the Saturday after Thanksgiving. The final was assigned for the Friday before finals week and you could only take it that one day. Watching lecture videos was required for "attendance", and you weren't allowed to increase the speed. The note PDFs were most helpful.

Dr Allameh, is an awesome professor. He make the class really easy and if you study he material and do the homework you can easily get an A. He is knowledgeable in his field and he really knows his material. He is there every day to answer your question or help you if you need help. A+ Professor
A great professor
he is good teacher
he is great professor and he gave us great advices in our senior project.

his theory exam is not easy part and you do not have enough time to solve the exam,he give some of the questions directly from the HW and the rest from the note. like the practical part since it is open book, open note and allowed you to use the Xl.
keeps the class engaging. He has a fair grading curve that puts you to an instant B if you show a lot of effort such as showing up for lecture or section. Highly recommended professor!

Dr. Allameh is one of the best staff at NKU. His exams a little bet hard but, if u understand the TW and HW u will did well. Also, he will make a curve after each exam and, extra credit to rise your grade I took about 5  courses with him most my final grades A & B. I recommend this professor to anyone who want to learn & understand the engineering.
Easy class and helpful
Easy class. You have to learn how to do the homwork and you will get A

Dr.Allameh has a great personality, friendly with students and very helpful in/out of class. There are 2 tests, and a final (comprehensive) all fair, but throws impossible questions! Not a big deal because he will grade you based on your rank between others or grades curving. There is in class assignment as teamwork, and a smaller homework.
was not that easy but the guidelines were clear. the syllabus was really organized.
helpful and supportive.

He tries to make unbelievably tough exams like he wants every one to get low grades. He likes to see every one begging him for understandable questions. I got to take this class with him because he is the only teacher available.
Dr. Allameh is such a great Professor,he know the material very well, he like the student to understand and ask him if u don't understand any topic his one of the best pro in the University
