He is great professor, and very capable in the thermodynamic , he teaches us two ways or more to solve the equations, and shows us where the trick is, the exam is hard

Dr.Allameh knows his material very well, his class challenges you, the exams are hard but he is willing to help, he pushes you to learn by weekly HW and team work. Also, he explains the material very well, with many different ways. you have to stand for his class whole the semester otherwise don't take it

Dr. Allameh is such a great Professor that plays an important role within the NKU campus. I have been taking many classes with him ( EGT 340, EGT 318, and EGT 417 ) and his clarity is atop of everything surrounding him. he shows respect, fairness and enthusiasm. he is always motivated and into his job. I have learned so many things from him. :) :)

I've had this professor teaching me several courses. He's great in teaching his courses and interested in explaining them for several years. Truth to be said about him, his punctuality, clarity and overall fairness that he provides. Also, his type of assessments that he gives to his class is unique and beneficial in which it lets the student study.
Great teacher, know what he's taking about.you can get a good grade if you keep up :)

Name: Lori Kran
Comment: I think she is WONDERFUL! Her class is very easy (I took the 7 week course) there was no final, which was awesome. All you really are expected to do is a weekly discussion and reply to others posts. You will need the book to do well though! I would take again!
This was one of the easiest 7 week courses I've taken & would take it over again if I could

Name: Wesley Akers
Comment: I worked hard in this course, but there are very few things that the professor actually used when grading. Be very careful to be on top of things early, as messing up on some of the very few graded assignments you are given early in the class can be disastrous for the rest of your semester. Students that failed only learned that at the end :(

Professor Akers seems like a really cool professor and I would love to have him in person at some point. The class was pretty easy and after you take the first exam, you'll know what to take notes on. Those notes are absolutely essential to the course, but as long as you can take them, you'll be fine.
Wes Akers is an awesome professor. The content of the class was great as well. EMB 105

Nice guy, weird class. We had an exam once a month and prerecorded lectures from at least a year ago. No assignments whatsoever. Hes super funny and responds quick if you reach out to him but doesnt seem to care about class or the content that much. I can easily say I learned nothing. A kindergartener could direct this class better.

Great personality, I'd love to legitimately have him as a professor one day. Lectures are pre-recorded and often drag with white background powerpoints filled with a wall of text. 4 tests a semester that are easy, but leave possibility for falling behind very quickly.

Took EMB-110, had 5 assignments, make sure you know your stuff if you don't want to end with a grade like mine. I did bad on one test. He was testing online courses so constantly cancelled class/did an online video (which were kind of boring). I showed up most classes but if you're able to stay caught up, you only got to be there for test days.
He is an easy grader. Great teacher to have!

As long as you pay attention, you don't need the book.  He told us on the first day that a few extra credit questions would come from readings, but nothing else.  He doesn't take attendance for a grade, but I highly recommend showing up and taking your own notes on top of the powerpoint slides he posts.  Pretty easy class if you put in the effort.
This was my first college course in many years; he made it easy to get back into the swing of things.  Reading assignments were not overwhelming and homework was very relevant; easy to follow along.

Pretty laid back class overall.  Just make sure you have proof of actually doing your work and that you constantly check your grade book.  He forgot to grade my last exam before my final and I had to retake it the day of the final because he lost it.  Not a fun experience.  Organization is not in his arsenal, so stay on him about being organized.

He gives great lectures that keep you entertained. He is very knowledgeable about the field because he has worked in it for so long. Also, super hot so that is just an added incentive to pay attention.

Fairly easy class. He always complained about teaching at 8am because usually he got it at 9:25, so he would cancel classes every now and again. Very easy going. Doesn't take attendance for a grade. I only showed up to the quiz/test reviews and got a B in the class. Good professor, look forward to having him in higher EMB courses.

Wes is the man. I loved his classes. He made everything very clear in his lectures. One class a quiz every session, but they were easy if you were at the last class. Wes helped me on a career goal that got me into the NFL & MLB with his knowledge and awesome sports internships/independent study with NKU TV. Big ups to Wes. He made EMB fun.

Easy as long as you go to class and pay attention. I bought the textbook but I never used it. He offers extracredit on the test which really makes a difference w/ your grade.I not much of a studier but for a few test I did have to make some notecards. His powerpoints are also posted on blackboard along with extracredit. He cancelled class often too
Very good lecturer who can make seemingly dry subject matter interesting.

Wes is awesome. But keep in mind, his classes are not easy. You really have to pay attention and study to get good grades. His lectures can get boring at times, but he knows how to grab your attention with his hilarious, dry sense of humor. He's a really cool guy, but make sure you STUDY. Don't be late or absent: it affects your grade!

This teacher seemed to be a really cool guy out of class. But the way he taught the class was all over the place. Every Quiz or test seemed to be really hard and questions were way out there. They need to stick this guy to only upper level courses. Because I can't imagine being a freshman and having him.

Very laid-back professor, easy-going; however, I would say this personality type makes him a bit dangerous in teaching intro-level courses.  He's perfect teaching upper level EMB (I've had two 300 level courses with him), but not structured enough for introductory EMB in my opinion.
really liked this proessor, made it really interesting. quizzes were tricky sometimes and you didnt know what day they would be on so you pretty much had to show up every class.
If you are interested in television production this Professor is who you are looking for. Has extensive experience in the industry.

Name: Katie Boerger
Comment: The best teacher this University has to offer! Truly do miss her classes. But I do wish she had a LinkedIn account so we could connect. But still her classes are 1000% worth it

I HATE group projects, but I really enjoyed how this class went. She was hilarious and related everything to real world topics, which made the discussions easy to follow and not boring! Super easy A. Highly recommended.

This has been one of my favorite classes and Katie was quickly one of my favorite professors. The class involved essays and lots of group work, but if you showed up and participated, there was a good chance you did well. She put a lot of class topics into real life situations from her own experience.

Name: Melanie Cundiff
Comment: Mel is extremely intelligent and if you are interested in anything healthcare related, you should take her. The classes are generally not that hard because Mel engages you and inspires you to know the material. Northern Kentucky University's best kept secret honestly.
The best professor I've ever had at NKU! She is sweet and always there for you! No matter what health care field you're going in TAKE HER!!!

MEL IS AMAZING! She is so down to earth and really cares about her students. She understands things happen. She gives her phone number the first day and is really good at answering texts! She has been through A LOT and even if you aren't a respiratory major, find a class to have her, you'll be truly inspired. One professor i'll keep in touch with!

Name: Lou Manchise
Comment: A lot of open-ended/essay type questions for assignments, but he is very clear with what he expects from them and where to find the information. Multiple opportunities for extra credit.
This guy was great, top notch. His compliments made me cry happy tears. I wish I could have him again!
He's very knowledgeable and fair, although he does use the words "fully describe" but really means "take a quote from the book and then one more sentence"
Great Professor!
He's kinda boring and the lectures are very long! Test can be difficult
Great teacher I am sad class is over

One of my favorite professors of all time.  Gives out extra credit like candy (All an actual percentage of your grade- helps out  A LOT.)  Makes class as interesting as he possibly can.  Very knowledgeable.
Great prof! Helpful hint: study all the T&R's and you'll pass with flying colors! He offers plenty of extra credit at the % level NOT points you'd be a fool not to do the EC.
Love this class.  Learned a lot, not hard if you follow directions. Would highly recommend.

He is a very nice and caring guy. His class is sometimes boring. Does alot of group work, so if you skip make sure you have a good group. Group work is on the test though. Is very fair in grading. Though I got a C in the class but ended up with a B+! Lots of Extra Credit!
Good professor who really cares about his students.  We had guest speakers.  I'm going to take his other grad class in the fall.

Lou Manchise is a great teacher.  He is very friendly and willing to help his students.  The class was very enjoyable, and I recommend taking him.  The only catch is that you NEED to show up for class.  Test questions will relate to actual things were done/talked about in class.  So, you have to have been there to know the answers.

HORRIBLE CLASS. I wouldn't recommend him for anything. Class is all powerpoint and quizzes are mostly fill in the blank. Doesn't give study guides and doesn't specify whats on the quiz. Just says to review class notes, powerpoints and book. He is useless and didn't learn anything from this class and well avoid him.

One of my all time favorite professors. He tries to make class fun and exciting. There are a lot of group activities so make sure you are with people you like. All of the quizes are based on power point and in class activities. So if you go to class every day you will get an easy A. Everything you learn is real life and he tries to make class fun.

Manchise is a nice guy, the class is just really boring. Can tell he has a genuine interest in management and he wants to relate things in class to the real world so you'll take something away from it. Really repetitive, and if you don't come to class, you won't know half the questions on the quizzes.

He's a good man. Very wise when it comes to Managing people. But, as a teacher, he kind of rambles. If you don't come to class then it's useless to answer the fill-in-the-blank questions. So, I would recomend taking him. He's a good guy, somewhat boring. But, there is extra credi

Prof. Manchise seems like the ideal grandfather type figure. Take this class, he's a really nice guy that explains himself clearly and he's also quite jolly and amusing. I don't mind his teaching methods at all. He also gives out a good bit of extra credit (8% in total), so don't worry about bombing a quiz.

He was very knowledgable, i agree, class does get repetitive and sometimes boring, but everything he taught was all real world material.  He was very nice and I would recommend him.  Not a lot of homework, quizes are alright, and final was lil tough.  His quizes and test consist mostly of fill in the blank, so make sure u know ur stuff!

GREAT GUY! The class could get very repetitive, but he's trying to drill in the skills he wants you to take away. You do learn some very useful real world negotiating skills. Super nice guy, enthusiastic about the material, fun to talk to. Would definitely take more classes with him!

Name: David Bishop
Comment: He is a. Exemplary mentor!
Dr. Bishop is awesome. Period.

Dr. Bishop is a very nice guy! Easy to listen to. He seems to know a lot about liturature and did not seem to know what direction to take classroom management. I really didn't learn any more then what I had known from experience! I was hoping to learn more about responsive classroom and that subject was never discussed! Super easy class!!!

Dr. Bishop is one of the nicest profs but I didn't feel I learned much on the proper way to manage a classroom and I was really hoping to get more insight on this.  Class was mostly discussion with alot of self analysis at the beginning to determine your teaching style.  I was disappointed that the class was not set up differently.  Super guy thoug

Dr. Bishop is amazing!  He's very laid back, but still manages to teach you an extraordinary amount.  He has great tastes in texbooks and other course literature, and always takes students' needs into account.  Being in his class was a great experience, and I hope I have the opportunity to take hime again.
Dr. Bishop was one of my favorite professors. He genuinely cares for his students.

Maybe the easiest A ever.  Classes are just discussions about the chapters from the book.  You write a few papers during the semester, and he gives you a rubric so you know exactly what you need.  The final is a paper, which is a very long paper, but also he tells you exactly what to write.  He is also a very nice guy and does know his stuff
Professor Bishop is an excellent professor. He is someone you could listen to all day.  He has a wealth of experience and knowledge.  Anyone who has him should be considered lucky.
He is awesome!  Very laid back, yet extremely enthusiastic about what he wants to teach.  You can learn a lot from him, if you want to.

Name: Rebecca Hazen
Comment: I pay minimum attention in this class. I took psych in high school but not AP as I did not originally need it. If you have taken psych before, this is the easiest class. If you haven't taken psych before, pay attention to what she says.

Shes super cool. Her class is so easy and shes super cool. The only bad thing is theres lots of powerpoints. She tries to shake it up with some videos and fun personality quizzes, but sometimes an hour and 25 minute class with nothing but powerpoints gets tiring.

Hazen gives only multiple choice tests and a decent amount of possible extra credit. She heavily relies on powerpoint lectures for the class and reviews before every test. A good choice for a gen-ed and a good grade, as long as you pay attention in class.

I went to class because she took attendance, but didn't pay much attention during lectures. She tells you what you need to know for the tests, and you can go through the powerpnts to find the answers to those questions. Tests are pretty easy; she also offered 75 easy extra credit pts. Very little homework which amounted to maybe 30m of time total.
She's a really sweet professor. She really knows her stuff and makes class fun. I'd take her again. We had almost all of our tests online, which made it nice.

She gives very little homework, all semester we had only 5 homework assignments. All very easy. She allows you to skip 6 classes with no grade deduction. She is very funny. Final exam is not accumulative. She will give you a list of everything you need to know before every exam. So easy to pass this class.

Mrs. Hazen is a great professor! She goes over the exams the class period before. The material is very interesting and she incorporates a lot of videos and modern day scenarios to the lessons. Doesn't make this class so difficult that it is impossible to pass. Only mild studying required. She has inspired me to add a neuroscience minor.

Perfect professor if you're taking this for a gen ed! She gives you the topic of each question on the exam the class before the exam, and the final is just the exam on the last chapter. Homework is so basic. DON'T buy the book!

The most boring Psychology course that I've ever taken. Every class is a Powerpoint lecture, with information taken almost directly out of the book. She practically reads word for word off of the powerpoint. If you are a fan of Psychology and want to actually learn something, I suggest taking this course with another professor.
She's an amazing person and teacher.  Super nice, always gives examples that help and she goes over everything that's going to be on the test before the test!!

Easy class, super boring. Barely knows the material, and the powerpoints come almost directly out of the textbook. If you enjoy psych, dont take her,taking it cause you have to, shes a good choice as long as you don't mind having to show up for a class you can easily pass without with mandatory attendance

one of the easiest psychology classes you will take. It irritated me she graded on attendance because all she does is read right off the power points half the time I don't think she knew the material very well. (had her for abnormal). Don't get me wrong she is really nice and you can pass the class easy if you just show up and listen.

After reading the ratings on this professor I think it depends on what days you have her. If you have her 2x a week then it may get rushed a little bit from what she told us(3x a week). She presents the material well, interesting tone of voice, uses great examples to relate to her lecture material. Great teacher, easy tests if you study.

She has a really bubbly personality and uses real world situations so it's easy to relate to her lectures. She seems fair with her rules and grading criteria, and shows that she's trying to improve as a professor. She started off kind of ditsy and would occasionally slur her words, but that seems to be improving. I would recommend her.

I regret taking this course with Ms. Hazen.  If you HAVE to take this class, look for a different professor.  Not only does she not clarify her lectures, but it seems like she reads off the PowerPoint slides and that is the extent of her knowledge. She also made us pay 75$ for a textbookonline quiz system (REVEL) that we didn't use once.
Easiest class I've ever taken. All quizzes are online so you can use your book, she only has 4 exams the whole year. I rarely went to class, maybe once a week & I passed with a 95%.

I would not recommend her. She is very nice, but she always comes in to class not too prepared. She rushes through her lectures and is constanly saying, "um." Her tests are easy enough. I did like how she posted her power points on black board. As long as you have those and study you will pass the class without her lectures.
She goes way too fast during her lectures, she doesn't really engage with students. A lot of the time it seems likes shes just goes on about nothing. She's just very frustrating overall.

Her class was pretty easy, if you come to class, pay attention & go 2 the test review w/ the teacher assistant you'll get an A. She's young but she knows her stuff & gives real world examples so you can actually use what u learn. And it's not all lecture, she does videos & activities too. I'd take her again.

Her class is all about passing the test. This is great if you're like me and don't intend on having a future in Psychology. Her lectures can get kinda boring, her student aid is more interesting than she is. She has random pop quizzes. But her tests are super easy to pass, minimal homework, and minimal textbook use. All in all, an easy class.

Name: Greg Procaccino
Comment: Mr. Procaccino was very engaging and cared about how his students did. He was funny, but pretty crass at times and did use profanity relatively often, as well as showed a video in class that had nudity in it to show the theatrical elements. Extra credit was an option, which was nice, and he was interested in getting to know students.

Great person. Speaks fast. Lots of writing for taking the notes. Required to see two plays and write summaries. Gives extra credit. Content is heavy , you will actually have to study for the test and quizzes and some questions are based on class discussion
I love this guy. Hes a comedic genius and my class experience couldnt have been better this semester

I LOVE THIS PROFFESOR!!! I had him for theater appreciation and would take him over and over again if I had the chance. If you ever get the opportunity to take his class I highly recommend you do so. Would rate 100% in every aspect including but not limited too his teaching and personality.

At the beginning I thought he was awesome and then towards the end not so much. He doesn't use blackboard so you have to go to class to get the notes. When he's in a bad mood he can be really rude. Tests are really easy but only if you study. All of his tests are short answer questions. And he will make you give performances and right papers.

Greg was really cool in the beginning but then towards the end he got sick of us "stupid students." When he is in a bad mood he lets you know and puts you there with him. He's really inappropriate at times, especailly to the ladies. write in answers for tests, no mult. chioce. makes you participate in class. easy A if you study though.
Procaccino is my spirit animal. Best class of my entire life. Take this class you won't regret it.

The BEST professor I have ever had. I had him for a dual credit course and it was incredibly fun! He is absolutely hilarious and very understanding. He is very knowledgeable and makes everything interesting. Plus, there is no textbook for his class.

Great teacher! He is hilarious and he really cares about theatre. He has a strange sense of humor so if you are overly sensitive don't take this class. While some of the material can be boring, he does whatever he can to make the class fun!
He is awesome! Best teacher I have so far. Please take this class he is so funny!!
This was my favorite class of the semester by far.
Hysterical professor! He is defnitely one you wont forget. He's an awesome singer and his class is very informative but fun at the same time!

Hilarious. Favorite class yet! He makes everything interesting, and will help you a lot. He's got a great sense of humor and likes to get to know his students. Great professional actor, by the way. Every Year, He's Scrooge in playhouse in the park's A Christmas Carol if you wanna see him

LOVED HIM! Best professor I've had. He's hilarious and makes class fun. There are only 2 papers, and the final is over the play Equis (spelling?). No text book required. Study the notes he gives you, which isn't very much)and the tests will be a breeze

Absolute best theater teacher I've ever had. You show up get the notes and study them. The tests are a breeze as long as you attend class and get the notes. He is hilarious. He likes to talk about his heritage a lot. He isn't bad to look at either. Highly suggested that you take his course. He is extremely knowledgeable because he is/was an actor.

Absolute best theater teacher I've ever had. You show up get the notes and study them. The tests are a breeze as long as you attend class and get the notes. He is hilarious. He likes to talk about his Italian heritage a lot. He isn't bad to look at either. Highly suggested that you take his course.
Hey is freaking awesome. Easy to get along with and willing to help anyone who asks.

He is HILARIOUS. I love this guy!! His tests are easy, and if you're a good looking girl, you'll get an even better grade (Kidding, but only a little). For the first time in my life, I'm actually going to miss this class and I kind of wish I failed just so I can retake him again!!!Gleckner

Realize this: I have been in some sort of theater program for years so I might have thought it was simple but others might now. You do however have to attend class that's a lot of your grade, the tests are as well. It's fun though and the professor is nice. Basically if you show up and do your work than you'll be fine.
love him he is so funny and makes class fun!!! You just have to show for class and you will pass.

Name: Robin Bartlett
Comment: I've had two classes with Dr. Bartlett. She's an acquired taste. Very kind, just had hard tests. She liked to put in "none of the above" as an answer choice and it became hard to discern the answer because of wording and conflicting information in the textbook and test. Studied extensively for the last test (unit tests only) and got a 79%.

Exams are extremely difficult. When studying, make sure to use the textbook because almost all information comes from that. She's nice and the quizzes/extra credit are good grade boosters, but lectures don't give lots of great preparation for the exams. If I could redo, I just wish I would have used the book for everything.
Good no-nonsense overview class. Would take it again. One small complaint: the research participation "extra credit" is mandatory and tedious.
Gets very off topic and has very difficult tests depite the easy quizzes and study guides

I managed to get a B without reading the textbook. 
Lecture notes have blanks in them for you to fill out during class.

Tests are worth a lot but she has study guides and there are lots of chances for extra credit. She is very caring and wants to see you succeed, and ask for help if you need it. If you focus on the study topics she gives you and does the reviews she makes you should do well. You don't have to read the whole book but skim it if you want an A.

Beware! Very lecture heavy, very test-heavy, you have to take 5 very difficult exams within the semester and they are pretty heavily weighted on your grade. Dr. Bartlett does give extra credit opportunities but nothing substantial. You need to do very well on the exams or it will result in a low grade in the class.
She's a great professor, her exams are just very hard even when note taking. I would recommend if needed to take this class then to watch the exams more then reading the textbook.
Very nice and responsive to students.

Dr. Bartlett is an amazing professor. Lectures are great especially bc she's so passionate developmental. Really cares about all her students. If you're able to take a class with her, do it!! You won't regret it.
She has LOTS OF LECTURES that you MUST watch in order to pass the tests. She is very helpful and caring, and I would definitely take her again!

She is one of the best! She answered questions quickly, and was always willing to help. By far the smoothest online class I have ever taken. She really knows what she is doing. The class was actually really helpful an I learned a lot.
super easy class, obviously required with 210

Dr. Bartlett's class is very enjoyable and you definitely learn a lot. She is very approachable, a great professor, and seems like an overall caring individual. I would definitely take her again for another Psychology class.

She was extremely good with me when I had to miss more than one class and missed some homework. Her teaching method really worked well and she made what I thought was going to be a boring class interesting. I really liked her and I'm taking her again. But don't think about missing class unless it's a very very good reason.
Dr. Bartlett is the sweetest woman Ive ever had as a professor. She truly cares about her students and their futures. The class required no book or exams. Very simple!!
Professor Bartlett is awesome!

Dr. Bartlett is honestly amazing. She's genuine, caring, and she knows so much about the subject matter she teaches. She gave me an amazing recommendation for my current job. She's funny, and her classes are simple enough. I wish I had the opportunity to take her again!!!

Lectures are good but prepare to learn about her personal life. Usually struggles to get through 3-4 slides and I had this class 2x, 1 hr 15 min. Wish more was covered in class. Gives "study topics" which are broad & hard to locate within text. Make sure you go thru text bc some will be on exam. Gives up to 15 pts xtra cred & in class participation
easily off topic in this class. Lots of reading involved because the interesting stuff required to pass the tests is in the book. offers extra credit and drops some low quizzes.

Name: Susan Winters
Comment: She is one of the best teachers at NKU. She is not your traditional read from a text book. She teaches her online class from resources across the internet. She has in depth assignments that make you think. She is awesome at giving meaningful feedback and has extra throughout the course. Taking her again in the fall.

Professor Winters is the best professor at NKU. I have taken 2 online classes with her and would take more. Neither class felt like an online learning experience. Winters was invested in us and active in the course. She made personal comments to us in discussion boards and kept conversation flowing. She treated me with empathy and compassion.

Professor Winters is one of my favorite professors at NKU. She is so caring and helpful! You do want to be on top of your work because some of the papers can be lengthy, but they're very helpful. If you can taker her class, I would highly recommend it!

This professor is honestly one of the best on campus. I have never left a review on this site before but felt I should after how great she was to us. This semester we switched in the middle of the semester from in person to online because of COVID 19 and Dr Winters took it like a champ. She was available via her personal cell phone and email.
Professor Winters really cares about the students and is very good at communication and explaining the homework well.
Professor Winters is one of the best professors I have taken in the college of business. Glad to be taking her for a second time

She's great. She really cares about her students, but expects everyone to come to class for the group members sake. She teaches in a non conventional way but keeps everyone engaged. This class has helped me in my current job as a manager. I recommend.

Best professor I've had in my college experience!She teaches the class in her own style which made it fun and interesting. There is a lot of group work in the class but its because she wants everyone engaging with each other. Attendance is mandatory! If you study for the quizzes, participate and wow her with the final presentation, you'll get an A

Name: Emily Detmer-Goebel
Comment: She's overall lovely, however the class was a bit tedious while at the same time being too easy in content matter for most students. Also, one time in a comment on a paper I turned in she used the wrong form of your/you're. So.

I had her Shakespeare class and she was so passionate about it, she made me love it! Super awesome teacher and would take her again in a heart beat! If you have the chance, go for it. Definatley worth it!

Dr. D is awesome! She is the best professor I have had in my major and she is also my advisor which is super helpful! i am taking a course in the fall and i made sure it was with her. she is very clear on what she expects and she is very good about keeping things "interesting" :D definitely take her if you get the chance!

Dr. D. is awesome.  She is very open to discussion and loves what she teaches.  She is also very helpful when it comes to writing papers. I would recommend her to any student, especially English majors.
Best class i've had at NKU. She loved teaching and made the class interesting and worth while. If you do the work, you will get the A.

So nice!  Dr. D is a great professor.  If you show up to class and turn in all four papers ON TIME, you should make an A.  A lot of class discussion, just comment every once and awhile and you'll be fine.  No tests.  Fun class and very laid back. Definitely would recommend her!

Dr. D is first off a relief for a new freshman like myself who is not amazing at English.She was always willing to help any of us individually post class. Having said that, it was an honors class and she did grade it as such.I do not recommend taking her course if you can not handle receiving constructive criticism frequently.
Dr. D is so wonderful!  She is was a professor should be.  She is passionate about what she teaches and is genuinely concerned about the students.  Taking her again next semester!
Emily is a wonderful professor and is very enthusiastic about the criteria in which she teaches!

Great professor. Read the books and talk and it can't get easier. If you don't read, sparknote it and add to others comments in class. Easy participation grade. Everything is discussed that you need to know.

The instructor was interesting, very helpful, and always cheerful. The class was well paced and instructions were clear. Attending some plays was required and enjoyable. Definitely recommend this instructor.

easy A if you write all the assigned papers and read when she tells you to. there's a lot of writing, but as long as you have something you'll usually get an A. she didn't really teach anything new, just made us write a lot. shes a nice person.

She's a sweet person. There was a lot of work in the class, but with an honors class, you shouldn't go in expecting much less. Lots of reading and papers, but she's always willing to help you with it when you need her.

Dr. D is a great professor. She explains things very well and is extremely helpful. Her tests are easy if you've read the material - they require almost no studying. She is more interested in having the students understand the material than giving hard tests.

She's a very good teacher, she knows her stuff! She's always willing to help you with your papers. She expects you to do the work and the readings and comment in class. Don't take her if you're the shy/silent type, she WILL expect you to comment and discuss.

Awesome class!  I enjoyed coming to class every time.  She brought snacks and it was a laid back environment that was very condusive for conversation-like commentary on the texts.  I would definately recommend this professor.
She's super nice but expects you to do the work you're assigned.  I guarantee if you take her you'll learn something.

Name: Keith Collins
Comment: such a good man
Overall Mr. Collins was a great teacher. I took a 100 level course so it was a pretty introductory class. He is funny and very intelligent. His lectures are interesting. Good guy and a good teacher.

One of the best professors at the college. Is willing to help you with anything and is very accessible outside of class. His tests are easy as long as you come to class, and offers extra credit throughout the semester. Is very easy to talk to and a class I enjoy going to everyday.

Mr. Collins is a really nice and caring professor. He is a quick responder when you message him and always is willing to help you understand material if you are confused. His test are hard and there is sometimes information on there that you didn't learn in class. His lectures are often really heavy but he does provide extra credit opportunities.
Nicest guy you will ever meet! Very understandable and willing to help in any way he can.

My FAVORITE person and professor. I loved coming to his classes and I looked forward to them. Hes amazing, 10/10 recommend. Really makes you understand the material. Teaches you and tells you exactly what you need to know and what is important. Willing to answer any question you have and is easily accessible via email or in-person if need be.
One of the best professors at NKU. Hes very student centered and understanding. Definitely my favorite professor at NKU by far.
had fun, amazing teacher, learned a lot and is willing to meet with you. very accessible
Favorite professor!! Learned good information and it was an easy A
Honestly one of the best professors at nku. Very understanding and wants all his students to excel in his class. i would definitely take this class again if i could.

LOVED him! He is so nice, I also had him for KIN 125. He is lecture heavy but he doesn't read straight off the ppt. He knows what he's talking about and does his best to get you to understand the topic. Quiz every class over the previous stuff we went over but theyre easy as long as you pay attention. Gives lots of extra credit ops and easy points.

Great professor! And an extremely easy class. I don't care for sports all that much but I learned a lot in his class, lectures can be boring but if you show up, it's a possibility that you could earn some extra credit. His tests are easy, not a stressful class at all. I loved his class.

Name: David Smith
Comment: Accounting lab was a benefit when taking accounting. 25 points a class so dont miss any. 4 projects, one is out of 100. Good with explaining anything you feel your accounting professor didnt explain good.

Name: Lezlie Stephens
Comment: I took Professor Stephens online and her class was super organized and she is very clear about everything she expects from you. She is a stickler about late work- it isn't accepted, so make sure you're staying on top of your assignments. There was a quiz each week and the answers were straight out of the book, 2 tests, and a final paper. Take her.

Name: Stephanie Brumer
Comment: She's great

Stephanie's great! I've now taken two different dance classes with her, Ballet I and Jazz I. I have enjoyed both of them. She keeps you moving the entire class time! She's easy to talk to and allows 3 unexcused absences. However, the class moves a little slow if you have prior dance experience & she tends not to give specific feedback/corrections

She is very helpful and classes are engaging and fun. I've had her from 100 level to 300 classes and she is always willing to help you, no matter how good of a dancer you are.  Attendance is mandatory.  You will get out of this class what you put into it.
Great instructor who cares about people.

Name: Sylvain Fasciotto
Comment: Yall I love his class so freaking much, like he is honestly one of my favorite professors. He grades really well and gives excellent feedback, he responds to messages almost immediately!! Teaches the class well. But! If you arent an auditory learner you may struggle a little

Honestly as long as you try, you'll get a good grade. He makes the class super enjoyable. If he can see you're putting in effort, he won't take away points for little mistakes on homework or quizzes. You just have to study and actually try. If you do so, it's an automatic, easy A or B. I wish I could take him for FRE 102.

By far one of the most interesting teachers I've had in awhile! I really became interested in French because of him enough so that I minored in it. If you are struggling or don't understand something he is more than willing to help. The more you participate in class the better. He's full of interesting trivia and makes learning stress free.

Professor Fasciotto is a cool guy. He can be quirky and crazy sometimes, but he means well. I know the Language Department has to fit a lot of info into a short period of time, but every class was very rushed and he made us feel like we were always behind schedule. Other than that, the class was great.

Name: Lin Sun
Comment: Sun laoshi is the best teacher I have had at NKU so far! She is super helpful if you have any questions. She explains everything so well. I wish they had CHI 201 so I could take her more. She made learning this complex language very easy.

I really like her and her class. She's originally from China, so she always shares her authentic view with us. She also speaks good English, which helps to explain things clearly. This is a fun class, with a lot of fun stuff to learn.

Sun Laoshi is awesome! She makes this challenging language so fun to learn, and she always has some ways to make things easy to remember. There are not too many assignments, and they are pretty helpful. Quizzes and tests are not hard at all (if you are studying). I do enjoy all the culture stuff she talks about in class. She rocks my world!

Name: Holly Riffe
Comment: She is very nice, her class is very entertaining, and she lectures the class in a more conversation/discussion based way making you feel like you can talk and interact with what she is saying. My only complaint is there is a few documentaries you have to watch in another language, but the class is still amazing!

What a phenomenal leader Hollie is. Please don't be afraid of her liberal views, we are all adult and must learn to respect each other and our beliefs. I am a conservative and still LOVED the compassion and empathy Hollie has for humanity. I will try to take her again!

I absolutely could not stand this class because of how liberal heavy she is. If you are a republican, I wouldn't recommend taking this class because it gets really annoying when she comments on every assignment with liberal feedback. She doesn't take off points for not writing liberal ideas, but always leaves some type of intimidating feedback.

Absolutely wonderful professor. I learned so much from Professor Riffes class and would definitely take it again. Very interesting and eye opening. This class is mostly documentaries and you need to thoroughly manage your time to finish the work. If you complete everything, you will earn an A and learn a lot.
SWK 106: Introduction to Social Justice Summer June 1 ? July 3, 2010. I had an A in the class that is was supper... She will correct your mistakes so you can earn more point. She is the BEST
Great Professor in the department. Down to earth woman, yes liberal, but very smart and forward with reality.
She is a great professor, she got me interested in social work.  she is very understanding and will work to help you out with any problem you have.

Dr. Riffe is an amazing person with a wealth of knowledge to share. Some folks in my class thought it was "stupid" to have to do all the community involvement exercises, but it was really a very good experience; also a nice way to make some basic connections in the field. Dr. Riffe is laid back and liberal. Highly recommended.

She's an awesome professor! You will learn a lot from her, and she knows what she's talking about.  Is liberal but I feel she is fair about not making more conservative students feel inferior she's very open minded.

This is a grant writing class which will come in handy if you plan to work nonprofit-ever. Very educational and enlightning.  Good rational with current issues- a professor without talking points! Very well decorated in the academic world.

This class is very fun.  Its called Community Experience bc you visit places in the community where a social worker might work. It was very interesting finding out what a social worker does and it helped me decide if that was what I wanted to do with my life.  Holly Riffe was an alright teacher. However, she is very political. Be prepared for bias.
Very interesting.  Very liberal professors.  Very interesting comments about the government.
thats true...everyone does want her!
Everyone wants Riffe!

Name: Julie Hart
Comment: Her lectures were quite lengthy and she would often talk around the subject. When she was talking on subject, I found it helpful to take notes over everything she said. For exams, make sure to study the objectives and go through the PowerPoints. It's not a hard class, but don't slack off or it'll be hard to catch back up.
hard class for me, but she made it better. she is very accessible outside of class and wants you to do well

Julie is a really fun professor! Very to the point and direct in her teaching. I do agree with others when they say she's a hard grader, because she is. But, if you study and know the content, then everything will be okay! Overall really great!

She is very willing to help and her classes are so much fun. Very polite and respectful even out of class. However we spent a lot of time before class prepping for quizzes. Class would have been perfect without those quizzes
Julie is very helpful! She makes this class fun but you do need to be there everyday. Would recommend taking her!!

She is great for 210L (skills lab), 215 (fundamentals) and 339L (clinical reasoning I). She is super sweet and really explains everything so you actually know the rationale behind things, not just memorization of information. I highly recommend her for any nursing class.
Had her for 215 and 220L.  Very helpful and easy to talk to.  Wants you to do well so she is a hard grader but still puts things very straightforward.

Great Professor! She really pushes you that extra bit to perform the skill with precision. She can be a tough grader but it will pay off in the end. Also had her for 215- very easy exams and great enthusiasm in the classroom. Definitely recommend! (PS: DONT BUY THE 210 SKILLS BOOK!)
She is great!!! So helpful and made the class much more enjoyable.
There isn't enough space

Name: Nancy Jentsch
Comment: This class is fairly easy, so long as you put in the work. Assignments are given daily, but are online and don't take long. Professor Jentsch is very good at teaching, and will do anything to help you. Participation is important, but it helps with learning the material. There are a decent amount of quizzes are given often, but are fairly easy.

Professor gives extra-credit. The textbook is online so there's no getting out of that. Assignments are pretty straight forward. There are alot of quizzes and a good handful of tests but she makes sure you're well prepared. She's well organized and she gives you a step-by-step schedule.

She's a wonderful professor and she's very passionate about German. Textbook is mandatory but is good for both semesters so it's not too bad. There is extra credit available but you will need to keep up with your syllabus in order to find it. Most homework is done online and usually doesn't take longer that 15 minutes to complete.

I had to take a foreign language credit for my science major and I'm glad I wound up taking German 101 and 102 with Mrs. Jentsch. She is very passionate and knowledgeable about the German language. If you show up to class and take good notes, you shouldn't have a problem.
Very nice and is always willing to try and help. If you keep up on homework and learn vocabulary you will pass with flying colors. She loves German which makes learning German a lot easier.
Ms. Jensch is a great professor and she is obsessed with German! I thought her class was easy. Not much homework. Go to class and you will have no problem passing!

Willing to help students at anytime. She is exceptionally sweet. She does take attendance and it is factored into your grade. However she is very understanding if you need to miss. I recommend taking her. Very easy to understand and a wonderful professor.
Good professor,enthusiastic about her subject. Instructions are clear and if you're confused or having trouble, she's willing to help.
she's very enthusiastic about the german language and can explain grammar pretty well. I would recommend taking her to those interested in taking german.

Professor Jentsch is a great teacher. She's obviously passionate about the German language. She is very helpful and will answer any question. She can be a little judgmental at times, but she's still a great teacher.
Extremely helpful. If you pay attention and study for her vocab quizzes in class you will do fine. Just get on her good side and she will always be nice to you. Best german teacher i have ever had.

Fabulous professor. Caring individual. Very helpful and always willing to go out of her way to help students. Always available outside of class, almost whenever you need something. Very good professor. Is very enthusiastic about the subject, and really helps you learn.
She is not only a caring individual outside of class, but a fabulous teacher.  Like any language class, there is repetitive work, but it is necessary.  I will be taking her again!
She seemed rather short tempered and impatient. She spoke to our class like we were stupid. The lectures weren't really all that interesting and didn't seem to have much to do with the course.

Had her for Harry Potter and Social Justice, summer intersession. She made the 3 hours fly by, and gave me a totally new side to the HP books. Very nice, friendly, and helpful. Probably the most fun and interesting class I've had so far.
Amazing professor. I learned so much in her class. It's a shame that she does not teach more of the upper level classes. I would still be in German if she taught more.
No Comments

Name: Connie Bruins
Comment: she is a great professor if you take her night class it will be cake but its mostly basic knowledge and if you pay attention to what she says you will be fine doesn't grade very hard as long as you put something down and attempt it you will get most if not all points but you must be outgoing to make the class easy, ask questions and seem intereste
She cares about every student passing and is willing to give alternative assignments if something isnt working out for you.
She is so easy to talk to and if you need help with anything inside or out of her class she's always willing to help you. Only complaint is that her lectures are a little confusing.
Connie is a great professor! If you need Geography, definitely take it with Dr. Bruins!

While I enjoyed Connie more as a person than a professor, her class wasn't too difficult.  The only challenge was her two midterms.  She gave ridiculous study guides a week in advance, but really just going to class and having some prior knowledge of the subjects discussed are what helped me get an A.

I agree the test are somewhat hard but if you know anything about geography you should be fine for this class. I love her stories and it is always something different each class. Overall I enjoy the class.

She is a GREAT lady.  I love her just for that.  She loves her students and is there to help. She does tell alot of stories but most of the time they connect with what she is talking about or she has a reason to be telling them..

Connie seems to be a little confused. This is a geography class not story time. We maybe had 4-5 lectures all semester that was on topic, besides that we listened to her stories or talked in groups off topic. She is very friendly and willing to help but I learned nothing. Being that she doesn't teach, he tests are very difficulty. Do well on HW!

Connie is a nice lady and I like her as a person. But as a teacher, absolutley horrible. I have no idea whats going on in the class and I havent missed one day. She tells stories the whole class and gets off topic and then apparently we have these hard tests?? Its like I dont know where she gets this information from. If you can take someone else, do it. Nice lady, but teaching style is just completely off and confusing.

Connie is great! This was my second class with her. She is very easy and really cares about her students. If you turn something in late, she does not take off points. If you have a problem with an assignment, she will work with you to create a solution. Attendance was not mandatory, but was taken into account for a small participation grade.
I think she is a very nice lady, but can be very confusing, Doesn't post grades in a timely manner on Blackboard, lets students run all over her, and doesn't really seem to care for her job.

Professor Bruins is so nice. As long as you have all the assignments in by the end of the semester she does not take points off. Her test are a little lengthy though, with at least 1 essay, but most have 2.

Dreaded this class, but Professor Bruins made it tolerable. GREAT professor, projects/papers are not difficult. Buy the book, you need it. Very willing to accommodate extenuating circumstances and highly understanding. TAKE GEO 100 WITH HER!!
If you need to take geo 100, TAKE HER. She's friendly, and will help you. If you have projects/papers, she tells you what she wants in them, and as long as you follow what she asks for, easy A.

She is an awesome lady and is very nice and helpful. The class in general isn't too exciting but she can make it interesting. Everything is easy just make sure you study your book really hard for the tests. I would recommend her, you wouldn't regret it.
Love her!! She is so nice. Her lectures aren't interesting. They are very boring. But she's awesome. Take this class!

Super easy class! Love Ms. Bruins, she took our whole class out to eat and paid. I've had her for three semesters and plan to take her again. Great class to just hang out in and attendance isn't a big a priority just don't take advantage and not show up all the time.

She is a fun teacher and one of the easiest classes I have ever taken. As long as you read your books for exams you will be fine because her lectures aren't very useful. 3 tests and 8 hw assignments, super easy class.

I love Dr. Bruins! I have had her a few times now and I enjoy her classes because its like a "free" period in college. She is lenient on attendance, her assignments are easy but fun and her exams are take home. Most of the time you have a big paper to write, but they're not bad at all. She grades easy. A nice change from other teachers here.Low key

The class is kind of boring, but she tries to make it fun and enjoyable. The assignments and quizzes are easy enough, but you do have to work in this class. She will help you in any way possible and really does want you to succeed. Her class is such a relaxed, low stress environment.

Name: Teressa Elliott
Comment: I want graded by Judge Karen A. Thomas, but it was her class. It was lengthy for sure.

I absolutely loved having Professor Elliott! Her lectures are super informative, and the grading is straightforward. Study guides are super useful, and the readings are long but no fluff to it. As long as you read the material you'll pass. I hope I get her for future classes.
I was very nervous to take a law class especially because it's not my major/focus and she was great!!

Great professor! Two papers but I enjoyed the content. Not an easy 100% like some other professors but I enjoyed actual constructive feedback. Watch the video lectures. Re-watch the relevant lecture while writing an outline for your paper. The structure is in the lectures, just supplement with the readings. My favorite processor at NKU so far.
First class of my MBA and I already wish she taught the rest of my classes. She's tough but very clear in grading and communication. An A is definitely possible if you put in the work!

RUN DON'T WALK TO TAKE COURSES WITH THIS PROFESSOR! Professor Elliott has truly been my favorite teacher since I have been at Northern Kentucky University. She is extremely knowledgeable and makes her lectures fun and engaging. Take notes, quizzes are pretty straight forward with good notes, and exams are fairly difficult- study guide is given.
She actually makes her lectures interesting & she's super funny! I loved taking her class. There isn't really homework, just at home quizzes (open note) and a few tests in class.

Elliot was a great professor in my opinion. I've taken her Legal Environment class and she honestly made me consider becoming a lawyer because of her awesome lectures. She has a bubbly personality and jokes around a lot which I loved. She didn't really use the book but used her own powerpoint. Go to class and write notes and you will do just fine.

Her work is hard at first but once you get the hang of it, it becomes very easy. Her exams are not hard as long as you understand the cases presented in class and take your quizzes due every few weeks which are only 5 points. Her exams are not hard as long as you prepare. She has a great sense of humor and is always willing to help you out!!!

She is pretty clear on the course expectations, the instructions are clear, and the rubric is clear. She gives excellent feedback, and she is a harsh grader but based on the input, you should be able to improve, and the constructive criticism won't seem so bad. I learned a lot in this course.
Class is easier if you attend class and take notes

-The canvas setup was super confusing -You have to do a couple group presentations -Lots of assignments -Difficult exams She's not the worst professor, but the class was more difficult than it needed to be.

What makes Prof. Elliot great is she is an acting lawyer. She can give real and clear examples for every topic. This helped me a lot when studying for the exams. She is good at responding to emails. She also uploads all the powerpoints to canvas which is helpful when time to study. Go to the lectures or you will be lost when taking the exams.

Prof. Elliot put together great lectures that truly encouraged students to learn the material. Some professors give less to online classes, but she did not. The class required quite a bit of work (multiple papers/assignments and weekly discussions), but she graded fairly and was very organized in giving the work.
She was super nice and would interact with the discussion board, which i thought was cool.

She is the best business law teacher ever. She makes the class fun with her lectures and the material is real world; it is not text book material that hasn't been updated in 20 years. You do have two group projects but she lets you read directly off the powerpoint. I would love to have her for more classes.
I loved her and as long as you come to class, you can get an easy A. she gives study guides and only tests on what she lectures.

She was one of the best professors I've had! She made the class fun and enjoyable, and she made a real effort to get to know people. She was always cheerful and had a sunny disposition. I recommend taking BUS 330 with her.

you have to present two cases as a group but you can read right off the power point and doesnt care, you get to grade your own group, attendance isnt crucial she is very funny and gives out study guides that do a good job of laying out the tests, theyre multiple choice short answer and 1 essay

Teressa is a great professor. She takes a subject that is extremely boring and makes it interesting by keeping the class engaged - I can't think of a lecture where I didn't laugh at least once at her jokes. She does provide an extra credit quiz and extra credit for business week as well which is nice in a class that is somewhat hard.

Name: Sandra Bazzani Aronne
Comment: Professor Bazzani was very sweet but not very understanding. So much homework and so many topics shoved in our brains every week with not much explanation. Also, gave exams every week. No thanks.

The best professor Ive had! She is so kind and helpful, and on top of that she is a great teacher. There is homework every week that is directly related to what is learned in class and is very easy. There are 6 exams and she give a study guide for each one that goes over every question. There is a lot of partner work but its easy and quick.

LOTS of homework, with about 20 short assignments per week. She's a good teacher and very passionate and kind! BUT her tests are much harder than what we learn in class. She also has "optional" extra-credit events you go to, but then requires an essay about it for a grade.

Professor Bazzani is hands down the best professor I have ever had. You can tell she really loves what she does, and really cares about her students. She takes the time to properly explain the content and makes class fun. Would 10/10 recommend anyone to take this class with her.

Once again the best teacher I've ever had. Cares about her students so much and is always 100% prepared. Has us do super fun community projects that teach us priceless things. The best teacher at NKU. Take her if you can!
Great professor and amazing person

First, she is amazing and very caring. Participation matters a lot! The content might be hard at times but she definitely willing to help you understand even if that means spending the whole class time explaining. She knows what she's doing and she speaks slow. Get help for online assignment, because you can easily fail on those (3 chances/takes)

Profesora Bazzani is a queen. So passionate about Spanish and teaching, I was always excited to go to her class. On top of that, it's easy af. Just show up, participate in the lecture, and do the online assignments, which most of them we do in class together throughout the chapter. No tests. For the final, we had to volunteer. Amazing experience.

This professor is wonderful. She is so kind and helpful. She really understands to teach you spanish you need to use it. I am working on fluency and decided to retake 101 and she was amazing. She really cares about her students and knows how to teach you not just talk at you. She's wonderful and understanding!

Profesora Bazzani was my first college spanish teacher and she is great. I am taking her again next semester. You will have a decent amount of homework assignments but they are easy and she gives you more than enough time to finish them. Great at explaining things. She really cares about her students and will gladly help you outside of class.

Name: Rodney D'Souza
Comment: If you want an easy class, go for it. I would not spend my money on this class. You get placed in a mediocre internship and learn very little. They sell it to you as a great opportunity, but not worth it in my opinion. Most of my classmates think the same. The professor is ok, but the class not so much. I do not recommend this class.
Took him for an online class but met him a couple times to go over assignments and grading. Very helpful and funny. He needs to teach in class!

Wow! Talk about passionate. Prof D'Souza is extremely helpful and very well connected. He responds to emails almost immediately and is always willing to meet (even though this was an online class). I wish he taught in class.

Interesting class. His assignments actually help you learn, because he doesn't just do discussion boards and quizzes constantly.  Provides rubrics and grades pretty generously, but he doesn't seem to put any comments on anything. Overall he is an easy professor but you'll have to put time in, just not a lot of effort. Good class for creative people

First time taking an online class and could not be more pleased. Everything is laid out very clearly and he responds to messages within an hour at the most. The assignments are unlike any I have done before so be ready to be challenged. Very accessible and fun to work with. Would love to take an in person class with him.

Students are required to do blackboard blogs relating online articles about ENTP to what is learned in class.  There are many videos to watch, most of which are pretty interesting.  Several large projects mixed in.  Great class overall and a fantastic professor!

A Gem of a person. Very helpful and extremely knowledgable. Well known and liked in the community as well so can help with jobs. Just talk to him and he will make things happen. Didn't use the book in class so just borrow it from the library

Nice enough guy but I didn't learn very much from him. He is an easy professor; a lot of guest speakers and not a ton of projects. He is a pleasant and laid back person, but I don't feel he is an asset to the Entrepreneurship program. He never really taught the class anything, simply had guest lecturers discuss their experiences in bussiness.
Super knowledgeable and connected. Great professor and an even better mentor. If you get a chance, definitely take his class or at least go talk to him. Best professor at NKU!
Best Professor at NKU bar none! I had no interest in entrepreneurship before this class. Now I'm hooked.

He is really nice and funny guy. I'm always looking forward to attending the class. and He has such a huge network so if you try hard, you can get a chance of in ternship of something like that. However, he actually taught us anything.
Awesome professor! Highly recommend this guy. Knows the material and is very passionate about the subject. Best class at NKU - ever!

Great Professor.Funny and Interesting. Learned alot in his class. Make sure you read the book, even-though weekly quizzes are open book. I do not get last review,because I did not have a final in the class. He also gives you several opportunities to receive extra credit. I definitely recommend him (just read the text)and you will do fine.

The class was easy, we always had guest speakers and Pr. D'Souza made it exciting. We never had any study content or tests, then he decided to give a final over things we hadn't even talked about, because he never actually taught us anything. So I received a lower grade because he didn't take the time to tell us what might be on the test.

Name: Eileen (nora) Drust
Comment: Dr. Drust was very straight forward with the course material. The quiz's were a bit difficult at times but she allows 3 attempts and it shows you which you answered right and wrong. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK! I didn't buy the book based on other reviews and I can confirm their truth. Discussion boards are easy and often fun.

STOP WHAT YOU'RE DOING AND TAKE THIS CLASS! NOW! It's the easiest class EVER! She's is so easy. Do not buy the book! Our final was to bring in food, that should give you an idea of how easy the class is!
Take her, shes super nice!

Very easy class! Honestly the book isn't necessarily neeeded except for a few quizzes. I ended up not reading half of the chapters, and still receiving a good grade. Nice professor, very funny, and relatable to students. All in all a pretty easy Gen Ed.

DO NOT BUY THE BOOK. I bought it and never cracked it open once. She puts all the powerpoints on blackboard so just print those out, you don't even have to take notes. Attendance is part of the grade; so are the 10 writing assignments. Easy A if you show up and do the work.

Drust is a really fun teacher.  She is one the nicest teachers you will ever have.  Very easy, the only reason I got an A- instead of an A because I decided to study for another final instead, and still passed the final.  If you do all the assignments, come to class (which is mandatory) and participate, you will get an A.  FUN CLASS!

she is such a nice lady but this class felt like a joke. attendance is graded so you can't just show up and take the tests and get an A but i really felt that class time never taught me anything different than the powerpoints up on her blackboard so i wouldn't have gone to class if i had the choice. easy A if you show up.

Pretty easy class, and easy teaching style.  She was pretty distracted by trying to earn her PhD and constantly brought it up in case.  Actually forgot to bring a test to class once and made one up on the spot.  Always got pretty early, which was okay but she would then cut portions outta the syllabus saying there wasn't time.  DO NOT BUY THE BOOK
I love her! She's very sweet and funny, and she's a good teacher. You watch a lot of videos, and the weekly writing activities are great for a grade boost! 10 points for you to say your opinion!

Mrs. Drust's speech class ended up being a lot of fun. I hate public speaking and was dreading the class, but I did a lot better than expected and got on A on everything. The quizzes are kinda hard, but not bad if you skim through the chapters before. She is a very fair grader! She's also very personable! Loved her!

Professor Drust is great!  You have to go to class though.  She teaches a lot about the evolution of media.  I learned a great deal in class.  There are weekly quizzes and a few multiple choice tests.  There also is a big project at the end of the year.  But she is very nice and understanding and someone I would love to take again.

She grades pretty easy, though her exams are pretty hard for a speech class. Do the chapter review problems at the end of each chapter before taking any quiz, most questions come from there. Will never tell you that you had a bad speech, will just encourage you to improve. Class atmosphere is VERY relaxed, get out early everyday except speech days.

Name: Annie Welch
Comment: If you can take a class with Annie, DO IT! The "textbook" is videos to teach you ASL and help you learn to read the language more. Participation is required. She is wonderful and will help you when you have a tough patch. Assignments can be turned in late (Especially if you communicate why they're late.) Excellent class and an overall good time.

Annie is amazing! While she does use textbooks, it's best to just watch her and any videos she posts. Practice outside of class!! She's super sweet, though, and is lax about due dates because she knows life happens and mental health comes first. If you're stuck, don't be afraid to use her office hours. She'll walk you through anything you need.

Annie is the best! She is very caring and loves to teach. I have had her for several classes and each time she makes the assignments fun and engaging. She really wants her students to understand the material and succeed. She goes above and beyond for everyone in her class! If you have the opportunity I highly suggest taking any of her classes.

She is an amazing professor. She is super understanding when it comes to not being able to turn in an assignment on time because life happens. I also loved how understanding she was about her students mental health unlike other professors. Overall the best professor I have had so far.
I 100% recommend talking her class. You will not regret it! Just practice outside of her class and you will do great.
MAKE SURE THAT YOU PRACTICE OUTSIDE OF CLASS AND THAT YOU ALSO WATCH THE VIDEOS SHE POSTS

Such a great professor and she helped me every step of the way! Her introductory ASL class is about the usual difficulty, but so worth the time and effort. She teaches effectively and grades fairly, she's super sweet and great to talk to. :)
Loved Prof. Welch! This was my second class with her and I'm definitely taking another one. I love knowing sign language and she is great at teaching it. Take her if you can!

I loved Prof. Welch! She makes learning ASL fun and you genuinely get something from being in a class with her. Inspired me to take more classes with her. I would get the textbook for homework and whatnot. Overall, good class and professor!

Professor Welch is easily one of my favorite professors at NKU. Her lectures are very easy to understand and she is always willing to help you understand a sign if you do not get it at first. Do buy the book and get the DVDs, they are required for homework. This was an 8-week course and wasn't bad at all.
I took her for Beginning ASL and I love her. She is very helpful when you don't know a particular sign. She is funny and is very intelligent when it comes to deaf culture.

This was my first ASL class. It was so amazing. Annie is very participation-driven, so attendance is mandatory. You learn most of the signs in class, with homework for practice. There was one group project, 4 unit tests, occasional homework, and an online final. Hilarious and always laughing, always ready to teach. She's a deaf culture expert! :)

Name: Jill Easter
Comment: She is a great teacher. You have 6 papers to write in her class,she explains them pretty good. No test, weekly journals on fridays, and daily attendance questions worth points. Hardly any homework.

Ms. Easter is an amazing teacher! I would recommend her to anyone having to take the class. She is extremely helpful and kind. She makes the class fun and you do learn a lot. I love Ms. Easter she is the best professor I have had so far! :)
teacher was very nice and her class was easy to adjust to.
Jill is an amazing professor who wants all her students to do well. She is very helpful and her assignments are clear to the point.

Jill is great! I enjoyed coming to her class everyday. If only all professors could be as kind hearted as Jill. She loves to give hugs:)She loves papers that are personal to the writer. She grades very fair.
Great teacher!!!

Ms. Easter is she sweetest lady ever. I have really enjoyed having her. She is very understanding about things and is always willing to help. Even though we had to write 82 papers (just kidding, she likes that number) she makes class fun. I wish she could be my teacher all the time, I LOVE THIS CLASS and I will miss her.
No Comments
shes the sweetest teacher ever.  shes very nice and always willing to work with students.  Her classes are super easy and shes fun.
very very helpful

First of all - not hot at all, I don't know who rated her that.  Secondly, great teacher.  Very easy, maybe too easy.  Extremely caring and helpful, not to mention leniant.  Would definately recommend her to anyone.  She is always smiling, always.
Jill is the best teacher ever!!  I wish I could have her for every class!!
She brought us Panera. we want her back. she is so sweet.
Was a very very nice lady and was always willing to help and very compassionate. I would recommend her to anyone.
Was always very helpful in what she taught and was very clear on what she thought made a good paper.  I would LOVE to have her in another class down the road.
She IS GREAT! She works with you and very nice REALLY RECOMMEND TAKING HER!!  Great teacher!!
she never stops smiling but has the easiest class

Name: Cathy Pence
Comment: She was not difficult, just study the powerpoints!

I enjoy class when Professor Pence is teaching. She seems to have a good grasp on what things are really important for us to retain. She provides plenty of info on each section. Sometimes she gets off topic, but she is pretty funny, so I didn't mind. She is always there to help. It really seems that she genuinely wants to see her students succeed.

I have taken Pence for many classes and I always know I'm going to pass with an A. She tells so many stories in class and gets off topic constantly but she's hilarious. She loves to laugh at her own jokes. Her classes are always easy and she loves to interact with her students. I never stress about the classes that I have her for.

The only teacher I've ever had who is so bad at communicating that it frustrated me to my soul. In order for your e-mails to be answered, you'll have to send it once every 24 hours for 4+ days. To understand her e-mail/rubric, you'll have to pretend it was written by a third grader and decipher from there. Ask a question and her answer won't help.

Like everyone said, she is very corny and awkward, but nothing you can't get past. She basically has study guides within her notes, and exam questions come straight from that. Very easy if you take the time to actually learn it. She doesnt lecture ALL the time, so teaching yourself is needed, but the content is not that bad, and I liked it.
Easy A for research, but you won't learn anything. Although, the other classes said they didn't learn anything in research either. Recommend taking for an easy GPA booster.

Have her for 210L and 220. She can be corny to try and help you remember key points.  Very clear on what she wants from you. Lab stays the whole period even if others left early, not a bad thing in nursing. Lectures are kinda boring but she is very helpful!

She's a good teacher- but she does pronounce everything wrong during the lectures. She laughs at her own corny jokes- which then makes you kinda chuckle. She's VERY nice and seems fairly helpful. I would recommend her to others. Tests are right off notes- book is useless.

I hated this class. She posted modules with case studies for us to complete and turn in each week. The longest was 37 pages and the shortest was around 12. She hardly lectured. She spent our 3 hour class asking us practice questions. Everything I learned in that class I taught myself.

Professor Pence's enthusiasm was contagious to learning the material in class.  She made the class fun and easy to learn.  The MP3 files and extra credit points was a plus.  The NIH stroke scale extra credit was nice & I like the certificate that goes with it.  She was helpful in reviewing what I miss on the exams and has a good sense of humor.
We learn research as we go through the class and it makes sense and it is a very fair class!

Her lectures are not dynamic but her study guides are brilliant. Know those and you can get 100s on your tests. Believe me, folks really struggle with all the memorization that this class can demand, especially if the instructor is not specific about what to know. Ms Pence is kind and seems very sweet,  and she is INCREDIBLY fair in grading.
very easy class, and she's super nice...but she pronounced everything wrong and just read from powerpoint
Great teacher; very knowledgeable
This women pronounced peritoneal dialysis perioneal dialysis everytime!!!! so we are doing dialysis from that area? no didn't think so. sorry about your totally ineffective teaching style
No Comments

Name: Jamey Strawn
Comment: Pretty laid back guy. Classes are mostly discussion based. There was no more than 10 people in my class so it was more one-on-one than my honors class was. He doesn't like giving tests (only 2 tests and 2 quizzes) and just a couple decent assignments to do (other than see the plays). The final was a take-home. TAKE HIM!
Most helpful person I know. Amazing teacher and person.

Jamey seems to realize Essentials of Theatre is an unnecessary course, so he puts the majority of the time and effort into creating a strong new faces piece. Aims to lead the class as a group discussion rather than a lecture. This course is a review of concepts that should have been obtained previously, doesn't really introduce new material.
jamey's an amazing professor...i'm not even interested in theatre, but he made the class so worth it. all you have to do is read the plays for the quizzes...and new faces is awesome!
How can you not like Jamey? He's amazing and is ridiculously talented and makes class fun.

Name: Jeffrey Smith
Comment: This class was solely the textbook so make sure to purchase it. It wasn't too hard but if you need help he does answer at a decent time. There was nothing too exciting about the class so just get your work done and you're fine.
I really enjoyed his online Industrial/Organizational Psychology class. It was not too terribly difficult and the 7 week course flew by with no issues.

He is a very nice guy however, lectures are very boring. He tries to make them as interesting as possible but most of the time he stands in the front reading off of a powerpoint. He also hands out papers for everything and all tests are on paper. Not the best about messaging back outside of class and is constantly coughing or clearing his throat.

I took a seven-week course for this class, so there was a lot of homework, but it was all really easy. As long as you read the textbook and take good notes, you should pass effortlessly. Just take your time and study.

Dr Throat Clear is a great guy. Super easy to work with. Just really dry throat in every one of his recorded lectures. He will respond at a moments notice to schedule a meeting with you if you don't understand. Like I said, super nice guy. Soft spoken, but when he clears his throat on the mic I swear he puts it right next to his mouth...

This professor is the most boring teacher I've EVER had. I rarely went to class because he was so awful. All you have to do is study the chapters and you can ace the test. Gave full credit on all papers and projects even if they were awful. I don't recommend.

Are you guys kidding me? He rambles & gives study guides that hardly match the test. He stands in front of a PowerPoint and reads off of it.
