Yes, he is a nice guy but my lack of attendance was due to his lack of interest. He was completely boring, which explains why everyone has their laptop out on Facebook.
Very enthusiastic teacher! Really knows his stuff and makes it interesting. Tests are super easy and the final is only over 4 chapters!
Take good notes, look at your book. He's a pretty good teacher, not difficult at all. Writing assingments are easy.
Great teacher!!!

Mr. Smith is great! He does all his notes on powerpoint He tries to make the class interesting, so your not bored! You watch random videos, they are rather interesting! He is a extremely nice guy, and he doesn't take attendance. But if you miss the notes you are screwed for his quizes. You will have quizzes every 3 days or so, the exams are hard!
Great teacher!! You will have a quiz every class and tests are difficult.

Smith is organized, introverted, predictable and pleasant.  Lectures using powerpoints with charts, graphs, and examples (not posted on blackboard).  Tests are multiple choice and short answer, and the short-answer questions are relatively simple.  Overall, a good guy and good class.

Name: Amy Fugazzi
Comment: Loved her. Her expectations were clear, and she would bend over backwards for you to help you do well. She is very approachable. Answered my questions that I emailed to her fast. I was not a fan of the textbook we used, but she always supplemented what we went over in class with handouts.
Easy Teacher. 1st English teacher was more involved and a lot more work

Unclear and arbitrary grading criteria. Doesn't give timely feedback. Refuses to answer questions at times and simply states to look in your book. However the information is not always provided in the book.
I love her! She's amazing. If you're honest and put in the effort, she will help you with anything you need.

Professor Fugazzi was really good. As long as you know basic MLA format then you won't need to read anything she assigns. The research project she assigns is pretty time heavy and takes up the majority of the last 8 weeks, but it's not so bad.  I had her for a 3 hour class, but we were usually let out half an hour early or so. Honestly an easy A.
Very sweet and gives very few homework. Class is based off of papers due that are usually due every 2 weeks or so. I highly suggest Amy.
Amy made English 101 super easy and fun! You will write on unique topics that may or may not interest you. No testing, or exams. Just writing. I actually am taking her again next semester!
She is AMAZING! I learned so much in her class. It wasn't easy, but it was earned! She has the most amazing, insightful lectures for an English 101 class!
An easy A, just don't expect to learn anything. Just be nice and talk about stuff and she will like you, maybe skim the readings... she is nice, just not a good professor, an easy A though.

Name: Andrea Lambert
Comment: I took her 7 week class and the amount of work was UNREAL. There is no way she takes into consideration the other courses we have to take 7 assignments a week. The discussion boards, quizzes, assignments, and exams are not easy at all so don't think this is an easy class because its not. Im sure she is a good person but this class is hard!
This is the class that you do Death Over Dinner as your main project. It was super fun and she's great.

Dr. Lambert- South is one of the best NKU has to offer! She is so funny, light hearted, and understanding. I had her for an evening lecture class and she lets us out early, and often extended deadlines on assignments. I have also taken 2 of her online classes over the summer and her directions are very clear, and straight forward! 10/10 TAKE HER!!

Dr Lambert-South is one of the most influential professors in my college career so far. The course content is pretty dense, but she lightens it up with her authentic, comedic and conversational teaching style. Weekly quizzes are clearly aligned with the readings. Group project is a lot of work - get a head start if you can.

This class with Andrea is one that you HAVE TO BE IN CLASS TO PASS! She has a quiz (10pts) every week, & all of those questions will come straight from the reading or her lectures. There is also a group project (HUGE part of your grade) so take the class with some friends. However, she is super funny during lectures & she makes it relatable.

Had her as my break out teacher for INF. Totally hated INF on Tuesdays when we did nothing but lectures. She made Thursdays a lot better and the class easier to understand. She's super cool and cares for her kids!
Really good teacher.

One of the best and coolest professors I've had at NKU. There is a lot of material and her test are kind of tough, but she makes it really easy to pay attention in class. Super funny and down to earth
Needed more in class time, but what we had was really good.
Awesome.  Best Prof I had in college.  End of story.  Made class fun.  I took classes because she was teaching them.
This class is very hard.  There are no speeches.  You have to read a lot and go to class daily... It's not a real fun class.  She's a good professor and really cool, but it's a tough class.
She is a really cool professor, however, her class is a bit difficult.
She is extremely helpful and has a great in-class style. She's great!
What a delight. She's just great. Such a wonderful teacher. I learned so much. She's so fantastic. Professors like her are the reason why I go to school.
Very good. First class in the MA and it was a challenge but she helped make it a good one.

You may have heard that the speech department has hired three new speech professors and though they are all good Dr. Lambert is the best easy. She does family stuff and as a advanced student I can tell you she is clearly an expert and knows how to relate to students on a real and honest level and will know families inside and out.
I love this class! She is an amazing teacher and has a very easy was of explaining things.  She likes to laugh and is always cutting up with the students.  I totally recommend her!
She's very clear and concise about what she expects, and her standards are not unreasonable. Prof Lambert is very student oriented, and it was a pleasure being in her class albeit over the web.
Dr. Lambert is awesome!  She is so smart and totally willing to help you in anyway possible.  A total rockstar professor!
Your typical public speaking class.

Name: Kris Hehn
Comment: AMAZING PROFESSOR!! Definitely take her. Class was easy as long as you put forth some effort. Engages with the students through emails so you know exactly what to do each week. WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Kris is the best teacher I have had. She is always there to answer comments or concerns, and she cares about her classes. She will go out of her way to help you pass, and offers extra credit. I enjoyed her class because her lectures were interested and gave me a different outlook on the world. You won't be disappointed with her class.
You have six classes you can miss before you start to get penalized. If you need help she will get back with you right away to meet and help you.

I love Prof. Hehn. She is such a nice person that cares about sociology and her students. Her lectures are always engaging and she relates the topics to the students. She's great. The book was needed for her exams online, because they can be tricky since Cengage actually creates them, as opposed to her making them.

Professor Hehn was probably my favorite professor of my freshman year. I really enjoyed class with her. She was ALWAYS engaged in conversation and there to help when needed. She always replied to emails as well. I would HIGHLY recommend taking a class with this awesome professor.
She was amazing! Extremely helpful and she was very fair about things. The class wasn't too difficult either. Take her definitely.
Great teacher!! She explains things very well, she is willing to work with you on everything, she is excited about her job.

A great teacher - she makes class very interesting and time does go by fast. She will get you thinking and make sure you understand the concepts instead of just memorizing the terms. Book quizes online every week and a weekly paper related to the chapters. Overall a very good class to take!

Kris was a wonderful teacher who made class very interesting.  Her syllabus and class expectations were crystal clear which made it easier.  She is also a very understanding person when it comes to absences, etc.

Very easy online course!!!  Weekly book quizzes that you have ninety minutes on that only take thirty minutes to do without even reading the book, weekly short essays over videos she has picked out, and one paper.  TAKE THIS GEN ED online!

She was a really great professor.  I had her online so I never met her in person, but she was always quick to help if you had any questions about the class and she always answered your emails very clearly. She sent instructions every week via email for what we needed to do and it was always very clear and easy to follow. Great professor and nice.

This woman is amazing! I wish everyone was like her. All quizes were online, open book and she was always open for questions. She also loves her youtube videos so get ready for movie time! Love her though!

Kris is an amazing teacher, she's passionate about what she's teaching so she makes the class very interesting. The tests are essays and very simple, you're allowed to use your notes! So come to class and you'll do great. She gives a ridiculous amount of extra credit and is extremely helpful. Take her!!
Excellent instructor that is very engaged and helpful. Outstanding communication in and out of class. Timely and helpful feedback.

I took this class online.  Read chapters then take timed quizzes online, you only get 1 try, but you can use the book.  You also write about 4 papers.  Final exam was a paper.  She's very helpful and emails back in a timely manner.
This class is lecture based and Mrs. Hehn kicks ass. Great teacher, and great class. I would strongly reccomend!

Very cool teacher, made class interesting. Not a hard class at all. You don't need the main text book although it is helpful to read. You do need the other supplement book. Only 3 tests including the midterm and final exam, one paper to write but it's easy No homework except reading.

Mrs. Hehn is very willing to help you if you don't understand.  There are two essays and the test are not to bad as long as you study.  You have to be there in order to take proper notes for the tests.
Awesome teacher.  Tests are kind of tough, but not too hard if you study.  Multiple choice and T/F with one essay for each.  Very informative and helpful if you need it.
Lectures are very informational and overall a very good course, both midterm and final are in essay format and there is an additional take home essay and one research paper

Name: Jim Justice
Comment: Homework not graded but quizzes are over it so you should do it. There were 6 quizzes and he dropped the two lowest.  There were only 2 tests plus the final.  No extra credit but he does did change the lowest test grade to be the same as your final grade if you scored higher on the final.  Great Professor!

Homework was not graded but the quizzes cover it so you should do it.  There where 6 quizzes and he dropped the 2 lowest ones. There are only 2 test plus the final.  He don't offer any extra credit but will drop your lowest test grade and replace it with your final test grade if it is higher. Great Professor!
Great professor, definitely knows the material and how to teach it. Switched between multiple professors until I found this guy, would definitely take again.

Wonderful guy.  Very nice guy.   If you don't like surprises, don't take him is my advice.  He does try to trick you on exams, he will tell you he likes to challenge you on the exams.   It also takes him a long time to get things graded.  This is okay when you have large classes, but our class was very small and we were taking our first big exam before we knew what we got on our quizzes so you didn't know where you were for weeks at a time.  I really enjoyed him as a professor overall but you will find yourself frustrated at times because he adds concepts to quizzes and tests that he didn't cover in class all that thoroughly or that the homework didn't cover.  This only bothered me because he claims he follows homework when he makes his exams out but he adds concepts that the homework didn't cover, at all. Or he adds items to exams that he BARELY goes over in class.  If you are someone who needs practice and lots of examples in homework to practice & study, him adding concepts to tests that he barely went over, you will struggle.  My advice is to work problems from each section, even the ones he says you don't need,  because he will add stuff.  For example, when we covered even and odd functions, telling if a function is even or odd, etc, the homework doesn't cover those things but he added it to our 2nd exam.  So when you go over a study guide for the exam, he will add things and your like, "Ummmm our homework didn't cover this," so then you basically have to learn new concepts at all once.  Also, when we covered trig functions, he added coterminals to the quiz and that was no where in the section we were being quizzed on so you basically have no real way of studying for his quizzes or exams when he does tricks like this.  I'm doing very well in the course, but him consistently doing this, it got so tiring and frustrating toward finals time.  I feel exhausted because you never know what to expect from his tests.  I think he assumes we are all math experts and know all of this math so studying can be so exhausting when he throws things in without warning us or preparing us adequately.  I never even heard the term coterminal in his class and yet we were quizzed on it, so be warned.

Jim Justice is the best math teacher I have ever had. ever.  If I can take him for other classes I will, no matter how I have to rework my schedule.  He explains the topics so you can understand. The exams are a little tough, you need to make sure you have done your homework and you will be fine.
Excellent professor who really cares about his students.  I took him for MAT 112 and MAT 114.  I took the classes at night just so I could get him.  Take him if you can.
Awesome !!  It was my pleasure to take this class with him ! :)
One of the better teachers you will have at NKU.  Super guy and will go over homework problems until you get it.  Go to class, Pay attention, Get an A.

TAKE PROFESSOR JUSTICE!  Entering this class, I was not that interested in math. I was fearful of calculus. Leaving the class, that is now the complete opposite. Professor Justice will not give you an A, you will def. have to work hard for it. He has the ability to explain things so that one can actually understand the topic. Very caring professor
I've never known a teacher who cares as much as this one does.  He reminds me of Big Boy from Frisch's!  :)
Awesome
He is completely awesome, he is very helpful and is always attempting to better explain please take this class if you dont like math and need to take it. he is awesome.

I'd advise anyone not normally "into" math who has to take a math course to take it from him.  He comes from a high school teaching background, so he knows how to explain material very clearly, but still effectively and thoroughly.  Absolutely no complaints.
Awesome teacher. Explains potentially complicated material in a manner everyone can understand. I wish I could take him for MAT 129.
This guy is AWESOME! If you fail his class, and have no idea what's going on, you have only yourself to blame.
Fantastic professor. Can rarely get better than him. I have his class in the evening, and throughout the day, I am only waiting to get into his class.
He really knows his stuff and will help you with anything. If you need calculus you should definitely take it with him.  Plus he's funny and has a lot of kids so he tends to cancel some class.
If you have to take calculus at NKU, take this teacher! He makes calculus easy and he makes class fun.

He is one of the coolest teachers I have had yet. He would go over as many homework problems as students would have questions, before moving on to new material. The regular tests and homeworks weren't too bad, but watch out for his final! Ouch!
He makes calculus easy to understand.

Name: Julie Baker
Comment: great professor, super easy, no exams. good class!

Julie is an excellent professor and really enjoys teaching her class. She gives class time for project completion and is extremely helpful. Attendence is taken every day and is mandatory. I would absolutely recommend her for this class.
I really enjoyed this class.  We did everything from clay sculptures to collages to drawings.  Put in the effort and attend class and you will do well!
Great teacher overall, could've given the class more time to work on paintings at the end of the semester. The projects were fun and textbook work was almost nonexistent.

Julie is awesome. She doesn't give tests but you have to show up and participate. If you do that you'll be fine. She really cares about what she does and is an artist herself. She shows some intriguing artwork and you get to talk about it. And she's pretty too. Definitely take this professor.

Very nice, but very outspoken on her opinions. Likes to converse. Attendance is MANDATORY. Doesn't know how to work computers, so no blackboard or email. Interupts your group presentations to comment on pronounciation and such, I found that to be really rude. An easy A if you attend and make an effort.
Great class - does lots of projects you experience lots of mediums and learn a lot - one presentation w a group and one paper.  Class partic. is important

Julie was seriously the most caring teacher I have ever had. She didn't grade on artistic ability, but on the amount you have learned and surpassed your prior artistic ability. She was also willing to help anyone out if they needed it.
Doesn't grade on you artistic ability!!

Ms. Baker is amazing.  She's very kind and very rule-oriented. She has no tests, but fully expects you to attend and do the other work. If you don't participate in class (i.e. offer your opinions, ask questions)she WILL FAIL YOU! ATTENDANCE IS MANDATORY! She shows a movie and other material that have graphic content, which include nudity.Very kind!

Ms. Baker is a very nice lady. She is helpful and always has a smile on her face. She doesnt expect anything great out of you if you aren't an artist... IF YOU MISS 6 classes she AUTOMATICALLY fails you! So if you aren't a morning person, you dont want this in the morning!

Julie Rocks! She is a great person and her class is an easy way to learn about art. You dont have a final and you dont have quizes or homework! She is really easy to talk to and she is really FUNNY! She is really serious about attendence though she hates when people dont come or are late.

Julie is a good teacher, if you're taking Art I would recommend her. She is funny & easy to talk to. She does take attendance seriously and when videos are shown, make sure you come to class. There are group discussions after the every video, and she expects everyone to verbally participate.

Julie is a great person and professor. She's very nice and extremely helpful. Very easy to get along with and easy to talk to. I hated drawing coming into the class (mostly because I sucked at drawing), and ended up learning a lot and became a decent drawer.
Julie is the best drawing teacher in the world!! Very laid back but still willing to tell you when you suck, something everyone needs to hear at some point! Love HER!!!

Julie was an amazing teacher. I couldn't draw to save my life before her class and I was dreading the class in general, but Julie was so patient and an awesome teacher. We all learned so much but had fun at the same time
julie is awesome and makes the calss fun.  she is really helpfull and you learn so much.
She was so awesome, really made Art fun!
She was really cool and I really enjoyed the class.

Julie is totally sweet. At first I thought she was kinda mean but once I kept going to her class and once I got to know her, she is a doll. She had us sell back our books and we did all hands on projects. As long as you try and show up to her class and show interest, she'll love you! She also watches movies in class, and does fun photography projects. No tests, at least when I took it. Julie is AWESOME!

Name: Robert Rhode
Comment: Amazing teacher. I hardly went to class. Mostly all conferences. The easiest English class I have ever been in. He cares about his students and responds to your emails in a timely manner. Attend when it's not conference time. But during conferences unless it's yours don't go.

This is probably the easiest class I've ever taken. You only have to go to class like 10 or 15 times all semester. Most of the time is spent for conferences; in which each student only has 2 twenty minute conferences all semester. If you want an easy A, take Dr. Rhode. If you want to learn the ins and outs of English, you may want someone else.
Easiest class ever. We only had class 2 months out of the semester. Take him for an easy A.

Prof. Rhode is very understanding and helpful. If you are more of a visual learner, you may find him more difficult. He uses a textbook he co-authored and he basically just reads the book to the class. I struggled at first but got an A.

He also asks students if they have questions before every class. He accepts incorrect answers, tells you why you may have thought that and tells you why the correct answer should be used. This is a test only class, but Dr. Rhode is more than accommodating. I have never learned more in a class than I did in his.

The beginning of his class is hard, but once you get past the first two or three weeks, it gets way easier. I never had grammar taught to me before and I felt like I learned a lot. If you want to improve the quality of your papers for any class, the grammar class is helpful. Dr. Rhode really knows his stuff. Actually, seems to know everything. ;)
Easiest class I have ever taken. As long as you write something you get a good grade. Professor is very nice and helpful.

I had never been taught grammar before taking this class. It's a little fast paced, but not too hard as long as you try. I never met someone as enthusiastic about grammar as Dr. Rhode. It's kind of funny, really. He's a nice guy who is very helpful outside of class as well.

Before taking his Poe seminar, I had about as much interest in Edgar Allan Poe as I had in NASCCAR, which is not never much.  He helped us see Poe as a complicated and fascinating literary figure.  He encourages critical thinking, a lost art among educators.  I can't recommend him enough.

Very excited about grammar. He uses his own book which expensive and, to be honest, not very good.  I didn't like the style of the class AT ALL. I was expecting to learn a lot and round up learning nothing. However, the class was extremely easy; you never have to go and can still get an A.

GREAT Professor!!!!! He takes an interesting approach to writing that really helped me to come out of my shell. He wants you to write to your strengths which he truly believes everyone has. I wish I could take another course with him, I learned a lott!
I LOVE Professor Rhode he is the best teacher I have ever had. He teaches in a unique way that made me want to come to class. If you get the chance to take him DO IT!!!!

Bob, oh bob. You don't have to go to class every day-class doesn't even meet for like half a semester. He really encourages new and creative viewpoints on papers and projects.He gives you a syllabus that has everything you are going to do the semester, so helpful. PROOFREAD your paper before you take it to him, he will find every typo. Easy class.

Most of the people who take this professor are English majors and therefore think he is easy. I took the course because I knew I had very poor grammar skills. He presents a step by step process which breaks down difficult grammar rules into easily digested bite-size pieces. If you would like to improve your writing this professor is a godsend.

Aw Mr. Rhode is such a sweet man. He is very understanding and a complete dork. He is so enthusiastic about grammar. Attendance is absolutely not necessary and the class is passable even if you only go once a month. I really enjoyed his class and would definitely take him again.
Gotta love Dr. Rhode.  He is extremly helpful and kind.  I would take as many classes that I possibly can with him!

Fabulous professor with a corny yet hilarious sense of humor. My ONLY gripe is that we had to pay over $80 for an e-book and exercises, had to print it out ourselves, and we can't sell it back at the end of the semester. Otherwise, great guy, easy class.

Never thought anyone could be so passionate about grammar!  He's such a nice man.  He explains everything.  Really wants to make sure his students understand the material.  Everyone should take this class.

first off, you don't need a book. yay. his class is really easy. i hate writing and i have an A+ in that class. you don't have to be there everyday, just as long as you make an effort to show up every now and then.

Amazing course taught by a very intelligent man. extremely helpful and overall great guy. No need for a textbook. just cover the syllabus and listen to others in the class, you will be fine. Greatest English class...ever.

Name: Lee Kersting
Comment: Helps you out at every possible opportunity. Extra credit, partial points on tests if youre somewhere in the ballpark, very clear explanations of the material. Make sure you attend class. Dont be afraid to reach out to him, he is very helpful and knowledgeable. I received a B that I may or may not have deserved. Would 100% take again.

Professor Kersting is an amazing professor. His lectures are packed full of information and his tests are rough. Make sure to show up to class because you do problems similar to ones on the test. Mgt Cost is a rough class so be sure to read the textbook and practice the problems and you shouldn't have too bad of a time. Kersting makes it doable.

He is a great professor, and great at explaining things. He always has in class exercises to offer which help alot with studying for exams. Exams are hard, but that's because it's Accounting. If you show up to class you will do fine, I'd definitely take his class again.

Best accounting teacher he wants you to do well and pass you can tell he has his PhD in accounting by how well he knows it and teaches it. He will help you outside of class as much as you want. Hes really smart. Gives extra credit and will give you points on test if you at least try and attempt. wants everyone to do well and pass. Best professor
Great professor! Absolutely should try and take his sections versus other professors. He won't let you down!

Professor Kersting is great! I took ACC 201 over the summer was really difficult for me, but Kersting was really supportive, and was always willing to help whenever he could. He also a big family guy, and had a new baby daughter in the middle of class, so adorable.
Best Professor at NKU, very passionate about teaching/accounting.  Knows what he is talking about and wants you to succeed!

Amazing Professor. Great teacher who actually cares about students and loves what he does. Would highly recommend him. If you put effort into his class you will be successful. You learn a lot and he makes it as enjoyable as possible. His office is always open and he never makes you feel stupid. Also, puts in effort to get to know each student.

Best professor I have ever taken, I failed this class at UC but passed his class with a B.  Excel project was difficult but he walked me through every step during office hours. He is always available for questions, not many people go to office hours and he loves it when people go!

Great Professor. Tests are very very difficult. He tends to move pretty fast on subjects though, but if you are in need of help he is very willing to help and make sure you understand the material. Does a lot of in class examples that help. Homework is due before every exam instead of evenly throughout the weeks. Uses MyAccountingLab.
Dr. Kersting is the best professor I have ever had. My friends and I called him the Kerstinator because he spit hot fire. I recommend him and this class for any and everyone.

Amazing professor.  Willing to assist students and gives prompt feedback.  Lectures are extremely helpful, with homework designed to ensure material is read before class.  The reading assignments are by page numbers to eliminate topics not covered.  Best professor I've had at NKU.

He is one of my favorite professors.  He is fair, and spends time actually teaching.  I appreciate that he has a genuine interest in the subject and wants his students to learn (not just regurgitate the information he wrote on the board).  Class is tough, and requires work.  He facilitates discussions, and actual learning.  AWESOME teacher!!

Smokin hot.  Tests are hard, but he is a great teacher who explains very clearly and is super helpful to students with questions.  No projects, just tests and HW. He applies everything to real world, so that's great

It's true, he's extremely attractive. I think that was why I was so interested in what he had to say and actually passed the course. I thought managerial would be harder than Financial since one was not allowed to take MAN until after they passed FIN. I would totally take him again. OH yeaa.
Extremely attractive- to the point it can be distracting. Great teacher, keeps things interesting. Always willing to help.

Name: Daryl Harris
Comment: As long as you participate a couple of times you will be fine. Try to participate more. I'm a more quiet person, but I still enjoyed this class and regretted not putting my opinion out more. Participate! Also, the midterm and final exam are important, so do them properly and put time into them. DO NOT PROCRASTINATE OR YOUR GRADE WILL SUFFER! :)

Dr. Harris is an absolute legend of a professor. No other faculty member I have ever met can make such an incredible experience out of a regular 3 hour class. If you have chance, take this class. It's incredible, and makes you grow as a human while teaching you so much about the world of dramatic human expression.
Get well soon Professor!

Dr. Harris never failed to amaze me once. This class was a blast. He is always happy and is a very funny guy. He talks about 500mph though so once you get used to that you'll be fine. Great professor, even better class. Get well soon Dr. Harris.

I looked forward going to this class every week. You have to talk about very controversial topics in this class, but Daryl does not judge anyone's opinions and likes to have fun. He does talk really fast or quiet sometimes, but if you ask him to slow down, he will. You have to read a lot of scripts, but you can look up the summaries and be fine.

The professor himself is a nice person, but man, this class was a pain. You have to read a play a week, but there is no actual textbook. There are about 15 plays you have to read. During class time, we discuss the assigned play from the week, but we don't even discuss the play. You can get away with never reading a play, as long as you Google it.

The only negative thing about Daryl is that he mumbles so it's hard to hear him even in a small class room, and he goes off topic sometimes. It's a pretty interesting class, but you HAVE to participate. I didn't talk much and still finished with an A, but you will have to talk some! The grading is heavily based on the midterm and final, so read!

Daryl is easy-going and fun. A bit of a tough grader, especially on the midterm. You can easily get through all the discussions without reading and using Wikipedia. Take this class for an easy a. Attendance is necessary, you can only skip 2 classes.
Read the scripts and participate in discussions. Constantly work on your midterm paper throughout the semester.
He didn't even teach.... He put us into four groups then assigned each group 4 chapters in the book and then give a presentation on each chapter. Class was boring and always got out early.

Fun and very unique professor - his class is all discussion. As long as you show up and act interested and pipe up from time to time, you will get an A. He is lots of fun and super chill, but he speaks very fast sometimes and can be hard to understand.  But he is always very gracious about slowing down and rephrasing things in a better way :) Fun!

This class was FABULOUS! it really helped to bring me out of my shell and the class became a big group of friends. Daryl works magic to get everyone involved and engaged and thinking! TAKE THIS CLASS. RACE, GENDER, AND THEATER!
If you participate in discussions, this class is super easy. You just have to have reasons for your opinions, and not just spout off stuff.

I had an incredibly difficult time in this class. It is solely based on discussion and if you don't talk you could definitely get a poor grade. I found Daryl very hard to understand and frequently got confused as to what we were actually discussing.

One thing about Daryl's classes: they're rarely boring. If you don't mind going to class every day take this one for an easy GenEd. Show up, speak up once a week and you're halfway to an A. He does tend to mumble but it's worth putting up with for those moments when he blurts out something possibly inappropriate but infinitely hilarious.

Easily one of the most subjective courses I've ever taken. It showed me that the typical structure you find in a class had done more to rein me in and hamper my creativity than I could have imagined. If you're the sort of person who needs strict structure, I'd advise not taking the class. Sidenote: Daryl's voice puts Morgan Freeman's to shame.

Discussion-based course. No tests. No quizzes. You need to do the readings and attend class to get anything out of the class. I'm not very art-oriented, but I still enjoyed the course. Would recommend!

The class was Art for Social Change. His policy is basically if you attend and put forth a good effort while creating quality projects, you get an A. No exams, no quizzes. Just projects and some reading. He's a fun guy and really open-minded. Take him!

Daryl is amazing as a professor and a really interesting man if you give him a chance to talk. he would rather you be enlightened than be able to recite anything we read. it was more about how it effects you as a person and a citizen than what you can remember from the plays. honestly a great man though he doesn't remember your name :D
Daryl is an excellent professor he sometimes gets of topic but is and excellent professor overall

this was for race and gender - darryl is hilarious. he sparks creative thinking and discussion. this was my favorite class all semester. he'd rather have you debate and use your brain than just read something and take a useless exam. group projects are fun. he stays pretty unbiased while discussing very racy topics. take this man!

Name: Whittney Darnell
Comment: Dr. Darnell's Interpersonal communication class was really amazing. She did give quizzes every week but they were easy and you can use the book/notes during all quizzes and tests. A lot of the info we learned in class helped me to better relationships I have with friends, family, or co-workers. I was gonna take this course online but glad I didn't.

I love Dr. Darnell! Her class was interesting and I really learned a lot! You do need the textbook, and the tests and quizzes are open book so not bad! The papers aren't bad either, and they cover interesting topics. She really cares about her students and I would highly recommend her to everyone. 10/10!

When I signed up for Advanced Public Speaking I was super nervous, but the prof gives amazing, to the minute feedback on your speeches and the grading criteria is super clear. She is strict on due dates, but she's human. If you come to her and ask for help or extra time, she is going to help you! Such a good, fun class!
This was probably the hardest class I've taken at NKU. Her midterm was the most ridiculous exam I've taken in my life. She's not a bad professor but she makes things way harder than they need to be.

Professor Darnell is a pretty good professor. She's extremely helpful and is passionate about communication. She makes the class fun with interesting assignments. Be aware she does give 2 chapter quizzes each week along with other homework. They are not hard just a lot to keep track of with work from all the other classes you will take.

Other responses didn't show how tough she actually grades. She finds the smallest mistake possible and takes points off. Don't take her if you need a good GPA. There are really no good things I can say about Mrs. Darnell. I had a better time taking Organic Chemistry and Calculus II.

She is difficult to reach outside of class. She also likes to make it seem like the speeches and grades will be very hard, but she is an easy grader. I was terrified of public speaking but I slowly got better throughout the semester.

Professor Darnell was my favorite prof when I had her. She was very delightful and understanding and she makes class interesting and fun! I made a lot of friends through the group work and I enjoyed the speech prompts she gave! I'd take another class she taught if I could!

I was dreading taking public speaking but I got really lucky when taking Mrs. Darnell. She is a tough grader & has a strict attendance policy. You can only miss up to 2 class periods the whole semester, but I really enjoyed the class. She completely relieved my fear of speaking in front of people. I would definitely take her again!

I was dreading taking this class because I get really nervous talking in front of people. But she made the class enjoyable and comfortable. She's absolutely hilarious and jokes with you before and after your speech to make you more comfortable. Made it my favorite class and I'm not as nervous going up to speak anymore. Would take this class again.

I absolutely love professor Darnell! She has made cmst 101 become my favorite course at NKU and I absolutely hate speaking in front of people. If you're scared of public speaking I would definitely take Darnell's course because she helps you as much as possible. But, there is only one assignment you can make up and only one extra credit assignment.
She's very nice. This class was a little more work than my other com classes but informative.

This was the easiest speech class I've ever had to take. All you need to do is follow the instructions, deliver your speech and you'll do fine. Even if you aren't a great public speaker, she makes you feel comfortable getting in front of the class.

Best Professor I had this year! She was very clear in everything she taught, and was understanding of the fears people had in public speaking, she was very relatable to the students and made it a very comfortable environment. Show up to class and you'll have no problem!
She is nice and helpful but you have to show up for her class
Extremely Helpful. Show up and you'll do well.

Whittney is awesome! I recommend every student to take her class. She is very understanding of students outside lives. She is very clear on what she wants. She used her own examples to help you. This class has helped me overcome my fear of speaking in public. Classes are very fun! :]

She is the best professor ever. I hate giving speeches but she absolutely make it easy and fun. I took her this summer (2011) and it was a 3weeks class. the best essay A class i have ever had. it quick and easy course. Advice anybody taking effective public speaking to take Prof Whitney.

Instructor is very helpful and nice. Lots of opportunity to do speeches. I am very glad I did not take this course on line. She quizzes on the reading material before she lectures. I wasn't crazy about that. Pay attention to the power points in studying for the quizzes. Great class

Dr. Darnell is one of the best.  She is very caring and works with you to help you become the best speaker.  I feel like I learned so much from her that I can apply to my job and in other parts of my life.  I wish she taught more classes.  I would like to take her again!

Name: Michael Marchman
Comment: Michael Marchmann was an amazing professor, and one that I personally will never forget. He has a beautiful mind and thinks independently. He also teaches independent of text books and routine class constraints. If he ever comes back to teaching youd be remiss not to do everything in your power to be in his class.
Love this professor! He's the best!

Made this class very relevant with facts and truths without any bias to it. Tied current events to the each unit of the class. I can't believe NKU is letting go because he is probably one of the best teachers I have ever had.  NKU will definitely regret letting him go.  Professor Marchman is one of the best ever.
He is leaving end of this semester. I have never seen professor like Marchman. He is amazing and he knows his subject well.

Probably my favorite professor at NKU. Determined to deliver facts and truths without bias, material made current and interesting and applicable. Very friendly and helpful, he's leaving Northern and I'm sad to see him go
Mr. Marchman is AWESOME. one of my fav. proffs @ NKU. he made the class SO interesting and so current. he is hilarious & tests arent too bad at all. def recommend him!
The Zinn book is really irrelevant to the class. Other wise a very good teacher.
I recommend taking one of his classes. His class changed my major into Geography.

His tests aren't too bad. He offers a lot of extra credit. He never lets you out of class early. He talks way too much--and sort of hard to follow unless you are really interested in what he is saying. Shows a lot of movies. He's pretty excellent.
He's an amazing teacher! I hate all social studies, but he made geography more than just maps and memorizing - it was really interesting. I definitely would recommend him to anyone.

This class was my favorite class I have EVER taken. Marchman is a hottie and made concentration difficult at times but well worth it. What he had to say was mind blowing and I think that was what really made him so attractive. He knows his stuff and really knows how to make it interesting. No text book which was WONDERFUL! TAKE HIM FOR ANYTHING!

Fantastic professor! His classes are extremely enlightening. He's super laid back and interesting to boot! The type of prof you wouldn't mind running into at a bar. Beware: if you are still stuck in high school mode, don't take his class. He doesn't put up with immature nonsense like ' I need extra credit'. Kinda cute too.

looovvveeeddd this class! In the beginning i was very unhappy i felt he was too difficult for a 100 level. But as the class went on i realized it was my favorite class i've ever taken too bad he was my last class before  graduating. Great guy great professor tests can be alittle hard but if you take good notes you'll ace it please take this class

Very nice guy, interactive class style, lots of readings and discussions.  Interesting & applicable material.  Non-cumulative final.  You have to think about the material and do the readings to get a good grade but it is NOT a hard class.  He'll do a lot to help you (study guides,  reading guides, etc).  Plenty of extra credit opportunities. Take!
Awesome teacher, mixed teaching style with lectures, class discussions, group discussions, and videos.

Very Interesting Professor, he keeps the classroom atmosphere very relaxed and you may get carried away and think you are in someone's living room having a casual conversation because of how interactive the class is.

AMAZING semester. Best one I've had since taking Dr. Hewan's class. Marchman tells the truth and he's not sorry if you don't agree. I'm really glad I took the class. Take this if you want a fun and interesting class, it's worth it.
I think I'm in love with him. I'll admit this class requires a lot of studying, but it's definitely worth it. Especially around Halloween. Definitely take this class.

Easiest class I've ever had.  Just spews leftist rhetoric,  all though there is ome truth to some of what he says. Just spew it right back on the test and you'll ace the class.  Don't buy the book, you won't need it.
Best prof. at NKU!  Tells the truth about the current situations going on with the world.  Laid back teaching style, trys his best to keep the class engaged.

Name: Katie Barton
Comment: Prof. Barton is very kind and caring and is willing to work with people, but you need to put in the work.  Just communicate clearly with her and attend rehearsals/classes!!

Prof. Barton is different depending on the class you take. IN MUSE321 (Chamber Ensemble), she expects you to put in the hours. She frequently volunteers her Chamber group for performances and events around and beyond campus. If you take MUSE321, be prepared to work hard. That being said, it's a wonderful growth opportunity for the choral singer.

Professor Barton is a joy to work with. She cares about her students and tries to build independent relationships with each one. In Chorale, the work is easy but stimulating. The community she facilitates is priceless and the opportunities the class provides you with are very beneficial. I WILL be taking her class again in the spring!

Worst Prof. I've had so far. Zero communication and our class had to contact the director multiple times, she only sent out 2 emails, and neither answered questions. went to her in person and still no direct answer. everything is unclear, and don't expect any grading done until after the semester. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. If I could type more I would.

Zero communication with anyone, we had to contact the DIRECTOR! In order for her to send out a single email (we recieved only 2 all semester). 
The syllabus is anything but followed (the papers are to vague and no idea how to write the papers, even after they were graded. I wish I could type more, WORST teacher I've ever had. Needs replaced/fired.

Her classes have been some of the best classes I've ever had. She is super caring, funny, and has everyone's best interest in mind. I've absolutely loved getting to work with her, and I've learned so much from her. She will always remain as an amazing mentor to me and my career.
She's an incredible, kind, and caring teacher but don't get on her bad side
She is one of the best professors I have had this semester.
She's literally the most amazing professor. I love her classes and take her every chance I get. She's super understanding and nice.
Great class if you like to sing in a group. As long as you come to class and to the concerts, you don't have to worry about your grade. It's up to you to keep it. You don't show, you can get an F.

Katie is a phenomenal conductor and educator. She really cares about her students and is always willing to go the extra mile help; even if it's not her class to teach. She has often helped understand material in other classes such as aural skills

Name: Leighann Rechtin
Comment: The most unorganized professor, never sends out emails and updates as you think one would being in an online class. Does not grade assignments until weeks or months later and does not respond back to emails until at least a week later and it was super rude.

This professor was extremely rude! She sent nasty messages to multiple students. For being an online professor, you'd think she would know how her messages can be interpreted extremely negative. Never again.

I would've liked this class if the professor put forth literally any effort. Lengthy assignments would be made available the day before they were do and she stopped grading anything after midterm, which wouldn't matter so much if the class wasn't so dependent on you building off of past assignments. No feedback whatsoever, the book saved my life.

I had never had a professor like Leighann and I really took a liking to her. She "rules with an iron fist", so you have to stay on top of things in her class in order to do well. And coming to class is extremely important if you want to really understand the material. I enjoyed her so much I'm taking her again this semester!

Loved this class! Very easy if you read and keep on the assignments. Leighann is an amazing professor and is really passionate about communication. She gets to know her students as well. Take her class!

This class was self-taught.  No lectures, but a few videos to help with concepts.  Quiz each week on assigned reading.  2 exams.  Didn't give much info on 2 group projects.  She does not respond to emails, despite 4 pg "how to email your professor" in syllabus.  Disappointed all around in this class and her.

I hate getting up in front of people and talking, so taking a Public Speaking class wasn't exactly on my list of "top 10 favorite things to do".  But the class challenged me to get up there and talk, and while I still don't like public speaking, I feel a lot less anxious about it now than I did before.

I loved Leighann!! She is so sweet & down to earth. Honestly, if you do what is required of you, you're golden! If you're taking Public Speaking, definitely take it with her.  I'd for sure take a class with her again! P.S. you get like 3 days you're allowed to miss & any other you miss you get docked off points. Oh, & get the connect book!!!

She is a great professor it was my second time taking her, I wish i could take her again lol. If you had her for interpersonal it is just like gender and communication. Show up to class because all of your points are in participation. Not all but most. Make sure you do well on you test they are open book. And do extra credit got me an A.

She's really a great professor. She's so funny and makes class so much fun. I had interpersonal with her and she was very open about everything, made a very comfortable environment. I would take her again if I could, she's awesome.

Leighann was awesome! I really wish they would let her teach more upper level classes though. She offers extra credit, tests were online but you will definitely want to read the chapters before them if your trying to get an A. She is very relatable and doesn't make you feel like you are less than her because you are a student. TAKE HER IF YOU CAN!

Leighann is an AWESOME teacher. You can tell she really cares about each and every individual who takes her class, but that doesn't mean she won't give it to you straight. She is a professor you will absolutely love but won't want to disappoint. I want to take yet another class with her!

Leighann is a great professor! Shes very nice and funny. I was terrified of public speaking, but she doesnt make it torturous like other professors might. Dont think its a BS class though, because everything counts. It could be very easy to drop your grade if you dont keep up. Shes awesome though and I highly recommend her!

She is AWESOME! Can't say enough about her. You will love her, I learned a lot. You share journals with the class once a week, have a quiz once a week, and do an activity once a week. Everyone really enjoyed it and it was a lot of fun. You have 2 exams taken online and one paper. Don't let her niceness fool you for tests, YOU WILL NEED TO STUDY!!!!

She is an awesome professor! I didn't think that I would learn anything going into the class.  Every week I left class feeling like I actually learned something! Quizzes are not hard as long as you read each week.

You will actually look forward to going to this class every week. Leighann keeps things very interesting and lively. This class will actually make you think and has the potential to change your life. She's super helpful and lenient. Extra credit is offered. Assignments are easy. If you take this class you have to take Leighann!

She is fabulous. She is super enthusiastic about what she does and loves to teach, class is discussion based. Journals have to be written each week and lots of activities.. You will not be bored and will look forward to class!

she is amazing, i love her class, you do do a significant amount of writing each week, but its not anything difficult! He tests are open book, and her quizzes are with a partner. Mondays you discuss journals, Wednesday you have open quiz, and Fridays is a fun activety. Awesome class, you dont want to miss her class!
I LOVED her class, i was terrifed of public speaking but she helped me out with my projects, and replied back quickly when i had a question. Her class is awesome, easy to understand,

She's very knowledgeable in her area and thus is super helpful. She is very laid back and her teaching style is discussion based. I really enjoyed her class and the tests are very easy if you show up everyday and complete the journal and quiz assignments.

Name: Steven Castellano
Comment: This class was super easy, partially because it was fun, and partially because the content was easy. The textbook wasn't necessary, all of the material was in the slides. There were not a ton of grades, but Steve wasn't a tough grader so it didn't really matter. This class was super chill and fun and I would 100% recommend!

Out of my four semesters, Professor Castellano is by far my favorite professor at NKU. He is very friendly and relaxed with students. His grading requirements are very clear and you know what to expect with each assignment. I'm excited to take him in my future courses.

One of the best professors I've had at NKU! He was very helpful in and outside of class and explained concepts in terms that were easy to understand. He likes to get to know his students on a personal level and enjoys seeing you succeed. Complete all your work on time and you should easily pass this course and make a lifelong peer!

Steve is a great guy. His class was a challenge, but he gives good feedback so you can improve on the next assignment. Willing to help when he is needed, and will email back quickly. He keeps a consistent schedule all semester, so you know what and when to expect things. You learn a lot of useful skills in this class!

Super chill teacher and easy to talk to/ask questions. Gives clear instructions for assignments. Even if he takes off some random points, youll still get a good grade if you follow rubrics. Labs are done in assigned groups, but he pays attention to your group dynamic and will make adjustments throughout the semester. Great guy, would take again.

There was almost no homework outside of class. He is passionate about the topics he teaches. His lectures are easy to follow and take notes on. All quizzes and tests are taken online through canvas in class. He has "active listening quizzes" during lecture in which he answers all the questions on the quiz during the class. Easy A.
There really isn't anything bad to say about Steve. He's just a good guy and watches over the lab groups as we work. I like Steve.

you have to work but everything is graded fairly and quickly. he is so fun and interesting. i also enjoy that he doesn't answer questions directly, he helps you get there on your own. he gets to know everyone by name and developed a relationship with all the students. i really grew in this class bc of the independence he gave us. he's the best!!!

Not too bad of a class or instructor. He can sometimes be confusing but is willing to clarify things for you. Lots of assignments in the beginning of semester but they aren't too hard. Lectures are relaxed and attendance isn't mandatory. There are a few presentations and one big end of the semester paper you have to do so have fun with that.

He can be rather unclear about some things, but for the most part, he is very understandable. He explains the steps to labs before starting and even makes comical noises with the actions. During the lab, he walks around to make sure everyone gets it and makes jokes throughout to ease the stress. BIO 150/L is not for those that aren't interested.
He explains things very clearly and is always willing to help.  He's also very funny and always available for questions outside class.

Was actually a very good professor. Yes, he was slow at grading but he improved that over the semester. He is working really hard to enhance the class and spend more time in the field than writing lab reports. He cares about the success of his students, and it shows.

This professor was not that great, but he's the only one who teaches the section. He is a nitpick grader and will not give you an A unless your Lab reports are a replica of his graduate published work. He is also a slow grader and pushes a huge political agenda in class.

9/10! he is a good prof and understands students are very busy. also understands labs are only worth 1 credit. he is funny and lectures and labs were always fun and entertaining. my one and only complaint about him is that it takes him a long time to grade papers and give feedback. that being said he will always work with you on asnmnts & due dates

Name: James Vanover
Comment: AMAZING. I have failed this class twice before until now. He is awesome! He teaches at a decent pace and the study guides are literally in the same structure as the tests so as long as you do them and understand what you're doing, you'll get a good grade. You can just tell that he really actually wants students to pass and understand math.

TAKE THIS INSTRUCTOR! All through out school I've struggled with math and done awful, but James Vanover is the FIRST person to teach math in a way I could understand and prepared me enough for the tests that I got an A on almost every test! He is easily approachable, breaks the content down so you will understand it, and sets the class up to pass.

Name: Lee Michael Kersting Lee Michael Kersting
Comment: Ask questions, follow along with the lectures, and do the homework. He emphasized that it's always best to attend lectures to ask questions, especially for challenging chapters. He won't call you out to answer a question, but you can tell he does enjoy it when someone answers. He used Math XL for homework and exams.

Professor Kersting is a great accounting professor. We work on real problems during class, so that you understand the content and can easily complete the homework outside of class. If you don't understand the content he is happy to help. Since this is an accounting course being at class will help you.

Name: Steve Stephens
Comment: Prof Stevens is one of my favorites. Very knowledgeable guy.

Can't use a laptop in class, but he's interesting enough to move class along pretty well. I liked him as a prof. And like him even more as a person. He stopped class early one night and took the class out for drinks. Cool guy.

I had Stephens for Evidence. Absolutely the best professor I've ever had in college or law school. He makes Evidence, which is one of the hardest subjects in law school, easy, interesting and fun. This could easily have been a doctrinal, theoretical approach and he showed me how to use it in real life practice. I would take him for any class. Perio

Name: Ryan Clark
Comment: Ryan is great. I had a huge fear of having others read my work in this class but their comments really help. The book you absolutely need to have is your AP styles book, new reporting and writing textbook we didn't really use except for once. Overall this is a great class, if you have to take it with anyone, take it with Clark!
Ryan was definitely a breath of fresh air. His in-class critiques were esp. helpful. I would absolutely recommend him.

Ryan is easily one of my favorite professors I've had. I learned a lot more from his class than I expected, and he truly cares if you succeed in your college career. He's very flexible and understanding, and you'll do well if you attend class and put in the effort. I'd recommend him for any class!

The first day class was called "News II: The Reckoning." That should have been the first clue he was a breath of fresh air that taught us to be free-thinkers. Unlike other teachers that are typically cut, dry & almost formulaic. You learned through story examples & other students. His edits & comments were great & he got back to emails quickly.

The most amazing professor. He is HILARIOUS and so laid back. Almost nothing is required of you and he is super easy going. I still keep in touch with him sometimes because he goes beyond the classroom to help you however you need. He could teach anything and make it awesome. TAKE HIM!

This professor is really nice and fun! He is always making us laugh and joking around. He teaches the class well but I feel as if the class in general is a waste of time. If you really want to take this class though I suggest him! The only thing hard about this class is th campus event papers! Oh && there is no final exam!

Name: Daniel Meloy
Comment: Tests aren't too bad as long as you study.  Don't bother with the textbook because you won't use it.  You have to do a five minute speech at the end of the semester.  Offers several extra credit opportunities for attendance, etc.

The material is pretty dry and boring, but his stories as a police chief help out a lot. As long as you show up to EVERY class, you'll get an A regardless of what you get on tests. He gives out a lot of extra points just for being in class. DON'T BUY THE BOOK! Didn't open it once.

I take all of his classes. Don't even buy the book! He teaches from power point, just go to class and you will get an A. So easy. And he's an awesome guy and a really good professor. His stories rock! And he's such a good family guy (always talks about his wife and kids). Recommend!
I loved the cop stories! Very interesting and you'll learn a lot

Great professor. Had him for another jus class. Very easy. if you take good notes don't have to use the book. he never orders new book because he doesn't like to use it. police cheif so every thing he teaches is from being on the job. no homework just 3 or 4 test which are easy.

Name: Carl Miller
Comment: He cares and wants you to succeed in his class. Explained class topics very well and tried to keep it interesting. If you showed up to lecture, most of the homework was extremely easy. If you did the homework, you would be very prepared for tests because the test questions were more straight forward.

Dr. Miller was a great professor. Goes over topics very thoroughly. If you go to class, you should have no issue getting a good grade in his class. You can tell he cares about students and ensures their success as much as he can.

Mr. Miller made stats easy to understand! He puts effort into helping with homework questions and goes into detail about concepts. Tests aren't complex and you get to retake two of them. His practice tests set you up for success. Homework can be a bit difficult but he is willing to help you!
Dr. Miller, was a great professor and a nice guy. I'd recommend taking him.

Awesome professor, he has everything set up as modules, its hard to understand the set up at first but its very easy. I already like math so I may be biased but he made me love statistics, he explains very well and if you don't understand math he will help you. I would definitely recommend him. You can retake every test and get full credit.

I have never been good at math, but Dr. Miller was the best professor I've ever had. He explains concepts extremely well and is very easy to talk to. He explained intricate concepts in such great detail that made it easy for me to understand. You definitely do have to put in effort for this class, but as long as you do, you will do fine!

The best stats teacher you will find!! Trust me- take his class! He is super compassionate and will go out of his way to help you! He makes it super easy to understand the material. Awesome teaching and test style! I failed stats before I took him and I received an A in his class!! 10/10 professor :)

The class tested by standards, and you have multiple opportunities to earn mastery on them. If you didn't get the standard on the test right, you can retake the standard. If you do the retakes and the learning checks you will get a good grade. He is very understanding and wants you to pass!

Miller does not explain things very well and when you don't understand, he makes it your fault. Not only does he not explain well, but he does not go as in-depth as he should, and the stuff he does go in-depth, you do not need to know. Be ready to teach yourself the majority of this information.

Carl is the only person who has taught me anything math related and I have not cried in frustration because of not understanding. Hes really sweet and sincere! 10/10 would take again but not really because I no longer need math based classes!
Not the best. Doesn't explain things very well and likes to watch you take quizzes and tests (this was an online class for me). Deadlines moved around all the time, making it difficult to keep up.
Professor Miller is very caring and his lectures are easy to understand.

I took his STA205 class last semester and loved it. very easily understood from his lectures. very lenient about homework, all of it was online but he always extended the deadlines. The tests we're fairly simple, he doesn't try and trick you, its all basic concepts. wish I could take him for every math class!!

HE GIVES OUT TOO MANY HOMEWORKS AND QUIZZES ONE AFTER THE OTHER, AND MAJOR TESTS, TOO. YOU WON'T LEARN ANYTHING ONLINE, AS HE WOULD POST VIDEOS OF LECTURES IN TEGRITY, BUT JUST BASICALLY READ TO YOU WHAT THE POWERPOINT IS. I REPEAT, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM. FIND A DIFFERENT PROFESSOR.

Very helpful, made an effort to give good explanations. The class can be a bit difficult but Prof Miller is often in his office and is always excited to answer questions. Would definitely take his class again.
Obviously knows the class material but really unclear when he explains things.  There are lots of assignments but class notes don't help much.  Take someone else if you can.

Worst math professor of I've had.  Spends half of class on something then says, "But that's the long way." No graded HW. Quizzes and tests only - tests are heavily weighted & most of class didn't even have time to finish.  Have to ask same question 10 times to get an answer, so expect to self teach. Never made below A in math until this class.
Doesn't fully explain in great detail. Not bad professor.

If you don't study, you won't do well. If you have questions you should ask; he's very helpful and wants everyone to do well. The class is hard, so be prepared to work for a good grade. He was a great teacher though and he is a savage.. it's awesome.

Really seems to know what he is talking about. If you need help he'll certainly help out. Homework is straight forward and you can continue to do until you can an A (only in MyStatLab though). If you miss a day it isn't the end of the world. He posts everything online and is quick to respond to emails. Would definitely take again!

Name: Joan Bolser
Comment: great teacher! very helpful, and very fun. Easy going. Sucks that the class is only on saturday but she makes it worth while
Easy Class good teacher easy to get along with

Yeah, it's a saturday class, but I had no problem going. Loved the class. Tests are easy, open book, open note. Teacher is easy to kid around with. All work is with groups outside. Easy A. Goes by fast!
Fun teacher. Easy to talk to and joke around with.  Knows her stuff. Very Helpful. Quiz and Mid-Term were open note.  Don't bother buying the text. Never used it.

Name: Ned Kalapasev
Comment: Ned has a bit of an Eastern European accents, it can be hard to understand. So cool though.

I feel bad for missing his student review in class.  This class is everything you would ever want to know about maps, which is is about as exciting as it sounds.  He makes up for the material with an Eastern European coolness.  Should be teaching GIS though...

Name: George Manning
Comment: Tests were difficult if you didnt study, but if you put the effort in by completing the study guide you had every answer needed on tests. I enjoyed the interactive video lessons and activities and truly enjoyed this class.
Fantastic teacher. Keeps in contact after you have taken his courses.
Very ethereal, course content is great, makes you think instead of memorizing. One of the best teachers I have ever had.

He's very knowledgeable. You DO have to read the book and write deeply. The textbook isn't a normal text book-- it actually feels personal. Take this class-it's perfect and I would take it again if I could.
A wonderful teacher that really cares about his students. Can't wait to take him again!

Dr. Manning is a very nice person but does not teach psychology in the conventional way. The final exam included concepts never discussed in class. We did stupid things in class like watch The Bucket List and talk about our feelings. Got a B, which ticked me off because I'm a straight A student, came to class everyday and did all assignments.
Organizational psych

This guy was no fun.  Grade deducted for abscenses that were excused, he just didn't keep records.  Sent my final project (a) to the shredder--which I found out when I emailed the next semester about getting it back.  Did not deal well with questions, yet was v. unclear.

Very good teacher. He is very detailed and you must use the book. gives you a study guide- they are the exact questions on the test. essays on every test too. promotes positive stress free life. mandatory attendance! always go! he seems a little loopy at first- but he is a nice guy.
Very detailed
Promotes positive thinking- enjoyed his class

i really liked prof manning.  my class was a second session class. he is fare, friendly and extremely caring. he knows the name of each of his students which is rare. there were 4 tests, a 45-50 min presentation that was done in a group, and a term paper that was 15-20 pages. He provided study guides that were exact answers to his tests. loved it.
I adore Dr. Manning! His classes are fun and interesting and he is so sweet and understanding!

Dr. Manning's class...whoa.  they tried something new this year... and that's squeezing this class into 1 session (half a semester). personally, i love this class and the way he teaches it because it has such a mellow feel to it.i warn you,if you dont plan on reading his book (and quickly. and thoroughly) do not take this class. study, & ur golden.
Great professor.  Class is very unstructured and interesting.  Professor keeps things light and fun while still actually teaching.
Amazing, caring, understanding, practical and helpful
Great Class - I wish I could take all my classes with Dr. Manning. Thanks
No Comments

Prof Manning is so sweet. He is one of the nicest teachers I have had so far. He is all about getting students to learn as much as possible and he goes about it in a fun way. We did group presentations which was really fun and we had study buddies. If you are shy you should take this class. It will help you overcome your shyness. Great class!!!
Dr Manning's humanistic psy class was a breeze. First mid-term consists of easy quizzes by other students. The final take-home is long but easy since he wants you to talk about YOUR life.

Name: Paige Wideman
Comment: For a 100 level class, this class was much harder, boring, and more time consuming than expected. It is very lecture heavy and has lots of confusing assignments. I would not recommend this class.
I would not recommend this professor, at least online. Her book is confusing and the class has a heavy workload for a Gen Ed class. Not organized at all.

Class has a heavy work load especially for being a Gen Ed class. All assignments are in her book that she makes you buy, makes it kind of confusing and unorganized. I wouldn't recommend or take this class again.
I hated the digital book assignments and grades were confusing. Easy but boring class.
super easy class, finished with a 100. most quizzes and tests are on quizlet, only reason you'd need the book is for worksheets but if you know someone else taking it you could get them from them
Her tests are super specific, so you have to know the material--its not necessarily art analysis like I thought it would be.
LOVE HER.

This class was very easy. She's into the subject matter therefore she is very knowledgeable. Really easy class. Simple lectures on powerpoints and an extra credit exam as the final. I would take again!

Better than I expected after reading reviews here.  She'll work with you if you have issues (example: doesn't permit electronics, but she let me leave my laptop on a table in the front row to audiovideo record her lectures) . Scantron testing was kinda old school, but a guarantee of no short answer questions was nice.

This class isn't that hard if you show up and take notes. The lectures can get long and she is really boring sometimes, but you learn some interesting stuff. As long as you go to class and pay attention you should be fine.

No final for this class. She is a very helpful teacher and will do anything to help her students! You often get out of class early! The text book is only used for quizzes and we only had 2 quizzes. You definitely need scantrons and the workbook!

Pretty sure this gal voiced Roz in Monsters Inc. Her lectures make me want to die, her first test will kill you and she doesn't allow any sort of electronics making the class 800 years long. ITS HORRIBLE. I hate it. The only part I liked was the graffiti artist section. I'm an Arts and sciences student and I still hated it.
This class isn't suited for anyone but art majors. This is the worst professor I have ever had. I wouldn't take her again and now my gpa is officially ruined.
I wouldn't reccomend this professor to anyone.

This class is too hard for someone who is not an art major. Her exams are too difficult and she doesn't even allow you to see what you missed on the exams. This gen ed ruined my 4.0 gpa. Her lecture videos don't work half of the time and she blames her students for it. Don't take her unless you already know stuff about Art.

Art 100 was pretty easy if you went to class and took notes. You have four tests throughout the semester and she will drop the lowest test grade. Hardly any homework but, you have 3 quizzes.  also, you have art labs that will help your grade. Mrs. Wideman is really nice and is willing to help you. TAKE HER!

Interesting information taught, but the class itself was boring. Goes off of powerpoints and videos for tests so you need to be there to get the little details she leaves out of it all. She also does random in class assignments. If you want a good grade you need to be there. Tests are pretty difficult, they require a lot of studying.

Fairness at grade. You have to attend classes to write down notes. She gives a study guide for the test. 4 tests, drop the lowest test. Online quizzes are fair if you read the chapters. Extra credits worth 10 points of your final grade. If you attend the classes, do the online quizzes, and write down the notes you will do just fine.

In all fairness, her online class is not that difficult.  If you pay attention to deadlines, you can do well in the class. She has improved in keep communication throughout the term to provide reminders.  And always responded quickly to my concerns and questions.
I am not interested in art but i did like her class.  One thing i didnt like is when she would give us studios she would never give us time to do them 10 minutes here and there.

Name: Helen Bukulmez
Comment: Loved the class not difficult at all just time consuming at time. But overall I would take the class again.

Professor Bukulmez really has done a good job of showing us what it means to be a lawyer and market yourself to the fullest extent. The class is alot in terms of workload and out of class preparation time, but in the end it helps us learn the concepts of the class more effectively.

Professor Bukulmez has brought a lot of emphasis to something that isn't highlighted too often in law school classes: marketing. It's a great skills-based course that focuses on personal development, which is great because the better we are as individuals, the better we'll be as attorneys. This class prepares you to get and keep clients. It's great

Professor Bukulmez really has done a great job of inspiring me to pursue my dreams as a lawyer. Her class has been tough at times in terms of workload, but the substance of the work has been helpful and informative. She has been very supportive as a professor and I believe she will continue to be supportive as I continue to pursue a legal career.

Professor Bukulmez is a very nice and knowledgeable person. She understands this subject matter in great detail and I will be able to use this when I go practice. The work that needs to be done prior to coming to class, is a substantial amount which is difficult to complete on top of work and other classes.
She really knows what she is talking about, and has added much value to my future profession in my law career as an attorney.

For a 2 credit course, the workload is excessive. All assignments are due on Saturday evening when class is scheduled for Monday at 4:30pm. For students with full-time jobs and families, the weekends are a time to complete law school assignments. To arbitrarily take Sunday away, places an undue burden on these students.

Law Project Management is a great class to learn practical project management skills that will be necessary for every new attorney entering the field. This class is very beneficial and I would highly recommend taking it!

Professor Bukulmez gives real world examples to everything we learn which is very helpful! She makes class a comfortable environment for participation and always offers to help us with materials for her class or in our careers once we leave law school. There is a lot of work, but that's expected in law school.

She's super nice and what you learn is completely related to real life. This is a class that you work for your grade, you do the work then you'll be fine. There is a lot of homework and at time it's repetitive but that's kinda all of law school. This isn't an easy A class, you have to do a lot of work and go to class but It isn't a bad class.

Name: Katherine Sliter
Comment: This is the best course I've ever taken at NKU. The class is simple; she lectures, you take notes, and get a quiz every week. You study those quizzes for the exams. The class is always interesting. You do an online assignment every week, the book isn't needed. Also, you have to do surveys for points(she'll explain). I HIGHLY recommend her course.
Prof Sliter is awesome!  She is very enthusiastic, and you can tell that she cares about the material and about the students.

She's great. You take notes from simple powerpoints and have one short quiz per week. There are many ways to obtain points and even extra credit. Easy class if you take ten minutes out of your week to study.
Katherine is very helpful. The class is very easy if you attend, and there are multiple extra credit opportunities if you are struggling. I highly recommend this class!
Best teacher I've ever had. Clear, concise, nice, and always there to help. (P.S. She's also very gorgeous too.)
