This class is a guaranteed A if you show up and do the work. All information is on the powerpoints, no need to buy the book. Videos and games always kept the class interesting. Willing to help outside of class as well. Would highly recommend!

Katherine is great!  She is very enthusiastic and talks very clearly.  The only bad part of the class was some weird kid who sat in front and would just interrupt and shout all the time.  I would recommend her!

You do the same thing every week if you take her on MWF. Monday & Wednesday you have a powerpoint and take notes and every Friday you have quiz which is super easy! I recommend her for sure! It's an Easy A if you do all of her assignments.

Name: Charles Heath
Comment: I very much enjoyed this class. Content was super interesting and homeworks and tests were easy. The only critique I have is how harshly he graded the discussion boards- taking points off for menial things. I never contacted the prof. directly so I cannot speak on his personality. Lots of homework but very easy if you just read over the modules.

Professor Heath was awesome! Responded to emails in a timely manner. He was very understanding if you needed extra time on assignments and gave feedback for our group project that we did. I would definitely take another class of his!

Group work EVERY week. LOTS of reading. Responds pretty fast. Instructions are not always clear and concise, but will give pretty good feedback. Expectations are clear and up front, so as long as you keep up with the readings and assignments you should be good. Definitely reach out to him if you need help. He wants to help you.

Professor Heath was fine at teaching. I'm sure he is good if you take him in person but since I took him online it was just kind of mediocre. In his online lectures he does apply the material to real world context which did made it easier to understand. He can also be a funny guy. Just pay attention, read the chapters, take notes, and you'll be ok.

First online class, so was worried. But honestly was an Easy A. Make a few friends in your class! It will help a lot. Just a quiz per week, a few discussions and there you go. Just remember you have something due every Sunday and you are good to go
Overall was an okay professor. If you read the chapters the quizzes and assignments are not too bad. The grading scale is kind of crazy, it'll end up out of like 10,000 points.

Easy online course! As long as you read the chapter you will pass the quiz. One module per week, and a quiz and you're done. Super easy! He offers extra credit as well. Takes about an hour and a half one day a week to finish that modules assignments.

Name: Mike King
Comment: Guest speakers to tell you about different departments in the fine arts building.
He is hilarious and very easy going. As long as you g to class and read the plays you'll be just fine.

Prof. King's theatre appreciation class starts off easy but turns fast. great guy, funny, loves his subject. I had to see 2 plays and read a few plays as well. good class but I missed one play, tanked the final because of it and got a C. SEE THE PLAYS!

Prof. King's theatre aprietiation class starts off easy but turns fast. great guy, funny, loves his subject. I had to see 2 plays and read a few plays as well. good class but I missed one play, tanked the final because of it and got a C. SEE THE PLAYS!

King is a good teacher. Has good powerpoints. He has you read 3 books thru out the sem and write one 2-page paper. just sparknote them and you'll be good to go! make sure you study at least a little bit for the tests and you'll pass. he makes you go to 2 nku plays (8 EASY points) but they were both awesome and i really enjoyed them!

Good proffessor with a good sense of humor.  I recommend this class to anyone who is interested in theatre, or just needs to cover a requirment.  Show up, take notes, maybe read over them once before tests and this class is an easy a

Show up, take notes, read the spark notes on the plays, and you get an A or B. Better than taking art or music, and he understands that not everybody likes the classes topic and makes it somewhat interesting. Pretty funny guy, take this class if you need a humanities credit.
He is really great!  He cares about you learning the material and really knows and cares about what he talks about.  Not too hard as long as you read the plays
He's a pretty good teacher. Class is really easy. I would recommend him to anyone.
Great class, taught inside the theater.  He has a great sense of humor, making this the most enjoyable lecture hall I have ever taken.
Awesome professor-very funny and nice. The class wasn't as simple as sitting in class and getting an A but if you go to class and do what he asks (which isn't a lot) you'll get a good grade.

He knows his stuff.  Due to classes of a lot of people, you can sneak out easily.  But I don't recommend it.  What he teaches in class is on the test.  He uses Blackboard so you can get the notes, but I recommend going and staying in class to really learn the material.  You do have to go to a few plays, but you don't have to get on stage.
It was an ok class and you could sneak out  very easily due to the large amount of students.

Took this as a huge lecture class...and was glad that I did!  We met in the Corbett theatre and this man taught, and read from his powerpoints each class period as though he were acting!  VERY well prepared (one of the best profs so far), and very good  delivery!  TAKE NOTES, read what he says...and you'll get 100s on the test (MUST STUDY!) Awesome
Entertaining, enthusiastic teacher
Dr. King is a nice guy and so funny! You must attend class and take notes, if you do that then you should get an A.
An amazing professor!  I have had him for more than one class and each time, his class was the highlight of my schedule.  He has so much to impart, take him if at all possible.
A wonderful professor!  Very professional, approachable and interesting.
This man is genius. He's hilarious and also a great professor. He's very helpful and just a really great guy
He's cool, fun and amusing. I like acting so it may be the class, but he does a good job teaching it.

Name: Bryan Holmes
Comment: My favorite professor I've had so far! He writes out the notes (as he is explaining them) exactly how he wants you to write them because they are structured just like the tests. Tests were open book and identical to the notes. He made class very engaging and I never dreaded coming to class. He made the material funny and entertaining.

This class was super easy but the reason he gets a low rating is that this is an intro-level class and also a gen ed and he made us watch the most disgusting video I've ever seen, it was on sexual violence and completely inappropriate for the class level. It made me sick to my stomach and I'm a nursing major so you know I've seen some things.

I love him, he is a great professor and teaches very well! He takes his time on teaching you the material, gives great notes, and all quizzes and exams are online. You only have to do 2 paper throughout the whole semester, this class is an easy A. I always look forward to this class.
This was a gen. ed. class for me but it was very interesting! The lectures were interactive and informative and I was never bored.

He is a nice guy, but his grading is very HARSH. You have to take notes in the class because all the questions in the exams are from the notes, not the book. For a 101 class, it is the hardest class I have taken and he does not give any extra credit. I would not recommend this class to anyone unless you really have to take him.
Super fun, gives good examples, clear cut, NOTES are awesome

Name: Mike Sterling
Comment: He is a great instructor and a seriously nice guy. Test are tough and he doest give out a study guide. My study group saved my life. One group presentation and a couple papers.

The subject was relatively "boring" but he tried his best to make it interesting. Take his class, if you do everything he asked, you should score an A easily (I did):-) The textbook needs to be updated with current issues, i.e. hazing, bulling, etc. things that exist in every organization and how one could learn ways to cope with these issues.

Mr. Sterling is a great guy. Obviously Org. Behavior is not rocket science by any means, but if you do the study guides based on his terms then you are fine. Only read the first 3 chapters of the book and skimmed the rest. If you work hard though you definitely can get an A.

Take his class!!! He is BRILLIANT. You will learn a great deal; at the same time will have fun. His lectures are very interesting, because he has a great knowledge of the subject? very powerful speaker with remarkable personality. Highly recommend to everyone.
Very fun professor. Takes time to prepare his class to it's funny and interesting. Great learning environment! TAKE THIS GUY!
I like him a lot. One of the best NKU professors. Helps a lot. You would have to do a lot work, but it is possible to get an "A". Class average was "B". Take him, you will like him too
easy test and easy projects.
No Comments

I really liked this professor!  He tries very hard to make sure his students understand the subjects.  His class is not all lecture.  He does all kinds of activities to make his class more interesting.  He give great study guides for his tests and his tests are all multiple choice.  He uses blackboard and posts his power points.  He is Great!

Name: Lauren Mohr
Comment: I had professor Mohr for public speaking and loved her! She understood that everyone in the class was there for their public speaking credit and took that into consideration when grading speeches. Her directions were always clear and she is just a super friendly and nice person. She was very understanding about how nerve wrecking speeches are.

Name: Vickie Knueven
Comment: Very good professor! Really knows what she's talking about. She is a really understanding person and will help you through anything you need.

Name: Lori Wheeler
Comment: Professor Wheeler is a great teacher and it's one of the best classes I took. She is realistic and compassionate about what she teaches. She cares about her students.

Name: Beth Ackerson
Comment: Professor Ackerson is easily one of my favorite professors I have ever taken. Her class is actually very easy and an easy A if you do what is expected of you. It does not take much time out of your week and you can easily get all of the required things done in no time. Definitely recommend!

Name: Aaron Zlatkin
Comment: Zlatkin is absolutely great at what he does, but as a lecturer, if you're not absolutely fascinated by audio production, can be a little rough.  He is a very kind and understanding person, but isn't always the best at teaching.

If you're in EMB, you know Zlatkin. Unfortunately his calm personality carries into his classes, at least online. Also Adobe Audition is not the move and the C.o.I. should look into other audio editing software.

I love this man, normally when you have a teacher showing a movie, normally they almost ruin the movie in the way they spoil it beforehand, or load off unnecessary details, however, everything Z said really added to my viewing experience and I truly enjoyed so much of this class because of him, any prof could make it good, Z made the class great!
The big Z is truly the greatest Audio Production Wizard this side of the Mississippi.

Name: Megan Peek
Comment: She has been one of my favorite professors so far. She is very understanding and helpful. Speaking in front of a class is hard for some people but she makes it less painful. She also cancels class sometimes which is cool. Would recommend.

Name: Traci Freeman
Comment: There are not enough kind words to describe Traci. She is the best professor I've ever had. She is so willing to help and talk you through stress or exam material. I would highly recommend taking her!!! She's awesome!
She is great! She has a ton of energy and is lots of fun. Knows material and demonstrates very well. Take her!

Traci is an awesome teacher! I loved going to lab with her. She made lab fun with her tremendous amount of energy and outgoing personality. The class is easy and one of the more exciting classes since it is hands on. She is very helpful when ever needed. If you have Traci, be prepared for her to be your favorie teacher.

I loved having class with Traci! She is so friendly and easy to talk to, she's also goofy and funny which make her classes fun to sit through. If given the opportunity, I highly recommend taking her class! One of the best at NKU :)
She was so amazing! the B-E-S-T! Traci made the class seem more interesting and I learned so much. I wouldn't change a thing.

Name: Bobby Platt
Comment: He is genuinely one of the nicest professors I have ever met and makes class interesting!

Name: JeeEun Lee
Comment: Took this course with no prior ceramic teachings and found it to be very useful! Overall the course is extremely fun, but with very few projects and very tough grading it can be fairly difficult. She did also break my whole classes final project so we all got A's. Super slay.

While I think JeeEun is excellent at teaching her craft, her critiques really fell flat for me. She heavily values function over appearance, which is where I experienced a lot of friction with her. She also prioritizes deeper meanings behind works during critique, so be prepared for this type of grading even as a beginner to ceramic work.

JeeEun cares about her students. She is very understanding whether you suffer from anxiety, or just want to redo your project. She will work to make the project enjoyable for you. She pushes you to be more creative and see things outside the box. Ceramics was one of the most enjoyable classes i've taken at NKU and will miss it every semester.

JeeEun is my favorite professor at NKU! She is kind, talented, and loves to help her students grow. Because of her class I have found my passion and am switching to a Spatial Arts Major. Lots of fun assignments, expect to work outside of class. But every assignment she allows for 100% creativity. I could not recommend her course more!

Name: Jason  Farkas
Comment: A great teacher who turned the classroom into a space that felt safe to share our opinions, we spent many days discussing ethical dilemmas as a class and what we would do in tough situations. Highly highly recommend.

Name: Ralph Draper
Comment: I'm amazed I'm the first to rate prof Draper he's honestly by far the best teacher I've ever had at NKU or otherwise. Very funny and engaging classes and you can tell he genuinely cares about his students.

Name: Krista Weiss
Comment: Im taking this class this spring for my gen ed. Prof Weiss has been so helpful and very available to reply my emails when I have problems. The class has weekly 2 discussion boards and quiz. There are also writing assignments later in the term on classical concerts that you witnessed and on an amadeus movie

Name: Willie Elliott
Comment: Dr. Elliot is an awesome teacher and is always willing to stop and listen to see your point of view, and to help you with things you do not understand! My favorite professor, thus far!

Dr. Elliot is a good man, but an awful teacher.  Your grade is not representative of the work you put in, but of the number he decided to write on your paper.  Grades are completely random.  Sometimes he will grade assignments before you even turn them in.  Easy A though, as long as you show up and turn something in.
love him! he is so amazingly hilarious and personable. my favorite social work professor thus far.
Great teacher.
Great professor
He is great!!  He has an amazing mind!
washed up. needs a new job. i don't think he believes half of what he says.  he's a fake.

Dr. Elliot is a great professor and teaches you so much outside the textbook.  He really cares about the student, and helps in regular life situations.  He is by far, my favorite professor at NKU, and I highly reccomend taking him if you have the chance.

This class was great.  Elliot takes the pressure off of learning which is important when u want to retain info.  he is easy...but everything this man says is worth a million bucks..so pay attention.  he hates silence so answer questions b/c he will make it seem as if you were 100% right even if you were 100% wrong.
Good prof.  He has been around and has seen many things in life.  A lot of busy work but you will learn a lot.
The best prof. I've had in my 4 years at nku. He has an amazing ability of imprinting information into your brain without you being consciously aware of the process of acquiring knowledge.
i had to take a physical fitness class for my major and he was a great instructor. the assistants were not so great but he rocks. he helped me one on one a lot because i struggled with karate.

class was very interesting.  every word out of this mans mouth is worth a million dollars.  really can take his views and teachings to the real world.  very worldly person.  he is easy and will get into great conversations and interesting topics
No Comments

Name: Judith Meeker-Archer
Comment: She doesn't go over anything on the exams in class, you watch videos and she tells you about her personal experiences with broadway and other theatrical settings. I wouldn't take her class again.

She is so easy i would definitely take her again!! There are a few projects and assignments and one monologue but it's so easy. You mostly watch videos and movies through most of the class. If you have even the slightest interest in theatre I would definiely take this class!

Joodi was a good professor for teaching a boring subject in my opinion. If you are not into theatre this class will be very boring especially if you take her 8 am class, it is very hard to stay awake but this class was an easy a. You had to do a monologue in front of class but it was easy and she is a very nice lady. Take her if you need this class
test are easy because you get a study guide
It's an easy A, but soooo boring. I took an 8 o clock class and attendence was mandatory so it was hard to get up an actually attend class.

The most boring class.   Lectures go on and on and on.   As stated before, her handwriting is barely legible.    Tests aren't hard if you skim your notes prior.   She is a nice lady, but I did not expect this class to be so boring.

Easy A! I winged my monolog, and still got an A. Easy exam. Lectures a bit boring, and her handwriting is unreadable. I have this as a night class, and wouldn't recommend it to anyone. It's just very long and drags on. Overall, very extremely easy.
super easy class. real nice teacher and easy exams! highly recommend.

Name: Frank Sheehy
Comment: Frank was really easy and laid back in class.  Although the syllabus was not outlined, he made it easy to understand what the next assignment was.  He's a little unorganized.  Good class. Take it if you want an easy science credit.

He was great in previous classes, but he seems to have lost his mind- totally insecure about other professors.  His tests are not consistent with material covered and he even puts questions on his tests where you're obliged to write about how he is your favorite instructor at the school

he is so funny! makes the class fun and enjoyable. he talks really fast but always repeats what he says.  really helps you understand what he's talking about. you will definitely enjoy this professor!

Does talk pretty fast but really cool guy. Gave us all 10 bonus points for coming on the last day of class. I'm taking him for SCI110L because i know it will be easy and fun. Plus he's pretty easy on the eyes ;)

Talks really fast, but laid back teacher.  Normally wouldn't stay in class the whole time and time would always go fast.  I bought an earlier edition of the textbook we needed for $6; don't buy the new version.  Show up, complete the labs, and study for tests and you'll be okay. EASY
frank was the best. his class was so much fun and he is just so personable with his students, its amazing. i will def take him for my other science class.

While he may talk incredibly fast this class was a pretty easy. He is very laid back and as long as you go to class it is an easy A. Having the book is helpful but you can get by without it if you are stretched for cash.

Frank is very laid back. Gives good reviews before test day. Tests aren't too difficult if you study a little bit. You should come to class because you do a lab just about every time (labs are pretty easy). Good way to tackle your science w/ lab gen ed. Would recommend!
Far too easy, but we did learn numerous field techniques we probibly would not have from the "other" hydrogeology instructor.

For an upper level class, I expected more substance. It's very easy and we normally don't stay in class the full length of time, which is nice if you don't care about your education. Takes a more practical approach to hydro, which is great, however.
Makes great powerpoints, a bit hard to follow when lecturing but always clears things up. The class was easy and fun. He could've spent less time on some topics, but everyone learned the information.

He is kind of hard to follow sometimes but this was such an easy class. He is very flexible, gives study guides, and is very leniant when grading tests. As long as you attend class, there is no way you won't pass, even if your grades aren't so good. If you have to take a science class, you definitely want this guy. He is extremely nice.
Awesome guy!! Made the class a lot of fun!! Easy for the most part! Definitely take his classes!!
Awesome and easy! Tests are easy! Requires some reading if you want to get an A on tests. It's definitely an easy B class if you show up.
Not always so clear when making a point, but he eventually gets there. Nice guy. Do your study guides and you'll get an easy A everytime. Take good notes.
funny guy.
Easy class, nice guy, likes to joke around. You can tell he knows what he's talking about but he seemed to have a hard time explaining things sometimes. Likes to draw pictures. Overall, good class.
Great teacher! He was very flexible and the class was pretty easy....funny guy, take him!

frank is a good, fair teacher the tests, quizzes, and homework are straight forward. He has compassion and will work hard to help you get through. He likes students to bring in articles for x-tra credit. take him for class
Easy class, but this guy is confusing. I stopped listening to him and skimmed through the book, and I did fine. He's funny, in a weird way.

Name: Chris Strobel
Comment: Strobel is very kind and caring, his lectures are engaging, and he is very happy to help students. Coursework is relatively easy if you take some notes. He gives constructive feedback on projects.

His lectures were entertaining and kept me engaged, but the tests were a lot harder than I anticipated. He gives great feedback on projects, and most of what I learned in his class, I learned by doing it, which is great. Would definitely recommend.

There are weekly quizzes over the chapters, but they aren't too difficult. Tests are mostly over what is talked about in lecture, so take notes because its mostly over what he says. Projects aren't too hard-just be creative and you'll do fine on those.

The professor demonstrates few examples for what is desired from assignments. He is unclear for what he expects and will pick apart responses. Professor Strobel rarely gives full credit for work and changes his requirements after each journal and discussion is posted. The course taken was 5 weeks long, this meant lots of work, less instruction.
Chris was very helpful in the class I took with him. He was also very involved and easy to get ahold of.

Chris is easily one of the best professors ive had when its comes to EMB. so much that I want to make it my minor now. him and the other professor who both teach in the lecture part of the class like to make it entertaining by showing movie clips and other videos in class. They are very good at breaking down scenes from a broadcasting POV

Chris is by far the best professor I've had at college so far!  He makes lecture and lab interesting and enjoyable.  Video feedback allows us to see what was right and what was wrong to allow us the opportunity to fix it on future projects.  Tests are pretty difficult but they are open book/notes and we get 90 minutes to work on them.

This class was a challenge. Chris knows his stuff but when it comes to using software like Final Cut or Priemere, he is not very helpful. He turned us loose on Priemere to edit our own footage but we barely knew how to work the program. Lectures are interesting but they expected us to know a lot of stuff on our own.

Strobel was a great professor. This class overall is quite a bit of work and you must put in the effort. Even the online exams were pretty difficult (even with being open book/notes)  But Strobel was always willing to help if you needed it and tried to explain everything clearly.

Very, very helpful. All about feedback and helping the student get as much out of his class as possible. The class is tough, but if you listen to what he has to say, by the end of the semester, you'll come out with a good grade and a head full of knowledge. He is extremely passionate about what he does and it shows through his awesome teaching.

Strobel is an awesome professor! He knows what he's taking about and he is very nice and helpful when it comes to assignments and expelling things you might not understand. Definitely recommend taking a class with him if you can!

EMB 140 Introduction to Media Aesthetics -  looking for an easy A go someplace else. Awesome professor, awesome person, great introductory class. My only complaint was that I took this as a three week summer class. you really need more time. if you're serious about media production, you must take this professor, and he must take this class.

Chris has great energy and is always willing to help, but I didn't receive what I expected from this class. However, there were too many assignments packed into the semester. Instead of being introduced to a variety of post-production programs, I would have preferred to be skilled on one specific software.

Chris is a great guy.  He's nice and really knows his stuff.  I thought he was a bit hard though.  Some things to me weren't clear and didn't make sense.  I do recommend him though, but he has a personality that you either like or don't like. Overall though 5/5.

GREAT PROFESSOR! Chris is amazing! the class I had wasn't very hard, there was limited reading involved. his lectures are great and he puts his powerpoints on blackboard. uses a lot of videos to teach. we used to take a black board quiz each week but now stopped. the mid-term was not hard at all.

This course was the decider on if I should stay with my major, and thanks to Chris's incredible teaching & course structure, I am glad to say I am pursuing my interest in television. He's very helpful, and the hands on activities are terrific in comparison to typical college lecture. More professors should be as passionate about learning as Chris.
Chris is a great teacher. I really enjoyed his classes. You have to work really hard for him, but he is laid back and will help you every chance he gets to.
Great proff, great person, knows it all, overall as good as it gets.
KNows his stuff. Really talented and easy to get along with. take him for everything you can.
Chris is awesome.

Name: Jessica Mandle
Comment: Extremely helpful, particularly for undecided majors in College of Business. Explains topics thoroughly, helpful, easy quizzes if you look over the powerpoints on Blackboard prior. Often gives points for attending and gives extra credit.
Jessica is a very good teacher, she gives you so many chances to get a high grade. And always show up for class you never know  when she will handout free extra credit.
Very helpful with understanding all the business majors. Gives points each day so make sure you go and gives extra credit alot.

Name: Anthony Burk
Comment: There are a lot of homework assignments but they are easy and have detailed instructions. You also get multiple chances to do most assignments for full credit. Attendance is mandatory but he offers lab days every week that are optional to attend. Lectures can be boring but overall his class is easy if you do the homework.

Professor Burk is great. He posts all of his MANY fairly easy assignments so you can get ahead, and, if you have a grade high enough, you can be excused from the final. I finished the course two weeks ahead. However, his lectures are redundant and he can be a little abrasive when giving help. Take the course with him because you'll pass 100%.
He's a nice professor but you will need to complete the assignments on time, it takes hours to do but once you figure things out you get "A" and don't have to give the finals.
Very easy class. Class is optional as he just goes over how to do the homework you're assigned

Class is not mandatory and you don't learn anything from the lectures. Overall, he's a good person and the class is easy, it consists of online assignments. You don't learn anything from this course if you already know how to use Office2019.

Great and funny professor, Fridays are lab optional days where he helps people with questions. You have to pay for simnet and connect and all the assignments are on their, you can work ahead and attending class is optional. Their is a good amount of assignments every week but if don't wait till Sunday to do them then they aren't too bad.
He can be relatable, he is hilarious, and willing to help you if you have a question. If you can, take his class.

All assignments are online. Attending class is not worth it since he only talks about how to do the homework which is easy. I stopped attending class after the first few weeks and still got an easy A. Just a lot of busy work.

Lectures were pointless because he didnt teach anything. Easy to get an A, its all online and if you wanted you could get all the assignments done in the first couple weeks. I wouldnt take again, just because it was boring, but it was also the easiest class Ive ever taken so I liked that. Hes nice, just repeats everything he says.
Professor Burk was my least favorite professor I had this year. Definitely would recommend taking a different professor for this course.

Tony was so chill. He allows us to finish the class at our own pace, so I was able to finish over a month early. If you need help, you can contact him and he will respond with useful tips really fast. Overall my favorite class this semester and professor as well.

One of the easiest and most boring class I've had. Just do your work and show up and you'll get an A. The whole class is learning how to use Powerpoint, Word, etc. Stuff that students already know how to do. You can do assignments over again to get a higher grade. Lots of extra credit. Super boring lectures. He says okay like 50 times a class.

Professor Burk was okay not the best not the worst but def will make sure Im not gonna have him again. He talks so much and jumps all over the place not only topic wise but homework wise. He gives so much homework its like he thinks the only things in our lives to do is homework.

Professor Burk is an interesting guy. Be prepared to hear the word Okay more often than not. Other than that I could tell he is passionate about teaching the material and cares about the success of his students. Theres a lot of assignments, just dont get behind and youll do fine. Take advantage of extra credit opportunities to avoid the final.

Tony is a hilarious professor. There was a never a sad day in his classroom. There is a lot of extra credit in this class, which isn't needed because the class is extremely easy if you've ever used a computer before. There is a good bit of homework that takes a while to complete because the software is very sensitive, but it's not awful.

If you put in the effort you will have no problem getting an A. Professor Burk gives many extra credit opportunities and allows corrections on almost every assignment. The actual class seems repetitive, especially since he goes over the assignments after they are due. Overall I would recommend Professor Burk to anyone taking BIS 101.

Burk is a good guy. He's quirky, which is great for keeping students focused on the material. My only issue with him is how often he says "okay." In the first two classes alone, Burk said "okay" a total of 1,407 times. "Okay? okay. Okay SO, ok today class..." If you're not easily bothered like me, youll be ok.

Look. I never got this many extra credit in my life. Didnt have to take the final and still had an A. If you fail, you did it to yourself. Most exams are online and open book so its extremely easy to get an A. Make sure to do all the excel/access work online on MYITlab. You can resumbit until you get a 100%, takes time but its a very doable A.

I didn't show up to many of his classes, at the beginning of the semester he said that attendance is a grade. I'm pretty sure he only said that so people would show up. all of his test are online and the answers are within Quizlet. He will also let you retake a test or assignment if you have an excuse what so ever.
Easy a just go to class do the work he accepts late work

Name: Donald Knochelmann
Comment: He has worked construction for decades, but he's not a hard ass and really cares about teaching. He is part time so you're lucky if you get him because he really is able to focus on his few classes. It is worth it for the occasional "I will be 15 minutes late today because of my other job" to have someone who gives real world examples. 6/5

Professor Knochelmann's class is very easy to pass. It is basically just a lecture, then you answer all of your assignments right off of the slides. He is impossible to get ahold of outside of class and never responds to emails. He will also just drop off of communications for long periods of time with the whole class.

Name: Gary De Jesus
Comment: Awesome professor! Really tells you how things are and what the real world is going to be like. There is no sugar coating with him, which is what was so awesome about taking his classes! I learned more about Marketing in 2 class secessions with him than I did throughout my 4 year bachelors degree!
Gary's class is hot, just like him. But in all seriousness, I learned more in this class than any other I've enrolled in at NKU.

Name: Sara Drabik
Comment: Best EMB professor

Professor Drabik was great! The class I took was a 1 credit class where we just watched movies, wrote a paper on them, and then discussed them in class. She gave everyone extra opportunities to catch up on movies if we missed the 10 required. She is very knowledgeable and really cares about her students.
She will give out many papers to read and write a lot. I wrote 20 pages every week. She is the worst professor out there. I highly recommend students to stay away from her.

105 questions on the tests, 79 multuple questions,20 true and false and 6 essay questions. She grades based on ceitian stuff, I highly recommend her for those who are willing to get a C and do to much work for only C. The worst proffesior of all time, wish I knew before I paid for her class. she is a proffesor who stress students out alot everyday
I think that she is the worst professor ever. Graded on certain things and the test is 105 questions. I dont recommend her at all
She is nice and approachable and explains things well if you ask questions

Awesome professor and I would recommend taking this course. The content was very interesting and the assignments for the entire course were laid out so that it was easy to keep up with the online class. She gives almost instant feedback on discussion posts and helped me a lot with my final paper.
easy class with a lot of work. every class you have something to do also 10 pop quizzes worth 10 point each.

I really cannot say enough positive things about Sara. Very funny, Very intelligent, up front about assignments, detailed feedback on assignments, aesthetically pleasing, appreciates humor, great insight, and just an all around cool chick. I wish she taught all my classes because she genuinely wants you to do well and gives you the tools to do so.

Had her for a projects class. We were supposed to put on a children's show for an outside outfit, but they imploded, leaving us free to create and shoot our own sketch/improv show. Drabik is phenomenal, very cool, very helpful, laid back but authoritative when necessary. One of the best EMB experiences I ever had.
She is an amazing teacher.  She tells you exactly what to expect from her.  She's easy going.  Gives you a study guide for the material that will be on your exams.Offers extra credit.
One of the best EMB teachers at NKU. I cannot wait to take another class she offers. She is very helpful and willing to clarify when asked.

Name: Tamuchin McCreless
Comment: Even though, he left NKU he was a really good professor. He kept the classroom alive and made everything interesting.

Dr. McCreless was awesome! His lectures were clear and easy to follow and his idea to record lectures online as well was really helpful. He emails back very quickly and always with useful information. His class was also very fun to be a part of and we even had a pizza party while we took our finals! Great teacher, would take again if I could.

Class was a combination of video lectures and reading.  Lectures got down to the nitty gritty- pay attention to the Power Point content!  Lots of memorization but well worth it.  Lots of reading- book and current events.  Weekly quizzes and assignments. One big paper. Prof was very accessible for issues, questions and before exams.

Name: Jason Mossman
Comment: As the other review said, if you are a female student please keep your head down and do the work and come to class. I took this class 2 years ago and still remember how inappropriate Jason is. Often making the female students, including myself, uncomfortable in his class.

He paired us for groups and fought with me when I said I needed a new group. My reasoning was when my group members heard me speak positively of a professor they started screaming to the entire library of students that I wanted to F*uck my professor. After this I told him exactly what happened and he refused for a whole week to change my group.

Although kind of an oddball, Prof. Mossman got the job done and taught the stuff well. I was in his EMB-110 course. Attended all the classes. 3 things: pop quizzes over chapters WILL happen, make sure you know APA format, and make sure you aren't late for the exam. Straight up watched him send two people out. I would take it again.

Awesome class, Jason is the best. As long as you show up and participate you'll do fine, just make sure you complete the assignments on Canvas. He takes attendance very seriously so don't skip and be late a lot. A few surprise quizzes but he is understanding and teaches this class in a very entertaining way.

In the beginning of the year, I really enjoyed Jason. I thought he was a good professor and very approachable. My only note is that in the first half of the semester we were assigned 2 MAYBE 3 speeches/papers, but in the second half we were overwhelmed by around 6 or 7 big things, having to give a speech every week the last 5 weeks of class.

I really enjoyed Jason!! He was an engaging lecturer, and I recommend him to everyone I talk to. As long as you put in some effort it's an easy class. Make sure to buy the textbook and do the reading. Also his syllabus is kind of misleading. He seems really harsh in it, but he's actually super chill.

Jason's awesome. I had him my first semester of my freshman year (for two classes, in fact) and would recommend him to anyone. He's an engaging professor, and clearly cares about students outside of just class. As long as you put some effort into this class, it's an easy A. I personally didn't use the online textbook, but the workbook is a must.
Make sure to practice your speeches and youll be fine. If you struggle, make sure to reach out and ask for help.
Easy class. Just show up and keep your head down or else hes wildly inappropriate.

I loved Professor Mossman. He was funny, helpful, and an overall a very nice guy. Make sure to do the readings when he tells you to, and do your assignments. There is a 24 hour media fast and group project that are most of the grade, but if you try your best, it's not hard to get an A. Definitely would take again.

Professor Mossman is fun and a great professor. Class consists of group discussions and occasional quizzes. The material covered is beneficial outside of the classroom, so I would definitely recommend for an easy A.
Most of the assignment in this class were speeches, this class was a lot of fun and easy if you practice and prepared well, he rewarded you

I enjoyed his class. The class was discussion based around the textbook. There were a couple pop quizes that were incredibly easy if you read, but hard to bs if you didn't. He made lectures enjoyable and very little home other than reading a chapter each week and three ish other assignments. Overall good choice.

Mossman is a great discussion leader and this class is discussion based so that matters, however, he won't force anyone to talk so unless you want awkward silence for 50 minutes, speak up! You MUST read though!!! HE WILL QUIZ YOU and those may make or break your grade. Great in class discussions! Would take a class with him again!

Jason gives a lot of quizzes over the chapters, so make sure you read before coming to class. He is easy to reach outside of class and answers any questions you might have, so it is always clear what is expected of you.
Love

Jason is by far my favorite professor I've had so far. He makes the content enjoyable and easy to understand and remember. He makes the dreaded speech class setting a more comfortable and fun environment and makes each student feel welcome and at ease. If there was something I struggled with or needed a bit more, he was never hesitant to help.

I was initially excited to dig into the content in this course when we first began, however we barely used the (very informational) text and instead had a lot of discussion, which was sometimes decent but for the most part lacking direction. Mossman is a good guy but his students could benefit from clearer expectations and utilizing the text.
Difficult, "discussion based" but we have a quiz almost every week and are supposed to read the week before we talk about it.

Jason really wants his class to be discussion based but fails to do so, especially when hes getting mad at students for not knowing material when he hasnt elaborated. He attempted to fail his entire class because he thought they werent reading. He gave us an easy quiz but it was on something due the next week, so everyone turned in a blank paper

Name: Nancy Dick
Comment: THE BEST TEACHER EVER!!!!!
Very easy class. Such a nice teacher. Just show up and do the assignments and you will get an easy A!! Take her!
I loved Mrs. Dick. She was the best teacher I had in my first semester of college. Extremely helpful.
very helpful teacher
Very helpful yet, Easy class.

Name: Michael Washington
Comment: Take advantage of the extra credit! Although, the tests are pretty easy, lots of essays are required. The grading for the essays is a bit difficult. I did most of the extra credit word and was able to boost my grade a great deal.

It is very hard to reach him, if you have a question about an assignment email over a week in advance. I usually don't struggle with essay assignments but his felt impossible. The directions don't make sense and he doesn't make it much clearer after you ask him. His lectures are a blank screen of blackboard where he reads from the book for a while

His class is really dependent on watching the lectures OR reading the textbooks (his lectures are just him reading the book). I had a hard time figuring out what to do for the essay assignments because the instructions aren't clear. The essay assignments are AWFUL and they took me hours even though I'm generally a fast-paced worker. Not good :(

Dr. Washington encourages class discussion. He is somewhat lecture heavy, but his lectures are very intriguing and based on documented historical evidence.  He guides discussion to encourage independent thought and conclusions. This man is passionate about what he teaches and his methods show it.

He is so nice and laid back. He actually cares what he is talking about and wants students to be just as engaged with him. If you read the textbook and do the study guides, you should pass fairly easy.
he does not take his time going through any work or task he gives to the class.

Okay, so if you want an easy class this isn't it. THIS COURSE IS SO IMPORTANT! Also its very interesting! Dr. Washington is compassionate and easy to listen to, laid back and will engage the class. Fill the provided study guides in as he lectures and you have easy extra credit, he offers lots of EC for watching movies outside. Its time intensive.

He's a good teacher and you learn a lot if you pay attention. The class is lecture heavy and he gives you readings(they are free) which you may have to use to fill out your notes. The grading mostly relies on quizzes and 2 exams but he provides so much easy extra credit you'll more than likely have a good grade if you do them. Definitely recommend!

I had to take this class for an elective and thought it would be interesting. Hes a pretty tough grader and wants everything to be exact to his expectations. He does give extra credit though but even those assignments take awhile. He really makes you work for it. Wouldnt take it again or recommend.

His class is not the most difficult because he does have extra credit every week but the wording for his tests is ridiculous. He makes things more difficult for no reason. Try another history teacher if you have to take it.
Dr. Washington is the most intelligent and passionate professor I have ever had. I highly recommend taking all of his courses. He is a true inspiration and I learned so much by taking his courses.

If you are coming to University to learn and history interests you in the least I highly recommend Dr. Washington. He is incredibly intelligent and I truly enjoyed his lectures. He offers extra credit if you're willing to work you will pass with a good grade.

If you do the extra credit and study minimally for the exams, you will perform well. The exams are only worth 10 pts, so it's important that one does the extra credit to get ahead. I recommend taking this course for an easy A. This course is biased, however, and rewrites history in favor of Democrats.

I liked the Professor, material, and his lectures were fine, but you have to write a excruciatingly long paper for the vocab of each test, one test there were like 140 vocab terms, and my paper was roughly 3500 words, only for 10 points. I did great because I love history, but if you dont, this isnt the class for you.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!! Every chapter you have to write an incredibly long essay with (am i'm not exaggerating) 75 vocab words that's only worth 10 points! And then a 10 question quiz over a few of those vocab words His lectures are incredibly long and boring and hard to follow. This class was a nightmare

The textbook is hard to understand, is random, and is opinion oriented. Only selective parts of history are covered in this class thus manipulating the facts. The class should not be a forum. For the professors viewpoints.

The textbook was edited by the professor and rather than being a factual course, it is based upon opinion . The class covers material from Darwinism African colonization, US history to African sociology and psychology. The book is difficult to read and jumps all over the place. There are prejudicial opinions in the book. Surprised Nku allows it

Dr. Washington has become one of my favorite professors. He is passionate about what he teaches, he has a good sense of humor, and he gives a lot of extra credit. The work was mostly tests and essays that revolved around vocabulary words from the textbook. The essays could get a little lengthy but he did not grade them very tough. I recommend him.

This guy is straight crazy, but the class is one of the easiest I've been in at NKU. He gives a ton of extra credit & you could just about fail every test and still pass with a B. He is a little skewed when it comes to republican vs democratic views in history, but if you do the research, you can compare truth from opinion.
I loved being in his class. He give a unique perspective on historical events. Washington is a really nice guy and makes the class fun. Take notes and do the assignments and you'll pass.

Name: Richard Fox
Comment: He is by far the worst professor I have ever took. what he teaches is nothing like the HW and exams he gives. He basically teaches 5th grade math and gives you college math for homework and exams on top of all that he doesn't give you enough time on exams and his reasoning is because the  exams are open note. extremely strict on grading.

This class is very tough. Definitely the hardest I've taken so far. However, I think Dr. Fox explains things very well and in depth, and is always willing to answer questions. He responds very quickly to questions whether it is through email or a zoom meeting. He does grade pretty tough but after a couple assignments it becomes clear what he wants

The CSC 362 class is a very difficult class that is unlike anything else I have taken in the Computer Science track, focusing on the very base of computer software and hardware. HE does not seem to know how to use Canvas correctly, requires homework to be sent into him by email, and posts all grades out of 0 points.

I took his Computer Systems class and while I struggled a bit in the latter part of the semester, he really cares about his students that want to do well and pass. His tests are fairly long, but they are very doable, assuming you put in the time to study. He explains things very well and is always willing to meet with you, should you need help.

Dr. Fox was an incredible professor. He is very smart and is very good at teaching the class material. The class is a little cramped but he still got through everything without having to skip over anything too much. He genuinely cares about the success of his students. He is a hard grader, but a fair one.

I took this class specifically so that I could have him as a professor again. His classes are incredibly challenging but there is no chance of you finishing the course not understanding the course material as long as you worked on the homework. Generally a fair grader and is always willing to help you with any topic you don't understand.
Fantastic professor! He really cares about his students and does his best to make sure everyone understands the course material.
He really cares about his students and will always be there to give detailed explanations to any question you have. Would definitely retake him.

Dr. Fox is a genius. This class wasn't too bad, but programming in old languages was a bit of a struggle because of how few resources there are out there. There are quite a few assignments but no tests. The final was essentially just asking us what we thought of the class. It's a fun elective if you have room for it.

Dr. Fox is a superb professor. He knows what he's talking about and is able to answer basically any question. If he doesn't know then he says that rather than making up some answer. The class was incredibly difficult though. He taught it well, but there is a TON of material in it so nothing gets particularly focused on.

Dr. Fox is a very good instructor; he explains things very well, is very knowledgeable, and advocates your success. I was a little bit put off by how hard his tests are and how hard he sometimes grades things, but he is otherwise a very good instructor. From my experience in Fall 2016, he didn't enforce attendance, but he strongly encouraged it.

Dr. Fox is a very excellent professor. If you miss more than one or two classes, you'll definitely be struggling, unless you're already an expert at this stuff. I feel like he really tried to make his office hours clear and open. Anytime I asked for help, he lead me down the right path. Don't be afraid of CSC 362. Fox is there to help.
Test are super hard, our class average for the fist one was in the 50's. However, there is an endless amount of extra credit you can earn on the dis. boards. Labs can be long and boring.

This is a tough class because of all the information that needs to be covered.  Dr Fox offered plenty off extra credit with the discussion boards so make sure to do all  of them. The tests are extremely tough because the are over 5 chapters each. Very knowledgeable, he wrote the text book. Great Professor!

This class was extremely tough, but not because he is a bad teacher. The reason this course is difficult is because there is such an unbelievable amount of material to cover, at no fault of the professor. Dr. Richard Fox is unarguably the best teacher I have ever had.  I learned more in this class than in the entirety of high school.

VERY knowledgeable and good at teaching. Quizzes are online, timed, and open book, but they are difficult. Suggest studying before hand and marking pages for quick reference. LOTS of extra credit opportunities. Not an easy course, some effort is required, but overall it is not terrible. So keep that in mind.

Very laid back but genius professor. He even wrote the required textbook. Lectures do leave a lot to be desired. Very hard quizzes/final, very easy labs. Offers tons of extra credit.  You will pass his class if you try.  However, he fails to make the subject interesting. Cant say I recommend him but there are much worse professors at NKU.

Dr. Fox is a very good professor. He will go out of his way to help you succeed in his class. In this class, quizzes are very difficult, but he gives numerous opportunities for extra credit. I got over 100 points extra credit just by doing discussion board posts. I never scored higher than an 80% on any quiz all semester and got a B+ in the class.

Dr. Fox is one of the best professors in the computer science department. He's able to effectively explain complicated material which would stump a lot of other professors. If you're taking CSC 362 prepare to take a pretty hard class. The material itself isn't too hard to grasp but there's a lot of material that needs to be covered for the course.

Except about 10 hours of homework a week outside of class. One assignment took about 20 hours.   Exams are very long, but he only allots 75 minutes to take them.  They usually have 30 questions, a third of which require you to write time consuming scripts.  Not lax on grading, but very forgiving of his own mistakes while explaining material.

Name: Beth Wells
Comment: Great Teacher! She gives out homework and you have a take home quiz every class, but they are simple to do.   If you study the review she gives you then you will get an A.  She doesn't try to trick you.

Beth is the best math teacher that I have ever had, Hands Down.. Very clear and very helpful, go to her office whenever you can't figure something out and she will walk you right through it until you get it. Definately take her for a math class.

Awesome teacher! Failed this class the first time with a different teacher, got an A when I took it with her! Very helpful, and explains everything very well! Homework every night (not much though). It is hard to get anything less than a B in this class!

Intro/Prob. Excellent teacher. She needs to write her own book! Very interested in seeing students do well.  Will do whatever it takes to assist.  Let's you use some notes on tests; they relate to what she teaches. Very fair and fun-loving. Pleasure to take her class and would do so again.  Recommend her to anyone, esp. if you have trouble w/math.

She is really helpful, puts notes online, is really good about letting you make-up things, really straightforward about what will be on tests, drops a couple of quiz grades, not too much work outside of class.

Name: Roxanne Kent-drury
Comment: communication is horrible. The way this class is set up is very confusing. There are zero due dates on any of the assignments but it is still expected that certain assignments are due at certain times. Email responses are short and rude, easy class but is really frustrating to figure out. No grades are put in until the very end of the semester.

she is horrible with outside communication if you have a question about an assignment or if you have questions about grading. She also doesn't grade things until the last minute unless it is a quiz and it's an automatic grade. overall, she is just a horrible communicator and I've had her twice and she just wasn't good in either classes.

This course just ended and we do not have a single grade in at all. We've done about 10 discussion posts (one was an introduce yourself to the class one) and 2 essays. Nothing is super hard or anything, but it would be nice to have a grade in the class instead of an N/A.
honestly one of the most boring classes I've taken, but she's a solid professor and its an easy A

Roxanne was really an awesome professor. I took that class because I needed my last gen. ed. requirement filled and I'm so glad I did take it. She took a boring subject like Jane Austen and made it super interesting. It's a Lit and Film class so all we did was watch Jane Austen movies and read the novels along with it. Only 3 major papers, no tests

Go to class and do the work. professor is kind and honestly the sweetest thing this side of the river. I would honestly take this class again if I could. Grades are given back a little late but she's a fair grader and is just a real gem overall.

Her online class was extremely easy. You just did weekly discussion posts and the expectations she holds you to are always clear. She's lenient on late work if it's a day or two late; she just wants you to turn it in and get credit for it. The only annoying thing was that she sucked at grading on time. I rarely knew my grade throughout the semester

Dr. Kent-Drury is very knowledgeable in subject matter. I took her for Western World Literature 1. I enjoyed her class. The only issue was she cancelled class quite a few times but overall she's great. I would recommend taking her again. We ended up taking our midterm two weeks before finals due to the class cancellations.

She is easily one of my favorite professors. Yes, she is a bit frazzled at times, and the feedback she provides isn't always useful, but she is incredibly kind and passionate about poetry. Her classes are very student/discussion-driven, but I enjoyed that. I have gotten an A in every class I've taken with her.

Assignments graded too late in term (giving no idea how we were doing). No useful feedback on writing assignments. What little there was, was not constructive-- lots of "good" comments, did not catch things that classmates did pick up. I suspect she graded everything an "A." I learned nothing. More talking about writing than writing itself.

This is very much a class where you get out of it what you put into it. If you're willing to participate and put active effort in, it'll be an enjoyable and effective experience. There's a lot of printing and lot of workshopping/discussion.
Good professor, not the most interesting course. Course was not clear-cut and some things (assignments/dates/etc) were confusing

I enjoyed the work in this class but was very disappointed at this prof's lack of communication and interaction online. It's a creative writing class and I got zero feedback on my work from her. And the class has less than a week left now and there's still not a single grade posted... so I have no idea what I have in this class.

I enjoyed Creative Writing Online very much. My only problem was that she did not post feedback or blackboard grades the entire semester, so I was left wondering how I was doing until the very end. She expects classmates to give feedback and critique each other, but I still spent a great deal of time concerned about my grade.

Roxanne is a wonderful professor. I had her for Literature and Film and she was very helpful and kind. Come to class, sit back, relax, and enjoy some Jane Austen. Her class is very laid back, however you will have to complete hand outs and three papers. I completed all the papers within an hour. Not too bad at all. Handouts aren't bad, either.

She's very helpful, but you have to ask for it.  She told us class was canceled for the entire end of the semester, saying "we have all of the tools."  Just write your papers, and do well and you'll do fine.

I didn't mind her. She wasn't a bad teacher, but we didn't have class more often than we did. She cancelled class all the time. So if you like that, take her! Our only grades were 4 papers, and they were easy. OH! And she doesn't require any textbooks!
Great teacher,very patient, intelligent, organized, and willing to help students learn. Those who complain about her, clearly did not complete their assignments.

Though attendance may not count for a grade, it really helps to come to class. The midterms and final are take-home and we go over everything she has us read. She tries to make everything as interesting as she can by putting humor into it. If you have the opportunity, take her.
She is intelligent, helpful, and very dedicated to teaching. Loved this class!

Name: Robert Thacker
Comment: I wish he would teach more classes, he's hilarious and has a great way of explaining things. He's always more than willing to help. Subject matter seems a bit overwhelming at first but he has a review before each test that really helps. He also drops the worst exam grade and offers extra credit. As long as you study it would be hard to fail.

Dr. Thacker is great. He does everything in his power to make you succeed.  No mind games.  He drops your lowest exam grade, gives you fill in the blank note pages for every chapter, has a review before every exam, offers lots of extra credit and he's hilarious.  He is more than a fair professor.  Take him for both lecture and lab!
THE BEST BIOLOGY PROFESSOR. I highly recommend taking him your first year in biology. Notes on blackboard, uses fill in notes, and he's so funny. TAKE HIM!

Dr. Thacker was awesome. He would say and do the strangest things if it meant the students would enjoy class and understand the material more. The tests are also extremely easy as long as you follow his notes. He puts them on Blackboard after lectures so you can get whatever you miss, too. I'm going to miss him, a lot.

He is hilarious. He really cares about students being interested in the material and he will make you laugh to keep your attention. He's also very helpful if you struggle with the  work, though you probably won't. It's an easy class and if you're struggling he's willing to help. Lecture attendance was not mandatory but I'd still recommend it.
If you struggle with Biology, this is the professor to have.  He truly cares if his students pass his class.  He gives ample opportunities for extra credit.  He is a wonderful teacher!!!

He is very funny and keeps class enjoyable.  He is very througouh with notes and uses powerpoint's to use as a study guide.  Lecture is not mandatory but Lab is and is probably the most difficult part of the whole class.

Very funny guy.  I would totally suggest taking him if you're not that into biology.  If you are, though, take someone else.  He's fun, but he caters to those who are simply there because they have.  This class was a pretty easy A, but if you remember anything from your high school science classes you'll probably be bored to tears.

He is an extremely nice guy and will give out a lot of extra credit to the class but it is a department ran class and it is a lot harder than I would have expected a 100 level class to be. However he does make sure you have the information needed to do well on the final ( the final developed by the department and is over all course material)
Excellent teacher! He is very helpful, and gives a lot of extra credit opportunities.

Name: Blaise Weller
Comment: Writing assignments are vague. He wants you to be specific yet gives you little to no instruction. Asks for your opinion on things and then tells you your opinion is wrong. Wastes a lot of time. Hardly any graded assignments.
Please dont take him. Hes very manipulative, knows it too.

He is the worst professor Ive ever taken at NKU. The most irrogant and cocky person ever and wasted our class time talking about himself and his movie if you can call it that. Biggest waste of time, spent half of the semester watching pointless movies with zero tie to writing. Do not take this class if you are actually interested in learning.
Do the readings show up and participate and you will do fine. He is awesome at helping you unleash your writing potential.
Very helpful . you will actually learn in his class. understanding and can be flexible. you will have to show effort.
I took him online, and he literally did nothing. Our final paper was our only assignment worth a significant number of points.  And I've never had a professor who wrote such incoherent emails.

I took Weller for my first ever online class, and he made everything so easy. At first everything seemed hard, but he took the time if you needed it to explain things to you and work with you. He's very understanding if you need extensions, and all of his assignments build toward the final paper. 100/10 would definitely take again and recommend

I can not express how much I loved him! He went above and beyond what I had expected. At first he was intimidating, but he is a great guy. He was always open to questions and was willing to meet outside of class. I wish he was teaching more creative writing classes! I never saw myself as a writer until I took him. I highly recommend his class.

Professor Weller has a unique and interesting way of entertaining his class, there was never a dull moment this semester. The assignments are challenging in a way that makes you a better writer. Overall, Professor Weller is an understanding, awesome, down-to-earth guy. I'd definitely take another class with him.

He is a very good professor and down the earth person. Will highly recommend for any English class he teaches. He will read to class openly from textbook and values class opinion. He will work with anyone just have to talk to him. Assignments run late sometime but he will make time  to go over your work if you need him to right away.

Hands down, the best professor I have ever had for English in my entire life. He was amazing. He made writing fun, and let us be free in what we chose to write, which I found very helpful. He's funny and sarcastic, also a plus. We also watched awesome movies and KING OF THE HILL in that class. LOVE HIM
Would definitely recommend. He is sarcastic which I liked. His assignments can be confusing, but he clears it up if you ask him. Very helpful. Listen to him and do what he says and it will be an A.

Prof Weller is a difficult instructor. He was condescending and arrogant at times. This class was supposed to be on writing, but the special topic “Violence in Movies” took over the class. I learned more about movies than I did about writing a paper. I was frustrated throughout the entire semester and couldn't wait for it to be over.
Very knowledgeable.  Sarcastic humor that I loved.

This guy made a big impression on me. I never knew I had a talent for writing until I had his class. I learned a lot from him and he still sits in my head and encourages me to write, even though I am now in the military, i still have that spark. thanks Weller.

I would definitely recommend this class. I found Weller to be very helpful, and the class to be rather enjoyable. The atmosphere of the class is very laid back. If anything is ever unclear he is more than willing to explain. You need to be sure to do all the assignments and show up to class. If you do all that you will be sure to get a good grade.
He is the most bad teacher I have ever seen. He does not give feed back to know what should you do. stay away from this kind of teachers to keep your GPA good.

i attended class every time on time. missed ONE class whole semester. raised my hand everyday, very active in class. i could turned in all homework and this man still failed me. talked to him numerous times. does not explain homework well and gets mad when you ask him a question about the homework needless to say, i DISLIKE him. don't waste your $

I absolutely loved Blaise'e course.English has always been my strongest & favorite subject,and he gave me more reason to love it.This class stretched me as a writer,I learned so much,and looked forward to class everyday.Writing topics aren't easy,but will make you think.Hes a hard grader,but it will force you to WORK on your writing skills.LOVE HIM
didnt know the class would be a "nature" writing class- but it ended up being pretty cool. good teacher - learned a lot which is why I am in school.

Name: Malcom Henderson
Comment: Professor Henderson was awesome! This was his first class he's ever had and he did great. All information are on power-points, if you miss the class just get on Blackboard. He'll post them. He has "reflection papers" scattered through the semester, you have to be in class that day to receive credit. Said book was mandatory, but it's not! EASY A!

Name: Kimberly Schave
Comment: Very easy class. Very nice and understanding professor. Class can be boring sometimes. You could probably pass without coming. It's a good fly by course.

Name: Peter Padolik
Comment: Dr. Padolik was a great Chemistry professor. His enthusiasm and excitement made the class fun while we were still hardcore learning. His taught very well and it is currently paying off in my CHE 120/120L class.

Name: Lynda Mercer
Comment: She's a great person. Very helpful. Warning of a lot of writing work/papers. If the load was less I would give her a 10!   ; )

She is helpful and kind. I am a returning student but she made my return to college much better than expected. I sometimes got emails back from her only a few minutes after I sent my question. I recommend her very much if you need a more understanding type of teacher who is more helpful than usual.

Name: Erin Hackmann
Comment: This was a block class where the professor lectured for nearly three hours straight. I personally found the content and professor interesting, but 3 hours straight of anything can get exhausting, which is why attendance was typically less then a quarter of the class. Pay attention, and youll do fine, even with little studying. Take good notes!

History has always been my worst subject but I enjoyed the class a lot! The book is optional, but she recommends it. I didn't use it and got an A-. Just pay attention in class, she gives lots of study guides and they're basically verbatim for the tests. Quizzes also have some of the same questions!

Name: Matt Gregory
Comment: Matt is a great professor, although he teaches stats he makes the class as interactive as possible. Plus he really cares about your grades because he knows it reflects him. Stay on top of your homework because the quizzes are just like the homework and the test are just like the quizzes. I was failing at midterm and he helped me get my grade to a B
Matt is a really good professor, you can tell that he really cares about his students.

Name: Andrew Miller
Comment: Pretty open-minded professor. He did not give a single lecture so I can't judge his teaching ability. Had to write a 12-page paper, for which he provided no guidelines other than "it has to be about a superhero." Then graded it super harshly w/ expectations that were never articulated. You have to be a mind reader, or ask LOTS of questions.
Not clear on deadlines, students do not all have same opportunities, class was canceled several times and substituted online (I took in class for a reason.) would not recommend with him.

Andy is a great professor. You need to be an active participant in class though or else he feels less willing to help you (understandably). There's a ton of reading and writing but that that just comes with this class. He seemed more stressed and tired this semester, which he hasn't seemed before. But still a great professor and makes learning fun!

He was a really great professor.  I had him 2 times in one semester and I feel very lucky. He always explains everything very well to the class - in Greek/Roman Mythology we watched a lot of videos which really brought the class to life.  He also brought food pertaining to each lesson. I will take him again if I can get the opportunity to do so.

Awesome professor. Very clear about assignments & very fun in class.  Explains things well, informative and understanding of issues that may come up.  Willing to work with his students - I will take him again if I get the chance.  VERY laid back and chill.

Mr Miller is an easy professor IF you do your reading and show up to class. It's a LOT of reading, but we covered tons of material in one semester. I missed class once, but kept up with the reading and was fine. I tried to take another of his classes this semester, but couldn't fit it in my schedule.
Dude obviously knows his stuff and how to teach it... Greek & Roman mythology was mostly just memorization + lots of reading.  Good/informative class!

I don't see the point of the bad reviews. This man knows his stuff and he is passionate about it. Although a lot of the class is memorization, its not very hard. 2 Papers and 2 Tests but there are a lot of 5 points quizzes that can put you behind if you miss class. Overall Great guy and very understanding

Took his superhero honors course. Had to write 12 page paper and do some creative projects. No tests, we read five graphic novels that were interesting and watched a lot of clips/movies. He grades the essays pretty harshly, but overall it is a good and interesting class.
Fun class! Very engaging professor. Not planning on being a professional writer, but will use a lot of his ideas in my classroom as a future English teacher myself.
This is an excellent, engaging course. As a bonus, Miller is funny and easy on the eyes.

Take Poetry Writing with him! It's a great & easy class. You'll learn a lot from the workshops. Very laid back class, but that could've been because it was a night class. Still, really enjoyable class!

Myth and Magic sounded like an interesting class. Although, he is rude and not clear on his assignments.  Be prepared to read a novel a week.  In all honesty, he was a jerk and I will never take one of his classes ever again.
Myth and Magic is a really interesting and fun class. It has a discussion base and requires a good bit of reading and writing. If you keep up with your work, it's an easy course.

A sincere and knowledgable instructor. Helpful w/ constructive comments, willing to answer questions. Willing to meet outside of class for help. The student to whom Miller refused to summarize a 3-hour lecture? Had already missed three 3-hour class periods for a total of 12 missed hours, at that point! Come to class, participate; an easy A.

He is okay unless you are a freshman!!!!  I missed a class one day because of my car; and I e-mailed him and asked him about class and he said I can't detail a 3 hour class in an e-mail, that is why you are supposed to get classmates e-mails.  What is that?!?!

I took this class without having any idea about creative writing. I learned a lot from this professor. Knows so much about publishing and his assignments are easy to do. If you are interested in creative writing you MUST take Andrew Miller.

Very good teacher.  He's weird, but he's very open minded and encourages free thought and creative, innovative ideas.  He can be critical of writing, but not overly so.  He's a wonderful professor, recommended for all creative and free thinkers.

Incredibly open minded professor.  His major area is creative writing and fantasy literature, so he gives a lot of room to come up with original ideas for papers.  Very helpful and intelligent, invokes thought in students.  Highly recommended.
It helps to be a Sci/Fi fan when taking his classes; a somewhat accomplished writer--not highly impressive credentials, but a fantastic teacher for beginning writers.

Name: Elizabeth Harris
Comment: Elizabeth is consistently in a bad mood, which she usually projects onto her students and her work. She is also very unsympathetic to legitimate absences like hospital visits or illness, and will dock your grade for them (I earned an A but got a B because of absences due to my chronic illness). Take any other teacher if you can.

If there were a definition of "fabulous teacher" in the dictionary, you would see Elizabeth's face next to it. She truly is an amazing teacher and you learn so much about acting and yourself during this class. She always has hilarious stories to tell and she treats you as an adult which I find very important. Overall: Take her. She rocks.

She's been my favorite professor so far. She is HILARIOUS, and makes class so much fun. The one test you take is so stupidly easy and the scenes you perform are fun and simple as long as you listen to her. I got 110 extra credit pts from her too just by seeing 2 plays. This class is WAY better than public speaking, TRUST ME.
Elizabeth is both a wonderful person and professor. Her class is super fun and easy as long as you show up and are willing to do the work! Very personable and easy to understand. Great teacher.

She is a great professor I loved coming to her class because she made everyone feel welcome, very interpersonal person and outgoing, monologues seem nerve racking but she will walk you threw it and in the end it is so much fun! The plays you have to attend are not that bad and her tests are easy as long as you pay attention in class! A+ teacher

Elizabeth is a very energetic teacher. She is a professional actor, so she knows what she's doing. However, she makes you write research papers about the plays you are performing monologues and scenes from. Love her as a person, but indifferent as a Professor.

Name: Olga Filatova
Comment: The professor is awesome

I learnt a lot from her. I would try to use some of her style in my own teaching. Well... I took her a class as an exchange student  4 years ago, and recently go a teaching job myself. It made me think about her. I am glad I have sad my papers :)
Very helpful
She is very helpful. The class is interesting and helped me a lot, but a lot of homework.
She is very helpful and fair. She gives of of homework, but the class helped me to improve my English greatly.
She is very hot and very helpful. The class is not easy though. She gives a lot of homework.
She explains well and is a very good listener

Name: Terri Iacobucci
Comment: She is very particular about what she wants but everything is on canvas. All due dates were one day and it never changed. Many bonus points opportunities throughout the course. We did not have any exams for this course but there was a lot of writing/discussion boards.

Terri is a great professor. She is always there for students and truly listens and responds to student feedback. Her instructions aren't always clear, but she's always willing to clarify. I would recommend anyone to take her classes.
