She was unclear on what she expected in assignments. She let us redo everything after she graded it because everyone did awful but you have to ask her to spell out exactly what she wants or you're in trouble. Quizzes open book. Send her an email asking about quiz questions or directions and she'll give you extra credit each time - I got 35 pts EC.

Do NOT take this course with this professor! She is very unclear with every single assignment and is constantly changing the rules of the assignments. Don't even bother asking her for help, she won't provide assistance. I knew absolutely NOTHING on the final, and I spent hours and hours every week on this course. My experience with her was horrible

She is impossible. I spend more time on her class than any of my other classes. She makes ZERO since and gives no credit for your work. She wines about the smallest things on your assignments and won't give you a grade at all. She has WAY too much time to pick apart assignments, and then she starts changing how the assignments are due. DON'T TAKE!!

Took this course online, and oh my goodness it is IMPOSSIBLE to please her with assignments. She is very picky, and will give you a grade way less than what you deserve. I asked her for help on how I could fix my assignments, and she did not provide any answer. DO NOT TAKE this course online with this professor.
She is all over the place. ALL OVER. However she does really enjoy the material and I enjoyed the class. You also have to try to not get a A in this class.
She's not the most clear person on what she wants, but as long as you try on the assignments, you'll get a good grade. No test and mainly in-class group work. I'd recommend taking her.
Best online course I have taken! Takes strong interest in reviewing assignments.  Fairly easy class... I would recommend her to anyone!

Name: Nicole Grant
Comment: I have Prof. Grant for SOC 330 (online). The class is constructed simply: read the chapter, write a discussion board, and take a quiz. There is one final. She is very hands-off with the course and doesn't interact much, but I'd say she's a fine professor. This is the only class I've had with her but I would take another one if needed.

Took her SOC 320 class, was completely our of the textbook. You read the chapter and then do the activity at the end of the chapter in a discussion board post. As long as you read the chapters you'll be fine but she is not very involved in the course.

There is a lot of reading for this course and discussions to complete, but I personally learned a lot from this course. The quizzes at the beginning of the semester were really long; all of her quizzes are short-answer questions, but towards the end of the semester we had fewer questions to answer. She is very understanding and easy to talk to.

Nicole Grant is one of my favorite sociology teachers at NKU! Her lecture materials are very easy to follow and she provides amazing additional sources when needed. She's very clear about what she's looking for and assignments are always very well explained and fairly graded. I take classes with this teacher as often as possible!!

I took Professor Grant's class in my freshman year, and she really helped me gain an understanding on how to do research for future classes and how to properly write papers at a college level. She's very knowledgeable and as long as you do the weekly assignments you'll pass with an A no problem!

Only really grades Friday discussion boards for supplementing and if you dont do them youll fail. Dr. Grant is a really sweet lady but a very boring lecturer after a while. Her voice just puts me to sleep.

When I am in this class, I wish I was unconscious. Attendance is a grade so you have to show up which hurts me. This class is so boring and she gets off topic so much I forget I am on earth and I have learned nothing. I literally pray that Jesus comes back to earth before I go into that class in hopes I won't have to go. Easy A tho.

The thing was Professor Grant is she is truly a great educator. She is heavy on discussions because she wants to hear what you have to say. She is extremely respected and she is very personable. She uses upwards of 4 textbooks which seems like alot but they are riveting pieces of text that are really the foundation of your sociological perspective.

This professor tends to focus on her viewpoints, and picks specific content to discuss in class that appears to back up her viewpoint. She assumes everyone in there are like minded individuals with very little differentiation in thought. Never opened the textbook as it is useless. Just use google online and you'll be fine. DONT RECCOMEND.

Not good at answering emails. The lectures don't have anything to do with assignments/tests, therefor going to class is kind of pointless. Most of the assignments are discussions which are fairly easy.

Dr. Grant is by far the WORST communicator when it comes to online classes. She claims she checks email throughout the weekdays & tries respond within 24 (business) hrs, however takes 3-7 days to respond. When asking for clarification, none is given. Assignments not graded for over a month. ZERO feedback on assignments all semester long.
Genuinely cares about you, your learning experience, and your personal life. Is easy to work with and is very flexible. Would highly recommend taking her at any level.

I really enjoyed this class, there are only 4 tests and they are all open book online. The reading material is interesting but there is a lot of it. The final paper counts as your final and it is fairly simple. Class is discussion based, just make sure you keep up with the readings.

Dr. Grant is a very nice and caring Professor. This specific class is completely Lecture, discussion, and reading based. No homework assigned all semester. No points for participation. Only grades are 5 tests and a Final Paper.  Final paper isn't too bad and acts as the Exam. If you read what is assigned and pay attention, you can get an A.

Dr. Grant is the best professor I have ever had. Reading all of these negative reviews of her makes me sick.  It is extremely easy to get a 100% in any of Dr. Grant's classes, you just have to do the reading and write a VERY short synopsis of what you read. Classes are discussion based, and very fun. You will learn SO much from her, if you try.

She's an amazing professor. This class required a lot of reading but the books are really interesting and worth the read. She turns it more into a class discussion where we just tell our opinions and then she'll give us questions to think and talk about.
okay professor :)

Professor Grant is extremely knowledgable & her lectures are very intriguing. Since Ive began her class I've opened my eyes to so many more things. She is a terrific person and though her lectures seem very long at times and there is a lot of reading, you are educated on many many things. I recommend this class to everyone.

Though her lectures often run over on time and drag a little bit, she wants to help you get through the class. As long as you do the readings before they are discussed and take notes in class the tests are a breeze. The tests are all online as is the final paper, which is explained explicitly in the syllabus at the beginning of the semester.

She is a very nice person and if you go to her with questions on something she will definitely help you. However, there are only 5 assignments. 4 online tests and one 5-7 page paper, so if you do bad on a few of these your grade will plummet. She lectures about stuff not related to the topic, too.

Name: Jang-Chul Kim
Comment: Starts most classes by publicly embarrassing someone or calling someone out. In my experience you cant count on emails or private conversations staying private. This course was quite an unpleasant learning experience, also implied people who believe in God are silly for doing so. Unprofessional teacher, would recommend avoiding him.
JC always makes you laugh in class, he makes class very interactive and enjoyable. I always looked forward to attending, made the concepts very clear and the handouts helped a bunch.
Makes everything more complicated than it is and doesn't like helping. Don't take him

He is not nice and makes comments to students in front of the class. He doesn't help when you ask him. He tells students to just look up everything. He doesn't want anyone coming to his office hour for help. Overall I wouldn't recommend taking him at all. He is by far one of the most terrible professors I have taken.

J.C. has been the best professor I've had so far. I highly recommend taking a class with him to experience his humor and overall presence of the classroom. He has some great jokes and makes learning in the classroom engaging and fun and I always look forward to attending his class.

Professor Kim knows what he's talking about and has a great sense of humor. Tells you the class before when there will be a quiz. Allows a note card on exams, & homework is super straightforward. Im taking another class of his next semester. Best professor in the department. Take him if you get the opportunity, and show up to class. He makes it fun

Everything was good until we went online due to COVID-19, he had everyone meet at the same times as class would be on Zoom. He did not record these unlike other professors to view later. He also made all quizzes and tests online only start during this window. If i'm taking an "online" class, I want to have the whole day to start whenever I want

Prof. Kim is hilarious he truly loves what he teaches and always takes time to help his students. Make sure to pay attention during lecture because he goes over each type of problem you'll see on exams. He also has office hours where he explains everything to you slowly if you need more help.

Has a sense of humor. Carries an accent that can sometimes be tough to understand, especially when he gets on a roll with that dry erase board. It's tough to teach yourself so show up and really pay attention. GROUP Quizzes come random but he'll tell you the class before. Exams were tough, could have studied better though. Easy project as well.
Makes the class harder than its supposed to be, would not take again.
class average for the first exam was D. have to learn most things by yourself. first day of class said I am sure I will be seeing some students again the next semester.
Terrible prof. Hard to understand his accent. Goes over material too quickly. Was not helpful when approached

He was one of my favorite FIN professors. Hilarious and helpful. He gives a lot of quizzes but lets you know in advance (we never had a pop quiz), and drops the lowest one. His exams can be tough, they are weighted, but he makes your lowest exam grade a lower weight. He was always there to answer questions, usually right away.

Hands out assignments in class and does not post them online. Attending all classes is a must, miss even one class you will miss about 10% of the material on the next exam. He is more than willing to help you if asked. Gives huge amounts of examples so you can learn exactly how to do things. Fantastic experience although material not easy.

He goes over every type of problem that is going to be on the tests which is really helpful especially when you're not a Finance major and it's your first time looking at Finance stuff. He is funny and nice and overall a great professor! A lot of his questions on the test are the same as problems from the book or that he goes over in class.
Possibly the best professor I have had at NKU.  He has an excellent way of explaining things.

He is seriously the best finance professor I have ever had. It takes me back to learning in high school. He is funny and helpful and really wants the student to do weel in the class. Attendance isnt required but will help you a ton!!

J.C. is hilarious. This course is more math oriented than any other finance class. If you have trouble with complex math, this isnt for you. But he wants everyone to pass. Very good professor. I got into 450 with Prof Kim next semester and looking forward to managing NKU's large portfolio/fund.

The coolest professor at NKU.  He is hilarious and keeps class interesting.  He will make you laugh every day for sure.  His classes are not hard at all. I've had him for this class and FIN 450. He's a great guy and very helpful.  Lets you use index cards on exams.
Great guy... Favorite finance professor

Name: Jeffrey Steller
Comment: He rox my socks

BIO 155 is supposed to prepare biology majors for the rigors of being a biology major. It does not do this with Steller.  Attendance is not mandatory, assignments can be turned in late, and everyone gets an A.  We invited alumni in to talk to the class and he would ridicule them and insult them when they left.  He tries to be cool, but he is not.

Steller was exceptionally helpful and will hands-down be your best resource to make it through this tough subject. Answers questions clearly, ALWAYS available to help, and truly cares about your success. Holds 3+ review sessions before tests and gives great study guides. He does have quizzes every week that were really key to my success. Fave Prof.

Name: Seungcheol Lee
Comment: I've now taken two online classes with Professor Lee. There tends to be quite a bit of work involved but it's not overwhelming, definitely doable. Exams aren't super difficult as long as you have/read the textbook. I've done well in both of his classes. As long as you do the work and do it well you'll be fine.

The weekly assignments are helpful and easy, there are two smaller papers (2-4 pages), three tests, and one large paper (8-10 pages). The work corresponds with interesting online lectures and linked content, but the rubric for the large paper was troublesome, and it was due the Sunday of Thanksgiving weekend so beware fall semester students.
A fantastic, knowledgeable professor. Extremely interesting course. He uses a lot of popular culture references to keep the course fun and exciting. I highly recommend him.

Name: David Hogan
Comment: Passed the class. Don't remember any of the information. Hated the course and wish I would've picked another professor and maybe I would've remembered something. He is really caring and passionate though.
He gives study guides with the exact answers. I really liked him.
Gave study guides with the answers attached Quizzes was the study guides and had a two paragraph paper

Took Animal learning with Dr Hogan. He is awesome, funny, smart and easy to work with. What else would you want from professor ? Gave you quizes you can take through the semester or the choice of comprehensive. I enjoyed this class and material he taught.

He's a great guy, LOVES his stuff, but VERY boring class. I kid you not, everyone in the class is either on their phone or doing other homework. Quizzes only, no tests. VERY easy. The study guides ARE the quiz, you just have to find the right answers and memorize. Go to class to make him happy, use as a study hall and memorize the study guides, A+

Those who say Dr. H is not organized are crazy. He is very organized and very CLEAR about what he expects from every project/assignment. I adore this man. I took him for 210 and 337. Take him, he will be a professor you will NEVER forget!!!

I had Dr. Hogan for methods last semester and knew I wanted to take another class with him this semester. This man is a genius, I have truly learned so much from him. I will miss not having him next semester. I love, love, love him!!!
The class was rather boring. He was a funny and interesting professor but his teaching style was very much a bore. Used a lot of slides and didn't really communicate well

Took him for Methods, easy class. Uses powerpt which is boring and he will stare at you and you just have to look interested in what he is saying. Hates cell phones-don't use during class! Gives lots of quizzes-no tests, quizzes straight from his already answered study guide. He's quirky but easy, definitely take him!!!

I love Dr. Hogan. hilarious man and very smart. He is not afraid to say what he wants, and be careful because he can be serious too. Most of the time though, he is fun to joke with. He will know who you are so if you see him in the halls he will stop to talk. very nice man. quizzes are easy- he gives you the answers!

Dr. Hogan was great at the beginning of the semester.  However, he wears his emotions on his sleeve and you can certainly tell when he's having a rough day.  The class is boring and isn't well organized.  I've never failed a class in my entire life but I guess there's a first for everything?.
Dr. Hogan is smart, funny, and a good teacher. He really knows his stuff. I loved this class, because I learned a lot, and he cracks me up. It is not that hard. Just come to class, and do the work.

He is a very nice man. The class is not to hard because he gives you the quiz to find the answers ahead of time. So if you do it then it's easy breazy. He doesn't tolerate stupidity, or what he thinks it is. Shows a lot of really old movies and requires a 10 min oral presentation :(
Nice, funny, smart, a little eccentric. The material is a little tedious, but he gives the test and answers for study guides.

This class is torture.  He knows the subjects but its all I can do to actually focus and stay awake at the same time.  You have to study for the tests and the book is not entirely necessary.  Horrible combination of required class and extremely boring teacher.

Class is extremely boring, does play favorites and many women in the class say they feel he looks at them like a ****ed fool. If you have to make up a quiz in the computer room, don't think that you can use the computer he will blame you for cheating.

BORED out of my mind!! he knows his information there is no doubt about that!! BUT!! DOES NOT KNOW HOW TO TEACH IT!! and do not dare ask a question... he will make an example of you ... and either 1. makes you feel compleltely stupid ...or 2. answer in a way that you have NO idea he is even talking about the same topic!! leaving you more lost!!
A wonderful professor. I had Dr. Hogan in the 1990s, and he was smart, friendly, and a wild sense of humor. A cool guy that furthered my interest in psychology and my career. One of the best.
Awesome, knowledgeable and has superstitious pigeons, who could ask for more. If you do your work you will not have a problem. He teaches, he does not baby sit.
I LOVED his class!!!! I took it as a 5 week summer class. He was VERY helpful and fun!

Name: Jerome Gonnella
Comment: Interesting stuff, but the lectures were long... Sometimes he seemed unsure on what he was doing.
Great guy, would definitely take again for a third time. Just show up to class and ask questions and you will do fine. The tests can be rather hard, but you can tell they are straight from the book
very nice class 3 exam and 10 or so quizzes both of then online, 4 assignment to do, do not miss the class more than 4, I recommend him for BIS 300 and BIS 380 and INF 101 good prof.

Lab instructor on Fridays. Easy class: go online and start the lab or homework assignment and leave when class is over. If you're stuck or confused, he will help. Takes them a while to upload all the grades on Blackboard so overall grade isn't known until the end of semester.
Very Good professor, taking him again next semester.
He means well. I found it difficult to pay attention to his lectures, but to be fair the content isn't exactly that exciting. He gives lots of extra credit. Tests are SUPER hard.

Super easy class. 15 quizzes that he basically gives you the answers for. Come on Fridays for lab. There will be one quiz Monday andor Wednesday but besides that coming to class does nothing. Tests and Homework are easy. He is a great teacher

Only take INF 101 if you need to for your major. Extremely boring class due to the content, Gonnella generally makes it even more boring. 15 quizzes throughout semester, all easy - he'll give you the answers to most of the questions during the quiz anyway. 3 exams, not difficult if you pay slight attention during lecture. You need the book for lab.

This class probably would have been boring anyway, but Gonella made it SO much more boring. He talks to his students like 5 year olds and takes forever to do anything, especially when helping you with something.
easy class there are 15 pop quizzes all of them easy also 3 exam. the class is kind of boring but it's easy A. take him

I am a CS major. INF 282 is a req. I think he knows what he's talking about, but he's a awful teacher. He spent most of the time talking about nothing, and irrelevant stories, and let us out after 20 mins. almost every class, And expected us to learn. My bro with a MS summed up 6 wks in 10 mins. If you need this for your GPA, AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!

Attendance isn't mandatory but you should still go. You use the book a lot for in class assignments. The work isn't hard and you usually don't have homework if you finish it in class. Pay attention to the lectures because I didn't and the tests were hard for me. But I still received an A-.

He is very passionate about this class. He will go out of his way to explain topics and give examples on how to use the material covered. Some lectures are a little boring and pointless, but due to the lack of material in the class, they are needed. Would take again.

This is an advanced excell class.  Not an easy class to take (if you don't use it everyday) or teach.  Classes are boring but he tries to liven it up a bit.  Seems to really care for the students.  Do the homework and study for exams.  The time to complete the homework was greater than the amount needed to pass exams.

This class was pretty boring, most people in the class already knew how to do everything (basic word,pp,excel things) so I never paid attention to his lectures. Its an easy A if you pay attention, B if you show up

Mr. Gonnella is one of the kindest professors you will take. The class (Quantitative Analysis W/ Excel) is a very boring subject in itself, but Gonnella is very helpful if you need it. Do the assignments on time and attempt all extra credit. Study for the tests because they can be tricky. Try hard and come to class it will pay off.

Professor Gonella was a really good teacher however lectures were not very lively. This class had a lot of nit=picky test questions so study, study, study for the 2 exams and 1 final. Come to class and pay attention if you want to do well.

One of my favorite professors. His lectures are a bit tedious but he lets you out early often times and genuinly cares about his students. Attendance isn't enforced, assignments aren't too difficult and tests are pretty basic as long as you look over notes before. I wish he had more classes in my major I could take! He's the best!
BORING!!! this class is really boring but super easy, just skim through the chapters and you'll be fine. very few assignments.

I really liked him, He goes slow and is very easy to understand, shows you how to do the assignments, and can be funny at times! This class was a blessing compared to my 310 class. I didn't really study for the exams, listened in class somewhat, got at least a 97 on the assignments and got a B. take him if he's an option!

Name: Cathy Ingram
Comment: I took her EDU316 as a Web Class.  I felt she graded hard and I did not feel her grading was very consistent. Also, her instructions were vaque at times. Prof. Ingram's grading scale is 93-100 "A".  Based on the total points for the class, you have to get almost perfect scores on everything to get an "A" in the class.
She is too informal for my taste, uses a lot of language, including dik* and other curse words on a regular basis. definitely forward which i dont prefer at all in a professor. very non traditional.

GOOD PROFESSOR OVERALL.  SHE KNOWES HER STUFF WHEN IT COMES TO EDUCATION.  SHE IS ALWAYS ALWAYS ALWAYS LATE TO CLASS BUT THE EASINESS OF THE CLASS MAKES UP FOR IT. NO TESTS, MOSTLY ALL OPINION PAPERS, AND ONE RESEARCH PROJECT. VERY CLEAR, VERY APPROACHABLE, EASY A.

Cathy was a great teacher! I am a non traditional student and she was the first professor I came in contact with.  I was just wanting to get my feet wet to see if college was going to be the thing for me and she is the one who made it worth while!! Very nice, understandable (school and life), and fun. She's very clear on what she wants from you.
Late to class almost every single time (except for the final).  Did not grade clearly: gave grades on papers but did not say what was wrong.

I would highly recommend her class to anyone who needs a 300 level course because it is extremely easy.  There are 4 small papers and a project at the end of semester, no tests.  She also gives you 10 extra credit points if you don't miss a class. She is super nice and is an easy grader.

Don't take her unless you have to. She's very intimidating and doesn't remember half of what she says. The four small papers weren't hard, but the end of semester project was a pain. Luckily, she doesn't grade too harshly. She doesn't call off class (even when there's plenty of snow) but instead sends a sub, and she's almost always late

One of the best classroom experiences I have had to date. She cares that you learn something and not just about scores. All assignments are geared for you to have new experiences or viewpoints. Easy grader since that's not the point but if you participate you will gain value from the experience. EDU majors this is a must!

Great teacher.   Yes, she was late, but she mentioned on the first day that she probably would be.  The presentation of the class allowed for a lot of discussion.   She presented a lot of different viewpoints.   This particular class is made better with active class participation.

She would consistently show up 10 minutes late for our class. She doesn't really teach very much. She'll start a conversation in class and just let everyone talk. Lots of videos, and she knows nobody reads the book. Grade =  4 small papers (25pts each), a research project, and a small reflection paper for your final. Easy A, if that's what you want
Very nice. Very helpful. Made the class very enjoyable/looked forward to it.  Recommend taking this class.
Professor is easy going and I agree with everything else the other person said. Easy 300 level course.

SHE IS THE FUNNIEST TEACHER IVE EVER HAD! SHE GRADES REALLY EASY & MAKES CLASS FUN! YOU DONT HAVE TESTS! JUST LIKE 4 LIL PAPERS & A FINAL PRESENTATION! NOT STRESSFUL @ ALL! TAKE HER IF YOU CAN!! *NO FINAL*

Name: Elizabeth Schoulties
Comment: What is there to not like about Elizabeth. She's extremely helpful, approachable, nice, smart and the list could go on. I highly recommend and would take her again in a heartbeat.
AWESOME!!!! Very Helpful and just a wonderful teacher! Would take her again in a heartbeat!

Name: Danielle Donley
Comment: Super cool laid back teacher. Fun, easy class!

Danielle is an awesome teacher. She always seems to have a fun time teaching, laughing and making jokes along with the students. She gives a decent amount of work, but she's helpful enough that it doesn't seem like much. She is a fair grader and is extremely approachable. Little reading and moderately difficult tests, but prepares you well before.

Name: Kathleen Broomall
Comment: I loved her. She was very helpful and answered your questions with full clarity. She is very approachable and will even ask you if she is understanding correctly the question you are asking her. If you're unsure if something will be on the exam, just ask her and she will be more than happy to tell you. I would love to take her for another class!
She's awesome. She knows her stuff and will help you with whatever she can.

Name: Gary Gray
Comment:
I really liked him at first but he quickly turned sour and stopped helping me. I decided in the end that I did not like him much and wouldn't like to have any other class with him ever again. 
I don't appreciate the mandatory expensive testing software website.

This class was really nice and organized. There are not exams which is nice. Each week you will have a total of 3 assignments due. You can pretty much work at your own pace throughout the week. The professor did a great job letting you know where you went wrong if you did not receive full credit on the assignment.

Professor Gray is a pretty tough grader, I am normally a B+ student. I had to try my hardest to earn a C in this course. Each week there is a ch quiz, case study, and graded on reading the CH. if you don't do the case study how he wants it, he takes points away. CH quiz are hard w/ the class mean being 70-80% on them. only take him if u have to!!
The best part of his class is that there are no tests, he is very chill and only assigns a case study and two quizzes in a week. Take him you won't regret.

I took the class online, no exams. However there are a lot of in chapter assignments and the class was very time consuming. I did learn the material but it took a lot of my time, there are articles due every week from wallstreet journal, case studies, and chapter quizzes. Overall lots of work but bright side no exams!

Name: Mari Hoffman
Comment: I've always hated math...(which is probably why I was in remedial math) But sister Hoffman is such a sweet women and will bend over backwards for you, if she sees you making a little bit of effort!
This stats class is fairly easy, and only requires basic algebra.  She grades pretty tough, but allows you to use formula sheets on every quiz and test.

Easiest teacher ever and explains things very clearly.  Those who gave her a negative rating obviously didn't care about the class.  The best math teacher you'll ever get....Helpful, gives ample chances and extra credit

She is the best statistics teacher! She is willing to help, and she understands that most people in this class aren't math majors. Study your homework for quizzes. Study all your quizzes for the tests and you will get an A. Great teacher and great class!  Highly recommend her!

The class was okay and not that difficult. However, you teach a lot yourself. She's nice but i feel that her grading was unfair. quiz everyday after she barely went over the material and she grades homework really tough. She made many mistakes when doing examples on the board which confused the class a lot. Very boring. I would choose a diff. prof.
She made statistics easy!  Highly recommend her.

Sister Marilyn is a very kind nun. I'm not brilliant with math, but I found this class fun. There are a lot of real life examples, which makes it more interesting. You get to use a note card on the tests. There are a lot of quizzes, but she drops the lowest quiz grades. Not too much homework--pretty easy. I recommend her!
She is somewhat confusing but a very nice person.

The class is super easy but for some reason i could not do well in it. The topics that we covered are things straight from high school. But i find her hard to pay attention too. The class is dreadfully boring. I cannot concentrate on straight math for the full hour and fifteen minutes of that class. A lot of people in my class do very well.

She is an outstanding professor! I highly recommend taking her over any other stats teacher at NKU. She is so helpful and truly cares about her students. She does everything she can to make her students succeed and on most of her test the average class score was a B....that says a lot about how good she is.

I dreaded having to take this class, but Marilyn Hoffman made it easy enough...She goes fast so I would recommend not missing class if you want to do well even though it is not mandatory. Everything on the tests comes straight from what we did in class, so study and you'll be fine.

I actually liked this class after I took it with her! I was scared to death of taking a Stats class, but it ended up not being bad at all! She is very helpful and in class she gives you exactly what she expects on the test. Just study for the quizzes/exams and do the homework (she drops a few grades too!) and you will get a good grade, trust me!

She is a very good teacher if you are not good at Math like me! She repeatedly went over our the chapters and she gives a lot of chances for grades on tests and quizzes.  At the end of the semester she takes the last 3 classes to go over the final exam. I would highly recommend her to anyone that needs to take this course

The subject matter for this class is not very intriguing. However she does a well in teaching it. She shows a lot of examples and goes over every single question on quizzes and tests afterwards to explain how to do it. Drops quiz grades and allows a test to be replaced if you score higher on the final.

She is a nun, seriously. She is not a very good teacher though. She is extremely confusing and does not explain things very well. You have to teach yourself a lot. She does give many second chances and drops a few grades. She just is not a good teacher, I would recommend taking a different professor!!
She was awesome... I almost droped this class but Hoffman helped me complete this course.. She is the BEST

This class is hard by nature. The pace of her teaching is FAST. If you miss ONE DAY, you are likely going to have difficulty catching up, unless you are a math whiz. That said, she is a very understanding person, and is willing to help you if you ask for it. Not condescending, she understands that statistics is hard for most people!
does not explain anything, useless, lots of quizzes, boring teacher
Quizes almost every day and doesnt help understand homework problems. Very quick course.
She's very nice and easy.  Helps you if you need it and explains everything in great detail.

Name: Sara Mahle
Comment: INCREDIBLE TEACHER. She is very clear with what she expects from you and works hard to help you achieve your best in the class. Very structured and challenging but nothing you can't handle. TAKE HER CLASS. I will be taking any other classes with her I can!

You use the book and read a lot, but Sara is one of my favorite professors. She's extremely helpful, and is always there for help if you need it. A lot of work is put into the class but the info actually sticks with you. She really gets into what she teaches, so it's easier to learn and remember material.

One of the best professors at NKU. She challenges students without patronizing them. Her class and relationships with students encouraged me not to transfer schools. Not to mention, she is one fine looking woman.

Sara Mahle is one of the best professors I've taken.  We had to read a chapter every week and take quizes on them.  There is a presentation at the end, but if you at least try, you will do fine.  Sara is very, very helpful and she makes sure everyone knows exactly what she is looking for in the course.

Sara is a great professor. She is very clear on what she wants from her students and is very helpful.  The class consists of quizzes, a midterm, term paper and presentation, and final. She also gives many opportunities for extra credit.
Sara is an awesome professor.  She is so into the subject matter and really cares about her students.  There are a lot of in class discussions and a few presentations but I really loved this class.

Took her for NorseMedia Projects(production course).  The class difficulty is going to depend mostly on other students, rather than the professor.  You work a crew and produce a program. In this class, she is more of a mentor than lecturer.  Recommended for proactive students.

Name: Renee Human
Comment: She is a very patient and loving woman who admires her students. She is very encouraging and always there to help you whenever needed. Very enthusiastic with what she does and is a well-rounded person. Anyone can learn Information Science and Media with her.

Working with Renee is a pleasure, she is always willing to help and really goes the extra mile to help her students succeed. The number of students to whom she gives "special" treatment is staggeringly high. Renee gives each student exactly the kind of encouragement/help/inspiration that they need to be great.
She is an amazing Proffessor who is always there to help you when you need it.  She is very good at teaching her subject and getting you interested and excited.
Taking her for every MIN class I possibly can. She's energetic, fun, and loves what she does. Fair grading, clear assignments, and lots of great feedback. She is the reason I love the MIN program!

Love love love love LOVE her! She is an amazing teacher and an all-around awesome person! She's extremely understanding and is always willing to help you. Sometimes I find myself falling behind in lectures, but she's always willing to get you back up to speed. Take all of her classes, you won't regret it!

Name: Monica Gallegos
Comment: Although I took this class online, Monica seemed like a nice person and was always willing to work with you if you had questions. She is a tough grader and her exams are challenging but overall, I seemed to learn a lot more than I thought I would in this class. There was a decent amount of work required but overall, it was all doable and worth it.

Dr. Gallegos is a sweet, caring teacher. She's the type to take the time to memorize all of her students' names, even though she has hundreds. The class is so easy. No tests, just speeches, which are simple. I wrote some of my speeches the day of and got good grades. She will move her schedule back if she sees that everyone needs more time. Queen!

Lays out how she'll grade everything in the syllabus and assignment rubrics. She sticks to what she laid out so if you missed something expect some points off. Come to class or you'll fall behind. She's friendly but has a little bit of an edge to her. I never really gelled with her teaching style. The class left me lukewarm. Not bad but not great.

Monica was a great teacher!! She made the class super interesting and fun! She was a tough grader but was open to helping any student. I would definitely take another class with her as the professor. Also make sure you come to class, you get so many points for doing so.

Exam questions are, "Which of the following is the best answer?" When in fact all of the following are correct and the choices are a-g. She's strict with grading papers as well and actually told me that my writing skills needed a lot of work (rude comment) I have taken and aced my business writing classes. Rude to students ideas. Don't take her.

It is impossible to get an A with her. She is very picky in very dumb details. You MUST read you book and MUST show up... Not kidding... weekly quizes. Tests are hard with very tricky and wordy questions. She expects a lot of details in your answers. Memorize every video she shows bc many questions in your tests will come from them.

Took her for Interpersonal and Advanced Speaking. Nice lady and class activities are fun. Warning: will take off points for attendance and will NOT accept late work! The class itself is fairly easy, but her tests are very specific and difficult. Lots of movies watched in Interpersonal, and speeches in Advanced Speaking were very very easy.

This class was alright. I only had it once a week so it was 3 hours, which was the only downside. Very interesting lectures, and she had us do fun activities every class. there only two tests, which are hard so you really have to study, and one paper which is easy. As long as you follow directions you'll be golden.

WARNING. Stay away from her. She expects you to be at every class meeting. I received an A on both exams, but had to miss class for her volunteer work she requires and my brother graduating from basic training. So she gave me a B-. I was warned to not take a class with her. Made that mistake once but certainly will not make the same mistake again.
Super nice professor, sticks to what she says. Class was fun, we watched a lot of movies and shows. Only 4 100 point assignments all year. Mandatory attendance.

DO NOT TAKE A COURSE WITH HER. She seems really sweet at first, but she is one of the worst professors I have ever had. Sure, she will teach you what you need to know. But beware to feel like you are in middle school again. Mandatory attendance. No phones, laptops, snacks (she WILL tell you to put them away)I would suggest to stay away from her.

I took her CMST 101, and found it to be minimally painful for a public speaking class.  She is extremely nice and willing to help any way she can. Attendance is mandatory and counts for a large part of your grade, and the midterm and final require a decent amount of studying, but overall this was a pretty easy class. I would take Monica again.

Name: Robert Brice
Comment: Dr. Brice is a great professor. The material can be hard for some but it came easy to me. the grade is pretty much just final and midterm plus quizzes. quizzes are pretty easy but only worth 8 points each. Don't buy the book! He posts it in Canvas. he says to read and you probably should but I didn't and did fine.
This was a great class I learned a huge amount, classes are always very interesting! What a hard working and dedicated professor.
It's actually PHI 310 but there was no option. This class is so ridiculously dull. If you don't like to read do not take this. Discussions and quizzes are the only grades outside of the exams.

Weekly discussion boards and two exams were the only grades. The grading made no sense at all. He'd be ok with something one week, but not the next and randomly took off points. The exams are MC, but are really long with not enough time to answer, but basically word for word from the lectures which are online. Hated the lockdown browser too.

The subject matter itself is not that hard, some of the material is hard to understand, but you can get by. However, the only grades you receive are from quizzes and tests and there are not very many of them. Also, all the quizzes are worth 8.32 points or less, so they do not really help your grade much. Take your time and study as much as you can.

Lot of reading, but its a Philosophy course so expect a lot of reading and discussing. Lectures are long and can be boring if you aren't a philosophy major, but should be an easy 'A' if you take notes and read the required books. If you are a phi major or just really interested in the subject, Dr. Brice is brilliant and easily accessible.

This was by far one of the easiest and most interesting classes I've taken this semester. I 100% recommend it. If you show up to every class and take notes it's an easy A. There are weekly discussion boards and quizzes not too hard if you pay attention in class.

Mr. Brice was excellent, you have to pay attention, and you must take notes. The books are going to be boring, because they were written like eons ago so come into the class with the idea that there will be lots of reading. He grades fairly and is a delight to listen to.

This class was interesting and started out easy, but by the the end it really was the hardest class I've ever taken. If you didn't get a good grade on one of the three exams, you'll fail. Some concepts you learned you never had the opportunity to apply until an exam. The lectures were good, but you were pretty much on your own for most of it.

I liked this professor, but not the class. There was a lot of boring readings, but he goes allows you to go over the quizzes before taking them, which helped a lot; and they arent hard. There was only 10 quizzes, a midterm, and a final. No outside work besides reading, Each quiz is only 4 questions so its very important to do well on them.
Dr. Brice is an good choice for taking PHI 200.
Dr. Brice is so good at explaining things and helping students improve their argumentation. Great class and I want to take his classes again.

This was Robert's first time teaching this course, and he planned for us to cover a LOT of content, yet we only made it through about half of what he planned. He made sure we really understood the material before moving on. The book was helpful for studying. 4-5 papers which took some thought. He grades easily on them. Tests  easy if you studied.

I took this class online, and maybe it would be better if I took a physical class, but it was an awful class.  The online lectures weren't awful, but there is an awful amount of reading horribly boring books and excerpts.  The midterm and final barely reflected what we read. Absolutely would not recommend.
Easy if you follow the guidelines on the TRP's. Very open minded to any opinions in in-class discussions.

Each week you have to read long philosophy books (that don't make sense). Don't take unless you like philosophy, not an easy credit. He is a tough grader, and gives NO feedback. The lectures are online and are about 30-60 minutes long each week. Tests are difficult. grading isn't good and this class was not an easy A course.
Dr. Brice is a great lecturer. He knows the course content well, and provides relevant examples/relates content to important topics. Would recommend!

I took Professor Brice's philosophy class expecting it to be easy, but it turned out to be one of the hardest classes I've ever taken.  Every class a lecture is given and a new, often lengthy, reading is assigned.  The only grades given come from 4 questions pop quizzes, thought and reflection papers which he grades harshly, and 2 tests.

I took this class to cross off one of my gen ed requirements. Professor Brice is a very funny and nice guy. However, there is lots of reading. When you come to class, there are discussions so know what you are talking about. However, if you at least try, he will help you with your answer. Pop quizzes, show up if you want the final to be easy

Name: Patrick Ashley
Comment: Was a great professor. Easy to get along with and gives you a deserving grade. Makes the lectures less boring.
I loved his class. he made giving speeches enjoyable. and if you love dogs or UK, you will probably get along nicely

He is really helpful and gives good feedback in a reasonable amount of time. He cares about students and is very supportive of their lives outside of school. Still makes you earn your grade, but it really isn't difficult.
I really enjoyed attending this class. Very funny guy. He he very willing to help and all around a great person. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Name: Marie Jump
Comment: Had Ms. Jump after being out of college for almost 10 years, my first time taking PreCalculus I barely passed. Ask questions and she will try to make sure you understand (may have to speak loudly for her to hear u) She gives an outline of each test and what to expect. Really helped for studying for a Math test. She's a little quirky in her habits,

Mostly Algebra II stuff learned in HS. Hw given after every lecture however she does not grade for correctness just for completion. Only 2 exams each worth 100 points. She gave us a list of the type of questions there were going to be ahead of time.

Failed this class the semester before then took Marie, she is an amazing teacher. Everything is clear cut. Homework doesn't take long. Not a very tough class. She is an awesome teacher for people who cannot math
She is awesome. She makes sure that you understand every bit of what is going on in the lecture. If you are taking MAT 119, I recommend her without any hesitation.

Assumes you know what she is talking about immediately and skips sooo many steps on her explanations so you lose her fast. Would not take again if my life depended on it. Also prepare for her to fuss about technology for half the class. Also her notes are the biggest jumble that has ever existed.

She may be educated, but she certainly can't portray her knowledge to others. There was an elderly man in my class and she treated him like he was stupid because he didn't understand. Also, don't smile in that class because she'll yell at you. Don't say FOIL, because THAT'S completely wrong. She makes you say First Outer Inner Last.

I was a School Based Scholar in HS, and had Ms. Jump for Mat 119 AND 129. Yes, she know what she is talking about, but if you ask her a question or tell her you don't understand she will go back and try to explain it. You cannot expect her to know that you don't understand. I LOVED her and her class. If I could I would take it again.

She is awful! If you are not a math person DO NOT TAKE HER! She is smart but she picks a problem and tries to solve it herself without explaining things and also skipping steps. If you want to get a good grade in this class take a different professor!

Her knowledge of the subject is vast but I don't think she knows how to get the information across to her students.  She gets frustrated when you don't understand what she is trying to explain.  Lectures are erratic and jump all over the place.

Name: Jennifer Kinsley
Comment: AMAZING, AMAZING, AMAZING. She really cares about her students and wants to see you succeed. She does not cold call too.

Name: Sarah Keefe
Comment: Sarah is incredibly kind and sweet. She grades based on effort, not exactly how things look, which is great for someone artistically challenged like myself. She does drop your grade an entire letter grade if you miss more than two classes, though, which is kind of ridiculous, but she's a bit lenient on it as long as you tell her what happened.

Name: Barbara Cowan
Comment: Professor Cowan taught my 7 week, online, SWK 632 class. I cannot say enough good things about Professor Cowan. I have never had a professor take the time she did to provide me feedback. Professor Cowan recorded voice memos with feedback for major assignments we completed. She was very encouraging and provided many great tips! Highly recommend!

Name: Wayne Bresser
Comment: There is a bit of work for this class and reading, but the lectures are fun and interesting. Dr Bresser is a really awesome guy and he really cares about his students. follows the syllabus, very understanding, and fun. I hope I get the chance to take more of his classes. Don't be worried about this course, just pay attention and take notes.

Name: Kasey Kuhjada
Comment: Love Dr. K. always available if you need to contact him. the class is discussion heavy, so you need to do teh readings/work before class in preparation. he provides great feedback, and often times you can make edits to your papers to improve your grade. very fun class, would recommend.

Name: Brian Sauer
Comment: Honored to give Prof. Sauer his first rating. I had him for CSC260 in the spring but he was not on here at the time. He cares so much about his students. He tells you exactly what you need to do. Do not skip class or you will get behind. Ask questions, send emails. He gets back very quickly. Wish I could take him for CSC360. Genuinely a great guy.

Name: Ian Aiuto
Comment: Professor Aiuto taught my 7 week, online, SWK 631 class & I, honestly, thoroughly enjoyed it! The class was very informative & as for the professor himself, FANTASTIC! Assignments were graded in a timely manner, feedback was always positive & supportive & any questions I had were promptly answered in a kind & efficient manner. Highly recommend!

Name: Brendan Snyder
Comment: Prof, Snyder is really nice, he is young which makes the class less boring. Getting off topic was a daily occurrence but he did a good job minimizing it and even in some situations he related it to the material. dont like how on your rough drafts he only makes small grammatical comments. Its a shame that he is leaving NKU

So far, he's an excellent teacher. He's very clear in the examples he gives, and, seeing as how he's closer to college age than many professors, he's able to give references that we can relate to. He is very entertaining and a good storyteller, but he avoids personal stories like they're the plague. Really helpful. He explains WHY you have to do things, too. Never says, "That's just the way it is."
if you want an easy A for an english 101 class, take this guy.  He is pretty funny and usually in a good mood.  Didn't cancel class, but we got out early alot.  I barely tried and i got an A!
Really teacher. I enjoyed his class very much. Very fair and an easy grader. Attendance isn't mandatory but I would recommend it. Very funny too.

Easy. Doesn't really care if you show up late or leave early. treats you like adult's not children. It's helpful to stay in class in order to write a good paper. Only have 4-5 papers you have to write all year, and that's really the only assignment you have to do. I would suggest him to anyone. Kind of funny too.

Name: Shana Cronican
Comment: She's awesome! Great teacher and very passionate about the subject. She loves to keep students updated with current events relevant to the course. Only two (easy) online tests and a group project. Highly recommended.
Loved the class, it was very interesting! It is a most take.
great teacher, very helpful and understanding. one of the best teachers i have ever had ! - not too difficult, just pay attention in class and stay involved in the discussions.
Absolutely loved her class, wanted nothing to do with it in the beginning but am now minoring in WGS and taking another one of her classes this next semester.

I absolutely loved her class. I wish she taught more classes in my major. I love her attitude and approach, she changed my hole out look on woman's studies. She is not very hard but you have to do the work to get a good grade. she is impressed if u read the chapters as well!
She jokes around in class all the time.
No Comments
She's very forward with things. Very tough but she'll help you when you need it. She wont put up with any attitude.

Name: Richard Fox
Comment: Feedback is super detailed. Lack of Canvas use is strange (you must email him your assignments) and the labs are incredibly long and tedious. Tests are also some of the hardest I have ever taken, but sometimes there is a curve.
CSC 362 is not fun class. Dr. Fox is a very knowledgeable professor and it is advisable to reach out to him if you need help. He will help you.

This will likley be the hardest call you have ever taken and Professor Fox was very forward about this. The homework will take around six hours to complete each week and the lectures will require some intense note taking. That said, Professor Fox is an excellent teacher and is always willing to work with students one-on-one.

Extra credit for the discussion boards. Make sure you do them all!! Tests are very hard but he applies the extra credit from the discussion boards to the tests, so again, do all the discussion boards.  He wrote the book for the class so he knows what he is talking about. He is very helpful and responds quickly to emails.  Great Professor!

Tests are killer, but he gets that a lot and says he'll never change, so be ready! Commenting like crazy every detail of every program I wrote AND printing them out was a nuisance. But lectures were bearable and he is super helpful if you go to him for help and very fair.

Name: Fred Otto
Comment: Very helpful and is extremely willing to help you look for job openings out of college in you concentrated feilds.

AWFUL! His class is very easy, however if you ever need ANYTHING he will ignore you in every way possible. It took me going to the dean for him to even email me back about missing an exam, which I gave over a months notice to him before hand. He never grades any work we do in class. Tests are strictly vocab words & an essay. So frustrating! Useless

Name: Ed Workman
Comment: HELPFUL
No Comments

Name: Ann Taylor
Comment: Her lectures are typically boring and are straight from the book, but she is extremely nice! Tests are easy as long as you take notes
Avoid. She lectures straight out of the book. The speaking portion of the class was easy but otherwise avoid this professor

She is the nicest professor that I've ever had! She is ALWAYS willing to help her students in any way possible. She grades journals easy, and reaction essays require a little more effort and thought on your own part. But no matter what! READ THE ASSIGNED READINGS!!! That is what the journals/reaction essays/test/quizzes/group discussions are over!

Dr. Ann is highly dedicated to her job and the topic. Make sure you show up to class. She wants her students to learn and teach each other, so a lot of the class is open discussion. There are journal entries usually due every week, 5 Reaction Essays where you summarize the material learned and discuss it with your group. There is one group project.

A very impressive teacher. She created an enviroment that made people more comfortable giving thier speeches. Reviews are straight off the test and the lectures are very straught forward. Just meet the requirements and you'll be fine.

Dr. Taylor is kind of a boring teacher, but she grades easy and is always willing to meet in her office to talk or if you need help. Her email correspondence is exceptional! I thought it would be my most hated class and it turned out to be my favorite because of her.

Reviews for tests are straight off the test. Grades fair. Easy, as long as you follow all speech guidelines. Most difficult part of the class was giving speeches in front of class, but she does her best to make you feel comfortable. Would absolutely take her again!

She is one of the nicest professor's I've had. Class is interesting. She has a few quizzes and tests here and there, but she tells you what they are over, and they are pretty easy. A few 2-3 page essays all based on your opinion. Easy A if you keep up.

She is a very sweet woman. She is funny and easy to get along with. Her exams can get tricky but she reviews straight from the test so if you fail, it is your own fault. She grades speeches very fairly and does her best to make you feel comfortable in from of an audience.

The tests were hard for me because I didn't study. But she basically gives you the answers when she reviews for the test. She is a pretty fair grader for the speeches but doesn't like late work so be on time. The class was actually very interesting and fun.
Class wasn't very hard. Biggest thing obviously is getting up in front of the cass to do your speeches. Professor Taylor is very nice but wasn't very helpful with questions.

She was overall pretty easy. I got 100's on all 4 speeches. The tests were in my opinion very tricky due to wording...but she gives extra credit for being time keeper and such in class. Not hard if you listen to what SHE wants! Highly recommended! :)

but she is a horrible teacher.  we had an examnext class, she did no reviewing, did not mention it. Iwent to her during office hours (which she sets aside to "help" students) to try to get somewhat of idea what to study for exam. From what i gathered, I studied (and expected)half of exam. She likes to make people fall. DO NOT TAKE HER.
She is awesome!!!!! Always trying to help students release tension before doing their speeches!!! Phenomenal class. I highly recommend her!!!!

I wasn't looking forward to taking public speaking, but she made it easy. She is really nice and helpful. Only four speeches total and the lectures are straight from the book so if you miss a day all you have to do is read the chapter she went over. She is fair with grading and tells you exactly what will be on the exams. Defiantly recommend her fo
If you listen to her instructions and pay attention in class, it is an easy A. She grades you on your personal progress in speeches. 4 speeches total.
I took the EMB race and gender. The class was super boring! Papers due at most once a week. Watch a lot of movies.

Ann Taylor is a very easy instructor. If you follow what she wants in your speeches you will almost always get an A on the speech. The tests are really hard. I studied for a week for the final and still thought it was hard. Overall Ann Taylor is an easy instructor and she makes you feel comfortable. We had 4 speeches and an Impromtu speech!!
She is pretty easy all around. But she takes no excuses and is not afraid to take points off. She trys to be funny which makes her funny. She is worth taking.
This is a great teacher and is easy. She makes giving speaches easy.  The lowest I have gotten on a speech in a 95. She is starting to put her tests online and they are very easy.

Name: Jim Hughes
Comment: I took Prof. Hughes for BIS 300, His class is one of the worst I've ever taken, not because of the content, but because of his teaching style. He spends little time talking about content, usually talks about his life and how he's been married 4 times. There are a lot of long assignments that you're on your own with. Take any other prof. than him...

Professor Hughes was okay. Lectures were not interesting, and got boring. Weekly 10 true false quizzes. 7 assignment projects on Excel, Access, and creating on online website. 3 exams including the final, he provides a study guide so the exams and quizzes are easy. There were a few "pop" assignments that came up.
Nice Professor. A bit too much work but you get what you what you work for. would take again easily.

I took this class as a part of my integration into a finance major. I took Professor hughes for bus-300. He will not respond to your emails, so do not bother emailing him. I took this class online. The final project required a program called Crystal Reports which I did not have access to. It was not stated in the syllabus that I needed this.

Mr. Jim Hughes is a pretty nice guy, he is older and has a dated teaching style. Course material is not difficult, just a ton of memorization. Tests are all essay format and you need to study for them. Gives homework usually once a week. If you go to class everyday, study for tests and pay attention to lecture you will easily pass. Book is used.

I enjoyed his class and you can definitely use what is taught in life.  I use his class everyday.  The homework is easy.  The tests are hard unless you know how to study for them.  He tells you everything on the test, just memorize it all and you will get an A.  He has a lot of interesting life stories.  If you need help, talk to him after class.
He's so boring, the work is dull, and he doesn't respond to any emails. Rants about his dogs. Terrible professor, don't take if not necessary for graduation.

This class is an easy A if you attend and turn in homework. Do not expect to get any grades besides midterm and final grade. He does not grade anything at all and will not show you your grades. He thinks the class is some kind of game and it gets annoying. If you do not have to take this class then don't. If you do, show up and do your homework.

This is a good class if you need to take a nap... Its all you have to do is show up and take the weekly pop quizzes (which he gives the answers to in class DURING the quiz) and go to the lab and do the assignments to get an A. Even if you get C's and D's on the tests (like me) you can still pass with an A+

His class was simply put, boring. Everything is on a power point, and it's obvious that he didn't try to update them. The class was easy, but he didn't grade until the last minute. He never responds to emails. He gets annoyed if your point of view differs from his. Don't take his class if you're sensitive. In fact, just don't take it if not needed.

I do not recommend taking this professor for your Inf 101 course.  500 terms per test covered in book and power points with little to no guide as what to focus on.  I received an A but the class average for the first test was in the 60's.  He doesn't teach just repeats terms on the premade power points.

Thought it was an easy class, I got an A in it. He is willing to help if you ask. If you don't do good on the test it really doesn't hurt your grade as long as you do good on the labs and come to class everyday.

This clas was very boring. You have a lecture and a lab per week. For the many times I wanted to skip class I couldn't b/c he would have "pop quizzes" during the lecture classes (which he will hint the answer to you). Overall it was pretty easy, but extremely boring. So it is your call if you want to go to class or not.

Overall very easy class. Boring, but as long as you do the work, you will get an A. Go to lectures because pop quizzes are given. He makes lots of jokes during class that aren't really funny, but at least he tries.

DIDN'T LEARN ANYTHING! It is easy, but don't look for any real learning to occur.The test are the most random questions that don't prove any understanding of computers.You will get an A if you do the work don't stress when you do poorly on the test. Don't go to lectures its a waste but make sure you go to lab.Horribly usless only take if required
Hughes was a good teacher and funny too. Class was tedious because of the nature of computer class. All and all it wasn't to bad. Extra credit is offered.

I learned quite a bit of useful information in the class and he seemed to be very helpful during class. However, the lecture part of this class was extremely boring and the tests were really challenging. Most of the stuff I studied didn't even seem to be on the test. Overall not horrible but not great.

he is a nice person, but class is extremely BORING!!! he will NEVER respond to your emails so do not even bother to email him. His tests are VERY VERY hard. assignments and projects are easy, go to class because he gives extra credit sometimes! hes not an interesting professor AT ALL!

One of 2 classes I've had him teach. Both times, I had to wait until the last week to receive any grades. You have no idea how well/poorly you're doing. He never responds to emails/phone calls. He only responds when turned into the chair of the department. If you're going to teach business courses, you should know how business works. Terrible!

On the first day of class, he made these outragous threats about how this class was going to be the hardest class in our college career, so 8 or so people ended up dropping after the first class But that wasn't the case of all. I think most of our class ended up with "B's" easiy and I highly doubt anyone got below a "C."

Name: Alix Pitra
Comment: Very fair grader, wants students to succeed and wiling to help. She has trouble expressing herself in english sometimes, but you can learn easily if you ask her direct questions. A lot of class time is dedicated to text book exercises

Alix is a very nice person, but shouldn't be teaching a French class. She doesn't understand or know our language well enough to be teaching quite yet. She's really flexible with things. Her class really isn't french-speaking like it states in the syllabus so don't get frightened away. Don't take her class if you want to learn the language.

Alix is a wonderful teacher.  She has been very patient with me while I have been learning french and does what she can with some of the other unmotivated students in our class.  I think she is very good and hope to take another class of hers soon.  Au revoir !

Alix is a great person, but her French class is a joke. You do barely any speaking, and when it comes to the tests, she expects you to know it all. She grades REALLY easy though, and she's really cute when she tries to express what she's saying in English, and can't find the words. I'd say take the class with someone else if you can.

Name: Smita Ward
Comment: I had Dr. Ward years ago, and really enjoyed the structure of her class. She would read from the study guide given to us and we had to fill in the blanks. The tests were straight from these guides as well. If you came to class, she usually gave extra credit for that and had chances for extra credit on tests as well.

Seriously the worst professor I've ever had. The class I took was a 7 week online class, & she didn't post a single thing until the second week of classes. She didn't post any modules the entire time. She would post an assignment on Mon every week (sometimes Tue or Wed), but until then there was no heads up about assignments. Very unorganized

Lectures are very boring and tests are very unclear. Reads the notes word for word the entire class. She also has medical conditions which caused her to miss class so much, we were assigned a permanent replacement substitute. She emphasized the importance of showing up to class, which was ironic, because she missed more than any of the students.

I would not recommend Dr. Ward as a professor. She just reads her notes in a monotone voice and goes on tangents about random stuff. She cancels class a lot due to a back condition so, you feel like you aren't truly learning anything.

In the class there are 4 tests total, that do not go with the notes she prepares you with. She reads her notes right off of the slide, when or if she makes it to class that day. She does offer some extra credit but no other grade boosters.

She reads straight from her notes but they don't have details. She cancels class and has A LOT of medical issues that make it hard for her to teach. Her tests are hard, so study a lot because there are not a lot of chances to make it up. She says that you don't need the book but you do if you want to get a good grade

Dr. Ward is a very kind lady, however her lectures are very hard to follow, and she simply reads off of the paper. Her tests are extremely hard, and she doesn't prepare you well for them. She knows her stuff, but isn't able to relay that onto the class lecture.

Dr. Ward is very unorganized, and she will not respond to your emails. She cancels class a lot, and just reads off her notes outlines during lectures. You basically have to learn the material yourself. I would not take her again.

She would type outlines for notes and during class would just read us everything word for word on the outline she puts on Canvas. We don't have many assignments so if you do badly on one, you are screwed. She also will not let you redo anything or make anything up. She offers some extra credit to try to make it up though.

This was a 300 level class but it was easier than PSY 100. She cancelled class, sometimes without notice, had trouble breathing, and always in pain and tired which made her not extremely motivated. Super sweet but goes on long tangents about random stuff. Never studied and still got an A because her class was mostly common sense. Expect papers!
We ended up on chapter three within like 7 days because she just summarizes each chapter in a study guide thing and goes over those.

Dr. Ward is okay. She's dull, but shes a very sweet lady. She does care for her students and their education. Lectures are kinda hard to pay attention to, as all she does is read from a document (that can be scattered and hard to decipher). Just go to class, study a bit before exams, and take the extra credit and youll be fine. No book needed.

Overall a good class. The class is entirely lecture based - don't by the $100 textbook, you won't use it. The lectures can be very dry, even though the subject matter is interesting. While attendance isn't mandatory, expect a C or B if you skip often, and an A if you show up. Tests are all multiple choice with 10 extra credit. Use Quizlet!

She gives you 5 papers over the whole semester a paragraph each. You take about 5 tests over a few chapters at a time. She only grades over papers, tests and sona points. Overall make sure you do the papers you'll do fine.
I loved Dr. Ward her lectures were very structured. Tests are somewhat difficult but she makes it easy to succeed in her class. I highly recommend taking her class.
Gave a lot of reflection assignments. Had to add things to her notes from book, but she do review with you before test.
Wording on notes and tests was confusing. Final was suppose to be short answer, it ended up being essay questions that was mostly opinion based that you had to defended that she graded very hard on.

Dr. Ward is a really sweet person, but that doesn't matter when lectures are cancelled w/o notice and the lectures that are held are cut short. She will tell you you don't need the book, BUT her notes don't make sense, so buy the book and study for yourself. Potential to be an awesome topic, but she ruins it. Attendance is mandatory.

I'm genuinely concerned for the health of this woman as she drinks a Mountain Dew every single class (I had her 3x a week). Getting a bit too old for technology. A very sweet lady, but very dry & so-so on exam preparedness. She tells you you don't need the book but constantly tells you to reference it in class ?

Not a hard class to pass, but I learned very little. She lectures from a word document, and is very dry. She speaks slowly, and I struggled to stay awake. She sits behind the computer for the whole lecture, which for no particular reason, bother me immensely.

Name: Gary Scott
Comment: Mr. Scott at first didn't seem too bad, but because I didn't triple check the syllabus- my 97 dropped down to an 81 because he had the final test due on a Saturday night when everything else was due on Sunday nights. There are only 3 tests and literally every question was taken from quizlets. The work was really easy, but he is kind of picky on it.

This class was easy. Not going to lie, but the professor himself is a joke. Grades are sent via email, most unorganized class ever, dude said he accidental missed the deadline to give final grades... they are still not entered. Such a joke. Also be prepared to buy expensive textbooks and buy Microsoft 2013.
Alright teacher, for an online class follows the rubric and the work is easy.  If you don't do everything they way he wants it done even if you do it right he counts it wrong and takes points off.

The class material is very dull and boring to read, that being said Professor Scott does have a very well organized syllabus which he follows perfectly, so there are no surprises.  I took the accelerated online class, which made the reading ovewhelming (105 pg/wk) on top of assignments ands and 3 tests. Wouldn't recommend taking online.

He does not "teach" anything.  You pay $150.00 for an online book with access to a website.  His lessons are read this and this and complete this assignment. He has put zero effort into this class. Do not take this class if you are not already a moderate user of Microsoft Office.
He's a good professor.  He knows what he is doing.  Follow directions very carefully on the assignments, or you will get marked off significantly on your grade.

this is generally an easy class. he takes attendance everyday but you only need to go if there is an in class assignment or test. grade consists of 7 in class assignments and three tests. for each test we get a study guide that usually has the exact questions. everything that is due you must do in class the day that it is due or he will not accept

Very nice professor. Classes are really boring though but it's not his fault. Attendance is not mandatory and the powerpoint notes are on blackboard. tests are really easy. the class might be a little better online.

Class was pretty easy, just keep up with work.  He takes off a lot of points for a little mistake, but its an easy A or B if you try.  He is very nice and helpful, Access is really hard though, so pay attention when you get to that.

Gary was a good teacher. This class is very easy but for alot of people that do not know much about microsoft office especially the new 07 version its helpful to take because you can learn how to use it espeically if you are used to the older ones. Gary is very helpful if you have any questions and he lets you do what you want on lecture days.

This class is easy, but mind numbingly boring.  Professor Scott is extremely helpful and his class isn't very hard, but horribly boring.  Make sure to go to class at least once a week, and you'll be fine.

Gary's class is very easy and simple.  Just follow along with the book he goes slower than most people need but makes the class easier.  He is very thorough.  Will take off points if you are late and miss certain amount of classes.  Very Fun and EAsy
Good teacher, nice guy, get there on time, very particular about the material but you have to be.

He is really nice but the voice is monotoned. His test questions tend to not be anything you've talked about throughout class. You will get a weekly homework assignment. I think he grades every little detail and that brings down your grade but he is worth taking.

This class is the definition of boring.  He is very monotone and its hard to concentrate. He is a super nice guy but gets frustrated easily. DO NOT surf the net while he is teaching its RUDE and distracting to others who are sitting around you. HW is assigned once a week you get three days to do it. The tests always have a curve..
must go to class he takes attendance everyday but the material is super easy. an easy A.

He so boring and monotone, but he knows the material and will not leave anyone behind. Easy A whether you know the material already or not. He curved every test and takes lots of homework grades. Also, come to class everyday because he takes attendence.

Considering I knew all about the Microsoft programs when I walked into class, the class was a breeze. He so boring and monotone, but he knows the material and will not leave anyone behind. Easy A whether you know the material already or not.

Gary Scott is a great teacher, he grades like this is a 300 level course but always gives an A if you do the work which is not hard at all, his exams are difficult because the exams are not written clearly, but you can make up for that with the homework. You will get a B if not higher in this class. Overall, take him!

Name: Alain Krapl
Comment: This class was super easy for me, 6 hw assignments only 3 graded and 4 exams. Exams werent bad bc he lets you use a formula sheet where you can write anything you want which made exams easy. If you pay attention and write good notes you should be fine, but if you take bad notes you're screwed. Follow everything he says and write it down.

I would definitely take him again! The homework sets were graded but useful because you could practice. He is a genuinely nice person. The only hard thing is that he doesn't have slides so you have to write down anything he says! But that was good for me because it kept me focused during lecture! The exam on bonds was the hardest but the rest is ok

It's a difficult class in general so can't fault Krapl for that. He does well really teaching the material you need to know for the HW (3) & Exams (3) - Only Grades.. Take plenty of notes.. sometimes he'll lose you because there's so many terms and formulas so follow along. Test 1 is the easiest, DO NOT SLACK AFTER THAT FIRST EXAM.. it gets tough!

I would attend classes, I could tell when I missed a few as I felt like I fell far behind. Four test and 6 hard copy homework assignments (3 are graded). Do not utilize Blackboard/Canvas so you have to keep track of your own grade throughout which isn't difficult to do.. every test is 25 questions and structured similarly as is homework.

He has gotten rude since the beginning of the semester. He has not answered multiple question that I have asked. He won't meet outside of class to answer questions. He cut the final short and few people actually finished the exam. Currently he is the only professor for this class unfortunately.
So far he's a great teacher. He is very personable and very common sense minded. I almost wish I had more Finance classes to take because of him.   5/5... Would sign up again.
Great professor!

I really liked Dr. Krapl. He was funny in lectures, and very helpful if you needed it.
