He established exactly what was important for the class, and then spend abundant class time teaching (and re-teaching) it. Homework, quizzes, and tests all shared the same basic structure and content.  If he didn't mention it in class it was not on the test.

He's a very nice teacher, but the subject matter was difficult for me.  Many of my classmates that were finance majors really liked him.  I had a hard time understanding, but he answered all of my questions and emails very quickly.  The tests were difficult but 2 projects, that were worth as much as the tests, saved my grade.

Seriously the worse Finance professor I have ever had I seriously think Devoto is better yet I feel they are equally as hard. He uses a book that is free online but it is hard to understand. He has problems on tests but never does any in class. Its a req. class next year so good luck to you all!!!

Name: Katie Englert
Comment: You read a lot and recite information like a trained animal.  If you do any critical thinking you will fail.  She is more of an anthropologists rather than a professor as people in teaching positions should be open minded.  You can pass this class easily with a lot of reading, but you won't learn anything useful and it is insanely boring.

Professor Englert is awesome.  She has a passion for anthropology and it shows.  There is a ton of reading involved in this course, but every bit of it is relevant and tied directly to the assignments.  She does a great job of encouraging students to think beyond the text with the weekly discussion boards.  One of the best professors I've had.

Katie's class was a lot of fun. She does like for you to read - a lot; but her testing and material will be pretty easy if you do the reading you are assigned. While I had to work to keep up with the pace of the material, it's a great learning experience.
Online class, she expects a lot. The journals and discussion are every week and they take a long time. LOTS of reading.

Katie is super friendly, knowledgeable and clear.  She's got a lot of assignments, but they all relate and will only further your knowledge.  This class was very enlightening and it made anthropology fun and interesting.  I feel like I learned a lot and I would take an online class with her again.
This was an online class and I had expected the work load to be heavier but this class exceeded even those expectations. Lots of busy work, we were constantly doing something.
A lot of reading and test were not very easy. Busy work which is part of it being a 100 level class.. Overall class and teacher were interesting.

took online- was a lot of reading (two books), a DVD, power point, a weekly letter to read which did help clarify things, weekly discussion board - OH yah and a weekly quiz on the reading that has multi essay questions.. overall class ok.. wont take anymore online classes because I spend days reading (in all my online classes not just this one)

I took cultural anthropology as an online course with Professor Englert. She was VERY straightforward and it was easy to know what was needed to get the grade I wanted. She had a weekly letter stating what assignments would be due in the next 2 weeks. She was very nice when she e-mailed responses.  Plus, the content was interesting too.
Class was very straightforward.  You took notes, knew what was going to be on the test.  She's fun, a little dry on lectures, but overall, if you try, you'll do good.
She is a wonderful professor. I loved taking her class!

Hardly an anthropologist, I would call her “field work” tourism. Don't bother buying the text book you wont need to read, you don't have to come to class, however if you do chose to you'll be sitting through a power point every single day. Two or three films and a class presentation, This class was a joke because of her poor attempts at teaching.
She is a very helpful teacher. She does talk alot but her test are easy. She is very fair. You will enjoy her movies
very nice and easy to understand.  ALOT of homework, but pretty interesting stuff.  She graded very fairly.  Wish more teachers were like her.
Great. Her class is not difficult, you do have to do a few papers, but she is very helpful wiht giving advice on how to do them. Loved her stories from her field work.
Super good.  Like her stuff on New Guinea.
dedicated part-timer

Name: Patricia Curran
Comment: talks to you like your a child. thinks that she is right about everything. told me to hire a tutor for writing. she does know what she is talking about but she gets off topic and rambles on and on about stupid things.... couldnt stand her...

She is a little out there but it is a easy A if you show up and do the work.  The work is even easy it's just reading and answering a few questions on what you read.  You do have to tolerate her rambling and occasional accidental insults but its worth it for a easy class and an A.

If you get the chance, TAKE HER!!! She is a little out there and will go off and start talking about the most random information, but I loved that class. As long as you go to class, and do your homework you will pass with flying colors. I got an A with ease and I'm totally not an english person. You won't regret it and will learn so much!

She was an aweful professor.  She talked to you as if you were still in high school. I do not recommend this lady at all. Show up for class because she lowers you by a letter grade if you miss 2 classes. If you do miss class, bring a doctors note and she wont count it. Made me want to poke my eye balls out with my pen.

She is very easy but need a HUGE lesson on manners.  She puts you down in class and tells you that your education you received was poor.  She needs to grow up and start living with the times.  I would not reconment taking this person who calls themselves a teacher.  She takes off points for not saying words correctly when she can not even do it. F-

The only thing I could not stand, was the way she talks to her students. I seriously feel like a two year old when I'm in her class. BUT if you do the work you will ace the class, it's so easy. Just read short stories and take quizzes.

EASY EASY EASY! If you do the work you will get an A. Attendence is MANDATORY she even takes tardies. Does talk to you like a child, half the time i didn't even know what she was talking about because she gets herself off track a lot. If you are just taking this for gen ed's TAKE THIS CLASS.
Will talk to you like a child.  Easy course as long as you do what she wants and dont fight it. Found myself writing to please her more often then writing what I though
VERY HOT

Treated us like 3rd graders. Always harped on how some high schools were better, & if you didn't go to one of those schools, she more or less assumed you were deprived of a proper education & have no way of understanding MLA format or reading for yourself. If there was a list, we went through the class, one by one, reading the words. Try to avoid.

take her.. easy class. she's a bit opinionated, but its all in good fun! easy class, i was disappointed i got a B when i expected an A. i had a 89.5 before i turned in my last takehome quiz. :( but otherwise good fun easy class for literature.

Take her!  She is great, VERY organized!  She is strict with grammer, but it's a college English course, you have to expect that!  Very dear lady, has the best interest of the student at heart and is funny in her own little way.

Name: Marla Cordray
Comment: goes at a good pace and explains concepts clearly.
She is a good professor. Tests and homeworks are easy. Show up and you'll do great.
very good at explaining concepts. Writes everything on board. Easy test and quizes.
She goes over the material at a good pace and makes it very clear.  She is young and very easy on the eyes.

Name: Janis Broering
Comment: She is a great teacher. She explains the content very well and if you still don't understand the material, she will go over it again if necessary. VERY HELPFUL outside of class! Every time I emailed her about homework, she replied quickly and to the best of her ability. I learned so much from her and would definitely take her class again.

I've never understood math until this class. This professor is GREAT at teaching to those of whom havent been able to pick up simple math. Had I had her in high school I dont think I would have even needed this remedial class! Super sweet, informative and eager to help/work with you one on one. Highly recommend!
She assigns a lot of homework, both online and from the textbook. But, you can use the online textbook which is cheaper as opposed to buying the hardcover textbook.

gives a lot of homework but doesn't collect it. quizzes are straight from the homework and you can use it to copy down answers. tests are easy and allows for test retakes to gain points back. bad thing is sometimes she gets really confused and writes down the wrong numbers or signs but just be patient. would highly recommend!
Real friendly and helpful. Always clear with everything she taught, and would always be happy to help. Show up and keep up with homework and you'll be fine.
boring class .. quiz every week .. test every 2weeks.. a lot of homework .. do not take her !!

Great Professor, learned a lot!! I hated Math because I never got it in High School but now I learn everything so easily. She is a tad bit boring but just listen and you'll learn. Three Words GO TO CLASS! A quiz every week, test every two weeks, and a lot of homework but it helps a lot!
dony take her if u suck at math  to much homework and there is always homework due everyday a 20 pt quiz every week and 100 pt test every work way to much work for a 099 class

i was not very good at statistics, so that affected my grade- but she was not very clear in her teaching at all. class attendance was not mandatory, but if you don't go you won't understand anything and it is hard to catch up.

Boring class, I had to struggle to stay focused, but the quizzes were easy (came right from the homework.)  Picky with wording when grading exams.  I got a B but did not put forth much effort  ;)    Easy class.
Boorrrrrring!!! Not bad teacher but mono tone and boring

Best stat professor! ALL of the quizes are from your h/w questions which she will go over with everyone can during class. Tests include one of the problems from your h/w. I got an A in the class and I was horrified to take Stat. DO THE H/W! She helped me with any of my h/w in her office hrs. She is VERY picky on your wording on the exams. GO 2 CLAS
LOVE her! I enjoy math but never had taken stats before.  She is extremely helpful and so nice!  TOTALLY recommend her...the class is a lot of work but she tries to make it as clear as possible!

Do not take this instructor during the summer. She gives you way to much homework to get done in one day, And if you have a job, might as well quit it.  She doesn't make Mah 99 clear on how to do work.

Mrs. Broering was an awesome teacher! I learned a great deal in class. The homework is lengthy, but all stats hw is going to be! The quizzes come staright from your homework. There are 3 tests and a final. You get to use your formula sheet on all the tests, including exam. Attendance is mandatory if your wanting to earn an A! Recommended class!

She was okay. Quizzes are easy as long as you do the HW. She could be very boring and her voice was monotonous. I fell asleep a lot bc of this and I sat in the front row! Of course, it's Stats, so how interesting could it be. She got snippy w/ppl sumtimes when they asked questions. But overall, I've heard she is better than other Stats profs.
Amazing. will work you hard but you will learn a ton, she is very serious and crystal clear in class.  She will go out of her way to help students.
Very detailed instructor.  You will have a lot of homework.  She is awesome.  I went into the class hoping to pass because of statistic horror stories and ended up with a B.
The easiest stats teacher there is. Seriously.

She is very helpful, but gives lots of HW(which I am sure a lot of math professors do. She grades hard for a remedial level math class. If you miss just something small she will mark it. Otherwise she does explain everything well, but math is not my favorite--very bad in it. Take her if you can(math modules).

Name: Ann Hamill
Comment: I would not necessarily take this for an "easy A." That's what I thought it was going to be-- it was not. You do have to do all of the readings to be successful. However, overall, it is a very interesting class, and not too hard.

Her class was fun with amazing lectures and discussions! However, there are a lot of readings and you must read all of them to do the quizzes. There are many interesting and new things in her course that you need to know. She gives good feedbacks too.

I adore professor Hamil. She is one of the most amazing women I've met! She speaks with a tremor, but it's still easy to understand her and I didn't even notice it at the end, tbh. She assigns readings before every class and gives 5 pop quizzes throughout the semester. Her 'essays' are super easy and as long as you do them, you should pass easily!

very difficult to stay with, sometimes goes off-topic and doesn't make sense. the class is global inequalities but weve only talked about global things once for about a week. there are hardly any grades so stay on top of everything. she favors the people that talk during class (a lot) she is a hard grader her reasonings are picky. you read a lot

this class was super unenjoyable and boring. There are a ton of long readings and assignments every week. The professor is very old and hard to understand at times. Definitely not a class to take for an easy A. However, I never read bc there are optional study guides you can do for each reading that are the same ?s on the 5 pop quizzes.

I would not recommend if you're looking for an easy Gen Ed. You have to read long articles every night and you have pop quizzes over them. there is study guides to go along with the readings if you do you'll do fine on the pop quizzes though. Very boring class if you're not interested in global inequalities.
She is the most caring professor I have met at NKU. Show up to class prepared. She gives excellent feedback on assigments. Make sure to show up to class, she takes attendance. Overall easy A.

Unless you want to spend time reading long, pointless articles that you will be quizzed on over the most minute details, do not take this course. Very boring, don't really have to pay attention. Makes you do uncomfortable assignments that while not terrible, aren't something that should be mandatory for a grade.

Professor Ann would be recommended for a Gen-Ed easy A. She is one of the most genuine people to be around. She cares and would probably do a lot to help a student out if needed. You just need patience to sit in her class. Overall easy A
She is a very nice and respectful professor. I learned a lot in this class. I never missed her class. The only things that I hated were the pop quizzes and the long readings.

This class is easy to pass as long as you do the assignments. She is very nice, but it is really hard to pay attention in class. Sometimes she doesn't make sense so even when you do pay attention you're confused. Overall an easy A if you have the patience.
She is very nice and respectful, but she makes you read a lot of irrelevant articles. I still do recommend her, because the class is an easy class to pass.
5 pop quizzes, the rest of the course is just the 3 part project and essay exams. Overall easy class, but hard to understand lectures sometimes. LOTS of reading.
She assigns a lot of outside work and makes you go over the crazy long study guides in class, but her tests are straight from them. She is an okay professor just a little on the boring side.

When I first got to this class I was really irritated because Prof. Hamill had a speaking issue and it was hard to understand her. As the semester went on, I realized that although I do not agree with most of her lectures, her tests are directly off the study guides. The study guides take a while to do but if you do them you will ace the exams.
It seems as if its hard for her to get the words out when she speaks. She gives you study guides, but nothing on the study guide is on the actual test.
Super rude. Not helpful at all.
Very caring! If you participate enough and come to class, it will help you in the long run! Tests are pretty easy, just read the material. Prepare to be in groups sometimes!
She might seem a bit tough, but honestly all she expects is for you to genuinely put forth effort and learn. If you want an effortless class, this is not the one for you.

I love professor Hamill, she is such a sweet lady! She can be confusing at times, but if you show up to class and ask questions, the class is pretty easy. There are a few papers, but they aren't bad. She also gives you a study guide for every reading and a big study guide before each exam. I recommend her class!

Name: Nathan Gabriel
Comment: Professor makes the class about real life. All the reading material relates back to what is actually happening out in the world so it's interesting to read about.

Get ready to read! This class is A LOT of work. Read a play every week, quiz on the play every week, 4 or 5 discussion posts a week on the play, responding to another classmates discussion post on each discussion. Professor seems like he cares a lot and wants you to succeed, but if your looking for an easy class and not much work, skip this one.

Such a nice and caring professor. There is however a lot to read. Each week you read a play (takes 1-2 hours to read at one sitting, but are good plays and I do not like theatre) and an additional piece he selects and then we must complete a series of easy discussion posts (around 3-5 per play) tests are SUPER EASY. no reason to fail this course.

Name: Suzanne Deluca
Comment: really energetic in class. it's all lecture all the time. very open to questions from students and always seems interested in what you say. sometimes picks on you if you're in the front but its completely bearable. 2 quizzes and 2 exams for whole course and 2 two page papers. very manageable.
SHE IS THE BEST PROFESSOR EVER. Easy class, two 2 page papers and 4 tests/quizes all semester. If you fail you're stupid.

Name: Barry Rost
Comment: Easy A class as long as you do the homework and come to class.

easy test and quiz .. Can not explain for class .. he give every class about 30 question
 for homework..

At the beginning of the semester I was not sure about Prof. Rost. However as time went on I realized I was learning quite a bit from him. His tests are very easy and he will work with you if you need help. I definitely recommend taking him.

He is always rushing to get through chapters before the class can learn anything. However he does give you practice quizzes and tests which are exactly like the real ones only with different numbers. These did seem to help a lot.

awful teacher.  yelled at us when the class did poorly but never would go over exams after taken.  very frustrating prof.  to have.  very disorganized and totally unprepared.  hand wrote quizes and also used old exams that he whited out one number and hand wrote in.  totally ridiculous that he thinks he can teach.
He gives you practice test that are just like the test

no clarity what so ever.  disorganized, and makes tons of mistakes on his papers, grading and on the board.  his grading is crazy, a 10 q exam with no partial credit is just crazy for a prereq course. if you need to know this math to go on, dont plan on learning from him. never went over exams taken before moving on. terrible teacher

He gives you a review quizzes and review tests that are exactly the same as the real test but with different numbers.  So if you study your reviews all you will have to do on the tests and quizzes is put in different numbers.  He tells you exactly what is going to be on them instead of giving you chapters its over like most teachers.
good

Name: Mel Petersen
Comment: Tough class but probably the best teacher for the class. Will meet with you upon request.

He has guided, clear notes that make studying and understanding super easy. He grades quizzes (which there are many) really quick, and exams. He gets grades into Blackboard fast as well. Very good teacher, but tests and quizzes tend to not be easy.

Name: Rachel Noll
Comment: She is a great teacher but does not grade anything until the last week of class! If you e-mail her she will take at least a day to email you back. All of your tests are online so I wouldn't buy the book! Just get the access code and you'll be set for the semester! I would defiantly take her again!
Super nice lady......decent teacher.  Take her, shes fun.

I was lucky because she deleted my classes Virtual Children. But she doesnt grade anything!  Dont bother emailing her because she will not reply! The discussions in class are about the most controversial topics and no matter how she really feels about it she will just disagree with you just so she can get a rise out of you

Attendance is mandatory. She puts you in groups and you will do assignments that way in class. She starts long class discussions that have little relevance to the subject matter, so you'll have to read the chapters and basically learn everything on your own. All that aside, it's a fairly easy class. There is just a ton of busy work.

Great teacher! You have online tests and a virtual child that you can do whenever- so you can get them done the 1st week and not have to worry about them for the rest of the sem. Really easy ch quizzes in class- just study the defs. and you'll be fine. I think the class was really interesting and even if you don't, she makes it very entertaining.

This is a busy class, but don't blow the assignments way out of proportion, they're easier than you may initially think. She makes the class enjoyable and fun. She is really nice, but pretty unorganized. I'd say go ahead and get all of the chapter tests out of the way asap and then the rest of the class is pretty low stress.

You have to remember so much stupid stuff including a Virtual Child (useless) your tests (there about 17) and on top of all that she grades NOTHING! The computer grades for her,scantron or you switch papers! She loads you with busywork, then doesn't grade it herself! If you are one minute late she won't let you in but you're not learning anyways.

She is nice and very funny but she expects A LOT. Textbook exams are very difficult. Lots of quizzes.  Parent Forums for my virtual child are difficult.  She is terrible at responding to emails and don't expect her to post grades or blackboard documents in a timely manner.  For our Midterm she posted the study guide the day before the exam even though she had promised two weeks earlier.  I like her class overall but be prepared for frustration. Online exams over every chapter.
Very good professor. She has every ability to make the class fun and easily tops the cake in the Education department.

Dr. Noll is a really helpful professor.  If you meet with her one on one, she will make sure you understand and are prepared for what you need.  ; I wish I could take her in a class that was more interesting.  She is a good professor, but she gets stuck with difficult topics.

Truly the WORST professor I have EVER had in my entire life!  She is the epitome of what is wrong with education today.  Obviously knew someone to get her current position as she is the MOST unprofessional, unintelligent, uninformed, and lazy "teacher" I know.  I have learned nothing from her and doubt I ever could.

Class normally consists of Power Point lectures.  She does have some activities here and there. Tests are online, but hard! Feel like things we covered in Power Points weren't on the test. No homework besides Virtual Child. I enjoy her class, funny personality.

I love Dr. Noll to death, but her class is super hard. She lectures every day and yells at us for not doing well on the test when she gives us trick questions. Aside from the grades, she's a great person and hilarious as she's constantly making fun of herself. If you take this class be prepared to study a lot!
If you like to know what your grades are, don't take her because she does not grade anything in a decent amount of time.
All of her tests are online--but don't let it fool you. They are the hardest tests I've ever taken. You can look up every single answer and still not pass. In class, she is great though!

Dr. Noll is awesome! She is so funny and enthusiastic. I would love to take her again. Her tests were all online and pretty challenging, actually. With assignments--let's just say papers due in September still have not been graded.

I had her last semester and deliberately took her again.  She's an awesome professor. She is hilarious.  She genuinely wants you to enjoy her class but she also wants you to work.  It's appropriately challenging for the course level and it's still fun.  Take her if you can!

I took this class over the summer so it was really fast paced but that's b/c we had to cover an entire semester in 5 weeks. She is HILARIOUS... you WILL NOT be bored in her class. She is friendly, helpful, entertaining. I really learned a lot and she is one of my favorite professors!
No Comments
So far my favorite teacher i've had in college!  She is amazing.  Makes class interesting and is willing to go the extra mile to make sure you understand the material.

Name: Jan Gallagher
Comment: She is understanding if you need to miss a class. That being said, if you miss a class you are going to regret it because you need to hear the lecture. The tests are pretty difficult and you're going to dread taking each one but if you read you'll do ok. There is also not much homework besides reading and a writing assignment. Would not take again.

Whenever I approached her for hep, she was very rude and not helpful in the least bit. She basically reads the textbook word for word during lecture. The tests are pretty difficult, and a lot of the time, you're not exactly sure what to expect. Blackboard materials would be useful. Would not recommend at all.

I had reservations about this class, but after the first class I found it very interesting. She was very clear on what we need to know and reviewed before every test. I thought she had a good sense of humor and was very understanding about obligations outside of class. Study your notes and you will get an A.

She's a little nutty but her "off-topic" rants always relate to the subject matter and usually involve her extensive world travel. She practically reads from the book, so I can't understand why some people did so poorly. It's college: go to class and study and you'll do well. 7 page research paper and presentation required, non-cumulative final.

She gets the point across through various rants that sometimes go off topic.  She's a zany little lady.  Very hard to approach because she always seems (and is) hostile.  Almost as if you were an inconvenience to her life.  She'll then smile at you as if it never happened the next time you talk...  Zany lady.
I had a hard time with this course. I'm very visual, she doesnt us blackboard at all or powerpoints or hand outs making it hard to follow sometimes. She only gives tests and they were super hard.

She is a very good professor. I I hardly studied for the test and got high C's on all of them. She  is very funny I really enjoyed her class. I didn't take a lot of notes but if you went to class right before a test she went over everything. don't bother to buy the book you will never use it. its a waste of money. TAKE HER :)

Ive been taking Health Ethics for the past month. just got a 74% on the test and I dont ever get C's. She provides NO studyguide and admits 2 trying 2 trick u on the test. Shes a very nice, outgoing lady but Im not used to her teaching style. The class is extremely boring and hard 2 go to 3 times a week. I would try to get around taking the class!!

She's a spitfire, which makes this class fun. However if you ask her a question she seems put off by it, or even answering something you had originally thought was right but was wrong she'd also look at you as though you were stupid. She's very intelligent and amusing for classes which makes it interesting, but she's also rude to students.

She can be rude to students.  But her tests are easy enough that you just need to spend an hour studying them. A lot of it is just plain common sense. She's very understanding of obligations outside of class (i.e. sports, family, dr's appt., etc.) I would take her again.

I enjoyed her lectures and stories. Very funny lady. She does demand your undivided attention which isn't too much to ask. If you give that to her, she's cool. Tests are fairly easy.  My strategy is to quickly write what she says in class and rewrite my notes neater in outline format.  I didn't think note taking was too bad. I would take her again.

Yeah she keeps class interesting, but you can fall asleep at times.  But you really learn a lot, and it is an easy B if you don't try hard. She really deserves Thumbs up.Extra credit available.  We used book in class, but test were straight from notes. And not sure what to write half the time but listening to her can help to,PAY ATTENTION

A litte nutty, but that's what makes her fun! Insanely easy class. She gives reviews that basically ARE the tests. Won't tolerate loud/annoying students and will give them strange looks which is funnt!!! DO NOT BUY THE BOOK you will never use it. Just study off her guides. Scantron quizzes, 4 of them, plus 2 papers that will take 10minutes TAKE HER
She is a very strange person, but overall the class was easy.  she is very opinionated and her tests reflect her opinion, so study that and you will do ok!

This class is useless.  You learn nothing.  And don't have an opinion (or if you do, keep it to yourself!) Which is easy because there is no discussion.  You just listen to her talk, mostly.  She can be funny at times. Doesn't really like being asked questions, and hardly ever gave a straight answer.

this is the easiest class you will ever take, i took her for health care ethics and got an a... dont buy the book, you dont really have to go to class, but everything on the test she talks about in class, most is common sense, she is weird though!

After the first day of class I wanted to drop but I decided to stick it out and in the end I'M VERY GLAD I DID! She ended up being a very interesting person to listen to. She is even kinda funny at times! VERY VERY EASY A!
Very easy class, BUT she is strict and lashes out if you question her.  Test are a joke they are sooo easy.
WORST Professor EVER DON'T TAKE HER... took her in world religions .. have to write 10page paper
really liked her!!

Name: Rachelle Bruno
Comment: This class is extremely dry and boring! She is a very nice teacher and the assignments are fairly easy if you read the rubrics well. Takes points off for attendance even if it's excused, but for the most part she's good. Lots of busy work though and it's a pain for those of us who won't be spec. ed teachers.
Very sweet! She knows her stuff!  Just follow the rubrics and you will do great!
Very nice professor.  Sometimes comes across as condescending, but she truly wants you to understand the material.   She is a wonderful person.

Name: Greg De Blasio
Comment: Good teacher with lots to say, and knowledgeable about many topics. Is willing to accommodate to student's needs, and will help you. Quite a few speeches based on sections of the books we have to read. Will talk and tell stories for a while, but it isn't in a lecture kind of way. Cares about students, and not too many assignments at all.

Greg is a very nice person. He is a clear Expressive (if youre familiar with Social Styles) and has many ideas and thoughts flowing a mile per minute. This is why some people say hes unorganized and all over the place. However, he is extremely knowledgeablenot only in the PR realm, but in many aspectsand is willing to help whenever needed.

De Blasio is wonderful, get to know him and show him you care about your education and he will do whatever he can to help you. My top advice would be if you are confused just stay after class to talk to him, he is great 1 on 1.

De Blasio was a wonderful professor, I learned more from him than any other professor at NKU. He truly cares about his students and always has a good story to tell. I have personally seen him walk through assignments and exams with students to get them the best grades as possible. He is an extremely underrated asset to the PR program.

Dr. De Blasio is an animated fellow who teaches in a way that leads students to their own conclusions. Some say he doesn't set clear expectations, but I believe that to be an open door for students to get creative. You'll leave his class with a better vocabulary and a good idea of what you'll need for a solid portfolio when seeking a career in PR.

Very knowledgeable about PR, but the class itself lacks organization. He has very unclear expectations but is more than willing to answer any questions. Just always be ready for anything in his class. His Lecture are ok most days.

He is clearly very knowledgeable about the subject of PR, but he feels stuck in the past of the field and has trouble simplifying his expectations. He doesn't post grades online (ever) and assumes group projects can get done in a singe day.

I love Greg, I honestly really look up to him. He knows what hes talking about. He has some really good stories from all sorts of different things hes done (ask him about causing the police to purchase riot gear after pretending to book The Who when he was in high school, haha). Yes, he's a tough grader, but show that you care and you will be fine!

I can't begin to describe the lack or organization/communication in this class. While he does provide a schedule in the syllabus, do not expect to follow it AT ALL. He gets off track and you have no idea when a project really is due. At one point he announced the night before class, that a 3 page paper was due the next day. No respect for students!

Currently in PRE 377. I am not sure how I am doing as well as I am. He provides no clear direction on what he wants from you. He posts a 5 page midterm paper with only a couple of days and he explained what would be on the midterm by shrugging his shoulders and saying "what we've talked about". He is a very nice person but essentially just rambles.

I had Greg for PRE 376 and PRE 400. If you think Greg is hard, get out of this field because this is a glimpse of the real world, no one is going to hold your hand with this stuff and neither will he. He does get very off topic, but you will leave his class with a great portfolio of work. You will get an A if you be creative, guaranteed.

Literally the most difficult class I've ever had. This class was not helpful at all. He would go on random rants about PR that had nothing to do with the class and then all of a sudden tell us to "budget this PR account and create a campaign" without ANY guidance. I fought for my B!
TERRIBLE DON'T TAKE HIM! Avoid him at all cost.

I loved Deblasio! Everyone tried to talk me out of taking him, glad I didn't listen! He was an amazing professor and had a lot of interesting topics to talk about. Class was never boring!!! He is appropriately challenging for those who do not like homework I wouldn't recommend but for those of you that are realistic and know it's college and it's challenging he is amazing and I recommend him!

I was scared to take Greg by the rumors on here. I took Greg 3 TIMES! in one semester so i could graduate on time. It was alot of work but I learned alot and, Yes I recieved B's in all three classes. He makes you work and is very motivated and very knowledgable. He helps students with internships as well.

Basically like they said, if you want an A good luck. Taking both PRE 377 and 376 made my life a living nightmare. There's too much work in the beginning and then the take home exams don't really make sense to the class. If you're lost on the exams you don't really have a chance. The effort it takes to get even a B is ridiculous.

He is a fun guy. Very liberal, and not ashamed of it, but he knows his stuff. He has a tendency of rambling. He is very likeable and helpful. The assignments you do are useful for the real world; I learned a lot in this class. 6 assignments worth 65%, midterm and final worth 35% (both were take home). 3 group assignments- you pick the groups.
Really liked this class, got an A but had to work for it.  I learned a lot and feel in the future I can go to him for help. Work hard in this course and you will get the grade you deserve
very unorganized
Grading scale is ridiculous. He didn't teach anything I could not read out of the book myself. I would not recommend someone take him if they would like to make an A or get anything out of the class.

Name: Jean Becker
Comment: Ms. Becker is such a wonderful teacher. I would totally take her again if I could. She explains everything she can to the best of her ability. You just have to watch because she will talk about her life experiences, which might cause her to end up rushing through the materials toward the end of class, but she's great! She was also good in lab too!

She is by far the best professor Ive had my past 2 years at NKU. She makes sure you understand the material and is open for any questions you have. She has a pituitary (brain gland) tumor and she references that a lot. She is very lecture heavy and I had her for lab too. She's a great professor and it is an insanely hard class! Good luck!
Phenomenal teacher! BIO 208 is a hard class but if you're struggling she is willing to help and she gives really good advice. I loved her even though I really struggled.

Name: Gary Eippert
Comment: I have taken 3 classes with Gary now and he has been very helpful in each. I had to miss a week of class due to an emergency and he was very willing to work with me and gave me plenty of time to make up my assignments. Fair grader and not very many assignments where given. Definitely would take again.
Gary is a great teacher! Classes are always very easy and fun! Tests are easy too as long as your listen in class! HE IS MY FAVORITE PROFESSOR AT NKU!!!
Gary is a great teacher and I would take any of his classes again.  Gets very involved with the students. Tests are very easy! He's also very funny!

Mr. Eippert was very nice. I took his introduction to health online course. It was an easy A. As long as you do your assignments and don't put it off until the last minute you will have no problems in this class. He had us do health interviews and it was very fun.
Beginning tennis - easy. Show up and hit a ball around. Yeah, he can be a bit obnoxious, but oh well - hes very willing to help. Easy A.
Terrible!!! no direction.  i know some things about computers, i work at a computer company for petes sake, but he took off litttle points for "presentation" and lowered my grade to a B.  STAY AWAY
Mr. Eippert is annoying!! He is kinda rude too! His assignment where you have to tape yourself doing different techniques with badminton is tough bc YOU HAVE TO TEACH YOURSELF TO DO IT!!

How hard can a Badminton class be?  Learn the rules and the tests are simple.  Take the class with someone you know and play them in badminton all class.  For the final exam, you had to be able to hit the birdie on to certain areas of the court (drop shot just over the net, serve it into the back, hit it into a hoola hoop).  Easy class.
he is pretty childish, and annoying

He expected us to know computer techniques we could not have known without prior experience and then was rude when we did not understand his vauge directions. He told me that his exercises were "foolproof" and so when it did not work for me that I must not know how to read directions!  DO NOT TAKE A CLASS FROM HIM!
He creates tons of busy work for you to do. I can't stand him.
No Comments

Name: Callie Elizabeth Clare
Comment: Callie isn't bad but the class is very dry. Lots of powerpoint and readings with basically no devation. She gives good feedback on the writing and she seems to really care about her students. Good luck finding any other information on the class outside of her required textbook that she wrote though. Watch the lectures for sure and do the readings.

Let me start by saying Im sure Callie is a great person. She is very nice. However, as far as teaching this class it was awful. Straight reading from PowerPoint with no extended explanation. Readings are photo copies of old hard to read texts that are very relevant or up to date. Projects have unclear instructions. Dont take

Lectures are read directly from the powerpoint, almost no deviation at all. They are dry and boring. No tests, but lots of discussions on topics that are not expanded on. Reading the materials is the only way to get information, as lectures take heavy influence from the book. If you don't understand the topics in the book, the lecture won't help.

She found a way to take away any enjoyment that I had in this class. I was excited for this class, but it was all about comparing pop culture with folklore. We didn't dive into any folklore if that's what you're looking for. The one project that I was excited for wasn't good enough for her. It was the most boring class that I have ever taken.

Love Professor Clare. She's so quirky, fun and genuine! She's super helpful as well. Basically if you always go to class, participate in class convo's (usual funny), and take notes, studying for/doing well on tests are no problem. And the projects are super do-able.

Callie's classes were a lot better with the participation of the class. There is one research paper on a local icon or ritual (4 pages, double spaced, easy). She grades fair, only a mid term and final test wise. I had a blast in her class, and I'm glad I took it.

Professor Clare's class was not the most interesting. I had high expectations for the class, being that it is typically fun. No, this class was not at all. We didn't watch a single film the whole semester. The videos she showed were quite boring. I would not recommend taking this class unless it is required for your major.
She made up this term "Funhouse Mirror" which has no meaning at all. And then goes on to talk about it for the rest of the semester. Never talked about pop culture, only concepts.

Really enjoyed this class. All notes are on the board, and she does expect you to read (short readings). Very nice and encourages participation and everyone's ideas to be heard. Checks to make sure nobody has any questions over the material and if they do, tries to explain the info in different ways. Easy class if you pay attention. Recommend.

I love Callie! I have had her for 3 different classes. One was online. Her class is easy if you go and her tests are a little difficult but easier if you study and pay attention in class. She is a great professor. I highly recommend her!
Very easy. You work in partners on the assignments (4 page paper)she writes all notes on board and will help with any questions. She gives feedback fast I loved this class and had a blast.
This class was easy! We worked in partners on the assignments(4 page papers) it's very open and she writes all notes on the board. She isn't a hard professor. I enjoyed her class.

A boring class. You need the textbook and will have to attend class daily since she takes attendance. She grades papers and assignments hard. Her tests consist of short answers and essays, which she grades hard on as well. She expects a lot out of students sometimes and the way she explains theories and myths are terribly confusing.

She was alright. Not great, not terrible. Very high school style of teaching, though. I shouldn't have to trade papers with other students so that we can grade them. I shouldn't have to be taught how to do citations. If she gets away from this style of teaching, she could be alright. She can be a little repetitive, too.
Nothing extremely positive or negative to say. Decent enough, but rarely did I feel like I was learning anything especially new in her class.

Not one of my favorite classes, I believe she is a newer teacher and nice however, the class had more of a high school feel. I think as she does this more she will be an excellent teacher. I feel the material that is used needs to be updated and she did a good job to make it more current. Sometimes it was hard to connect everything.

Name: Irene Encarnacion
Comment: Professor Encarnacion is hilarious. I love her class so much and am taking her again next semester. The class moves extremely fast so always be ready to study and keep up on materials. A lot of learning is completed through the homework so never fall behind on that.

Super sweet and caring professor! I was a bit intimidated and extremely anxious for the first half of the semester because I felt underprepared, but she is very caring and understanding. Essays/Mindtap are a bit much if you aren't used to writing, but for the most part this class was easy and you pretty much just have to show up and participate.

She is a wonderful professor! She does give homework often but it is not hard and it helps teach you. Make sure you do the work before coming to class. The homework is when you learn, and in class is helping reinforce/clarify the lesson. She makes learning Spanish really fun, but make sure to pay attention and do the work!

She speaks mostly in Spanish and for beginners its hard to understand especially if don't speak Spanish or never been taught. I just feel like there's needs to be more of understanding of what is being said and teach for the beginners. I do not recommend!!!

Encarnacion talks in Spanish 95% of the time which can be difficult at first, but don't let it intimidate you. She is very understanding, and I have passed 2 of her 300+ lvl courses with A's as non-heritage speaker. Attendance matters and she's lecture heavy, but her class is interesting. She's a great pick, just pay attention and do the work.

Hated this class. Attendance is mandatory and will be counted against you even if you have a doctor's note or reason. She speaks in Spanish most of the time, so you must study. You can reach her via email, but it takes a thousand years to get back to you and keep an eye out on your grade because she may put in zeros for work you have turned in.

6 exams including the final. Has you complete long online mindtap sections every week as well as mini oral presentations which are graded fairly. She covers a lot during her lectures so you'll want to go to them to help you pass the exams. Very fun loving and caring, makes lectures fun!

Professor Encarnacion was very enjoyable to have. It has been 4 years since I last took a spanish class and she made getting back into it fun and exciting. You do have to keep up with the online program because that and various mini presentations are what make up your grade. If you put in the effort she do anything possible to help you succeed.

Others has criticism because Encarnacion uses mostly, if not all Spanish during her lectures. This is typical of all college-level languages as well as any high-school course after a semester or so. She is clear in her expectations, hilarious, and helpful. She uses mainly grammar and vocab from the course in her lecture, so study and care about it.

She is a kind person, and would do anything for her students. But I do not recommend taking her for a Spanish class. I took her Elementary Spanish 101 and she talked in Spanish the entire time. I had no idea what she was saying or how to reply back to her. The class started off with maybe 27 kids and ended with 10... do not recommend
doesnt tell you grades until midterms and finals but participation is heavy in the grade which makes it easy to pass if you forget about homework a lot like me

I would not recommend her to someone who doesn't remember the Spanish from high school. I hated the class because she went SO fast, I was very lost. She says her speaking spanish is part of it but day one? I don't think that's the best. I did not enjoy the class, very stressful and all over the place. :(

Prof. Encarnacion cares a lot about attendance; each day you miss is -20 points. She also doesn't use Canvas, so you won't know your grade unless you go to her office hours. She's normally 5-10 min late to class & doesn't respond emails. Profesora genuinely cares about the class & her students. Her teaching is unorthodox, but always interesting.
I would not recommend! She expects you to know a good amount of Spanish. She started the first day of class with speaking full on spanish.. soo be prepared. She also assigns a lot of homework..
Love her
Encarnacion genuinely cares about her students and loves to hear what they have to say. Shes very active as both a representative of the university and as a professor. 10/10 would recommend.

This was one of the hardest classes I have ever taken. Roughly 100 words minimum per chapter. She speaks Spanish most of the class which can be confusing in a beginner course. She does offer Extra credit which is nice. She is very bubbly and energetic which brings a new energy to the classroom.
I found her to be insulting and arrogant..  You will not find much support from her if you are struggling.  Look elsewhere for a Spanish class.

Speaks Spanish 90% of the time. Is unclear with assignments. Barely follows syllabus. There are no tests just essays and presentations. When she does give instructions, they go into excruciating detail or none at all. She is a lenient grader. She gives out random, out of the blue assignments, sometimes with huge time sinks or are group assignments.

I love Profesora Encarnacion! She is the cutest and always smiling and happy. She brightens your day. Her class is easy to pass if you put in the effort. She wants you to improve in the language, and that is her main goal of the course. Sometimes the assignments aren't very clear, but she is easy on grading so that's OK. I would def retake her!

Name: Teresa Phinney
Comment: It was a depressing class. Professor Phinney was difficult to read, I couldn't really tell what her mood was and she could be really intimidating at times. There is only one extra credit opportunity and that is worth a whole 2 points so be sure to keep that in mind.

I loved this professor! Nice teacher who cares about the course matter and her students. Class was not difficult and lectures were very helpful. Take this course for an easy A. Not to mention she is easy on the eyes....

Not really the greatest professor. She's an overall nice person who I'm sure cares about her job and her students, but she just gives off an attitude of indifference towards her teaching duties during class time. Class was very easy. Attendance/Textbook owning or reading wasn't required. Gave quizzes over chapter BEFORE discussing topics in class.

Name: Jeanne Holmes
Comment: I took Holmes for several HRM classes.  I felt that she was an awesome teacher and she could relate to the information she was teaching.  I recommend everyone to take her if you get the chance.

Professor Holmes has high expectations of students. I felt as though she was biased in rating groups and their projects. The test were easy, except the 2nd one and attendance is not mandatory. However, there is a lot of expections for students who are taking their first HR class and do not have it as their major.

One of my favorite professors at NKU. Experienced in her field, and helped class understand textbook principles by her stories. Very willing to help out students! She gives a test bank before test, so there will not be any surprises. The presentation for the class requires a lot of work, but overall and very good class. Would take Dr. Holmes again!

STAY AWAY! This prof is completely useless, she doesn't respond to emails, doesn't grade your work in anything close to a timely manner. 99% of her statements contradict what the book says but the book is what she uses for her tests-way easy class, but don't actually learn anything. Giving a poor name to the HR & Business Department at NKU!!

Name: Parmita Kapadia
Comment: She is unfair to her students. She does not follow her class rubric, when you communicate about test issues , she refuses to help you . She also does not give feedback or clear c criteria.

She kind of expects you to know things and misses the opportunity to define concepts or assist students in understanding the materials. Her video lectures are short but do hold valuable information. A lot of busy work with discussion board posts and required responses. But if you do the readings, you'll be fine.

Probably one of the worst professor's I've ever had in my entire life. She didn't seem like she cared about her students at all, and the grading was the WORST I've ever seen. I definitely would NOT recommend ANYONE to take her. Take another professor if you have the option.

Parmita Kapadia is a terrible professor. NKU should fire her. She never helps out with anything and is bad at giving feedback. DO NOT take this class and if you have to, change to a different professor!

Good professor but needs clearer expectations and more time on tests. Never gave expectations for discussion posts, so people wrote "don't know what/how to discuss." Tests required deep understanding of all seven books read. Only did well because can read and write well and fast. But had informative lectures and good time management  good grade.
MAKE SURE THAT YOU READ THE BOOKS THAT SHE ASSIGNS AND GO TO CLASS SO THAT YOU CAN GET NOTES ON THE BOOKS AND THE HISTORY BECAUSE ITS ON THE TESTS THAT SHE PUTS ON
Dr. Kapadia does not care about her students opinions or circumstances. She yelled at a student who clearly had ASD/some other social disability on our FIRST day of class. DO NOT TAKE HER.

Shes a mean professor who gives back unnecessarily sarcastic feedback that never helps, and if you ask for help she will always shoot you down or embarrass you in front of the class. Honestly shouldnt be a professor.

I had Dr. Kapadia for Film and Lit and Advanced College Writing. She is one of my favorite professors on campus; a reason I look for her classes specifically. She's fairly serious, but she is also really witty. She does care a lot about her students, especially students that are serious about her classes.

We only had discussion posts & 3 tests as our assignments. So not a lot of opportunities to redeem yourself if you do poorly on a test, which SUCKED. You also have to show up to pass. But she is an AMAZING teacher. I absolutely love her lectures. I learned so much and I would take her again if I could.

She has got to be one of the worst professors on the campus. She gives no rubric on how she grades the essays and even when you fix the notes she gave you, she just gives you more and doesnt bump up your score. Every time we got essays handed back I would here Another C!?!? around the class. She tries to justify herself by grading everyone hard.

Worst proffesor I've ever had! Dr. Kapadia shoots down eassay ideas and compains about not wanting to teach. She calls students out and her grading criteria is unclear. You're allowed to miss two classes, if you miss any more your letter grade drops by two. You also never see your grade in Canvas, unless it's mid-term or the end of the semester.

Dr. Kapadia was by no means my favorite professor. She only had 5 assignments (4 essays and attendance) and grade the essays very harshly. Everyone I asked or overheard talking in the class said they get mid C to low B on every essay even they fixed the notes on the previous essay. She will not give you any tests or exams in this class. Expect a C.
Professor Kapadia is one of my favorite professors. I highly encourage taking one of her courses. Tests are easy if you listen to lecture and take notes.

Dr. Kapadia has been one of my favorite english teachers of all time. ENG 291, now known as ENG 102 was required for my major. She gives amazing feedback and is willing to work with you to improve your writing if you're a good student. SHOW UP to class, participate in discussions, and show interest in making your writing better, and you'll do fine.
Go to class and get the book. Everything else is easy as pie. She's a bit intimidating at first but as long as you do the work she's easy to get along with. Tough grader but fair with assignments.

Professor Kapadia is awesome. She is funny, incredibly smart, and makes class as interesting as possible. She puts on a 'tough, uncaring' act on the first day, but is not at all hard to talk to-- she just demands respect, which is admirable. She really made the literature we examined interesting, I learned a lot!

One of the best Professor's I have ever had. On the first day she may come off a little not caring but she is so helpful. She gives great feed back but make sure you go to class. Everyday she dismissed class early . She has conferences with her students and they are so helpful. This is a class that you actually LEARN stuff  just put in some work.

There were only four total papers in her class, minimum room to escape one bad grade. She is a very tough grader. Some will say she's rude, I would say she's just blunt and straight forward. Attendance is part of the grade (apparently), so you don't miss class. The class before day a paper is due is optional to attend with no damage to your grade.

All the people saying Parmita is rude and doesn't care about her students are the ones that didn't care to work in her class. She's very specific with her lectures and will not ask you something that she didn't cover in class. Her lectures constantly leave me inspired and interested in the content. She makes you work, but she also makes you learn.

Name: Jay Human
Comment: with a 96 I failed because I missed a meet up outside of class due to emergency. other professors had no problem with my absence as I emailed them all beforehand. Mr. Human did not respond. My grade dropped instantly from A to F. He only allows absences from deaths. He also posted the wrong time for finals causing many students to miss it.

Would not recommend. Little effort was put into the class structure, multiple weeks of having in class time to work on projects may seem great but does not further my knowledge of accounting and I could just do that on my own.

I took Professor Human for both ACC 200 and 201 and he is genuinely a great professor. Accounting is difficult so it is a hard class, but he explains material very well and makes lectures bearable. There are only a couple homework assignments a week and he lets you use a note card on exams as well. I will always recommend him!

I had him in person and he was great. He was so easy and gave credit just for being there. I had him online and he wa horrible. If you submit an assignment even one minute late you will recieve a 0. He asks you to email him for questions yet when you email him, he either doesn't respond or tells you to look back the assignment. Would not recommed.

I was worried about this class because a lot of people fail. However, Jay has been awesome. He makes sure you understand the material and he is a super approachable nice guy. Always willing to help and an understanding grader on tests. Homework assignment once a week and occasional quizzes. Take him for class and lab!!
Very kind and like-able. If you attend class then you should have no problem.
Best professor I have ever had. Super personable and funny and made class interesting. By far, my favorite professor, he tells the best stories.
I hate accounting but he made it better. He really want s to help you do your best. Interesting stories in class.

If you follow instructions and turn everything the grading is easy. Everything is available early so you can work ahead. I had a problem with my filezila account and IT couldn't help me. I sent him a couple of screenshots and he showed me how to fix it right away. The only bad thing was too many assignments.

You can only contact via Email. No in-person meetings/sessions. Which really sucks, because this prof has the tendency to grade weeks behind of submitted work. Little to no extra credit opportunities. This prof is also real ambiguous in regards to makeup work/second chances at assignments. He'll take off 50% of late work within a week, that's it.
Great teacher. I dropped accounting before because of another teacher. J really cares and wants his students to do well. I wish he taught more classes. This class is so hard but he helped me pass.

He is one of the best teachers I had. He is so nice and was really helpful anytime I needed. He warned us that he was strict on late work because he wants to prepare you for the job world. The students who do bad wait until the last minute then complained that he graded hard. He expects you to follow instructions and you will get a good grade.

Takes forever to respond to emails. Sometimes he doesn't even respond at all. In AN ONLINE CLASS. Still blows my mind how that's possible. He doesn't even teach the class all he does is upload videos to watch. Blackboard grades the tests. So I'm not sure why he's considered a professor. The online video website is spotty as well.

I'd like to point out that not only are the other students reviewing here correct in his over-zealous approach to grading, the -10 and -20 points off are on a scale of 50 points per assignment. Miss a tag? Goodbye.

Avoid his section at all cost. Rarely emails back, waits weeks to grade multiple assignments. Takes points off for the most mundane things. Missing a title on your page? -10 pts. One line of code wrong? -30. Will just tell you that "one bad grade or 0 won't hurt you" but it will. It will hurt hard. Don't expect help, just no mercy. At all.

Terrible terrible, avoid at all cost. Grades WAY to hard especially for an intro level. it would be fine if he only took off a few points for missing minor things but he ends up taking off like 20 points. HE WILL NOT HELP YOU EVER even if you ask nicely gives terrible responses. think you get an A on something? chances are you will really get a C.

Awful. He grades way too harshly, considering this is an intro class. Always looking for mistakes, instead of looking if the assignment is fulfilled. Very redundant in lectures, and does not include all information needed for the assignments. "Look for it yourself". I'd avoid him at all costs.
Easy online class. He let me resubmit my web pages that didnt show up, mysteriously. Easy A

Online class. Taught nothing on own, only sent students to youtube videos to learn on own. Replied to e-mail questions very ambiguously, thus, no clear answer or solution was ever given. Despite both of these things, grades very hard (especially for it being a 100 level class)
A fun class, he makes things interesting. But is IMPOSSIBLE to get an A. This is an INTRO class, yet he grades like a 400 class. I would have a 4.0 GPA if I wouldn't have gotten a B in his class..

Name: Brian Collier
Comment: Professor Collier was such an awesome professor! If I have the chance to take him again, I definitely will! NO test were given to us throughout the semester, and he's not a tough grader on papers at all. He's really outgoing, will learn everyones name, and is also very passionate about the subject so it makes the class more interesting!

He was a fun professor and made sure that he knew everyone on a first name basis. There are a lot of assignments and things got confusing quickly. Tests were difficult even though they would be open book sometimes. He really is a fair person and will help you if you are open and honest with him.

Dr. Collier is passionate about his subject, and you can see this in his class. Class discussions get off tract sometimes, but this is good really, because he inspires almost all students to be involved in conversations. Some of the topics covered in this course might make students feel uncomfortable or even angry, but there is a lot to be gained.

Name: Rees Storm
Comment: SHE IS A GREAT PROFESSOR. SHE IS VERY PASSIONATE ABOUT WHAT SHE DOES AND SHE WANTS PEOPLE TO SUCCEED IN LIFE AND IN SCHOOL. SHE UNDERSTANDS MOST SITUATIONS AND GIVE YOU CHANCES TO MAKE THEM UP DIFFERENT WAYS. THIS UNV CLASS IS VERY DIFFERENT FROM OTHERS AND SOMETIMES YOU FEEL THAT THIS CLASS IS ABOUT YOUR INNER FEELINGS BUT GREAT CLASS AND PROFESSO

Great Professsor! UNV 101 was very helpful and Rees is very passionate about it! If you come to class and do the work it is an easy A. Attendance is mandatory, but if you go to class you will walk away from the class at the end of the semester with something that you can use the rest of your college career. class recieves an A++ in my book.
Has high expectations for students, but is really a great professor.  She has student's best interest in mind always.

She is a hard profesor, but a good one.  She will make you do a lot of projects that seem useless, but you come away respecting the class and respecting her a lot in the end. It takes time to warm up to her, but it's worth it. She's always prepared, and is always ready to teach. She's great
She is difficult, but very helpful and understanding.
Great professor.  Very difficult curriculum, especially for incoming freshman, but very worth it in the end.  Take this class if you want a challenge and really want to broaden your horizen.
Pretty good teacher but is very opinionated
AHHHH Rees... the single greatest HNR teacher ever.  She's very helpful, and kinda fun to make fun of!

Rees sometimes gets a little too excited, but she's a lot of fun.  She is very, very helpful and flexible.  Not only is she an excellent teacher but you can always approach her about anything (even non-school related).  The honors seminar style was nice because she was a lot more personal and kind of became your friend.  I loved Rees and her class.

Took a "food poverty & the environment" class with her. Very interesting class but frustrating at times. Requires a lot of mandatory out of class events and work that seems unrelated to the class. Big documentary at the end but no final. She's very helpful and willing to talk/help if you have concerns. Overall I would recommend her.

Name: Robert Kenney
Comment: Very hard to reach out of class very tough grader, no sympathy

I had issues trying to navigate the course, and through some technical difficulties. I was still able to make up my assignments. He was very caring and understanding of the technical issues I was having. Highly recommend

Literally the worst professor ever. Do NOT take him. He does not grade. He does not teach. But still expects work to be done on time. Doesn't accept or respond to emails. No assignment has a clear due date. Wants you to call him and "beg" to retake tests. He has no idea how to be a professor and is being reported. Save yourself a headache.

Dr Kenney is a nice guy who seems to really care about teaching but he's not good at it. The online format is impossible to navigate and its hard to tell what you're being graded by and how. He refuses to answer emails, you have to call him to ask questions. There is a ton of reading required each week and so much writing as well

Robert Kenney assists my actual professor in my health care ethics course. The assignments are convoluted and his grading scale is too difficult considering the subject. I was able to make an A, but I had to work for it. Writing comes naturally for me and I usually excel in writing based courses, yet with him I never scored higher than a 95.

Nice professor, but gives way to much work. Very confusing with the on-line format. Would not recommend if you are a full time student. He gives as much writing work if you were in a writing class. Beware!

Dr. Kenney was extremely nice from day one. I took his online health care ethics course. The class was a little confusing at first (he has stuff everywhere on BB) but once you get use to it, it isn't that bad. His class was pretty easy, sometimes had a lot of reading or work, but it is all straightforward. He is very helpful and nice though.

Took 2 classes with him. Very easy to get an A, but you have to deal with him. Online- is not good with Tech, does not answer emails! His deadlines are not clear, but if you can reach him he will change any of it for you. He works with you. On campus- Very hard to follow, he makes a statement then calls your name and wants you to answer something!

Web class: It was disorganized from the start.  When I went to my 'orientation' appointment for the class he was busy, so I never did it.  Assignment topics and due dates were unclear; Final paper consists of a confusing mix of analyses of 4 articles + argument + creative writing (?!?!) and apparently my argument was my 'concluding essay.'  What?

Professor Kenney is nice and seems to have good intentions, but he is not a good teacher. He is very unorganized. He always teaches out of the textbook and calls on students to answer questions that no one can ever comprehend. The class is easy, if you can manage the frustration.

He is  tech challenged. Having said that, he depends on Bboard to give out assingments,ppts,&grades. However, he never responds to email. Due dates are too vague. He is well informed on the subjects but he does not get the class motivated to read ahead.  So no one gets very far. If its fits your schede, its prob best for you to take a dif prof.
Easy A if you do the work, but you really need to which your grades on blackboard and question him if you think there is a problem.  Knows his stuff but he is unorganized, and doesn't check email.

He's a nice guy just taught a very boring class. The tests are online and done with groups so they aren't hard at all. The book was 6 dollars and you did have to bring it to class every day. Easy class, easy A. Most of the work is getting yourself there and staying awake.
Kenney is really a sweet man and has a good heart. He cares about his students but he is really awkward and is extremely boring. The class is easy. He gives group tests.
Easy A-Do work. Get A. It was web class.

Very unorganized.. will not assume responsibility for his actions or actions he didnt take and should have. Unfair, never checks his email or responds in order to get any sort of answer from him you must call and wait for him to call back. I think he has Alzheimers because he thinks he goes over things and he doesn't.. I think I have said enough..

I would beg to differ to anyone who said he is open minded. He's so ignorant and narrow minded. Likes to share his opinions in class. Lectures make no sense whatsover, and he turns an interesting topic into something as dull as watching paint dry. If you want to be bored out of your mind and have your beliefs criticized, than he's the man for you.
He is lost in this own world, never answers his emails, and should not be allowed to teach
Very unorganized but a very nice man. He will make assignments due without telling you! He overall does nothave his stuff together, but the class is easy

Easily the worst professor I have ever had.  His lectures were so pointless that I often entertained thoughts of suicide mid-class.  I had to drop the class, clinging onto the tiny bit of sanity I had left.

Name: Jae-Seung Lee
Comment: Lectures are boring and add nothing to the info you read in the textbook. Attendance is mandatory, even though you don't learn anything that you can't find in the textbook. Personally, I didn't have trouble with it, but Dr. Lee's accent is heavy and it might be hard for some to understand to him. Pay close attention!

Dr. Lee was a great teacher. Super nice man and very funny. There are weekly quizzes but as long as you read the chapter theyre easy. The discussion boards were the worst, but they get easier. All the exams were online. I would definitely recommend this professor.

The tests and quizzes are easy as long as you read the textbook. However, the lectures can be quite boring but he does eventually posts the PowerPoints to canvas. He does also do a lot of discussion posts but its not that bad. Overall he is really nice and understanding and would definitely take him again.

Okay, Ive had this professor for 3 classes and I absolutely loved him in my class last semester, so I signed up for 2 of his classes this semester. Tests are easy. However... the discussion board are not. Original posts must be 400 words and you must reply to 4 other peoples posts with a word count of 125 or more. He also grades of his opinion.

Ive had two online classes with Dr. Lee he is a very nice man well it seems. If you have him for a mandatory online class DONT expect a lecture or ANY contact from him. The only thing I have ever heard from him the entire semester was happy thanksgiving. There was NO teaching it was just here it is and go. 10/10 would not take if I can avoid

Dr. Lee is a great guy, just not a great professor. 2-page, single space chapter summaries are due twice a week, before class starts. Attendance is mandatory and 5 absences results in failing the class, even though his lecture is just reviewing the chapter you just wrote a book on. Slow response to emails. Keeps class entertaining, though.
Dr. Lee is a sweet man, but he is very difficult to understand. This class is extremely easy, as long as you show up. He is very strict on attendance.

I learned more from the textbook than his lectures. He constantly rambled and either didn't finish the lecture or went over the time. Chapter quizzes given for every chapter, no study guides given for exams, and discussion boards are complicated. Would not take him again..

Dr. Lee was an okay professor. Most of his lectures were re-reads of the chapter we had already read at home and been tested on. Other than that, the assignments are dead simple and are very hard to mess up. He gives a very clear rubric for the discussion boards and is more than fair in grading. Nice guy, didn't like the way he taught the class.
Hes a great professor and gives a lot of extra credit opportunities and helps a lot

i saw many people say he gives study guides out for exams, as of 2019 he does NOT. this class is exams and quizzes, no assignments! dr. Lee is a respectable, funny guy. make a connection w/ him and he will help you. offers extra credit. attendance is a MUST and if youre late, he makes you sing a song. very boring lecture. PAY ATTENTION OR FAIL!!!!

He makes his own quizzes, so make sure the grammar and punctuation in your answers are completely correct or your answers won't be correct. He is very funny, and if you come in to class late he makes you sing a song, so show up on time. He will reopen online assignments for a while until people start asking too much.

This class is extremely easy. Online exams, easy A. Attendance will reflect your grade and the classes are straight lecture and very boring. As long as you do your homework and exams, which are done at home, you will pass no problem

Lee is a great teacher. There are chapter summaries that are due about once a week, but if you read, it's not hard. There are four tests, but he gives study guides. No mid-term or final ("final is test #4") He makes jokes, and tries to engage the students. He appreciates participation.

The workload is bigger than it should be: Chapter summaries and quizzes every couple of classes. The only reason why I enjoyed him as a professor is because if you complete ALL extra credit: your grade gets bumped up by around a letter grade. Overall, if you send him an email before you need to skip the class he will understand.

Super nice guy, and extra too sometimes. However just too much work. 1 Chapter summary of 2 pages for every 2 days. Lose 4 points when late (on 10) and the test were just 25 questions so get two wrong and you down to a B+. He's attendance policy is horrible, miss a class without telling and lose 35%. Nice person but regret taking the class

Super nice guy, really understanding but the workload is ridiculous. Every test felt like I was preparing for a final- study guides were usually around 20 pages long that he would give out. Only gave 2 days of class time per chapter, had to do a 2 page chapter summary for every single chapter, along with online discussions. way to much work.

Name: Michael Hinckley
Comment: Halfway through the semester he turned my class into an online class. I tried to email him and set up meeting times so I could talk to him and figure out what I need to do to help my grade. Instead he said we can communicate via email and it takes him a couple days to respond.

Took his online class because I thought it would be an easy GPA booster.  Turns out it takes a lot of your time out of the week to complete weekly tegrity lectures along with quizzes and discussions.  On his syllabus he didn't put an email or number to contact him and when you email him a question, he answers in a way to make you seem dumb
Absolutely the worst professor I have ever had. I carried a 4.0 all through college until I had him for Arabic.

Online class was unnecessarily difficult, all because you are on your own teaching yourself the material outhat of a book. There is no clarity, and if you email him expect him to email you back with a rude remark. And remember if you take him, the historical content doesn't matter. Formatting is your grade. He has shaken my faith in online courses.

Mike is a pretty good guy. History can be a very dull topic but believe me, he goes out of his way to make it not boring at all, with comical examples. He almost makes you want to show up just to see what he is going to say next. However the work side of things can be a lil bit much... But not too difficult id say, just a good quantity

No clarity in online class. There is no laid out structure in the syllabus like every other online class. No due dates told in advance for anything other then what is expected every week such as discussion/blog. Never told what chapters we were on. His online was confusing when it didn't need to be.

Do not take this guy, worst professor on campus. I will never take him again even if I need a credit, I will take the credit online somewhere else. DO NOT TAKE HIM, he is not helpful and rude when responding in emails and when responding in general.

Always hated social studies but didn't mind going to this class at all. He loves talking about history so it makes it a little more bearable. Had a total of 6 assignments all semester, extremely easy. Would recommend to someone looking for an easy A.

Great lecturer. Tries to get students involved in discussion. All assignments are online: journals, monday quizzes, and midtermfinal. If you miss three days he takes 50 points!! off your grade. Always available to talk after class or email. Buy the book, some quiz and journal questions come from the book.

Hinckley is a great professor. He is really funny and I really enjoyed his lectures. His mid-term and finals will kill you though. Make sure you STUDY. IF you're like me though, and didn't know that, the 100 points of extra credit really help.
Great professor. You have to attend lectures to understand material. Everything is online so you can test together.

Took his course on line. Very knowledgable but this class required a lot of work. I also had another online history course at the time which made it more difficult. As long as you read and listen to his lecture you will do fine. He will make you learn, not just teach you.
