Great Professor, he makes the class interesting and actually makes you think about the material. He's down to earth and makes class fun

Would recommend. Always responded to my emails when I needed extra clarity. Tells you up front what will be on tests, only has a few assignments due throughout year. You get the grade for as much effort as you put in in this class.

Tried stupid hard to be funny, but ended up looking like a fool most of the time.  He makes students hand write their daily attendance which causes issues.  Will NOT work with you if you have conflicting outside deadlines.  Overall would not recommend.
Great teacher. Had him in person and took an online class. He's funny and knowledgable.
Great Teacher :)
Good professor. Very knowledgeable, prepared and makes difficult historical topics easy to understand.
Great teacher and pretty nice guy. He does a great job of keeping the class interesting!!

I loved this class!!! He is very clear when he lectures and gives you different insight on the topics that he lectures. The only work you do are 4 papers (easy) and read. Plus you have a review game before mid term and final exams. I learned alot from this class. It is worth taking Hinckley :)

Name: Sarah Mann
Comment: One of the worst professors I have ever had. I don't think she even looked over the coursework before she uploaded it to canvas because there were so many mistakes on her part during the semester and the instructions were completely outdated. The work is pretty easy but it will take you hours. And good luck trying to get an email response from her.

Professor Mann is very hands-off, which can be a good thing, but can also be very frustrating. Most of the homework is super long and took hours. This course wasn't very fun. At least there was a clear schedule throughout the semester.

This online class was structured very well. Each week you had a clear understanding on what had to be done. She emailed us in the first few weeks saying This is a 100 level course. Dont over think it. I spent maybe two hours a week on this class and passed no problem. Quite a few projects but they are very simple and she is easy on grading.

This professor is a very hands-off teacher if you do your work on time. She is incredibly nice and doesn't assign an absolutely overwhelming amount of work. I would take her class again just to feel her positive presence. Very kind professor, choose her!

WORST CLASS I HAVE TAKEN!!! I have friends that have taken her in class and said it was a breeze, I took her as an online 8 week class and it was the worst decision I've made. BIS 101 is a pre-req i need for next semester so I couldnt drop. I would spend HOURS on the projects. It was unrealistic to get done the amount assigned and actually learn.
Professor Mann is a great professor. Shes very helpful outside of class, and offers endless amounts of extra credit for those who show up to class

Computer Literacy and Informatics with Sarah Mann is easier than a 3rd grade art class. Attendence is recorded for a total of 50 points in the semester. Literally everything is online, there's modules and quizzes due every MWF. But she "reviews" the lesson AFTER the quiz from a powerpoint. No point in going to class. She gives so much extra credit.
Easy! there is a module every week with about 5-6 things to complete but it is easy! Any problems you have she is happy to help with

There's a ton to do for the online course, but it's very straightforward. The work is easy and you have multiple chances to redo work to get a higher grade. The only thing you don't get second and third chances on are the quizzes which are timed, but very easy. She is accessible. Generally if I emailed her she would reply in less than 45 minutes.

Sarah Mann is the WORST professor I have EVER had. I can't stand her. Her "lectures" are her reading powerpoints that were premade by the book company. She knows the bare minimum about the class. Being a millennial and growing up with a computer I felt as if I knew more about the topics than she did. She can't keep track of the grade book.

Course content isn't very complicated, but it seems as though Professor Mann was not as knowledgeable as a teacher on the content should be. She wasn't willing to help Mac OS users whenever they experienced issues, and often times was open about her lack of understanding. It's an easy A, but it could definitely be easier if not for the professor.

I did receive an A in her online bis 101 or inf 101 class but it was hard. I sometimes worked 7 hours straight on the projects and Sarah does not respond to emails or answer questions. It took her the entire class to finally have her grade the few (3) projects that were not computer graded. Absolutely no instruction. AWFUL!!!

This class is very very very tough. I struggled through the entire semester. Sarah isn't very helpful when it comes to answering questions, however I will say that she helped bump my grades up so I could pass. She is very nice, but I wouldn't recommend this class to anybody.
Terrible teacher. Don't take any classes with her.

Web class: big mistake. Halfway through finals week and have no idea how I'm doing. Has graded 1 of 12 assignments, tests are all online so those grades are automatic. Actually gave extra credit assignment (not an option initially) because she's been so lax in grading and responding to e-mails. Wouldn't recommend taking online.

Name: Sara Sidebottom
Comment: She started this semester with "the last time I taught, we used ACTUAL blackboards.." She had no idea how to use the computer and the white board, but she was still a great teacher. She did NOT take any crap from anyone if they were not paying attention, but she was NEVER unreasonable. Just listen during class and pay attention during exam reviews!

Name: Linda Wermeling
Comment: I had her for Forensic Social Work SWK572. AN ELECTIVE COURSE. She has a minimum of 4 assignments a week. Up to 6. This week I had 6 assignments in her class alone, including an exam AND a 3 page paper. Her grading makes zero sense. Our last 3 page paper was literally worth 1 POINT. I don't have time for this many assignments with 5 other classes
Awesome teacher that wants you to learn! You will love her.
Wermeling is extremely knowledgeable in her field, has great advice, is a great teacher, and assigns important assignments, no busy work.

Dr. Wermeling is incredibly knowledgeable in her field and really communicated well the effort and expertise it takes to do community organization. She talks often about her own experiences and tells a lot of stories during class.
Wermeling is hard, demanding and fabulous. If you think her class is a joke, you couldn't pass the course.
Wermeling is great.
Dr. Wermeling is great.

She is a complete JOKE! Check you grade points/she can't add. She lacks attention to detail, writes incoherent emails, vague descriptions on assignments. There is not one good thing I have to say about her or her teaching style or team based method learning! Guess she's writing another peer reviewed article.
She is unhelpful in the extreme, with unclear instructions, and ignores any pleas for clear explanation. Clearly has no interest in helping. Do not take her class
Love this class and professor
Take this class you learn so much from this professor
Take this class. It's hard, but working in teams ends up being fun and you learn so much
Dr Wermeling is great.
Dr. Wermeling brings reality into the classroom. She has very high expectations, but helps you meet them.
Professor very smart and expects alot of her students. The class was hard, but I learned alot.
She is very respectable!  She did not lecture a lot in our class but her "talks"  were very helpful with our class project.

Ha this class was a joke, if you need an easy class then take it!  The class was supposed to be tuesday thursday but she only had us meet tuesday and gave us very easy assignments to do for thursday which took like 20 minutes. Very boring teacher but very easy a
this class was so easy a robot could have taught it.  if you want to be challenged or intrigued, don't take her. if you want to sleep through class, then take her.

She is great and thanks to Dr. A 's easy textbook that she had to use it made the class so easy. She couldn't control it otherwise. She is a awesome and very intelligent Dr. and I suggest any SWK major to take her. Flippin AWESOME!! Oh yea but if she doesn't have her coffee she might be a little cranky but she will admit it. ha ha!
Great teacher! She used the workbook to the fullest. Although the workbook sucked and was very repitative I still learned a lot. This class was very helpful and beneficial.

Name: Mark Hardy
Comment: Mark is the best professor this department has to offer.  Come to class, do his papers, soak in his stories/advice, and you will be a better actor for it.

Mark is one, if not the best theatre instructor at NKU.  Attendance is mandatory in his class and be prepared to write papers but all of his classes are the best ones to take.  Plus, he's one of the most approachable professors I've ever worked with.

Mark is a great teacher and will help you however he can. One of the teachers at NKU that truly cares about every student. He does expect alot from you but is always fair. Very knowledgeable about theatre... spent a long time in the biz.

Name: Chad Ruschman
Comment: Be prepared to study. His exams are harder than a 100 level chemistry. If you don't study for the exams and quizzes you are screwed! Be very prepared to put a ton of effort and studying time in for this class.

Chad is always willing to answer questions and make sure you understand the topic, and gives his best effort into making all lectures apply to you in some way. Overall super smart guy who's been where you are.

Chad is a professor who truly loves to teach and cares about how well his students understand the material. He is really really good at making a difficult topic really interesting and easy to understand. I would recommend him to anybody, especially early in your chemistry career.

No matter what Chemistry 115 is a challenging class. I found Chad extremely enthusiastic and passionate about chemistry. He would always answer my questions before class or outside of class. If you really put in effort you will do good in this class. There are several practice problems and he gives extra credit on quizzes and tests.

Chad is alright for the most part, but sometimes when you ask him a question he can be condescending or answer in an off-putting way. He's very enthusiastic about chemistry and can sometimes be overly chatty when you're trying to get a lab done. His pre-lab lectures aren't all that interesting, but he tries. Overall, not too bad.

I absolutely hated this dude. He spent 90% of chem lab bragging about how much he accomplished by the time he was 19 and all the papers he published and whatever else. He never answered 1 question I had he only replied with other questions or some sort of rhetoric. Extremely cocky and unprofessional.
Chad is the man

This was Chad's first semester here at NKU, so he was just getting adjusted the things.  He would really make you think if you asked him a question. Sort of left me more confused after I asked for help. I think he may get better as he gets more adapted to the way NKU is in comparison to the other places he's taught.

He is way too smart to teach lower level chem classes. He makes no sense and if you ask a question he rambles and doesn't even answer it. He has no clear grading criteria and will take points off of your labs but won't take points off of other peoples who put the same answers. Would not recommend.

Name: Clyde Booker
Comment: He moved to Waukesha to teach in Carroll University. He's very helpful, goes very deep into your paper and tries to help you at all times. Seems that he knows a lot of things and always has an answer to everything. I guess my only cont here would be that he speaks extremely fast and mumbles a little bit, other than that, good professor.
Booker was the best teacher I had freshman year.  He's got a good sense of humor if you understand him.  Take good notes, study good and you will do fine.  He will help you whenever you need it.

Booker was not prepared to teach this class and it showed. He tended to argue frequently with students about historical facts, dates, & data & refused to accept when he was wrong. While he is very personable, nice, and accommodating, he was not prepared to teach a graduate level course.

Very interesting prof.  I loved his class.  Very entertaining, keeps students attention.  Tells you what he expects in the beginning.  It is essential that you READ THE BOOK.  If you don't, it will be difficult to do good.  Great prof all around.  Would take more classes from him.
Fantastic teacher! Class is mostly lecture, he is a very animated speaker...no one sleeps! Tells you the first day of class exactly what he expects; if you do the work you will do fine.

If you hate history, here is a professor that will change your mind. He is very helpful and gives you your money's worthy. Got an A in his class. I worked hard for it though. If you are lazy, do not take his class.
Booker is an awesome teacher. He isn't easy, but he wants to make you a better student. If you want to become a better student then take his class! Also, very funny. Wants to go to war with Canada!

Great teacher. His lectures are very boring, but the homework, tests, and papers you do makes such a difference. If you aren't a strong reader and writer, don't take this class. He really enforces these skills and tears people down who don't possess them or are unwilling to learn. He does everything to help you get an A.
amazing teacher really knows what he is talking about

Great professor, very knowledgeable and incredibly funny, but the class IS challenging. Still, I hate history, and he kept my attention for the most part. Not an easy A. If you do not attend class you will get behind very quickly.

Dr. Booker is hilarious and he makes history interesting. Doesn't teach straight from the book.  As long as you're willing to try, he's willing to help.  In addition to exams, expect pop quizzes to make sure you're keeping up w/ weekly readings and two 5-10 pg essays on books of his choice. I highly recommend this professor.
Dr. Booker is a great teacher! He's very enthusiastic and loves history which makes it interesting for everyone else. He's very helpful and does everything he can to help his students succeed!
Mr.Booker is a great teacher! Extremely helpful as long as he can tell you try! I hated history before I took his class but he made it fun. Don't worry to much about the first day it is all talk!

He presents himself as the teacher under siege when in fact he presents half truths and rumor as fact. He also claims to be "ghetto" and shunned by the establishment for speaking the "truth." Paranoid and nonsensical. Tries too hard to be friends with the students instead of teaching factsof history.

The greatest history I have ever had. He teaches the truth not just what is in our text books. He shows alternative ways to look at things and shows that history is not a black and white as high school made us believe. If you want an AMAZING teacher you need to  take one of his classes!

One of the best professors you could ever hope for. Not only will he do everything in his power to help you succeed in his class, he will help you succeed outside of class as well. The catch is that you MUST put forth 100% effort. Not recommended for students flippant about history or underclassmen.

He's a great teacher who has an interest in what he is teaching and is interested in what the students think about the subject.  Class discussion is something he encourages.  He seems lenient until you get your grades, if you don't try you will not get a high grade and that's what I like about him.  Just show up and work and you'll be fine.
Lol, earlier reviews hit it right on the spot. He comes off as a hard teacher but it's all talk. I didn't have to right book either and I passed ok. He gives in to classmates complaining alot.
Awesome, as well as interesting presentation.

Mr. Booker is a pretty funny guy. He is a spaz and sweats non-stop. His class was tough, but then again i didnt have the actual text book and still got a high c. Do the book reviews early enough to where he can grade it and give it back to you so you can redo it and get an A...and you should be fine! Take him, we watched several movies...

Name: Thomas Capizzi
Comment: While he is a nice guy, he was not helpful as a professor. It seemed to be assumed that students should already know how to work the programs. Students had to turn to hours of YouTube tutorials to complete the assignments. We often also just got thrown into the main assignment with no prep or instruction beyond reading the assignment requirements.

Professor had a good understanding and background for what the class was about. Unfortunately he expected everyone to know what they were doing and when they didn't, would give a speedy tutorial that taught nothing. Adobe programs had better videos that taught the material way clearer. Assignments were not laid out well at all.

Capizzi is overall a decent professor. Sometimes I feel as though he is less of a professor and more of someone who knows a lot about the topic being taught. I think he could be better at explaining and demonstrating the material. He is a super laid back and funny dude but I think he could teach the material a bit better.

Name: Leslie Combs
Comment: Leslie Combs is an AMAZING professor with a clear talent for her work. She is thorough, diligent, and smart. She CLEARLY knows what she is teaching. She expects a lot from her students, but that is only to prepare them to become the BEST in their field. Literally GOALS!
I thought she was tough, but fair.  She expected a lot from us, but I feel as though I learned a lot. I had her for job analysis and for training.  I enjoyed her classes.

Very difficult to get an A, if not impossible. Clearly favors women in class. Grades tests very critically, almost unrealistic expectations! Relatively boring teacher with not alot to offer. If you are taking her class it is probably because you have to, not because you want to.

Name: Ned Jackson
Comment: Gives in class assignments that are taken for a grade, but if you e-mail him to tell him you won't be in class he's very understanding about it. Only 3 tests and the final was a sales presentation with one other student. You need the book to pass the tests. Overall, interesting class and he was a great professor!
Interesting guy and class.  Tests were mostly short answer, so easier than multiple choice in my opinion.  He applies the material to real-world subject!  I wish he taught more classes!

He's a great professor but lack in flexibility of teaching.  Little bit opinionated in his view.  Just like most of the professor who do not learn from students' view point.  He acknowledge us at best.
nice guy easy class. tests are online which is nice, he can be a touch bit boring.

He is a very nice guy... willing to help if needed.  Tests were online, but they were difficult... forces you to put in time to study.  Tried to make class more interesting by talking about more real world application of the concept.  My biggest complaint was other students bringing useless newspaper articles that have nothing to do with marketing.

Not the best, but not the worst. I only took this clas as reqirement. However, if you ar a Marketing major, I would advise you to take someone else (NOT Dana Crane). BUT, if you want an easy A, take him.
Boring! 90% of your grade is from tests.  The other 10% is participation.  He's a nice guy but not very exciting.

Don't take him, He's long, Boring and it's not worth your money. If you want an easy, but boring A. Take him. He's a nice guy, persay. But, he's SOOOOOOO boring. He makes attandace mandatory. If you don't come then he deducts it away from your participation points worth 200 points. Take someone else.

He's so boring that I wanted to get up and leave his class everyday or skip because it was so painful to sit through. SERIOUSLY one of the worse teachers at nku...his tests are hardly over inclass material and he reads off powerpoints made by the author of the text.  honestly this class was useless and i agree a waste of money
this guy sucks. nothing he does is his own material. complete waste of money. has no business teaching. STAY AWAY. he is the worst teacher i have EVER had. completely clueless!!!!
Ned is an awesome guy. He'll help you with anything and really wants to see you succeed. take him if possible! :D
Fun, nice guy. Great teacher. Very easy if you pay attention in class. Easy tests, lots of lectures and group work. Alot of your grade depends on homework/participation.

Name: Michael Mannheimer
Comment: Prof Mannheimer was great. Love the Simpsons references, made Crim Pro interesting.

Great professor. One of my favorites. More conceptual than practical, but I liked that. Many found his Socratic method too intimidating. But if you prepare for class--you'll be fine. Really cares about his subjects.
2 Things will get him fired up: 1. don't be late 2. don't get caught unprepared, the whole class will get a long lecture on it

All theory, no meat, alot of unanswered questions. Mirrored a philosophy class on crime and punishment. Professor used Socratic Method on extrinsic hypos to extract rules from cases. Have thinking cap on when you go to class. Final wasn't too bad but a lot different than others. He knows his stuff and is willing to help those who help themselves.

An ok teacher who knows his subject well.  For a student taking Evidence for the first time, it was difficult to get a clear sense of "the answer" to any given question. You get a good sense of the arguments on both sides of every issue, but you don't come away knowing how a court would be likely to rule.

He teaches through the use of questions, and pwr pnt slides. Movie clips are great, and the pwr pnts are good as well. His grade here is based off his unperfessional acts (name calling), and his unwillingness to help clarify problems that a majority of the class has. He is a good choice only for the passive student with low professional standards.
He is the most confusing Prof I have ever had. He is all over the place in class. Completely theory focused.
He wasn't sure if was at Columbia or Chase.  Very nice man who loves his Southpark.

Name: Sandy Grinnell
Comment: Easily the worst professor I have ever taken. She is extremely horrible at responding to emails or any questions you may have. She is downright rude to her students. Clearly does not care about your education. 0/10 would NOT recommend.
This professor is so unhelpful and just plain nasty. Argues with the class instead of helping.

I had Grinnell for theories and I thought she was great. The only two things that our grade was based off was really just a group project and a paper. There are no notes, studying, or exams in this class. You just show up and play games, color, or watch a movie. I still feel like I learned a lot though. She is helpful with answering questions.

DO NOT TAKE! This professor has a nasty attitude and is so unhelpful. Ask a question to clarify something and she'll tell you to read the rubric as if you haven't already. Took her 2 weeks to answer an email and was no where to be found during office hours and kept cancelling class right before paper was due so I got no help. She is the worst!
Not an interesting topic but she tries to make class fun.  Not hard just have to complete the work, and it's only 2 projects and a couple responses.

Take her for Nursing Theory! She is AWESOME. You have no homework and no tests, only 2 projects (which are ridiculously easy), and a few responses (also easy). She makes everything easy and we watch movies and have lots of fun. TAKE HER!!

She emphasized that reading the book would be vital to passing the class, but then when it came to tests and the lecture she would tell us the opposite. You never knew if she was testing on the answers in the book or on her notes and many times students failed tests because of her contradictions! I would not recommend her to anyone.
I loved SANDY! She practically saved my life! She was more than willing to help you and although some say she is hard, I think she explains things perfectly! Love her!

Name: Tripta Desai
Comment: She's knowledgeable I'll giver her that. BUT.... she is constantly sick or injured. She does not communicate well. She is always late to her own class, pauses for minutes at a time randomly, and doesn't seem to have a sense of personal space. It's an easy but its painful to sit through the class.  She can't even say the correct name of the course.

If you want an easy A go ahead and take it but she does not care for her students at all and is the worst professor I have ever had. Hard to understand and after class your not sure if you even learned anything. Could go on and on about how I do not like her and why but would only take her if you want an easy A and don't care about the material.

Don't listen to these college Kids, I'm a 10 year army vet returning home, I'm old by their criteria at 30 years of age, but this professor is the nicest lady I met.  Her accent is what turns many away but she is super nice and understanding.   Very informative and cares.

Oh gee... time to rate my girl Desai. Lets start out with she is a very kind woman. BUT she is gross, if she coughs on my one more time i might jump off a bridge. Shes does not answer questions well and you can not get ahold of her after class unless you go to her room. He accent isnt bad but her notes are. Overall my class was very close ha!

Her class is so easy. She literally gives you a "study guide" which are the test questions and then she gives you the specific answers. All of our tests were multiple choice, no more than 30 questions. And barely any homework ever. You have to try to fail her class or even get a bad grade. I recommend taking her class as a break from others.

This professor is absolutely terrible. Her class lectures consist of the same useless information everyday. If you ask a question she will look at you laugh, and then continue as if you had never asked the question. "Napolean said, Oh Gee, and then invaded belgium."

She is a very nice lady. Very understanding; if you miss class, just write a note saying why and put it on her desk, she won't count it against you. Her study guides ARE the test. After a week or so you get used to the accent and it becomes a very interesting class.

Don't bring a laptop even though she forces you to print out her power points from black board.  Don't bother asking questions she will ignore you.  The summaries are nonsense and have absolutely nothing to do with the tests.  I did not learn anything in this class.  "Mongols are from Mongolia", yup she said that.  Need I say more?

She's very nice. Her notes are a little hard to keep up with, but her study guides are easy and are lifesavers. Overall, it's a pretty easy class. I missed class quite often and didn't even have to take the final.

I do not recommend taking a class taught by this teacher. You are given a lot a useless busy work from a teacher that does not want do any work herself, and she will give you a bad grade if she does not like you. She will talk about the same thing every day and you will end up watching over 10 videos that have nothing to do with the class.
She doesn't use blackboard. EVER. At no point during the semester will you evr have any idea what your grade is. If you miss class she takes off two points per absense.

I don't think people give her enough credit. She doesn't ask much and is extremely understanding if you cannot attend class and notify her. You write a lot of summaries, but their easy as pie. She may be a little repetitive and goofy, but students are ignorant and stubborn when they say they cannot understand her because of her accent.

This was an easy class but she is not a bad teacher. If you come to class and pay attention you will learn a great deal because she is very passionate and answers all questions. If you are considering this class, make sure you show up because she takes attendance every day. Use the study guides and you will do good.

She is very knowledgeable and gives a good non-western view to European history. She is incredibly easy as she gives the exact test as a study guide, and then gives students the answers to the test during lecture. Only teacher I've ever had that endorsed and facilitated plagiarism.
Probably the worst teacher I've ever had. She gives you the test answers. She is pretty much the embodiment of everything that's wrong with the American education system. Easy A at least.

Easiest class ever - but that's because you DON'T LEARN ANYTHING! She gives you the ANSWERS to the test...no scratch that, she gives you THE ACTUAL TEST itself to "study." If you know how to memorize your A, B, C's, take her. Everyone in my class has gotten a 100 on every test.

Absolutely horriendious. This Professor is the embodyment of a bad teacher. She is unbelieveable unorganized, her grading scale is obscene and above all she can and will make your mind go wild because of her accent. I could barely understand maybe even 25% of what she said. Overall, if you value your sanity avoid at all costs.

The previous comments don't lie. Horribly unorganized! She would lecture for a few minutes and then just stop and remind us of the test weeks in advance everyday for no reason.  Showed up late all the time, her notes would jump around and were unclear. Her grading system makes you go "WTF Mate?"
If you want to be educated then don't take this professor.  If you want an easy A go for it. Not recommended for History/Social Studies majors.

This teacher is horrible. She seriously doesn't know what she is ever talking about, rambles on, she doesn't stay with the book at all, and you can't understand anything she says because she has a really thick accent. She doesn't even know your grades if you ask her. Avoid her if you can, you don't want to take this class

Name: Melissa Digirolamo
Comment: She  lays everything out pretty clear for you. Don't let the work build up or you'll be in a world of trouble.
This was an easy online class.  No tests, only journals, discussion boards, a group project, and 1 short paper.  She is fair in grading, has a manageable workload, and is very helpful.

First of all, she does NOT tolerate slackers in her class.  Unlike a lot of professors I had at my university, she tells the hard truths of what the real world is like.  Encourages participation out of all of her pupils and encourages you to think for yourself.  The group assignments were challenging,  but it is what it is. Very good instructor!
excellent professor!

I had some trouble with my class submissions, and she was EXTREMELY helpful in helping me get all the assignments turned in, and she was in constant communication with me to make sure that I got everything taken care of.  She was such a huge help and a blessing!

This is an on-line course. First of all, if you send an email asking any questions, it takes the teacher three days to respond back. When she does respond she doesn't even answer the question that you asked. She does not teach. All she does is set up the homework assignments, which takes about twelve hours a week to complete.

Name: Amy Kardos
Comment: Has a dry sense of humor-nothin' wrong with that. Helpful when you have you have questions. Well we ended up getting behind in her class so we only took one test and then the final.  Make sure you read the book. And the final exam is open book. I got an A.

Dr. Kardos was one of the best professors that I have had so far. She is very interested in what she teaches and she knows her stuff. This class was challenging but very interesting and fun to go to. I Fully reccommend Dr. Kardos for any History class.

She is a very nice professor....sometimes a little difficult to follow notes, but she is willing to help and listen. If you are not on schedule, she does not rush at the last minute just because a test is scheduled
Would get off subject easily in class but she is always willing to help.

Professor Kardos is extremley helpful! Her class is challenging but not overwhelming and she gives you plenty of time to work on projects and she helps you with exams! She goes through things throughly and she seems interested in the subject! Take her if you have to!!

I had to get an override to enter her class due to an advising error. She was incredibly helpful and wrote back to my e-mails right away. In person she was friendly and willing to help in any way possible. I really look forward to her class, and was very impressed with how willing she was to help and take time out of her day to meet.

Name: Brian Sowers
Comment: I loved being in Dr. Sowers' class.  Very entertaining and knows how to get the information across without being boring.  Highly recommend.  As long as you study for your exams (gives you a study guide) you are golden!!!

OMG! i dunno how 2explain dr. sowers. He just made the class so fun! I am never into history but I enjoyed the discussion & how he made it relevent & easy 2 understand. he likes 2 debate about some issues which makes it interesting. & he is sooo helpful and willing 2 work with you. he has a strict homework guide & if you stick by it you are good!

Name: Yushi LI
Comment: The textbook and lecture content are old and boring. A lot of reading every week. She gave out a lot of extra credit, but tough grader!
This class was really good for an online class, gave out a lot of extra credit too. Has an online textbook to where to do the quizzes from every week so be prepared to read a lot.

Dr. Li is very rude to student. This is not a class about culture, but she spent much of class time to discuss and make fun of other cultures. Repeat herself over and over again. There are essays due mostly every week. Worst experience I ever have at NKU.
A lot of homework and writing assignments. Rude to students. Repeat herself every now and then during her lecture and get mad at students easily.

Bonni is a good professor with crazy interesting stories, but is often very loud and rude to students. If you don't like being the center of attention, be wary of taking her class, because anyone can get called on at any time. The textbook (her book) is a very good read, and tests are pretty easy because the topics are very simple.

The materials are dry, really outdated. You have one Essay and one quiz which requires you to read almost every week. Class discussion can be fun but rude at the same time. The professor spent 20 minutes yelling at the class if a few students did not come to class or missed assignments. Never recommend her!

The material is very outdated, mostly not updated since 2000. Dr. Li gets distracted easily. Also, she spends a large portion of class time just to ask many personal questions and try to give comments on personal lives which is rude sometimes. Overall, worst class I ever had at NKU.

Professor Li is a wonderful Sociology professor. Her tests and quizzes are heavily lecture based but if you come to class these should be easy for you. She gives stories in between notes to allow you to write down the notes and to be able to grasp the material better. An easy class, you just need to put in effort. Would take a class w/ her again.
Nice but she is easily distracted, hard to understand, and awful/outdated lectures. Do not take her unless you have to. You'll thank me later for saving your sanity.

This was an online class and it was super easy. If you have to take this class, but do not want to, I would suggest taking this online version. You read a lot but the tests and quizzes are easy as can be. She is very responsive to emails.

Easy class, interesting professor. She uses her book for the class which is about emigrating from China, she uses basic sociology terms and examples. Prepare to read as if you are in elementary school, it is very simply written. Tests were super easy IF you look for the exact answer in her powerpoint notes, she words it the exact same in the notes.

This professor actually goes by Bonni Li. There are a lot more reviews for her under that name. She is an amazing professor and is absolutely hilarious. She is so helpful and loves her students dearly, and is willing to work with you to help, so long as you are polite and can joke around with her. Take a class with Bonni, you will not regret it.

Name: Aimee Shandy
Comment: I have never had a professor as rude as Aimee Shandy. When I had questions , she couldnt answer them. When I asked simple questions she told me everything I needed to know was on the syllabus. Not a very nice person, doesnt seem to care about her students at all.

I look her 3 hour evening class, so the lectures kind of drug on but let out early on occasion. Strict about attendance and doesn't let you make up speeches. Easy grader if you just show up and do the work you'll get an A.

Class is boring, she does not relate the info to real world well at all. She comes off as rude and bitter. Our grade was from two papers and a group assignment. The group assignment weighs way too heavily for being a night class.Good luck getting in contact with your group. She isn't good at explaining what she expects. I dont recommend taking her.

I can't tell you anything that I have learned in this class except for APA formatting. The lectures are boring, there's a group project and two papers that basically account for your grade. We were given an extra credit assignment but we were repeatedly told not to bother if we were unsure about it. DO NOT TAKE HER WORST CLASS IVE EVER TAKEN
Easiest class Ive taken at NKU, took it on Monday evenings and we got to leave after about a half hour of lecture everyday.
Great Professor!!! The class isn't the most exciting topic but if you have to endure it, at least the professor is fun and it doesn't hurt that she is nice to look at ;)

Name: Hildegard Baldridge
Comment: Very helpful. Knows what she is talking about.
Baldridge is amazing. Absolutely loved her lectures. They may be long, but she makes sure you understand the curriculum. Must study for the tests!
Hilde is the best! She makes lectures fun, and she does have an accent, but she's not hard to understand AT ALL. Loved her and the class.

This was a hybrid course.  Part online and part on campus.  She is a great professor!  Hilde knows her stuff and makes Anatomy, which is difficult, do-able.  There is a lot of information, but if you study her notes and go to class, you can get a good grade.  She is very clear on what you need to study and know for exams.  She is also very helpful.

I have her for 208 lab, she is excellent!  she explains it well and her exams are straight forward, no tricks.  If you study and know the info, you'll be fine.  Go to open lab!!!  If you don't study, you won't do well regardless of the instructor.  I have an A+, but I work hard!
HORRIBLE. You can't understand her and her classes are so boring. I've emailed her multiple times about helping me out and she never responded. I don't recommend her.

She uses PP notes and has you fill in blanks so you have to go to class to get her notes. Studied hard for 2-3 days before exams and then you take them and realize they are pretty easy (she can make them so much harder but doesn't-simple MC ?s) she gives ECr asst week before exam but only for 2.5pts, her exams (4 exams) come straight from her ppts

She is really hard to understand because she speaks so slow. She also doesn't explain things very well if you ask her a question. You have to go to all her classes and take lots of notes if you want to pass.

Had her for lecture in 208. Thought I would take her for 209 Lab. What a mistake. Very difficult! Hard to understand but ask her to make your class study guides, it helps a lot. You have to really want to learn the material and spend a good amount of time studying. In the end it will pay off. Baldridge likes to teach anatomy and it really shows.
She is a great professor! She is very knowledgeable about anatomy and will answer any questions you ask. She is the sweetest lady! Although, her tests are difficult, must study hard!

This professor is great. Hard material but if you study straight out of the book you should do fine. Do well on the first test, it will make the class easier. I had to take a remedial math class and got a B+ in this class. You don't have to be smart to do well, just look at the material a lot

Dr. Baldridge is a sweetheart! She ALWAYS offers to answer any questions you may have. Tests are the only grade other than a couple small extra credit assignments. They are also straight from the notes though so go to class!

She is the best anatomy professor NKU has. This class is going to be hard no matter who you take, but she is so willing to help and meet with you. She's just great! Study hard for the exams! they are no cake walk

She's amazing! I am not getting a good grade but it's all my fault. She's my favorite professor! She is so willing to help and meet with you anytime! All the test questions come from the notes. I have NEVER used the textbook. It's a really challenging class, but if you have to take it, pick her!
Hard to understand, never opened the book in class. Hated the class. Do not recommend.

Pick Professor Baldridge! She knows what she's talking about. I had her for BIO 208 and BIO 209 Lab. She's so sweet and helpful. If you need her to explain something, she will explain it until she knows that you understand it. Anatomy is going to be hard no matter the teacher, but Professor Baldridge really cares.
Great teacher, professional, helpful.
Couldn't imagine a better Anatomy professor. She really knows her stuff and makes it easy to learn. Just make sure to not miss class, and you don't really use the textbook.

Dr. Baldridge was a great professor! She's always very willing to help, really knows her stuff and is able to communicate it in a way that makes it easy to understand. Her tests were somewhat difficult but easy if you try. A WORD OF CAUTION! Dont waste 150 bucks on the textbook! She never uses it!

By far the best anatomy lecturer NKU has.  The tests come directly from her power points and are very straightforward.  I had her for A&P 209 lab as well and definitely would have taken her for 209 lecture if she was an option.

Name: Dennis Miller
Comment: Late to every single class doesn't use blackboard doesn't check his NKU email doesn't post grades (going into my final, I only knew one papers' grade) rambles on and on

He wants you to read like four books outside of class which isn't hard, BUT he talks in circles just like the books do. Nothing makes sense and he says that if it doesn't click then it won't ever click.. it's finals week and NOTHING has clicked..

Dennis is extremely passionate about his classes. It's hard to not appreciate the care he has for it. His material just wasn't interesting to me. Very nice guy. Has a few papers that he gives throughout the semester. As long as you show effort, you'll get a good grade. He grades based on what you put into it, not right answers necessarily.

I love his classes! He's the good kind if crazy you want in a professor and is kind. He will be late (is always talking to students) and will run over (very passionate about phi). He will challenge you, but not out of disrespect so don't be afraid to be active in class. Be prepared to read and take pop quizzes. Exams are usually take home papers.

He's a great professor who goes above and beyond to help his students. Ever wonder why he's late? Because he talks to every student that has a question after class. Not to mention the students that pop into his office for personal advice. He does ramble, but that's part of PHI. If you want hard data spouted at you PHI is not the section to take.
He's the best philosophy professor at NKU! Love the guy!

Unclear teaching, curriculum, and grading. Learned as much in a semester of his teaching as I did in a week of other philosophy courses. If you want a real philosphical course do not take his class. He talks in circles as though he just wants to get the course over with.
I LOVE PROFESSOR MILLER! He is such a helpful professor, best class ever. It's easy, but you learn SO much!

Professor Miller is a passionate teacher. He observes the world in a unique way and challenges students to recognize the narrowness of their own views. He is always late because he helps students, even giving his own time to do philosophical counseling. Relaxed, low pressure. Must be mature to do well. Love him and have had many classes with him.

great teacher, have to read 3 books. Be in class in order to take the quizes. As long as you read and keep your journal together you will get an A. He was a little late everyday but if you forgot to read its good to skim the chapter then :) He makes you think, and opens your eyes to alot. Great Class, he really cares about the subject.

This could possibly be the worst class i ever been in. all he does is talk about random worthless stuff the whole class period and does nothing to help you learn anything about religion. its all a bunch of nonsense and its almost unbearable to sit thru his class. i wouldnt reccomend him to anyone.. by far the worst class/teacher i have ever been in

There are few more words describe this lunatic beyond "idiotic", "unorganized", "uninteresting", and just plain annoying! Late to class at least 10 minutes EVERY DAY, assignments and exams were utterly confusing and unclear, and the class was near impossible to sit through. All he did was ramble and scream... AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!
Good Teacher. Very interested in the topic. If you don't go to class, it isn't going to kill you, but it does help. The reading is alright and the tests are open book.

horrible. there is no other word to describe it. he is crazy and ridiculous! rude, mean, and insensitive are definately words to describe him by. im completely turned off to philosophy i wish i never wouldve taken this class in the first place, now im stuck because i cant drop the class... it sucks. he drones on and on about stuff not in book
Dr. Miller's class is laid back, just like him. With that said, you will come out of the class knowing a lot more about the topic and about yourself.
Great teacher who keeps you interested and helps you find yourdelf even if you're not looking.

I dreaded taking this class when I signed up for it, but now I'm very interested in the subject. Extremely knowledgable and ethusiastic. He is laid back and willing to work with you. He can be forgetful at times, but its not bad. He can be very funny as well. If you like lectures and writing this class is for you. I'd recommend him.

Horrible. He's usually at least ten minutes late, and always holds class at least five minutes over.  The texts assigned are confusing and even if you read them, the quizzes are still hard to answer.  Final isn't too bad, but he takes off points and never says why.  Rambles and yells a lot. Don't take unless you're really patient.

I took this class because I heard about Miller from others.  They were right. He is as interesting as he is compassionate and knowledgible.  If you don't understand him, it's because your not letting his words and questions get under your skin and cause the kind of deep personal introspection that is his goal.  Chat with him in the smoking area...

Maybe he did a little too many drugs back in the 60's, im not sure...kinda gives that hippie vibe.fun guy, entertaining in class.very passionate,you can tell that philosophy is his life.I would recommend him,as long as youre ready to take a look at your own life and beliefs.he will challenge them. he will make you think. he will be late for class.

Name: Michael Collins
Comment: Mike is an amazing professor who cares about his students, unless they are late. Lectures are long and information filled but he does a good job of segmenting it to keep your attention. Some people don't like the way he goes through problems, but I like watching someone do an example instead of baby-stepping us through the. Highly recommend.

Collins is the worst professor. He writes everything in cursive so if you were born after 1998, dont take him because we were not taught cursive. He also doesnt really teach and expects you to know everything. I still have not received my final test grade and its been almost two semesters. He takes easy content and makes it IMPOSSIBLE to learn.
He is a nice person but a terrible professor. If you skip class or do not do the homework, you won't pass.
Really good at explaining things, always willing to go the pace you need to go
Terrible teacher doesnt know what hes talking about teaches things so difficult expects you to know what he does

Mr. Collins is a fantastic teacher, as a matter of fact I just registered for another one of his classes. If you honestly put forth the effort you will do great in this class. The thing that I love the most about him is that he teaches the material, tells you what homework problems to do, and then at the beginning of every class he goes over it!

I LOVE professor Collins. I think he is such a sweet guy and genuinely cares about his students' success. His lectures can sometimes get confusing, but he is happy to answer questions. Definitely show up to class though bc you'll miss a lot if you miss a class session. This class is especially easy if you've taken algebra before!

I took this class for maybe two months this semester and had to drop it. His teaching style is very confusing, he often gets lost or makes mistakes while he's trying to explain problems  to the class and if he can't keep up with them I'm not sure how we are supposed to.

I'm having him right now for MAT114. I'd say he gets you loss very easy. He just gives examples and ask the class if they have any questions. But how can anyone ask if they are loss in the first place? All homework are online. The practice problems are not graded. There're a lot of content than you think. But he is a nice old man to talk to.

He is not very helpful when it comes to answering questions. He doesn't even really teach. He just puts examples on the board and expects us to know how he got the answer. He's very rude and isn't consistent with grading. He'll take points off for one person's wrong answer but not another's. It's very annoying.

Do the homework and you'll do fine in his class. He's always willing to go over the problems from the homework the next day before you turn it in. Ask questions, don't be afraid of being judged by other students. Majority of the time, someone else wanted to ask it but was too insecure. Put forth the effort and you'll get a great return from him.

The class itself is not complicated if you have a good professor, but professor Collins is not helpful. His lectures consist of him writing examples on the board, not explaining them, and expecting you to simply understand his process.

I honestly don't think the class itself was hard I just think he could've done a better job teaching. You definitely should show up to class. He's a really nice man and he will help you if you ask but the help isn't exactly helpful...

In his class right now. You have to go to class to understand the material. He's not exactly a bad professor, but he gets distracted very easily, and can't see anybody in the back of the room. Quizzes at least once a week. Pay attention and do your homework and you should be fine.

He doesn't collect the homework, but in order to do well in the class it is really essential that you do it. He does care about his students, and is very willing to help during his office hours. He gives a lot of partial credit when grading tests and quizzes.

Professor is half blind, and is bad at responding to questions. The examples on the board are written in chicken scratch and if you want him to go over a specific part again, he probably won't. Doesn't like to help, and just assumes you know what he's talking about. I found the class extremely hard.

If you're not good at math, I don't recommend him. Assumes you know what he is talking about at all times. All homeworks from the section can be turned in anytime before the test, but don't let yourself fall behind because it's easy to just push all the homeworks aside until the last minute. Does not curve tests or give extra credit whatsoever.

Collins is a good teacher! Be sure to pay attention during class and do the homework and you will be good! You go over homework each class and get a quiz every friday! Your homework  has everything the quizzes are over and if you don't understand you can ask during class and he will love to help! Gives 3 extra quizzes to replace lowest quiz grades!

This class is NOT easy and he is NOT a easy grader. I attended every class and barely passed.. literally by a couple points. He is a nice man but his teachinhg is not great. I was always confused and his formula sheet did not help one bit. Swich if you can.

He is NOT easy. I was so confused half the time. His formula sheet did not make since to me. I attended every class and still struggled greatly. Do not take him if you have the chance to switch, DO IT

Name: Jan Anderson
Comment: I disagree with most of these comments, Jan was a great!  I'm awful at math but the way she explained everything made it so much easier for me.  I actually understand what's happening in class and I really enjoy it!  All the homework is online and it adds up to an entire test grade, so do it and you'll get at least one easy A on a test.

I do not agree with a lot of the comments. Ms. Anderson was super nice and always willing to help. She always took extra time explaining even if only one student did not understand the material. I would highly recommend her.

WORST TEACHER EVER. she doesn't care about you or your work. she puts you down when you don't know how to solve a problem. she gets really sassy and doesn't mind humiliating you in front of the class. she's done it to me many times. she makes you feel completely stupid. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS CLASS. TERRIBLE TEACHER. TERRIBLE CLASS. PATHETIC

I will never take this teacher again. She is such a.. Word that I can't say on here. If you take her class... Don't even bother to ask for help because she will look at you like you are crazy and then down grade u in an unnecessary way. She treats you like you are in highs chill and I never met a more rude teacher. I will pray for her.

Anderson has no patience  with students. i struggled a lot in this class and every time i asked for help she would get sassy and treat me like i was stupid. she wasn't helpful at all and failed to actually show me how to do it. she would write the problem down, solve it, then leave. and wasn't afraid to reveal my grade (bad) in front of the class
She tells you to buy the textbook and you don't ever use it. She kind of gets an attitude when you ask for help. Would not recommend.
She is very easy to get along with and she is very understanding!
Great teacher! I loved every single class i attended. She was very clear, extremely helpful, very nice and easy teacher. If i could, i would take her again;) Highly recommend!!!!

The material to learn wasn't too hard, but she made it difficult to understand sometimes. Other times, she went over material too much and it became really boring. I am glad I don't have to take this class again.

Very rude. She would be very smart alecy and made me feel dumb all the time. I would not take her if I was anyone. I am so glad I am done with that class and I will never sign up with her again. I like all my other teachers.
I'm not very great at math at all But Jan really helped ALOT!  She explains things really well in a way you can understand! Great Teacher! Highly Recommended!
I disagree with several of the other comments made. I found Anderson to be fairly easy and even elementary which was good for me. Tests were very similar to study guides.

She's really nice but at times, tends to treat students like they are in middle school or high school. Homework is given but no specific due date, and is not necessarily graded. It's just for practice and studying for tests. Attendance isn't mandatory but I don't recommend skipping because she does a new chapter everyday.
IF YOU STRUGGLE IN MATH TAKE HER CLASS. VERY HELPFUL!

I am horrible at math and I did great in her class. She is a great professor if math is not your best subject. She makes everything very clear and is very helpful if you ever need it. Would take her again no doubt.

The class in general isn't to bad. I hate Math, and I did horrible at it in Highschool. After taking this class, I have really enjoyed learning it. I am not a Math person but Jan, makes it so easy to understand. She spends alot of time on problems, which is really helpful. If you are bad at math she is who you want. Boring class, but learned alot.

Jan was great! I went to study tables a couple of times when I didn't understand something in class, and she sat down & simplified things for me.  She is very patient and understanding to situaions that may arise outside of class. Take her if you struggle with math--she's a huge help.
Really Great Teacher!!!

Worst teacher ever! Not kidding-very very negative. Does not care how hard you try, acts like she is the only one that has a life outside of class. Just wrong for a 95 or 99 teacher-made me what to drop out, before I even got started. WORST TEACHER EVER! period.
Jan is a great teacher.  You earn your grade, she is very fair and quite patient. If you are not a great math person I would recommend taking her, you'll get through and you will not feel stupid.

Name: Augustine Yaw Frimpong-Mansoh
Comment: Dr. Yaw is a passionate, energetic lecturer from Ghana, but don't let that distract you. He really wants his students to participate in class. Take his class in person! Online version is excessive busy work. In person class includes a few quizzes, an open-response, opinion-based midterm and final, and one debate group project that was simple.

He focused mainly on African bioethics when it was supposed to be a general class. Not easy to access outside of class, isn't even the one to grade the work. His assistant gives low grades with no feedback. He even makes you buy his dumb African bioethics book. Please do not take this guy, he is horrible, this should have been a fun class.

Dr. Yaw is a nice professor with quick response times. That being said his bioethics course focused almost solely on African bioethics even though the course was health care bioethics. 1 out of 4 exams is multiple choice the rest are written 3-4 page papers. If you have difficulty writing papers do NOT take his class.
Never knows how long his class is supposed to last, gives a syllabus for an 8 week course, divides work as such, turns out its a 16 week course everyone's confused

It was a pleasure to have Dr. Yaw. His lectures were very informative and engaging. You definitely want to read the material before you come to class. One thing I really liked is that he would tell us what the extended response question(s) were going to be on a test; rather than testing our memorization, he wanted to see us engage in critical thought with the material. Overall, I would recommend Dr. Yaw as a professor - you do have to put in time and effort, but I think the experience is rewarding.

I have no idea why anyone would give him a low score.  I made nothing below a 93 in the class.  He doesn't overload you with work and I took the 8 week version of the class.  Anyone that complains about him is just a whiner.
Hardest teacher possible. Covers almost no material, doesn't give you feed back on why answers are incorrect. Grades very subjectively. WE ARE NOT PHI MAJORS!

I can't speak for Dr. Yaw's in-person classes, but do not take him online unless you enjoy independent study. Minimal interaction - no recorded lectures or anything. Materials were long reading assignments and Powerpoint slides with a few YouTube videos. Had to contact several times for clarification on assignment instructions. Don't recommend.
some exams are too hard, can't even find between lines, and some are the exactly from the study guide. NOT helpful at all

The first week I was worried, he is from Ghana and has an accent and I was afraid he would be hard to understand, I was wrong. Very funny, very easy, gives study guides with answers before all tests. Very understanding about late work. I wish he taught more classes I needed.
All of the test question comes from text book. Answers are easy to find, and tests are open notes.This class feels like an debate/opinion based class. I recommend him

I can't objectively say everything I want to say in this limited space. Shortened version: most of the class went to the chairs of CIT and PHI and voiced concerns about how the class was being taught. Class time was spent poorly and it was basically not worth going to the lectures b/c he didn't go over course material.  Read the book, take the test
Great teacher

He gives quizzes every week. You have to get the answers right from the book. He isn't very helpful in class but he does give extra credit. He's not the best teacher in the world, but I could tolerate him. I'd take the class, but be warned that sometimes you'll want to walk right out the door!

One of the best teachers I have had so far.  Fair in grading.  If you read and take notes during class you will be fine.  He is very clear on what he expects of you and willing to give extra credit. I highly recommend him he's funny at times as he really gets into his discussions.

I am not majoring in philosophy, but I still LOVED this class. He is very passionate about the topics and can get excited at times. It is one of my better classes. BE PREPARED (read chapters) before class AND take notes, you'll do fine

Took for Africana PHI, good class and great discussions.  I liked it a lot.  A little on the hard side.  If you're planning to take him make sure you leave yourself plenty of time to do the assignments.

I have taken Dr. Ya for intro to ethics, race and PHI, and Africana PHI. Although the ethics class was at times disorganized all other classes were superb. His strength lies in teaching philosophy concerning race and although his accent can be hard to understand it really does grow on you after awhile. Take his course!

This class is a total headache.  Honestly, really nice guy but the class is a pain. We just run in circles. You never get your quizzes/tests back to see what you did wrong. Very disorganized.  And, most of all, he expects a lot of students when the teaching is not really that great in helping you get prepared. Stay away.

Dr. Yaw was very knowledgeable and helpful.  Unfortunately we were all in there as an elective.  He does get very excited about his profession and is passionate about the subject.  You certainly need to take a stand, but most importantly backup as to why you feel as you do.  He is a very nice guy, but not easy!!

Name: Joanie Zhang
Comment: This professor is a joke. I took online. Exams and assignments are easy, group project sucked. WAY TO MUCH WORK INVOLVED, and she doesn't explain any of it worth crud. Stay away from her if at all possible.

Poor Instructor.  I'm non-trad. Great student w/another M.S. degree in Engineering & has taught.  Dr. Zhang is terrible.  Covered 5/25 chapters in book.  Tested 2.  Tests = ridiculous and ambiguous essays.  Answers she wanted were no where need the question.  SAP labs make up for the tests.  She explains them well. I will avoid her in the future.
She is more than willing to explain anything and everything at any time for me. I really appreciate her help.

I really enjoyed this class over all.  If you come to class you will be fine. Yes, she does have a accent BUT if you choose to listen and sat some what close you would easily understand what she is saying.  Ignore all these people who say they couldn't understand. Come to class, and actively listen during class and you will pass this class EASILY!
She is an amazing professor. She always spent time with students who need help.
Not really sure how this class is benefiting anyone...we're learning Oracle 8i...9i was End Of Life in 2003. This is 2010.
Great professor, always willing to help though the class is too intensive. Too many assignments.

I took introduction to database design with her. Class consisted of going over power point presentation notes of each chapter and some exercises from the text book. All assignments and notes were online. If you had any questions for her in class or otherwise she was extremely helpful :D
The class itself I found very interesting. But I felt like I was in A Ph.D class. Way too much work. She is a nice professor, but I spent more time on this class than any class I have ever taken.
The project was very time consuming but she was helpful and patient with us. She was also flexible on some deadlines.
Very knowledgeable and accessible.
I took her database class. She was very responsive and very helpful
I enjoyed her class. Her exams are hard but fair. She told us what to study for.
Great teacher! She is able to make me understand statistics. Highly recommended.
She is very knowledgeable. I learned a lot from her class. She always responds to students emails promptly.

She is a very nice lady, who grades pretty generously. There are not many out of class assignments other than a main project. She gave us time in class, almost every period, to work on the final project. Exams are not cumulative, and are online based (at home). I would recommend taking her if I had the option again.

Not only is she hard to understand, but she barely teaches! She reads off PowerPoint but doesn't describe anything, even homework assignments (which aren't on the syllabus, she springs them on you halfway thru the semester). One of the worst professors I've had.

This class should have been completely online, considering she didn't teach a single thing.   If you had any hope to learn anything it was on your own from this poorly rated book.  Also, verbal communication is painful.

Ok, so she is EXTREMELY nice, and will help you to the best of her ability.  Verbal communication is hard, but her emails are very helpful.  You basically teach yourself though.  Lots of in class homework, lots of reading the textbook.  She tells you specifically what to study and the tests are multiple choice.

only take her if you have a pretty good prior knowledge of the subject. you cannot understand her first of all, and she jumps right into the subject matter way ahead of time, expecting you to know what is going on, i dropped this class and am taking it again with Richardson,GREAT PROF. we are doing things now we had to do the 2nd day of class in Z'

Name: Bavand Karim
Comment: It seems like we just started getting some recognition for our work with Film Society, won some awards and got an Emmy nod, but Bavand had to move on to bigger things. I think most of the students he worked with will miss him. He was a great leader for our group.
Good professor for single camera production

What aggravated me about Bavand's course was that he wasn't teaching us true screenplay format as he claims, but rather how to write spec, or shooting, scripts. He also relies too heavily on the Blake Snyder "beat sheet" as the end all-be all of script story formatting. NOT EVERY NARRATIVE WILL FIT THE FORMAT! Okay course, but read Syd Field's work
Good quality
Working with Norse Film Society has been amazing

His screenwriting section was one of the best classes I have ever taken at NKU. The lectures were always interesting and he gives you a lot of different examples and tools to learn the correct structure. I look at movies in a completely different way now.
Great instructor. Accessible and responsive, knows how to engage you with the material.

This was Bavand's first semester as a professor but he knows his stuff and the lectures are always interesting. The class was very focused on cinema and we shoot class projects like a movie crew. Its not the easiest class and he can be critical if you don't arrive on time or work hard, but I learned a lot about film making.

He's a great assets to the EMB department at NKU. He's done quite a few professional independent films. 215 is a Audio production class. It was his first time teaching and Audio isn't his specialty.He was ok, id recommend taking him for Single camera production. He was always very helpful and nice.

Name: Ali Godel
Comment: I have had this professor once as a freshman and once as a sophomore. She is purposefully more challenging in her freshman classes, and admits it herself. My freshman experience was stressful and negative, however, taking her again as a sophomore, she is a lot more relaxed. Willing to work with students to find their passion in research projects.

I will never take this professor again. In assignments, she would leave out required criteria, so when she finally graded them, no one would include the requirement (because she didn't tell anyone about it & it wasn't in the syllabus) and everyone would that deducted. This happened multiple times throughout the course -everyone's grades suffered.

we have 7 different papers due still and there is only a week and half left of the semester!! unorganized! I have only had 2 grades returned at this point. I didn't know professors were allowed to conduct the online part of a hybrid class through Facebook, but she did.  I have never had this much homework in any class, and I'm studying engineering!
She is a nice person, but she is a little disorganized. Communicates mostly by Facebook. The class was interesting.

She was a nice lady but an awful professor. Her grading was nonsensical and if you dared to disagree with her she would argue with you until you gave up. If she disliked your ideas she would trash them and then tell you what to do. She was unprofessional and wouldn''t stop until you saw the light meaning her way.

Sweet in person, not as a professor. It was her opinion or no opinion, and if you didn't agree she talked until you gave in. If you didn't see it her way, you saw it wrong. Classwork not difficult, but project is completely up in the air. Good luck.

Really nice as a person, but not so much as a professor. Very vague in her instructions. Trashed your proposal if she didn't personally like your topic. Very dominating in discussion. Essentially, it was her opinion or none. However, I'd still take her class again if I absolutely had to. Not a horrible professor, but not great, either.

Ali is a good person, but some of her teaching methods are questionable. I didn't always know what she wanted in a speech and the grades were never posted on BB. I'm not saying don't take her, but weigh your options.

Ali is a very nice and relatable person overall, but my experience with her this semester was less than pleasant. She was very unorganized, losing several students' papers and missing important deadlines, and she wasn't particularly understanding with anyone (although she expected us to be with her.) Generally, she's nice, but I wouldn't recommend.

Ali's class was interesting. She's quite the character. Though I initially did not enjoy her class, I warmed up to her over the semester. Her humor can sometimes be a little harsh but it was an easy A, especially for an Honors course.
Pretty good professor. Easily gets sidetracked, but really knows what she is talking about. A lot of reading and writing involved, but grades pretty easily.
Very nice and approachable. Seemed to have favorites, but I believe all grading was fair. I liked her enough to sign up for another one of her class

Ali's a nice, relatable and approachable professor. Her syllabus is clearly outlined and everything you do is in it, including how the assignments will be graded. Sometimes her grading is a little weird (gave a low grade but didn't comment why) but if you ask her about it she's more than willing to explain. Overall, great!
Not difficult if you just talk to her after a speech about the outline and what she wants followed. Don't be afraid to talk to her. Great professor to get to know.
An obvious **** teacher towards girls. If you're a guy you're screwed.

one of the worst classes i've ever taken. hated, hated, hated it. chooses favorites. at the beginning of the semester she said she wouldn't let anyone rag on things that other people liked, but i never ever ever felt comfortable sharing anything because i knew i'd be heckled for it. AWFUL.

Ali is a great speech teacher.  She made class very fun and I really enjoyed going to class everyday.  I never missed her class.  If the class (or you personally) get Ali to like you she will make the class enjoyable and interesting.  I recommend Ali as a teacher.  I am taking her again for sure.

i love Ali! She loves kids who try hard, and you will have to do that if you want a good grade! very easy to relate to, very supportive. gives a fair amount of work, nothing that isnt manageable. she has a wide variety of interests and you can always find something to relate to with her
Ali is awesome! She makes speech fun. Get on her good side and her class is a piece of cake. Go to every class and listen to the feedback she gives you. It does help.

I did not enjoy this class or the professor at all.  I did not learn anything and due to the fact that the class was student discussion based she did zero teaching.  A lot of the assignments were incredibly pointless and did not stimulate me at all. I would not take this professor again.

Name: Kristi Rulli
Comment: Dr. Rulli is very pleasant and helpful. She is available for any additional questions via email and responds in a reasonable time frame. Her class was delightful and she thoroughly reads assignments/papers and provides helpful feedback. Do the work properly and your grade will surely reflect. I would take her class again!

Name: Meghan  Curry
Comment:
- sometimes difficult but will help if you go to office hours
- 5 main projects 2-3 small things per week
- tough grader but gives opportunities to fix grades
- very busy even brought grandson to class one day but works really hard to stay on top of things
-overall good just go to office hours once per 1-2 weeks and you will be fine

Name: Joan Von Handorf
Comment: Ms. Von Handorf is hands down one of the best math teachers I have ever had. This class is for students who did not do well with their math score on the ACT, but it was honestly nice to learn algebra all over again. She is very clear in her teaching and she does not move on until everyone understands the content.

Name: Nichole Ferry
Comment: One of my favorite classes Ive taken at NKU. Nikki is an excellent educator and always clearly explained our projects and made sure everybody understood the expectations. She was always available through email outside of class hours for any questions. Very understanding and wont punish you for missing a class, just dont make it a habit!

Name: Willard Peveler
Comment: Peveler is a good choice as a professor. His class is not easy, but if you are willing to do the work you will get a good grade. If you miss class you miss a lot of material and it will make the exams harder. To get an A you must go to class and have the ability to memorize your notes from class for the exam. If you do these things you will be fine

Name: Jillian Boyle
Comment: Jillian is a really great professor. She knows her material and has been in the field of nursing for several years. I like that she incorporates real life experiences into class because it makes it easier to understand the material. I would definitely take her again. I wish she taught skills as she is an ER nurse!

Name: Diane Fritz
Comment: She teaches a once a week A&P lab. She practically gives away points with 2 in 1. questions, but you have to know the material to get both answers. STUDY. AND SHOW UP! She is super cool, is very easy to talk to and very willing to explain content in a way you'll understand. She'll teach a lot but she teaches it well. 100/10 would recommend her.

Name: Ursula Doyle
Comment: Professor Doyle is a great professor. She pulls the potential out of all who want to learn the content. Outlining throughout the semester is a must and cases should be briefed from all the readings. Professor Doyle is easily accessible via email for questions and to give guidance after the midterm and final. You get what you put into the course.
Extraordinarily well-prepared, effective lecturer. She gives very detailed feedback after exams, which I benefited a lot from, especially in learning legal writing.

Great professor and is very articulate in her lectures. She has a great way of explaining difficult concepts and making them more manageable. She's really friendly and easy to talk to outside of class. Exams are very straightforward and not intended to trip you up. Definitely plan to take her again!

Professor Doyle is one of the most intelligent people I have ever met. However, the fact that she requires only hand written notes and rarely post the PowerPoints from class online makes this an extremely difficult class. We are only graded by a midterm and a final as well.
Prof Doyle is tough, and her grading is heavily influenced by her plaintiff bias.

I don't know why people are giving her bad reviews. She passed me when I really did not deserve it. I got behind and struggled to catch up. She only assigns one or two cases per concept. So make sure you understand the case, holding and why the court ruled that way. If you get behind on one concept you will stay behind so ask for help when needed.
Eloquent and articulate with great explanations and feedback for any issue and topic of the course. Requires you to properly learn and enjoy the subject

Ageee! And you can't record lectures yet she rushes everything and also doesn't post power points. She claims it's bc handwriting helps you remember. We're adults. We should be able to decide how we want to take notes. Go teach kindergarten if you need that much control.

Worst prof ever! Requires handwritten notes, but good luck keeping up. Cancels class and then makes you stay over. Can I reschedule that class I missed? I understand it's law school it's going to be difficult, but it should be possible. It should be doable. Just plain awful!

Name: William Blewett
Comment: Really good guy. Lab is easy and he will answer any questions you have. Was afraid when I got his syllabus- he requires you to develope procedure outside of class but it's not as bad as it sounds and compared to other lab teachers who require 2-3 written reports per lab it's ridiculously easy. Tests not hard at all.

Nice guy, but I always found him a little awkward. Will help you if you ask for it, and yes he doesn't mind if you call his house. Grades pretty fairly. The lectures at the beggining of his labs are long and very boring.

Dr. Blewett is the best.  He lets students email him, call him (at his home), or will come in to help students.  His explinations are sometimes a little complicated but like he told me "Its chemistry its not supposed to be easy"  Ive seen him come early and stay late with students and accepts reports way after their due date. Tests are hard.
