He's a good teacher. the only problem is he likes to explain too much before labs.But he grades pretty good. Aint that picky with reports. Just as long as you fill out your lab book. And there were times when he gave me the answers to some postlab questions when confused so he's helpful. But he does explain how to get the answer.

Not very helpful when asked questions, he will make you feel stupid. Very difficult to understand, and does not explain lab procedures very well. Overall horrible communication and teaching skill. Would not recommend.

Does not know how to explain things to students because he has worked outside of the school for so long.  If you ask him a question, make sure it is a good one because he will make you feel dumb.  Even when you ask him question, he doesn't explain them.  Other instructors may be harder, but at least you will learn something.  Don't take Dr. Blewett

very easy professor, explains things very well.  extremely picky grader, but he also doesn't expect much work out of you compared to other professors.  can be a smartalleck when you ask "silly" questions or don't understand something.

He assigns no pre-lab, no formal lab reports, and is fair with his grading, though very picky.  He gets frustrated if you ask a question and don't understand him the first time.  He's a good guy, but despite the miniscule amounts of work, this is probably one of the harder professors to take.  Recommended if you don't suck at Chemistry or are lazy.

he grades really hard and doesnt give you a break for anything.  it almost seems like he gets off on embarassing people publicly.   hes extremely rude and plays favorites.  not a good professor if your not a chemistry genius

Do not make a single mistake or you'll get your head ripped off.  Be sure to not ask any "stupid" questions.  He seems to have a short temper and no tolerance for ignorance at all.  He needs to chill, not all of us have had Labs before, not all of us are chem. majors and not all of us are perfect.  He settles for nothing less than perfection.

Name: Kristopher Teters
Comment: This was a challenging class, but that's why I'm here. I liked the biography of Abigail Adams we read. We had good discussions in class, and I liked when Prof. Teters helped us see connections between early American history and news today. There is a midterm and final which are reasonable and no surprises. Can be funny sometimes.

He grades to hard for a 100 level class. He always take attendance-- show up! I wouldn't recommend it, very boring and monotone. He thinks you know exactly what he knows and expects that you have as much interest as he does, although most people are taking this class because they have too not because they enjoy history.

His class mostly consists of notes but not all notes are used! Be sure to show up and take really good notes and you'll get at least a B. He has four essay tests total that makes up your grade and participation is 15% of your grade! He gives you the essay questions before the test so you can prepare! As long as you pay attention and prepare ur good

He is very enthusatic  about the subject and you can tell he clearly enjoys it. But there is alot of notes to take, he reads straight off blackboard and will talk until the last mintue. Test are a little tough, but he does tell you exactly what he expects.  Overall pretty good class.

Could have passed the class without going to class if he would have posted the PowerPoints on blackboard. Reads directly off them, doesn't use blackboard at all and grades way too hard for a 100 level gen-ed that most people only take because NKU requires them too. Kind of monotone, very boring.

I have always been a history fan but I still learned a lot and found his teaching interesting. You can tell he is passionate about the subject and he tries to get his students excited about it too. He talks fast so take notes and study them a lot before exams. Take his class.

He is a pretty good teacher but his class is a little on the difficult side. There is a lot of information and the tests are all essays or short answer questions. But if you allow yourself plenty of time to study and make an outline of what you're going to write about you will be fine. But he is a really nice guy who is passionate about history.

Attendance is 15% of grade so go to class. He really loves history and is actually quite entertaining. There are not many grades just a midterm, two essays and a final - (non-comprehensive). Make sure you study for those, but I do recommend his classes.

Name: Shannon Alexander
Comment: Very strict on her grading practices and will cut your points in half for even the slightest mistakes. Very few assignments so it's difficult to make up those points if you miss them.

Shannon is overall an excellent professor. She has high expectations of you, but is very fair and upfront about them. She responds quickly and informatively to emails! Very willing to help if you don't understand something. Excellent communicator! I would definitely take her for other classes!

She is so helpful and gives great feedback! I would definitely take this class again and I would recommend her for any other classes. There is some group work involved, but that is expected at the graduate level. You do have to read a lot, but it is so interesting that you won't mind it. She grades fairly and is encouraging in her feedback.

Name: Kassiani  Kotsidou
Comment: I like the teacher. I learned from her lectures. I did not like the labs. NKU has to spend more money on getting new equipment.
A lot of understanding but she is not a push-over. She knows her stuff inside and out.
I learned more from her than any other professor at NKU and I enjoyed her class.
She doesn't collect homework but if you don't do it, you will not do well on her quizzes and exams. If you don't score well she will curve for the class average, so that helps.

Good instructor but you have to read in order to follow her lectures. But then again how can you possibly graduate in engineering without reading and studying? She was  very dedicated and always there to help, very accessible.
She is tough, but I would take her again. I learned about circuits, and I am sure I will learn a lot from taking her classes.
DONT TAKE A COURSE WITH HER! EVER
Shes tough to understand so if at all possible, sit in the front of the class. You will have a much easier time understanding her.

If you want to learn you will learn. In general the students like her but her job seems challenging being in a male dominated field. She is one of the most helpful and caring professors that I have had at NKU.

I enjoy her lectures. When you visit her office she is more than happy to explain things and give feedback. You do however have to study, her tests are tough. I  admire her because she is the only woman electrical engineer that teaches at NKU.  She deals with colleagues and students who come from countries that don't respect women.

very nice teacher, very wonderful person, but isn't the best of teacher, but i cant blame her, anyone who actually understands circuits is going to have a hard time explaining it simply.  Some students didn't like her, but she really does care, she just sometimes doesn't know how to show it i guess!
More likely to help. Expline everything

Name: Robert Snyder
Comment: I would take any class taught by him, I definitely recommend, hes super funny and fair. He makes class fun for us (:

If you are a person that isn't the best at taking notes I recommend a different Professor.I feel His tests are very opinionated to his views. Hard grader. Powerpoint's aren't clea. I wish I had a different option for an instructor at the time, and I would never take him again.
Good teacher but tests are very hard. There is a lot of informaion and little guidance about what is on the test.
He is AWESOME!!!! He is kind and very helpful. The content of his class is also very informative and inspring.Take this class!!

Very helpful. Is passionate about what he's teaching. Participate, he'll give you credit for it. He actually wants you to learn the information and is helpful in doing so. I would definitely take him again!
All powerpoints studying for this class is hard you don't know what is important and what is not so I would look for someone else.
Great professor. No text book, Clear power points. Very helpful when you need him
Best professor I ever had.  SOOO helpful.

Awesome. No book. All material is from powerpoints which are online. He does not take attendence.  The only grades are four tests and he drops the lowest grade.  I got B's on my first 3 and he said I can skip the last test! Take this class.

Name: Jim Bardtmueller
Comment: This professor cares for the students, he is knowledgeable in Sustainable construction and his power points are very informative. I have been here at NKU for 3 years and I am sad to see Professor Bradtmueller leave, but I wish him luck in whatever he is moving on to do now.
He is nice as a person, but as a professor you cannot expect what he is up to!!

Name: Stuart Oehrle
Comment: lots of work for a onw credit class.  does give a good prelab that goes over the lab.  pay attention to that.  didnt like group work.  some in the group didnt do much.  played music during lab.  overall was ok.  did grade stuff pretty quickly

Dr. Oehrle isn't as bad as people make him out to be. He is a challenging professor and if you don't understand the subjects then you will struggle.  Make sure you have the GRL textbook. He missed 3 of our classes because he was out of town. He will help with labs and give you information that will save you time. some group work, some individual.

Tough grader but included really specific and useful feedback on lab reports and proposals. Can be a bit dry and straightforward, but helpful and genuinely great at teaching and instructing when needed. Overall, not as bad as others say! Make sure you show up and participate in your lab groups!
lot of work for a 1 credit class. Labs were pretty straight forward. DInt like the group work. He would help if you asked him. typically by email was easiest.
Class was Hybrid due to pandemic. He made things very straight forward and answered questions when asked. Class was fine
Show up and do the labs. Youll pass.
Class was fine. Doesnt give out the prelate. You have to take notes. Class was fine.

Cracks a lot of jokes, sometimes humorous, most of the time, very harsh. Not extremely helpful, and often times gets angry when asked too many questions. Listen very carefully to things when he runs through them the first time, or else you will likely be very lost in lab.
I had him a year ago and it was fine. Pretty straight forward on what was expected.

He is very rude and disrespectful towards his students. He is very vague on his assignments and is not approachable. He will treat you like you are stupid when asking a question and will not completely help you which is awful when not knowing what to do. He has also made fun of students. If you take him, be prepared to want to cry.
Standard lab.  Be sure to write down stuff.  He doesn't give handouts or the lecture powerpoint.  Didn't like the group work.
As long as you come to class and do the work you will pass.  Expects you to know the material for class.  Will help you if you ask.  Played music in class to keep it light

DO NOT take this professor! He does and will not give clear directions. Tells you that you have to "figure it out" when there was no direction given at all. He will not help you, and blows you off if you aren't a chemistry major. Very hard grader, and gives you more work than what the class is for. DO NOT TAKE!!!!!!!!!!!!

Class was as expected. Did go over material in lecture prior to start of lab.  Would help you if you asked.  Was upfront about not giving you the answer which made some not too happy.  If you did the work and turned it in on time you can pass
he is so rud

Lab was fine.  Followed a format that all the labs used.  Did a lengthy prelab that went over the lab.  If you took notes and followed them the lab was fine.  Didnt like the group concept.  I would rather fo the lab myself.
Very rude and treats you like you are very dumb if you don't understand a question.I would look for a teacher else wear. He is a very smart man, but I think he is too smart to teach.
He was pretty straightforward and went over the lab pretty well. Left us to do the lab which for some in the class was an issue. I was fine with it.  Some in the class were just lazy and complained.

He was a good teacher in some ways, but bad in others. He took the time to go over the lab before actually proceeding, but was VERY vague and rude when answering questions. You essentially had to tell him your question was stupid to get it answered fully.
rude, arrogant, very unfair with grades if you are not one of his favorites.

Name: Danielle Roemer
Comment: Basically, the class is a writing hour. She provided feedback with writing style and formatting, so I feel much more comfortable with both. Just show up and you will pass. She is the sweetest woman ever, I would definitely take her class again.

You couldn't help but see Roemer as someone who was your precious older neighbor. She assigned maybe 3-4 papers, but if you just follow her laid out expectations YOU WILL PASS! If she didn't take attendance and participation (with absolutely nothing on BB), I would have just stayed home most days. You'll learn nothing, but easy get an easy A.
Dr. Roemer's class is an easy A if you write good papers, show up to class and read the short story that are assigned. One of the easier classes I have taken.

She would take daily attendance and gave points for partcipation. The readings weren't difficult and would give most daily exams over what we had to read but were only 4-5 over plot. Poems didn't have to be read before class but on those days expect to be in class for most of the time period. Usually would let out class early. 3 papers and 2 exams.

She's an absolutely awful grader.  For example, I had 5 typos and got a 75%.... You would think that she would at least take off 2 points out of 20.  Another example, my peer put in an extra insightful quote but it wasn't from the reading.  She gave him a 75%.  Second time going to her class (I have her every Wedn. night) and I'm already hating it.

Her class was easy. Most of the work was in-class two page essays, based on the textbook. The essays are not bad, and she did not necessarily take points off for late in-class work.  She expects the papers for outside of class to be handed in on time. The in-class work can be done ahead of time, and she also allows a work at your own pace classroom

SHe is so sweet. You HAVE to show up for class. If you read the short stories then you will pass most def. She has three papers that are not too hard. Just show up and do the work and you should get a good grade. TAKE HER !

Dr. Roemer is a very nice woman, who does have some quirks, but overall I enjoyed her class. Readings were interesting, and the term paper due at the end of the semester isn't as daunting as it seems once you get into it.  She only covered what is in the syllabus each day, so we routinely got out of class early. Would recommend.

Dr. Roemer is very sweet and as long as you attend class and read the short stories before class you'll do fine.  She has three papers due throughout the semester which I feel are too long for what the subject is but it's not a very big deal.  This class is an easy A and I recommend Roemer!

Mrs. Roemer is a sweet older lady who takes attendance grades. The papers are stretched but fairly easy. Very good grading. Short papers to write everyday but you can leave after you write them or do them before class and take attendance and leave. 3 big papers, 2 are 4-6 pages and the last one is 8pgs. I would highly recommend Roemer!!

I would for sure recommend her! She is so easy. Just come for most classes, she cancels a decent amount, and read before. EASY A! She shows alot of videos and there is only 3 papers and couple of basic quizzes over readings. TAKE HER AND GET AN EASY GRADE!

you dont use the textbook- all the articles you have to write about can be found online. she is strange- and cancels class a lot. just follow the directions for the things you have to write and you'll get an A. very nice woman. i recommend this class for an easy A.

Assigns readings but winds up reading them aloud in class and offers no real insight to what's been discussed. Papers are terrible if only because they're so... uninspired. They have no real direction and you wind up really stretching what little info you have to get 4 pages. A sweet lady but the class feels like you're in middle school again.
A great class. You might not learn a ton, but it's still an interesting class. Just show up, read the short stories and you'll get an A. She is a great person.

I cannot believe that she has a bad rating! This is not exactly a fun class but it is not hard at all. As long as you show up, read and put at least some effort into this class you will be more than fine. I wouldn't have taken this class with anyone else!

Dr. Roemer was a very nice lady. She can be a little weird but this class is easy. It is very boring but she grades very easy. You only have to read short stories and take quizes on them. Just read the stories, they are usually only a few pages and the quizes are an easy pass. The papers are easy, just write what the story says and you'll get an A.

this woman is nice and professional but there is somethine about the way she talks that can drive a person nuts, always taking breaths in in the middle of EVERy sentince and always monotonus. she also stares stright ahead and her eyes seem so dialated like she is on the verge of not even being mentally present. smart lady though,cant take that away
Awesome teacher. If you listen in class and understand what she expects from you, you'll get A's everytime. She is a really nice lady and doesn't demand too much from you.

Dr Roemer would assign reading, then read aloud the same assignment the next day in class with elementary insight into the text. The books chosen were interesting, but there was no analysis and no class discussion, and she was unenlightening. Silly paper topics. Horribly boring class. I was very disappointed. Means well,but poor teacher.
Worst teacher I've ever had.  Doesn't give A's to anyone.  She's rude.  Her class has nothing to do with anything and is pretty much pointless to go to.  She's horrible.

Name: Heather Moulton
Comment: lots of discussion boards and assignment at the end. Does answer emails and gives feedback. was a 7 week course. content was kind of boring but liked that she knew i worked full time
She was awesome!  People complained in class because she expects you to work hard for the grade you earn.  I would definitely recommend taking her.  She is super helpful and will work with you.

She is very young. Seemed timid. Was a long night class once a week. Grades hard but at least gave comments on the papers that we did. Does accept late assignments but will take % off. I would take her again but maybe not in person.
Withdrawn, but expects you to be outgoing.  Boring lectures.  Doesn't grade fairly and doesn't care about life/work/school balance.  Pick another instructor!

Name: Paul Ellis
Comment: A very uninteresting class! i would not recommend him for anyone!

This professor is absolutely awful. He is boring. He is not an understanding person at all. He doesn't seem to stay on task. He is rude. He interrupts you. Did I  say he was awful? Because he is. The class is pointless in itself. I would never recommend this professor to anyone.

I had Paul Ellis for Critical Reading last semester and he was probably one of my favorite professors I've ever had. He gave enough room for the students to express their learning in a way that interested them and I always left class learning something new.
Very boring. Monotone voice. Always off topic and often said inappropriate things. Easy class, but I would not recommend taking one of his classes.

Easy A class. Professor is extremely boring and off task frequently. He class never could go fast enough! If you want an easy A and don't mind being extremely bored then he is the perfect professor to take!

Name: Michael Martindale
Comment: He is an absolutely terrible professor. I dreaded going to this class everyday. His class should really be called creative writing, because that's all you do. He gives you 5 writing assignments outside of class, but leaves no room to help you with him. Total waste of time and money. I definitely do not feel prepared for my next English class.
Terrible terrible teacher, he is very boring. You write in your journal for the entire time. The only good thing is the papers are easy & there is no final.

I've really enjoyed this class. The majority of the time in class is spent journaling about random topics. It's a great chance to be creative with your writing! There are also 5 papers which are easy because you can basically pick whatever you want to write about. I recommend this class, just bring something to read/do in class between journals!

He means well, but I recommend another professor. He is very easy, and if you want a easy english class then he is the one to take. He doesn't really help you with your papers, he just makes sure your grammer is correct and thats all.

Name: Celeste Morris
Comment: She invests heavily in the class, but it's kind of a boring subject so when students don't invest the same she gets upset.  She likes to micromanage and makes you come to class on days where all you do is type on a computer, which could be done much easier at home. She's a very nice person, just not someone I wish I'd taken this class with.
Dr. Morris is always willing to help with questions, even for 340 lecture, which she did not teach. She actually gave study sessions for lecture material when there was extra time after lab.
Very nice- willing to help.  Sometimes doesn't understand that the students do not have a complete understanding of analytical chemistry.  Always willing to meet with you, and isn't a harsh grader.
No Comments

she is very unhelpful and rude i wish i was a super hero and could sling cold spaghetti on her because nobody likes cold sphagetti and gees can you kindly actually help somebody by showing us how to do the dang problems lord knows Dr padolik wont
She was helpful and funny!
she is suppose to help us in SI but all she does is belittle us and make us feel stupid for asking questions

She is the intructor for the SI is Che 120 and she is a joke! She is suppose to be showing a people how to work out chemistry problems and all she does is haandout worksheets! She is very short tempered when you do not understand very unwilling to give any help as to the hows and whys of problem solving big thumbs down!

Name: Lee Weiner
Comment: Awesome teacher, definitely not as bad a guy as people think he is.  He is extremely helpful as long as you ask questions BEFORE the due date.  Only Class in college that I've had where paying attention was easy.  Its really sad to see someone this good at teaching CSC courses retire.

Extremely rude and unhelpful. Explanation is good but I do not know what he thinks of himself. He thinks he is the smartest person in the whole world, saying whatever he says is right. I do not recommend him.

Beware! If you miss one day he will subtract 50 points from your test scores.  I was sick and missed 4 of his classes even with a doctors note he took two of my test scores of 100% and turned them into zero's. I would have gotten an A but because of that I got a C. Does this after student evaluations are submitted to avoid flak, Bozo the Clown Hair

He will make you learn - bottom line. I learned more in this class than in the previous two OOP classes combined. Be warned: He admitted to "leaving things out" of homework assignments just to get you to ask him questions. It's a petty, stupid teaching tool, but he uses it. So, don't assume - ask.

funny class if you don't mind the language. good beginner computer class but you do need to listen because he will say some thing in it will not be in the notes or the book but it will show up on the test.

Tests are hard you really don't have anything to study off of.  He loses his train of thought frequently.  Labs are confusing, he does give instructions to follow but they need to be clarified and step by step instead of somethings implied.  Altogether an alright course.

Yes he's entertaining to listen to but sadly his entertainment value does not account for the fact that the majority of what he teaches in this class is based on his own personal experience. He claims that he is the authority on certain topics and are proven wrong in more advanced courses. Too bad you havent any alternative for this course.
Kind of funny, love to hear him speak.

Weiner was an awful professor. He is unclear on his tests because they are very opinionated. His tests are hard and there isn't hardily anything to study off of. Don't ask questions either or he will be rude about it, he expects you to know everything that he teaches.

Professor Weiner is a funny guy. He drops the F-Bomb every minute and it is interesting to find out what he is going to say next. Its hard to ask questions because he never answers them nicely I think its because he is from New York its the way they talk. His tests were really hard, he tries to trick you on alot of the questions but good guy

This friggin' guy is a real piece of work! He drops F bombs like I breathe air, he's got crazy hair, he smokes like a chimney and according to him, "takes his pants off" to play video games. So it would seem odd that he is undoubtedly the BEST professor I've ever had. I learned a TON! This guy knows his stuff. He's HILARIOUS.  Best class ever!

I loved weiner!  I am def going to take all of the classes that I can by him.  Yes he cusses in class, but I want to go to class just so I can see what he is going to come up with.  You have to do the work, but isnt that what college is?

He is a pretty nice guy, until you tell him that you did something wrong or you ask a question that isn't a good one (in his opinion). I was very hesitant to ask questions or ask for help because I thought he would jump me for it. As far as his teaching techniques, he is a good teacher.

Very opinionated. If you use anything besides Mircosoft/windows, you will hate this class. He has a huge bias towards windows. And not very knowledgeable on what he taught in this class. That's all I'll say about that.

He's a pretty good professor. He's so funny. He knows his stuff and answer almost any question you have. Be warned. If you don't follow directions, he will make you look stupid. I'd recommend him. Test aren't too bad.

great teacher.if you are the type of person who has to meet with profs and b.s. with them, then dont take this class. however, i love his style of teaching, and if you can shut up and pay attention you will learn a TON. the man is absolutely hilarious and i enjoyed his class. highly recommend the class to people who actually want to learn something

Teacher was awesome!  He has a great sense of humor, and he really knows his stuff.  If you are an egotist who knows it all, TAKE ANOTHER CLASS!  He is in the classroom to help those who don't now what they're doing, so pay attention, do your assignments on time and you will learn more than you ever counted on.

Ok, so I will definitely agree he is rough around the edges, BUT he is still a really good teacher.  In fact, he has a great sense of humor.  I've never had to go to him for too much help, but as long as you ask decent questions and aren't pushy he doesn't get cranky.  I would definitely take another course from him without a second thought.

Weiner knows almost everything there is to know about JAVA. He teaches his class very well. But he is the true meaning of the word GEEK. Dictionary - Geek - N.- Someone who is socially inept.  If you need help with anything DO NOT rely on this guy to help you out.  He is not a people person what-so-ever!

Very high expectations!  Constantly bragging about the difficulty level of his 260 class.  Not a people person and sometimes very rude.  Not recommended for people with little or no experience in programming.  Proceed with caution.

Name: Gretchen Kauscher
Comment: Mrs. K makes it very easy for you to pass her class. Not real upbeat morning person :). I did not like that she would stop class for her students who came in 10, 20, and 40 minutes late but she's nice. Go to class, get 100% on ALL the homework, and do ALL the extra credit. If you fail, it's because you didn't do the work outside the classroom.
ew

She was a very helpful teach, lots of extra credit and I actually learned ALOT from her. she breaks it down with explanations so it makes sense. Remedial class for me and glad I had her. Highly recommend her for anyone struggling in math.
Why anyone would rate her low is a mystery.  Gives so much extra credit, lets you correct tests, and will meet with you anytime she can.
Very monotone teacher. Two hour classes were unbearable. Not a hard teacher or class.
Best professor I ever had
Not sure why so many didn't l her. She gives so many opportunities to help you pass, and I have neverunderstood algebra unjtil now. she is a littlmonotone, but I wan't there to be entertained.

This instructor is a hard one to rate.  She was very willing to meet with you and set up times before tests to be available for questions.  That said, she wasn't always clear in how she taught.  She was nice but not very personable..if that makes sense.   Would I take her again?....probably.

Remedial class for me, but I knew everything except application problems. This was a problem seeing as how she rarely explained things clearly. If she was slightly more fun it would be fine. I'd recommend taking someone else. She's very nice though.
awful. she isnt helpful at all. she never works with students!
HORRIBLE dont take her!!!! no more explanation needed!

Don't take her class. Find someone else. Yes she is that bad. She does not answer questions or help she looks at you like you are stupid and moves on. although i have an A in this class i would not recomend her for anyone who seriously struggles with math
there is no method to her madness!
She really needs to find a new approach to teaching.  The class is so boring, and she is so monotone.  Its so hard to even sit through class.  She just needs to keep things to the point.
Extremely, extremely monotonous. Tends to repeat useless information. Attendance is mandatory, which sucks. She's really rude in email communication. I don't recommend this class.

Overall, a nice teacher. She does speak very monotone and slow. Everytime I asked for help, she kinda talked about the overall paper/test,  and not what I was specifically inquiring about. It was frustrating, but not a hard class.
She was so boring and had a monotone voice like the guy in the Clear Eyes commercial. I wouldn't recommend her for a person who falls asleep in class easily.
She was ok, but her clarity not da best

I had her for both math 095 and 099.  She is a great teacher, but she is also extremely dry humored and montonous.  It was really hard for me to concentrate in class because she would ramble and repeat things that I already knew because of prior experience and goes over and over and will answer any questions you have.

umm, well i thought she was okay.  she didnt really make things clear after she taught it to u.  I would always have to go and get help from someone who had taken a different professor.  test were easy tho if u knew that u were doing

Name: Ron Bramlage
Comment: Wow. This guy never actually holds class. I heard he has had several semesters where he switches to online only in the middle of the course. I learned nothing. What a disappointment.

took him online and couldnt have asked for an easier class.You have 10 discussions that he says are due by every sunday night, but literally you could turn them all in the day before the final and would still get credit.Slow at grading.You have one midterm and one final.WILL NEED THE BOOK!Also a 6 page paper, not hard, seriously.igot an A.TAKE HIM!
No Comments

Name: Patricia Connelly
Comment: By far the worst professor I had in my first semester of college. She encourages you to ask questions but when you do she makes you feel stupid to the point that nobody asks questions anymore. A lot of homework and if you dont do the test corrections, she takes 10 points off. Tests are not that bad and final was the easiest of them all.
She is a good teacher teaching wise but she absolutely confuses you and is very mean and wants it her way and have to do all the work. I suggest not taking her it is a long ruff ride.

Absolutely the worst professor I have ever had. Marks answers wrong even though they are correct, then refuses to correct your grade because you didn't do the process her way. Would never take her course again. Steer clear from her class if at all possible. I decided to do the work, take the ACT and score a 21 then you can avoid her period.
Wouldnt recommend. Makes you feel stupid and points her students out.  Willing to help, but not very easy--Lots of homework.
She is an amazing woman! He is so very helpful and really explains things well! i loved her and i will definately take her again!
Always willing to help! I recommend taking her! I am taking her again for 099.

Mrs.Connely is kinda scary at first she is very hard and expects you to come to class every time... She is super helpful and always willing.. As long as you try she will help out.. She is awesome just hard and strict
TONS of homework. both from textbook and online.  She does throw some jokes in which are kind of funny, but extremely hard and does make you feel stupid sometimes.  I wouldn't recommend.
Funny lady. Just show up to class and do the homework. She can also be pretty intimidating at times, though.

Connelly is a really tough teacher to get through a math class with. Every class day gets loaded with homework, both online and from the book. She can be a funny teacher unintentionally often times at least

wow, definitely the funniest teacher i've ever had with the way she tries to relate almost everything to real life, with crazy, i guess, analogies, you could call them, she seems to make up on the spot. I laughed a lot in that class due to all these. she raises her eyebrows a lot, this is also quite funny. she tries to help, but she goes too fast

She is VERY thorough and VERY clear about what you're supposed to do.  It's a lot of homework, but the homework she gives basically prepares you for her tests-which are exactly like the homework.  All in all, she's awesome.  The only thing that bothered me was the HUGE deal she made out of tardiness.  But it's her rule.

She is rude to her students and makes you feel stupid.  She wouldn't let me make up a quiz because I was at a funeral, even though I told her ahead of time that I wasn't going to be in class that day and I explained the circumstances.  I failed her class, and then took it in the summer and passed with a B with a different professor.
She is a gre t teacher, but you have to show up to class. She is not hard, but you have to be there if you xpect to pass

She is a very difficult professor, does not teach her material well. I had taken a chemistry 120 class and was doing much better in that then I was in her class. She treats you like you are dumb when you ask questions. I recommend not taking her

She is the best at what she does.  She does give you the material fast, but she is not a hard professor.  She assigned gobs of homework, but I know it was only ro reinforce what we did in class.  Don't think you skate through her class.  She is helpful, but demanding.
i like her i just cant get the material

god love her, she is a saint to have had the patience she had with me and others in my class.  she goes fast for me, but cannot slow down for the whole class because a few do not understand.  will help outside class anyway she can.  even met us on sunday nights to help us study for tests and quizzes.  goes above and beyond any other math faculty.
explains things a little fast but is helpful.  she has a pretty rude personality though
She was an excellent teacher.  She does everything in her power to help her students.  Would love to have her again.

Name: Debra Pearce
Comment: cool teacher. Lecture based. very knowledgeable, was intimidated by reviews on here, but if you pay attention, study and come to class you will do fine. She is excellent at reading e-mails and extra credit when she feels that it is needed.

Really learned a lot of information in this class, although it was a tough A to acquire. If you dont attend class you will fail, very lecture heavy. if you have the opportunity to take nutrition online take NUTRITION ONLINE, VERY EASY 'A'
Some of her methods are a bit ridiculous, but overall she is a good professor. I think she could use a little more compassion in some areas, but again overall she is a good professor.

This class is very informative. You learn interesting things and you can apply it to your daily life. You have to study to earn your grade. It is a pretty fair class. DON'T buy the book!!!! All you the things you need to know are in her outline. Even if she does not take attendance you should come to class.

Dr. Pearce is not a bad professor by any means, but her class is definitely not easy. Her tests and quizzes are very detail oriented, and a lot of times they include things that are not on her outlines but over things that she mentions in class. If you skip class a lot you definitely will not pass.
she was rude, hard to hear, she played favorites, and she went way too fast

Yes this class is hard, don't take it if you want an easy A. There are 5 quizzes 3 exams and a cumulative final. Again, its HARD. But I actually really liked her. She's fun and explains things well. I've learned so much from taking this class and use the knowledge in my everyday life. If you are good at memorizing, this class isn't that difficult.

Avoid this class. Her tests and quizzes are very difficult and very detailed oriented. The study guides and outlines are no help at all. I would recommend having taken similar classes or take another professor if you value your GPA.
LOL the amount of material that you need to know is ridiculous. Quizzes that are true or false- are you trying to make me cry???

She's okay, but I would recommend taking this class with a different professor. I've heard others are MUCH easier. You MUST study, A LOT. She tests you on very small details, and she sometimes tries to trick you. All the quizzes are true/false, which is sometimes hard. All the tests are multiple choice. She's not awful, but not easy.

Avoid. Her quizzes each class period are over the lab that you are about to do, not the previous one. Impossible! The homework assignment we had, she never clarified that it was supposed to be typed, so did not receive full credit for that. Does not give you anything to study off of. Doesn't give you any kind of credit for actually doing the lab.
Alright teacher. Hard tests, gives you useless study guides.
Horrible professor. Notes are terrible. Are to study for test.

After reading the reviews on here I was scared to take this class.  I have to say that it wasn't as bad as everyone made it sound.  Just make sure you print the outlines off blackboard and study those.  She is very knowledgeable and helpful.  I also recorded the lectures which really, REALLY helps.  I liked her!

Great professor - very smart and helpful. Genuinely fun person.  The material is difficult and confusing, but if you come to class *regularly* it is no problem.  She gives extra credit sometimes too, but not much.  I have learned so much about health and nutrition from this class - and it is applicable to daily life! You will learn so much :D

She is a really great teacher. She tries to make learning fun. She will also help you with any questions you have. As long as you show up and take notes, then you will study. She gives outlines for the chapters so you  just have to fill them in. Great teacher!
Great teacher. tough material and tough tests. Much study required.

Dr. Pearce is easily one of the best lecturers on campus. She is impossibly knowledgeable within her subject matter and presents material in a clear and concise manner. Attendance is effectively required, and the tests are...intense. Dr. Pearce grades without mercy. Study the notes, the lecture, the book, and you'll do well. Just...don't slack off.
Good at teaching, but exams are very hard. Have to read her notes and text very carefully.

Basically what everyone else said.  If you want to do good on her test, READ THE BOOK, and not just the day before the test.  Also, write down everything she says in lecture, no matter how minor it seems, there is a good possibility it will be on the test.

Name: Matthew Gregory
Comment: He is in my mind is the best Stat's professor at NKU. He gives out packets on the material that is on the tests! He is very approachable and is willing to help, you just got to put in the effort! The tests resemble what is taught through the packets, quizzes, and homework. He also gives an optional research project to help! Great professor!!!

His note packets are really helpful, but a couple things pop up on the exam that you have never done before which can be extremely frustrating. If the whole class misses the problem, he still takes it as full credit.

Name: Amy Abafo
Comment: Professor Abafo really cared about her students. She did her best to help us grow as writers. She is definitely one of the best professors I've had.

Amy Abafo is very caring and nice professor. Despite that, her class was very unorganized. Grades were never posted online, not even at midterms. All your grades were in her gradebook. Assignments were odd at times and didn't really reflect the class. Lectures didn't have much of a purpose. Coming to class started becoming a question of why.

Name: Raj Akula
Comment: Raj is a good professor, you just have to want to learn from him and be patient.  He has a very different style of teaching but he actually teaches you whats important rather than blathering on about repetitive things and going over concepts we have all already learned like many professors.  His class helped me the most in my profession.
It was okay, he could of explained a bit better.

Name: Jennifer Miller
Comment: Jennifer Miller was a pretty great professor. She was funny, helpful and her lectures were pretty nice. Show up and read the book and you'll do fine.

I took her for Human Nutrition and it was her 1st time teaching the class. She did very well and was very detailed in her lectures. Gives SGs to help with tests. And they really do help a lot. You can read the book and skip, but you'll learn more from her lectures. Gives EC later in trimester that deals with what will be on the final. Loved her!

Name: Jennifer Kreder
Comment: Get ready to teach yourself from the book. Asked to have one on one time with her and she declined. Cares too much about the bar (if that's even a thing), doesn't care enough about what she is supposed to be teaching. Would not take her again if my life depended on it.

Professor Kreder may be the best Bar Exam coach I've encountered. She is focused on preparing students to pass it in every class she teaches, and willing to provide individual feedback and coaching. She also does an excellent job of lecturing in ways that ensure all styles of learners receive what works best for them.
Great Teacher. Most practical law professor I ever had. Focuses on black letter. Great and Simplifying. After doing bar prep videos I really missed her.
Not only does she make class interesting, she also prepares you for the bar, but gives real world application to the material

Her life is chaotic and she brings chaos to class. Everyone jokes that she doesn't follow black-letter law, rather Kreder law. She makes things up as she goes. Most people don't think she even understands half of what she teaches. She also likes the weird people of the class. Good luck if you're well-dressed and normal.
Worst teacher at chase law school.  Writes a lot of interesting law review articles.  Sucks hard as a teacher.

Had a very hard time with this class, She tests over a lot of silly material that is rarely mentioned in class, kentucky flag statutes? esign? anyone?  I think she is super intelligent, but doesn't focus on that class very much and it shows with inconsistent teaching.

She read straight out of the book a lot.  She canceled our class but continued to teach her other class (of different students).  She's very kind and approachable.  She's passionate about property and enjoys property litigation (has experience with WWII litigation!).  She has had a few bad days and a tough semester.

Property, wow.  She was questioned/corrected more than any other professor I've had, but it was the first time she was teaching the course.  Her lectures were riddled with inconsistencies and contradictions.  First semester, those who did not do a single thing extra participation-wise received a point boost for extra participation.  Ridiculous.
Excellent professor.  She made materials in several classes quite clear and palatable.  She is in earnest in her desire to help students succeed in her classes.
She is all over the place during class. Her exam will focus on the most unsuspecting topic that you covered. I learned more by looking at my past outlines then time spent in her Remedies class.

Name: Julian Young
Comment: Loved this professor. Made Psychology fun
LOVED THE CLASS! She is so nice and the lectures are super interested. I really enjoyed going to class and learning about this! No cumulative exam. Loved it. I hope to have her again.

She's a fantastic teacher. Attendance is definitely a must, otherwise you might fall behind. It's best to read the book prior to the test because it really supports what she says in lecture. Her class is hard if you don't study or just don't care. She's a great teacher even though she is a little too loud. I love the stories about her kids, though.
love this class! tests are hard !
Not easy. Go to class otherwise you'll be lost. She can be funny but she's very tough and the tests are nearly impossible. People fail all the time, not very helpful.

Horrible, rude, annoying, and loud sums her up. She doesn't teach anything.. the book is a waste because she says the exact opposite of the book. the averages on the test were 60s ... wonder why ... because she's awful. She talks during test.. so its hard to focus on it..
i loved her! she keeps the class interested and she wasnt too hard.

Her lectures are pretty cool, makes it interesting, which makes class fly by. Don't by the textbook, I didn't use it once all semester. Attendence is mandatory and it is not an easy A by any means but if you look over the notes (all of which are online) then you'll do fine. Plenty of extra credit opportunities and no cummulative exam.
She is an amazing teacher! Not only does she use everyday life examples to help you understand the material she is also the most understanding professor around!

make sure you attend class because you need to add on to the notes on blackboard. i found her to be really easy, esp with all the extra credit we received. she is very smart, and friend, and cares about your grade.

Useless and loud professor. She didn't go by the book. Buying the book was a waste of my money. Only used the online aspect MyPsychLab for extra credit to pass the class. Lectures were dry, no additional assignments other than watching 30 min. videos online and answering 5 questions. Bad professor.
I love this professor! She is awesome! She really knows her students and loves to joke around with her student aid. She is overall an amazing professor! I STRONGLY recommend her!
She is awesome
I love her class! She explains things very well, and helps me out a lot. She is a GREAT advisor for Psych Majors! She's funny, and helps you get prepared well for the tests!! Take her if you can!

She's awesome! The class is difficult, and she lets you know this right off the bat. However, if you go to class and pay attention, she really makes you understand the material. Her examples help you relate to the material. Great professor!

Easily passable class but not easy A. DO NOT WASTE MONEY ON THE TEXT BOOK you will never use it.  5 50 question multiple choise test, unbelievably easy video test (dont even watch the videos you will still get 100%) She makes PSY somewhat interesting with alot of good expamples.  NO FINAL EXAM

Tests: 5, no final. 6 "logs" (1 paragraph in class). SONA research. Quizzes on 30-min. online videos. She uses clickers ($40) for participation grade. U need to attend class (20% of grade). She doesn't make it clear what you need to know.  This is a hard class for 100 level-I'm a senior, 3.7 GPA, got A's in all of my other classes, got a B here.
Professor missed a ton of classes, had teachers aids, her tests come from textbooks, notes, lecture, and pod casts which are recorded poorly, DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!!!

A nice professor, she attracts a loyal student following and has a very serious link to incoming freshman (as an advisor as well). Doesn't really have a wide breadth of knowledge, but meets basic specs. Could benefit from branching out and becoming more open-minded. A good prof' as an alternative to others.
very good teacher

Name: William Wright
Comment: Had him for both sections. I really like him. He's hard to approach at first, but easy going once you get to know him. He is by far one of the easiest Physics teachers at NKU. Don't let the other ratings fool you. But... don't take him if you rely on a professor to teach you everything. You must work from the book, and read each chapter on your own

Great teacher, he makes Physics fun and interesting. You do have to study for the quizzes, but the questions on the exams usually follow the quizzes. Do your self a favor and study the quizzes for the exams and everything for the final. I could not believe how many of the questions were the exact same.

Friendly guy.You can get a good grade but you REALLY have to work at it.Grades on a histogram, where you are judged compared to how well or poorly your classmates perform, which is VERY stressful.Good teacher, but I would avoid taking him again due to the HORRID Histogram grading system, which I believe to be unfair (and curves your grade DOWN).

I took this class because I needed it for the RAD TECH program; Physics REALLY isn't my thing, but trust me, if I can pass, anyone can. I got a B in the class, but REEEAAALLLY had to work at it. I learned a lot and the guy is pretty entertaining during lecture; he'll stop to answer questions and is helpful during lab. Good with Blackboard too.
Excellent professor. Will help those that really show an interest in learning the subject.  Quizzes and exams are tough if you don't study and read the book.

Cool, funny, approachable, easy going and will go out of his way to help you outside of class.  Zips through lecture but will stop for ?'s and notes are on BB. I recommend this prof. and would take him again. Not easy, but an A is possible if you REALLY work at it. Labs HW quizzes weekly. Tests once a month.  Not too bad if you really study.

Name: Angela Powell
Comment: I'm not sure why her rating isn't higher! I loved Professor Powell! She was accessible outside of class and responds to emails in a timely manner. She cares about her students and brings humor into the classroom. This class is difficult, but Professor Powell helps the best she can.
She is amazing. She keeps you engaged and is beyond willing to help you. The class is difficult but utilize what is given to you and ask for her help.
Ignore the negative comments on her. Professor Powell is such a caring individual, and she truly wants everyone to succeed in her class. She offers extra help if you need it. A great professor!

Not entirely sure what the other reviews are about because Professor Powell was extremely understanding with me during the course as well as helpful in ensuring I understood content. Professor Powell cares and wants to help her students

Avoid at all costs. Powell is literally unqualified for this role; didn't even get a BSN. Just some RN to MSN program, and thats not enough. She has no idea what she is talking about & is incapable of answering questions. She should not be teaching - NKU looks bad for keeping her on staff. Take Sorrell or transfer to another nursing school.

do not take Powell if you can help it. she is extremely rude when questions are asked and sends out passive-aggressive emails often. she reads off the slides and rarely elaborates on important topics. it truly feels like she should not be allowed to teach this class. I reach out to other professors for help because Powell doesn't answer questions

avoid at all costs. lectures off of powerpoints she didn't make and reads them word for word. hopefully ill pass this class but if you know what's best for you, you won't take her. attending lectures was a waste of time and you never get your questions answered. I have been asking the other professor for help.

Powell is not a good lecturer. In a lecture heavy class, this results in a lot of confusion among students. She reads straight off the slides and never knows the answers to students questions. If she does answer a question, it's a wordy answer that just confuses everyone more. I do not recommend taking her unless you want to struggle. Take Sorrell

Name: Eundak Kwon
Comment: Dr. Kwon is very knowledgeable about the content he teaches. He may come off as intense, but he truly cares about you and wants you to do well. All of his lessons and slides are provided online as well in case you miss a class. He also gets back to you quickly if you email him. You will do well if you actually put in effort.

Prof. Kwon has been a pretty difficult professor. Prepare to write a 1000+ word essay every other week, and receive mediocre feedback. Not as bad as I was expecting it to be, but definitely not taking him again.

Kwon could be a good professor if he didn't go off on so many tangents. I learned a lot this semester but I would never take a class with him again. He's very rude and cuts  students off when he calls on them. Our final was unnecessarily hard and we had to do presentations with zero instruction on what he wanted in them.

Professor Kwon provdes opportunities for extra credit and doesn't seem to be a touhg grader. But his class gives massive anxiety. I can only describe the class as aggressive. If he asks you a question, prepare to respond with a lengthy response, but also be ready to be interrepted.

He is pretty rude, I'm not going to lie. Like he's going to interrupt you when he asked you a question. Also, his accent is so heavy. All of that being said, his class isn't hard. He gives you MULTIPLE chances to finish the country case study and he is liberal with the extra credit.

He is a terrible professor. really strong accent which makes it impossible to understand. made us by two really expensive books to read 1 article. he never helps you out, never answers your questions, he is always interrupting. hated the class. I recommend you to not take him.

He has a strong Asian accent, which is hard to understand in the beginning of the course, but throughout you will be able to understand him better. Kind of a jerk, asks questions to the class, then doesn't listen to answers. Honestly made me hate the class, just overall he is unlikeable. CONSTANTLY interrupts students, very rude.

It is a tough class. There was a final group project you will need the book to complete. The hardest part is keeping focus with his accent. He is hard to understand sometime but if you get past this it would be easy to learn a lot.

Professor Kwon is great!  His classes are hard but he gives the necessary tools to do well.  He is always willing to help if needed.  He is pretty funny too.  I would recommend him to anyone.  Yes, he can be difficult to understand at times but he is so smart and keeps you engaged.

I took the class last fall. We learned lots of topic. Though the topics are very difficult, but doc gave us a clear idea with interesting examples. He asked some questions to whom texing or doing something. Definetly they could not understand the questions. Most students equally treated and encouraged..I respect doc.

Dr. Kwon knows his stuff. His English is terrible though. When he asked questions most of the class would sit there looking at each other cause they don't know what he is saying. The exams were not too hard but the fact you couldnt understand much of what he said made it so you had to do a lot of studying. He is kind of condesending as well.

Without any serious prepration of the theory and the country case study, the course would be difficult to follow. However, the discussion questions help us to build critical think of our current world. Easy going should not guarantee the quality.
Professor Kwon is extremely difficult to understand.  Both the course (including class participation) and learning are difficult because of this.
The professor is a real educator. We learn different color of world through interesting political economic theory. Miss the class a lot!! Great Professor.
We have lots of fun! Crystal clear explanation of difficult concepts. The professor pretty much take care of every students!!
We have lots of fun from the class. He always respects  and encourages students. What a nice educator!

While I do believe Dr. Kwon is a very knowledgable man and VERY helpful when you ask for help, he is hard to understand at times. He will make you participate in class even if he notices you aren't into the class. So just be prepared because you can't miss a lot, book is $150 but you don't really use it.
Prof. Kwon is a gem of NKU. We love the professor. He alwasys take care of every student.

Prof. Kown is an excellent professor whom I have ever met. He underline lots of theory with many interesting ampirical case study. Some of them who got an "F" in mid-exam complain because he ask them to withdow the course. He gaves us a living knowledge

Dr Kwon is an amazing teacher. He knows his stuff! He does have an accent, but after the first day I got used to it! He puts the notes online, and gives study guides with all the informations for the tests. There is no reason to not get a good grade in this class! He is very helpful as well and I will definitely take another course from him!

Name: Mike McKeown
Comment: Class is not easy, but there is no group projects or homework, so that is a plus+. Only 3 people received an A in course. How do I know, they did not have to take the final, and was excused at beginning of class. Pop quizzes are essays,& exams are very tricky. He is pretty funny, but goes through information at lightening speed. Read book 2to3x!
Professor McKeown is awesome!! It's not an easy A, you do need to read your book but class was so much fun! Probably my most favorite class ever.

Read the chapter for a good grade on test and quizes. Test questions are a little tricky if you don't read. He is very interesting for sure, but akward on the first day. Great prof. would recommend to anyone.
Yea, He totally relates everything to his car and working at Lenscrafter.Not a recommended teacher!
Very nice and helpful, definitely knows what he is talking about. He is very clear and organized. Cool guy, take his class.

I enjoyed this class & enjoyed him as a teacher.  He has a vast knowledge of marketing & I felt like I learned a ton from him.  If you are willing to attend class, take notes & read the chapters you will have no problem doing well in the class.  He is very approachable & has real world knowledge of marketing which is far suprior than the book!

I enjoyed this class & enjoyed him as a teacher.  He has a vast knowledge of marketing & I felt like I learned a ton from him.  If you are willing to attend class, take notes & read the chapters you will have no problem doing well in the class.  He is very approachable & has real world knowledge of marketing which is far suprior than the book!

Relates everything to his Lexus and working for Lenscrafters. First time teaching, does not answer e-mails. Not helpful and not clear about what he wants on tests or in class. Had Saturday class to review for test. Would Not advise taking.

Name: Barbara Houghton
Comment: She just doesn't know how to communicate and she will humiliate you in front of other students, its good that other students don't take her seriously though. She will disrespect you and gossip about you to other students especially her TA instead of better you and helping you to become a better person. She really needs to work on herself more !

She knows what she is doing and has little patience if you are not willing to work hard. If you don't listen and she has to repeat herself, she will be rude to you. If you are having technical issues she will try to help or send you to someone who can help. Gives good feedback as long as you have worked, otherwise expect to be torn apart.

She wants her students to succeed. Barbara is super helpful, but you have to be willing to put in the work.  I have seen her go to hardware stores to pick up extra supplies for a student's senior show.  She is always willing to answer questions.  Just show up to class on time ready to work.
I have had several classes with her.  She is really nice and so helpful.  Always willing to answer questions and give advice on projects.

Three Reasons Not to take this class 1. If you are a slacker. 2. You don't enjoy going to class and learning. 3.Your full of crap. Barbara is a excellent teacher who is of great assistance if you prove to her you are dedicated and care about learning and growing as a photographer.

Barbara is friendly once you get to know her. She is willing to help you with whatever you need at the drop of a hat. My favorite Professor at NKU. She will help brainstorm ideas and provide inspiration when you need it. She also has a wonderful collection of photography/art books that she is more than willing to let you borrow. Love her!

She's really rude and has no respect for her students. She'll sit in class and gossip about other students with her TA. She doesn't teach and this is a beginning class so you'd think she should. She expects you to know everything about the photography before you enter the class.

Houghton is like a bad cup of coffee. sucks when you find out its decaf. she knows little about photo and sticks to art photography,doesnt teach f stop and shutter speed and iso but rather sits there and wastes my money talking about obama and how amazing he is. wastes my money by making my IQ go down. annoying. useless. ignorant. self centered.

houghton does not have respect for students. she will tell them they should fail, tell them to drop the course, all in the rudest way possible. i speak for others too when i say this. She will belittle you and demean you and your work in front of the class and when you try to defend yourself she will accuse you of thinking she is stupid. avoid her

she has no formal education in web design nor any knowledge of how to do it correctly. she thinks the proper web page is made entirely of flash. complete ignorance for industry standards in web design. She will desecrate you in front of the class if you come up with an idea that might be contrary to hers. enjoys being thought of as a mean person.

She is extrememly lazy and doesn't want to take the time to teach things properly, but then ridicules when you don't do things right.  She plays favorites and will mock and belittle students in front of other students if she doesn't like them. She acts like she knows what she is doing but really doesn't take the time to learn what she's teaching

I loved this class! I've had Barbara for another course, but this time around was better. I have learned so much, and am now interested going into web design as well as photography. Just keep up - it's pretty easy once you get the hang of it.

I took her for photo I and I really didn't learn anything from her. I learned to use my camera, but hardly. She should have taught us about composition, and subject matter, yet it wasn't about any of that. For photo I I feel that I should be learning those things. She is hard to understand sometimes becuase she talks about everything at once.
My Favorite teacher at NKU...  She is awesome. Love her sarcasm!

Art can be very difficult because every person will have a different opinion as to whether you are an okay artist or if you got your point across but she is the worst I have had to deal with. I did a short series and unfortunately chose subject matter that she had some knowledge about and because of this she would not listen to my explanation.

She knows her stuff, but she expects you to know it too.  Even if you have never picked p a camera before in your life, just being in her presence, you should know what to do.  i do not recomend her for any incoming freshman or new photo majors.  you cant avoid her forever, but i would untill you have your feet on the ground.

B. is tough on people who don't pay attention in class, show up late, or othertise fail to WORK. if you do your work, show drive, and have an idea you want to pursue, and can intelligently discuss, you're golden. be passionate, and be smart. you will go far and get a lot of help from her if you're an artist who works hard.

Not someone I would recommend to anyone. Her constant mood swings and frequent "soapbox" talks are disruptive and annoying. She knows her stuff but needs to find a better outlet for her venting and constant sarcasm. If you get on her good side then you're safe, just dont make her mad. COME TO CLASS ON TIME! AND DONT LEAVE EARLY! and dont MISS!

Name: Alexis Pulos
Comment: Lex is soooo smart, and expects students to be fully prepared for class and ready to participate. I always read beforehand (which I never normally do lolz) and sat in the front. I was really worried about this class but I ended up with a "B" because he was always happy to help me understand. He's awesome.

Lex is a professor you can tell is very smart, but that has a hard time translating to students. His lectures are very dense, but he does engaging games and group work to try to help. Quizzes are also mostly with a group, but they are every week so if you're not there it is going to hurt you... you basically cannot skip. Instruction are also vague.

This professor will really make you think. I took him for CMST 430 (Com Theories) and it was actually a really good class. Don't be intimidated, just show up and be ready to share your ideas with him. Also, TRY on your projects, he's a pretty tough grader but extra effort goes a long way.

One of the best teachers I've had during my time at NKU. Lex really cares about his students, their learning and the overall class experience. As someone who recently graduated, I regret not haven taken a class with him sooner.   He's a tough grader but gives incredible feedback and works with you to understand the subject.

Dr. Pulos challenges you. Makes you really take a look at the world you are living in through a variety of lenses. You have to be willing to open your mind to things that might question what you have known to be true or the norm. He wants you to succeed, and is always willing to help. You have to work hard in this class but its worth it.

Taken for Comm Theories. VERY difficult grader and emphasizes creativity and research. Only 5 grades the entire semester, so be prepared for big projects and lengthy papers. Do not take this class if you procrastinate. He does not take attendance, but DO SHOW UP! I missed one day without problem but see how it would conflict if missed regularly.

On one hand was always prepared for class and knew material. Smart and has high standards for his students, who he says he genuinely wants to help succeed. On the other hand he is quick to give criticism and I felt very disrespected by him at times. He corrected me mid-sentence multiple times in front of peers before understanding what I had said.

Name: Anthony Deiter
Comment: This class is all about Flash and you won't really learn anything about design. His personal work sucks, but he can teach you how to use the program.  He's out of town a lot because he has a sickly daughter in another state.  In the syllabus, he tells you to read the book but I havent even opened it and it has made no difference.

Name: Chris Rickels
Comment: Took his online PHI181 class. It was specialized in global ethics when I thought it was more of an intro class but I love Professor Rickels so it was manageable. There were some papers and you needed to keep up on your readings. Just make sure to do everything asked and you should get an A or B.

Name: Edwin D King
Comment: Great teacher. explains a lot. very helpful. YOU JUST HAVE TO ASK! he is willing to go the extra mile for helping a student.

Name: Tara Dailey
Comment: Wonderful professor, really wants her students to succeed. Would definitely take her again if I had the option!

Name: Rachael Winters
Comment: Rachael is awesome! We had individual and team quizzes, in class assignments, out of class assignments, and a Final.  Don't expect to do well if you don't try. An A is very attainable if you do what you're supposed to  and Rachael is always willing to help if need be! I really felt like I learned  a lot!

Name: James Niewahner
Comment: HORRIBLE prof... It is true, he is extremely rude! I saw him 3 times screaming a student. He is very unclear about assignments and disrespectful to everyone...  Very unfair grader. Don't dare to make a mistake while responding his questions during his lectures or you will be humiliated in front of the class. Dr. Ball is the best for che 121L

Good professor.  Extremely nice.  He teaches well but grades very hard. He will take 5 points off for a decimal placement.  Exams are also very hard.  He is very helpful though.  I recommend but make sure assignments are well done and exact
Very helpful and always e-mails back promptly, but is a hard grader and exams are difficult.  You will learn a lot from him though.  Nice guy, very polite if he knows you really are trying.
Went at a good rate didnt go over things well expected too much
Extremely rude! Unclear about assignments and disrespectful to everyone.
he is helpful if you ask

Took him for 120 lab. He likes to talk for an hour, which sucks. He helps when you need it, but is a hard grader.  The two exams that there are extremely difficult. Got a C overall. Dry sense of humor, Emails back promptly.

He has a very serious sort of teaching technique. He comes to class prepared, always has everything graded on time, and almost always knows what he is going to say before he gets there. He has tough tests, so be prepared for those. Also, he tends to be a pretty tough grader. I would recommend him to any chemistry student.

Had him for lecture and lab.  Does not curve tests or final grade.  Organic is really hard, but I think he could have done a better job at explaining it and he is hard to hear sometimes.  Nice guy, just not for me as a professor.

Organic Chem is always hard. Expect to study a lot. I had him for lab. He's helpful when you need him, otherwise he just lets you work on your own. His humor is dry, but for a Chemistry teacher, I thought he was pretty approachable.

I had him for lab.  Thought he was great!!!  Heard bad thing about his lecture class but I can't say anything bad about him.  He was very helpful and GREAT sense of humor (if you know where he's coming from)  Show some respect and you will get some in return!!!!!
Good teacher.  He's pretty tough, but its supposed to be that way.  If you do well in his class, you pretty well know you can handle being a chem/bio major.

He was willing to help any time I asked but gave to many OWL problems.  I did really well in CHE 120 and had a hard time with him.  He is very boring.  Most of the class had trouble but everyone that was in Bloss' class told me it was easy.
I hated him.  Take Bloss he is the best intro chem teacher.  Neiwahner isn't that bad but he is boring as hell. I switched to Bloss's class and I have an A in chemistry this semester.

Very good teacher who is willing to do anything to help students pass with good grades, includes extra credit, help sessions, office time...If you are serious about chemistry I highly recommend Dr. Niewahner
Great professor, wonderful sense of humor once you realize that he is being sarcastic! Grades very fairly and gives help if you need it.

he is a great teacher, who takes an interest in his students. he is not an easy A.... but you will learn in his class and he goes way above and beyond to help his students. i would recommend him for anyone in pre-professional fields.
one word... HORRIBLE... very boring, hard to follow, not doesn't get in to the lectures at all... when you go to get help he confuses you even more..

Quizzes and tests are extremely difficult but he will do anything in his power to help you out, including prolonging his office hours.  He really cares about his students.  Great guy, great professor.
No Comments

Name: Carl Simkonis
Comment: terrible class, all lecture and no textbook use, tests are hard, worse grade i've gotten in my college career

Tough class, take good notes, study them, remember them and you'll do just fine.  Can't really afford to miss any classes, he moves at a quick pace.  Tests are all define and short answer coming straight from your notes.

Classes tend to drag on, as it is all lecture. He takes everything straight from the lectures. I haven't cracked the book yet. The tests suck. They are all definitions and explanations, and I never had time to finish them. I wouldn't recommend him.

Avoid this class if possible. He grades very hard. You need to take perfect notes with examples, completely memorize ur notes, and do not forget anything for the test. Tests: 20 essay questions. Grades hard. This class is harder than my 400 level classes! DO NOT TAKE!!!

The class was ECO and Organized Crime.  This was a very fun class.  But as with all of his classes you have to go to class and take notes to get a good grade.  I would recommend him as a professor; he is not the typical dry Economics professor.
Tough class. You need to have picture perfect notes. And on the test you have to memorize your notes forwards and backwards. Other words try and avoid this class.

He's a fun professor and someone who seems like would make a great fan. He has a ton of cool stories from growing up in NYC. As for teaching, he quizzes exclusively from his notes, so you don't even need the textbook. Just make sure your notes are thorough and be prepared to remember everything on the quizzes.
His lectures can be interesting.  His test are right from the notes.  If you go to class and take notes you will get an A in the class.
He really knew the material, but sometimes he gets carried away with explainations.  All of the exams are short answer (he wants defos of, like, everything).
His test are impossible and get ready to write down everything he says otherwise you fail. Lets face it Econ sucks anyways good luck!
Great teacher! Loved his class.  You take a lot of notes, and the tests are short answer, but show up for the review and pay attention and you'll do fine.
Very interesting professor, puts Economics into perspective for the common man. His tests are short answer and essay...a bit hard but nothing that you wouldn't expect out of a college course.

I liked him a lot, you do have to take a lot of notes (by choice) and if you miss a class you are not going to know what happened.  You don't use the book at all.  Although you take a lot of notes and the tests are not a walk in the park I would recommend to anyone.
Good Professor. But his tests are impossibly hard. Be prepared to have mass headaches.

A great teacher of economics. He did a good job of explaining things and is very helpful if u do have questions for him. However, u must show up for class and take notes bc he doesn't use the book. Pay very close attention bc the notes he puts on the board are very unclear and hard to follow. beware of his tests, he is an extremely hard grader!!!

He is a great professor.  He does not use the book, because he has a lot of knowledge in the field.  He teaches in a way that makes it easy to understand by using pop culture to explain Economics.  I would take another class that he teaches.
Good professor. Must attend and take good notes. If you do that no problem getting an A. Text books for him are useless,don't waste your money.

This prof is hard.  He expects students to attend class, pay attention, and take notes.  His exams that require serious studying before hand.  He must think he's teaching a college-level course or something.

I think he's a great teacher. His test are pretty straight forward but its a very good idea to take alot of notes. It does suck that test are the only way to get grades. And I think he kinda sounds like Chistopher Walken. I swear.

great prof.  this is college kids, you have to come to class and LISTEN, and study to do well.  his exams are hard, but it is possible to get an A. he is a much better econ prof. then many others, he has real life mixed in which keeps it interesting.

Name: Richard Turner
Comment: Total nazi about attendance.  Do not take if you miss classes.  But the classes that you attend are a waste of time, we didn't learn anything.  Had 5 papers the whole semester, and there was no reason to be there besides those 5 days.  Avoid this man

Starts off rough but eases up. Enjoyed him so much that I took him twice. Would recommend him to anyone. He works you, but it isn't hard if you stay on top of the material. Glad I took it because it helped me in my upper level classes.

Really Intimidating! Starts off really strict then eases up towards the end.  He sets very high expectations.  A VERY hard grader, definitely do not try and skimp out on the work. VERY strict with the readings and attendance. he definitely beats the material into your brain.  I remembered everything from his class despite his intimidating tactics

Really Intimidating! Starts off really strict then eases up towards the end.  He sets very high expectations.  A VERY hard grader, definitely do not try and skimp out on the work. VERY strict with the readings and attendance.

He is extremely judgemental. He talks down to the students and will not help if a student is struggling. Was absolutely rude about it and I could tell the student was really struggling. Terrible professor, don't take his class!

The assignments were complete busy work. Do not take this class! He talks down to students and teaches as though everyone has the mind set of a high schooler. "Do you understand what I am saying?' was a common question he would ask the class. He preaches about diversity but I am confident that he does not believe in it.

I've had several classes with Dr. Turner because I liked him so much. He's tough on students but in all honesty if you do the reading and work required it's not that hard.
