He makes sure students understand the material before testing them on it. If you struggle it's because you didn't do the work or didn't ask for help.

This teacher has very high expectations for his students.  Very strong debater.  Considers things during discussion, and is critical of opinions (this is a good thing.  It means he can think).  VERY APPRECIATIVE OF HARD WORK.

This class was horrible! I would have rather been beaten with a bat than go to his class. If you do not agree with him you are wrong! You get a sh*t ton of work and hardly any time to do it. Very hard grader. Do not take his class. He is absolutely horrible!

At first I though he was going to be a good teacher, he started off the first class saying how he understands the hard life of a student...he then proceded to dump loads of work ontop of us giving us a very limited amount of days to fulfill the wishes. He can be intimidating, and class drones on. His grading is aweful, he provides no rubric at all

At first, it took me a little while to get used to him because he can be opinionated. However, over all, he's a good guy & a great teacher. You do 5 papers & one of those is a group project. You have to earn your grade in here, here he does not tolerate slackers. Come to class and put in the effort and you will do well in this class.

Asks students questions, doesn't listen to the students answers.  Loves nit-picking and asking questions that lead into boring stories he likes to tell.  Awful class.  Were this class not required, I would drop it like it's hot.

Very good professor. He uses his experiences in life with the books you read. You read 4 books and write several (I think 5) papers. Unless you are motivated to read the books and write the papers you arent going to pass. Very helpful if you ask. Very specific. Be sure to ask for help if you need it. He enjoys people who get involved with the work.

He's a nice guy, but class=awful. He keeps you past class time. Quizzes are on useless information you wouldn't waste your time remembering and if you struggle in the class, he isn't willing to help. This class takes a lor of work and a lot of time for little pay-off. You'll dread it.

Really good English professor. Makes students think and tries to get opinions from class, so be prepared to answer. Unlike others, I find that he will "make eye contact" with anyone willing to participate in class or make an effort. Turner makes you think, but basically tells you exactly what you need to get a good grade on papers.

The man is a pompous ****. He makes eye contact with typically only the skinnier girls in the class. He treats the students like he is both a judgmental, parental figure and a middle school English teacher. He is an embarrassment to the university.
He is a very good teacher.  He always makes sure to talk about relevant matters and I've definitely learned a lot in his class.

I didn't like him at first. You have a lot of books to read, and you have a quiz every day over the assigned reading. His lectures keep you interested. He expects a lot out of his students. Attendance is mandatory. If you miss a class you missed a lot of material. does not use blackboard. Overall, he's a good teacher.

Very good teacher. He don't push the grammer use on you so much that it bores you to death. His writing is kind of hard to read off the board but he does all he can to help you do best on your papers. There are many discussions over events in class and you must participate in them.

Name: Darell Payne
Comment: Professor Payne is by far the worst teacher I've ever had. He blatantly favors women over men, and doles out his grades accordingly. Anyone that feels his classes have been challenging has been fooled. The only thing challenging about his class is appealing to his inexplicable and blatantly biased grading procedures.

SWK405/407. Will not help you after class and will not help you at all if your a guy. He is all about helping the ladies. Worked on a project with a girl, suppost to get the same grade but somehow she did better. Won the debate acording to class but still got a lower grade than the girl i debated. Thinks your opions aren't good unless they are his.

I had Dr. Payne for SWK 405/407 and his classes had a lot of material to cover but that is expected out of a 400 level class. He is a helpful instructor and is passionate about the topics. Participation is important unless you're an idiot and in that case nobody wants to listen to you anyway.

I really enjoyed this class. I felt as though I had learned a lot. He is a great teacher with a great personality. Tests were appropriately challenging. Be to class on time and do not miss more than 3 days and you will be fine. I recommend him as long as you don't have a habit of missing. He taught me a lot. Def. take him!!!!

Uses intimidation to keep you from questioning his grading system. Never available to willing to answer questions a second after class. Make an apt kind of guy. Oh, and don't voice your opinion if its different than his.

Will learn alot, but you better bring your A game so you can make at least a C in this class.Is hard on himself,if you do not learn.Hard work, but once you get it all together you should be okay, JUST DO YOUR BEST, and you will PASS. He is very fair, all it takes is effort on the student's part. It is not like a 100 or 200 level course.
Very tough grader.  Expects the best so no slacking in this class.  You will learn a lot and will be challenged completely!!!

He is a good professor, you will learn alot. He is a very tough grader so make sure you give yourself alot of time to write your paper.  also don't miss his class and do your best to be on time everyday and he will like you.
good class, educational may need to update handouts

Name: Tom Cate
Comment: I adore this man. He took a topic that I had absolutely no interest in and made it understandable. Tests are difficult, but he tells you exactly what you need to know beforehand. Pay attention and participate in his class and he will like you. Gives advice about marriage and life which is usually sarcastic and hilarious. Recommended!

This guy was scary at the beginning, but it turns out he is really nice and willing to help you any possible way he can. The class is not easy so I recommend actually going. Pay attention because he moves quick!
He helps very well with any questions and does a GREAT job explaining a hard subject. At first he seems intimidating but as the class goes on he's actually a very nice and funny teacher. RECOMMENDED!
I struggled a lot in micro Econ. If you ask him for help he'll set up a time that's convenient for the both of you. He retaught me several lectures either in or out of his office hours

Professor Cate has an interesting way of teaching class. This is not an easy class but learned a lot.  Still tell people to read Player Piano, great book.  You do have to work hard to do well.  worth taking

Excellent professor. It is an easy class, Cate makes everything simple and laid out. Quizzes are the hardest part of the class, but if you just read the chapter before hand you will do fine. SWA assignments are EASY, not hard like some of the reviews on here. Exams are EASY, he tells you exactly what is on them. Would take again. Excellent professo
Great Teacher. Hard to understand at first but if you go to class and pay attention in class you'll do fine. Plus, he is more than willing to help you. Great overall person!

Most of the comment on here say he's hard or impossible or underestimate amount of work- don't believe them. While it IS a lot of work and studying, he's not impossible by any means. Coming from someone who struggles with numbers and math outside of Algebra I, I am making a B- and understanding material despite little studying and texting in class.

You will have to work hard to do well in this class.  Some people may have to work hard just to pass.  I found the quizzes to be harder than the exams.  Dr. Cate always met with me whenever I needed help.  He is a very smart guy.

He is SUCH a horrible professor! Monotoned, does not give any good examples and does not relate material to anything you can relate to. It's all just facts and numbers. It's so frustrating because he is so bad but he continues teaching. SWA's are impossible because he takes every shortcut in writing them and does not give enough info. Do not take!!
Do not take. Horrible professor, unapproachable, You ask for help, he says, "Don't panic." Rather annoying, Tests are impossible, and he is very unwilling to help you

one of the best professors i have had.  very helpful with questions.  the class involves a lot of work. mini writing assignments for homework and quizzes that are pretty hard. test are all problems no multiple choice.  as long as you pay attention and do the worksheets you will do fine.  i would take him again.
Class is hard but he will meet with you and help.

This class is ALOT of work and should be about 6 credit hrs.  Mini papers due weekly.  The prof seriously under estimates the work needed for this class.  Has certain things he is looking for in the papers.  Lots of outside reading.  Whew-glad that's over! I gained 20lbs during this semester from working all day and writing papers all night/wkends.

He is seriously a horrible teacher and should retire. His quizes are harder than the exams and unless you are going to read the chapter outline it make notecards and re read the chapter you will fail them. I studied for 2 hours for one of his quizes and I got a lower grade than if I had just guessed. His exams are straight from the worksheets!

The quizes(you actually have to study for them) are harder than the tests (straight from the wkst's given done in class). He is intimidating at first, but you pick up on his teaching style fairly quickly. It's a challenge.

Professor Cate is something else.  The very first test, i admit i failed, and he told me to drop the class. Not "can i help you something? Set up time with me so we can work thru this." NOTHING.  But i didnt drop and I am doing better, but please choose a different professor.  He is a great guy, but the goal is to pass the class..
Class act!

An international business course touched on VERY few int'l business topics.  His environmentalist views took over the course in the latter stages.  Topics/instructions for papers were vague, but grading was based on a VERY specific criteria list.  You could write a compelling argument, but if you left out 1 of the req'd items, your grade plummeted.
No Comments

Name: Bill Cunningham
Comment: Not a good structured class. Offers a lot of extra credit, Only uses book for HW. One big group project, easy if you say on top. Goes over the quizzes in class, so you can fill in what you missed. Overall great class to take!
All we basiaclly did was come with marketing plans for people that he knew. He not very organized and I did not really learn anything from the class.

Name: Vicky Ragsdale
Comment: Very hard class to take. For a 100 class there should not be this much work, one right after another. I have put in more time and done more work for this 100 than any other class. Too much. If you miss one thing it's like your whole grade is ruined. Do not take if you are not prepared for the work load. Nice teacher if you try. Otherwise forget it.

I liked her, but not as a teacher.  She was helpful, but the class was very difficult for a 100 level class.  You HAVE to attend class.  HAVE TO.  It will end up reall affecting your grade if you do not.

Over all, I thought she was a great teacher. I did not like how she wouldn't let us use Google or other non-NKU search engines for our last 2 individual speeches (but let us do so for the first), but I really liked her; she was really nice, helpful, and always saw the best in us. I significantly improved my public speaking skills thanks to her.

This teacher is very hard. I took this class because I had to. I was taking chemistry at the same time as this class and found myself doing more work for a 100 level speech class then my 200 level chemistry class. I would recommend taking another teacher.
Great teacher! very helpful lots of notes but all our posted online. Work can be hard but if you attend the class you will do fine!

Mrs. Ragsdale is phenomenal. She uses all kinds of real world scenarios and examples of public speaking that shows the student the importance of her class and the art of public speaking. I won't lie, her class is a challenge. I found myself working very hard to receive a good grade in the class. However, her class is very useful and rewarding.

Horrible!! Take another class to avoid the "busy work" that adult learners do not have time to meet her expectations. I will complete the class but now know not to take any with this instructor in the future.
very tough. makes you print way too many papers. first 2 weeks i already printed 74 papers. too strict. recommend a diff teacher or take creative expression

Although the work load is very  high, this professor was the BEST that I have ever had in this area. I guarantee that you will come out being able to write a professional-level speech after taking her course. If you have the time, I highly suggest it.

she is terrible-  thinks a 101 is a 500 level class.  any other teacher gives you an A or B if you do all the work and present in front of class.    do not take  do not take- did i mention she is the chair of cmst     explains the difficulty
On-line Class--- Worst class I've ever taken. Lots of work for very little points. I worked harder for this class than any class I've ever taken.  Find someone else!

Professor Ragsdale is very good... She seems strict at the beginning of the semester, but once she sees that you pt in the work she is easy (ish). She is fair when it comes to grading  persuasive speeches. She said she personally disagreed with my views but I still got an A+ on the speech. As long as you are willing to earn your grade, take her!

Absolutely horrible class. She grades from HER opinions.  The easiest things you will FAIL. I regret registering for this class and seriously, take another Professor. It shouldn't be this hard to pass a test. Example of her tests: 2+2=? If you answer 4 she'll take points off because she doesn't think you know what you're saying.

One of the hardest classes I have ever taken. I didn't want to take the class but I was required to. I felt like I kept studying and studying with no result. She gave me a good grade cause I studied a lot and I think she could tell but I would recommend an easier professor to take if you can.

I took the speech apprehension class.  At first she seems nice and helpful, but it turns out that her method of grading is not very fair or consistent.  It seems to be based off of her opinion rather than how well you actually did on the speech.  Was very frustrating, but if you do the work at the very least you will pass.
Very good professor.  Hard, but I learned a lot.  She is a very nice and helpful.
An awesome teacher, if you get the chance take her, you will learn a lot!!

DEFINITELY a class worth taking!  Let alone the fact that the class material was extremely interesting, Professor Ragsdale has a way of really putting things into perspective.  By far my favorite professor at NKU.  Great communicator - would love to take her again!

LOVED this class. You have to work very hard, but you learn so much. Ragsdale is very dedicated and funny, but she is kind of intimidating at first. There are a lot of open discussions. There are surprise in-class quizzes at least once a week but if you read, you should do fine. Tests are pretty difficult, so give yourself plenty of time to study.
VICKI ROCKS! your doing it....you've done it in conclusion Vicki is a great teacher.

Name: Ana England
Comment: Knows what she is talking about and is not a bad grader. She will answer all questions you ask, but she can be hard to get along with. Hard to hear in the room so pay attention during demonstrations. Don't forget about gopher points. Clay dries out in the room, but be patient. I love clay and am not a beginner, so just ask if you don't know things.

Ana is a great teacher. Around finals, she gets a bit overwhelmed and it is best to keep a distance, but that is my only complaint. Ana is old school art; she wants creative people who can solve problems. Assignments are not unclear she wants you to be creative, the more elaborate the better. If you are passionate about art you will do well.
a bit hard to get along with sometimes.

She is a great professor and can tell when you keep making pinch pots over and over. You have to be inventive, not typical. She just wants to see some out-of-the-box ideas and as an art student you should be able to do that. Don't blame her for you lack of creativity.

The class starts out ok, but eventually you'll notice she plays favorites, is very unclear about specific due dates and the prior posts about her attitude are accurate. She will tell you that your construction method is wrong, but doesn't show you what to do differently or explain herself even remotely. Rarely available outside of class.

The other comments say that Ana doesnt explain things very well,Truth is, she explains the general technique, and expects you to use your own CREATIVITY (imagine that, in an art class!)to come up with a solution to the assignment.  I guess non-art people just dont get that.  I like Ana.  She has lots of really cool ideas and knows what she's doing.

She's not a horrible teacher or anything, but I do not like clay and am not very good with it, and she didn't do very much in changing either my opinion or ability with the medium. The assignments were vague and she did seem to play favorites. Often not very helpful, just leaves students to their own devices.

I dont know what those other comments are talking about. I thought she was a great teacher. True she is  a little intimidating, but she was always willing to help from what I could see. She has an incredible wealth of knowledge. I enjoyed her class and I plan to take more with her.

she acts like child. she has locked herself in her office just to get away from her students. if she doesnt like you then you get a bad grade. she has to put her 2 cents in on everything. do NOT take her. she doesnt even teach. its like trying to figure things out on your own then she tells you what you did wrong. TERRIBLE TEACHER!!!

This professor has serious attitude problems and acts much like a five year old throwing a tantrum at times.  Take this class if you love dealing with women on an emotional roller coaster...otherwise avoid.  She also spends most of her class time helping other, more advanced students (not in the class).

Name: Nicole Dillard
Comment: Good class! No exams, so that was good. The discussion posts and projects make you work for the grade, but it's not too bad. I would strongly recommend getting the textbook, you work from it a lot in class. She's really nice even though she can be intimidating sometimes. Pretty good class!
Lots of papers

Name: Nile Patterson
Comment: Very difficult class to deal with, extremely easy subject for how difficult the professor made it out to be, not helpful at all during office hours, no extra credit, not understanding.

Attendance accounts for 20% of the total grade. I missed 2 classes and got C for attendance. The test questions are in the textbook, but some is confusing. Getting an A or A- is not easy in this class.

Mr. Patterson's classes are EXTREMLEY mandatory. I missed 2 classes out of the whole semester and I ended up getting a C on attendance. Both times were because I was sick but I didn't have a doctors note so he didn't care. Beware of Pop Quizzes! He did one the day before spring break and he doesn't let you make them up. Would not recommend.

You talk about controversial topics in this class, but he incorporates your opinions into the lesson. Grades heavy on attendance and participation. Watches a video every single class which incorporates into the tests. No outside homework, which was nice. Had a pop quiz on the second day. Have to read a lot. Overall, and easy class.

Name: Liza Benham
Comment: All together it was a pretty easy class!  Yes, she stutters a little bit and sometimes looses her train of thought, BUT she is a good Teacher and if you come to class, She will help you out if you need anything.  An overall good Teacher! Recommended
The only thing I got out of this class was gay rights is sooo important that it is relevant in every single scenario.
Sitting in class is sooo boring and there isn't a point in taking notes. Its so easy I didn't learn anything in this class but I got an A so who cares!
She is nice and mean's well, but it's just sooo boring sitting through her class, making it almost impossible to stay attentive.

She is very nice and helpful at times. But doesn't know how to explain the material at all! You can only miss 3 times, and sitting in class is almost unbearable. If you're really into politics I'd suggest her, but if you're just looking for a psc class look else where. It's definately a high level course and she holds you to it.
this class is literally useless! all she ever talks about is gay marriage and abortion. i have not learned a thing in this class. but it is literally ridiculously easy to pass the class.

She was super easy, but a WASTE OF TIME! I dreaded every minute of that class and sat in the back with my laptop and surfed the web the whole time to keep my sanity. Unless you don't want to learn anything and earn an easy grade, then that's the only reason you should take this class.
Terrible teacher. She is completely scatter brained. Has no ability to make the topic at hand comprehensible. DO NOT take her. You will regret it. Worst professor ever hands down.

Absolute worst teacher I have EVER had.  Makes the class extremely more difficult than it needs to be.  She has no ability to relate the subject to her students. NEVER take her class and if you have DROP IT NOW.

The worst teacher I have ever had. Ever. She is extremely unable to express herself when speaking. The class was disorganized and seemed to have no rhyme or reason. She seemed to have little idea what she was doing most of the time. I was extremely unimpressed and advise anyone who values their intelligence and IQ to avoid taking her classes.
a waste of time, gained no knowledge from this class. she had no idea about topics she was teaching, don't take her

Awful! I would not suggest her to anyone! Is horrible to follow and took everything directly from the book. I took this class during the election season and found out that she didn't even watch the debates! HORRIBLE teacher, smart woman. She should be working in another feild.

This is absolutely the worst professor I have ever had. She skips around so much its impossible to follow her train of thought. She might have the knowledge but she has no clue how to teach. Its completely pointless to even attend class. You would learn more reading the book and never going to class. She says "um" and "uh" more then she teaches.
You can tell the professor is very intelligent but does not teach very well. It is very unclear what is expected of you in this class and she changes the syllabus through out the semester.

This teacher was ridiculous.  She does not stay on track and class is extremely boring.  It seems like she has no clue what she is talking about.  I absolutely dread having to go to this class.  If you need an easy A go for it but it comes with a price.
Absolutely the educator I have ever had.  She is unable to stay on task, let's students get by with almost any excuse, and is a lousy speaker.  I was counting "um's" on the first day...horrible.

she is a terrible teacher. she shames the political science profession as a whole. i would NEVER recommend her to anyone. she "uhs and ums" constantly. she never seems prepared. she turned, what could have been a very interesting subject this semester due to the presidential elections, into a class i dread EVERYDAY! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
She seems clueless at times. I found myself gritting my teeth at her "Um's" and "Uh's". The way her grades compile make it pretty easy to get a good grade. But she is a very boring lecturer.

Worst class I have ever taken and not because of the subject matter.  I have never had a class with someone as absolutely clueless as she. Complete lack of commmon sense but an easy class. If you think you can sit in her class and deal with how terrible every second is, then your ready for an eas class.
Her class was pretty easy. Her midterm was take-home. She was a little unclear at times a/b her specific expectations, but overall, she was a good teacher.

Name: Sonia Wasan
Comment: You will sacrifice every weekend doing HW and online quizzes.  Decent prof but started to run out of time at end of semester and rushed through material.  Held class during finals week (new material) and gave half new half cumulative final 2 days later.  3 tests, HW and quiz for almost ever chapter.  Can be a little blunt/harsh sometimes.

For those who actually care about his or her education Dr. W is a great professor.  Many students give her poor reviews, but those students probably didn't put in much effort.  The only thing I wish she would improve, would be the amount of time it takes her to return grades.  If you want a challenging yet rewarding class take her!!
Awful professor!Does not keep up with grades which is ridiculous since all she has to grade are quizzes and test. Her "teaching" style is reading off powerpoint. Avoid her if possible.

She was a terrible professor for ACC 300. All she did was read from her PowerPoints, not keep up with Blackboard or grade our projects, yelled at a student for not laying his project down "nicely", made people come sit in the front of the class, and the night before final grades were due, she emailed us asking to re-submit a project due weeks ago.

Dr. W was very helpful in explaining all of the material. The class does have some tough concepts to understand but she does an amazing job of translating the work into something you can understand. Do the homework, study for quizzes, if you have questions ask them and you will be fine. By far one of the best professors I have had at NKU.
Shes okay, she rushes through some material so she can cover all the topics. Theres online HW about once a week but its just to reinforce what you went over in class.

If you don't mess around in class and follow along with the logic she uses, she is very helpful. She does not like people who mess around and is not afraid to call people out sometimes. Do ALL the homework and don't be afraid to ASK QUESTIONS. She is more than willing to help, even on exams.

She is very helpful and wants you to understand. The subject matter is challenging and not very exciting but she does the best she can with it. And if you want to learn, she will make sure you do that.

Aggrivating to say the least. Runs through powerpoint slides so fast you cant keep up. Sometimes will even give quizzes on chapters we havent completely finished.Tests are very difficult. Shes a nice lady but doesnt look comfortable in class, and she's very hard to understand. Did curve final but still very hard class that i barely got through.

She is a great professor! Her class is very challenging, but she teaches in a way that is very detailed and clear. If you apply yourself, go to class and do the homework you will do well. She is a no nonsense lady, she expects you to take he class seriously and be respectful. I learned a great deal from her class and respect her as a professor!

She is tough but if you don't mess around in class (texting, other HW, etc.) she will like you and you're more than likely to get a good grade. Do not miss class or you will  not be able to catch up. Lots of homework but really helps with midterm and final.

Very helpful acct teacher I have ever had.  She makes her notes very clear to follow.  I like her teaching method.  Just need to be very attentive in the class, follow her notes/homework instructions, and you should be fine.  Fair teacher.  Will recommend.

Worst teacher I've ever had at NKU. She runs through her powerpoints and doesn't actually teach anything! She will go over one or two problems with you, but she wants to finish her powerpoints rather actually teach you the material. Tests are way harder than they should be, the class would be easier if she took time to actually teach the material! I would never take her if given the chance again!

Lengthy homework, but will help with exams. Clear, step by step instruction. Easy class if you attend regularly and read the chapter before class. Very willing to help if you have questions and are putting in effort.

On the plus side, she grades pretty fairly and gave a lot of extra credit. My biggest complaint would have to be the fact that when I went to her office for help after the first exam, she laughed at me and said I must have not studied ... not the case. It's hard to understand her so she repeats herself a lot, makes the class drag on forever!
Very nice. She gave a lot of hw but it was helpful on tests and quizzes. Willing to help if you ask. Offered extra credit. If you go to class you will not have a problem.

Would definately not take again! Tests are very difficult to finish in times amount. Very lengthy and not enough time given.There is a issue when you have used 15 minutes over class time and everyone is still working on the exam.   Doesnt want to work with you if you have an exception. Hospital, car accident ect. Would NOT RECOMEND!!
Hard to understand and changes her mind when she wants things due.  Quizzes are always timed and usually not given enough time to finish them. Won't be taking her again if I can help it!

WOW! She gives too much homework and it is all online and takes hours and she doesnt even grade it. She says things are due but then changes her due dates without telling you. Very confusing and not very helpful. She gets annoyed if she asks you a question and you don't know I would not take her again....

Name: Dale Elfrits
Comment: I loved Dr. Elfrits!He is patient and kind. His class consists of interesting lectures and videos... A couple of super easy tests and one simple 'creative' end of semester project. EASY A! No need to take notes, even.

I am a very good student but this is the worst class I've ever taken.  Way too much work that is not stated in the syllabus so you never know your grade.  The Course project is very difficult and the labs are exhausting.  He knows the subject but can't teach it.  He is extremely nice, he just requires too much work for a 100 level class.

soil science - great teacher with hilarious stories and lots of experience in the professional geologic world when it comes to engineering and resource management. i advise all students to take this teacher

Name: Mary Kay Morris
Comment: if you have ever had a health class in your life then this class shouldnt be very hard for you. of course it is a little more in depth than a normal health class but i found it to be extremely easy. she is a great professor and definitely knows what she is talking about. i recommend this woman although she may look intimidating she is very nice!
Outstanding

i have had this class for a month now and absolutely love it.  She is a very good teacher and knows her stuff. Nutrition is so interesting. i just got an 86% on the 1st test JUST by studying the powerpoints she gives you. its as easy as that,READ THE POWERPOINTS SHE GIVES YOU! yea, she treats u like ur in 8th grade but who cares? appreciate it!

this is a VERY hard class. She knows her stuff but exams are WAY hard. pretty nice professor! i just took this class for geneds requirement and i regret it! I made a C, studying,and being in class EVERY DAY. if you want an easy class, DO NOT TAKE HER!

If you're looking for an easy ride, don't take her. She knows what she is talking about but that could be the reason her tests are a bit hard. Attendance is mandatory, but don't buy the book, study her powerpoints very thoroughly and you should do fine. This class isn't a joke, you must do the work to get a good grade.

If you aren't willing to sit down and learn the material, don't take this class. The tests are hard, the quizzes are easy. The professor is very well knowledged. You don't use the book unless you want to read the chapters before class. She uses powerpoints for every chapter. Study those and you'll do fine.
she would use powerpoint for disscussion in class. Then on the test would use materail not covered in class

Professor Morris was great!  She doesn't mess around because there is a lot of info to cover.  I sat up front, never missed a class, and studied hard and made an 'A'.  I really enjoyed this class, but you have to do the work.
pretty good teacher, but doesnt cover material that appears on exams or quiz.

Very good proff. Extremely organized and knows what she's talking about. I felt very prepared for tests. However, I strongly reccomend tutoring. I made a C on the first quiz attended tutoring and I'm up to an A. She's not difficult it's just a lot of memorization.
Really seemed to enjoy what she was teaching.  Nice enough, and was helpful if you asked her a question.  The material was somewhat hard, and she expected you to remember a lot for quizzes and test.
VERY HARD a lot of info does not help students... don't take

This lady knows her stuff.  If you're interested in the subject, you'll dig it.  If you're just trying to fulfill a science credit, you're likely screwed.  Lots of material to cover, but if you like the subject, that's a good thing.
 I liked this class a lot.

She's pretty mean, actually. Very tricky, esp on tests and quizzes. Must study A LOT to get a good grade. Tons of people dropped out. Also, her views on nutrition are a bit extreme. Did offer easy extra credit, but it didnt help much. Final was horrrible. If you study hard enough, go to class, you can get by with an A or B.
This is a difficult class to take with a heavy schedule.  It requires much studying and memorization.  The instructor is good, but she expects you to really study for her tests.

Hard, i wouldnt take if you have a lot of other hard classes.  She will help you out if you have any questions, but you have to study pretty well for the tests. It is really interesting if your into nutrition and stuff.

NOT FOR AN ELECTIVE.YOU HAVE TO STUDY VERY HARD DONT HAVE ANY OTHER CLASS YOU REALLY CARE ABOUT WHILE TAKING THIS.SHE GIVES YOU NO STUDY GUIDE CAN ONLY TELLYOU TO GO TO EVERY CLASS AND STAY AFTER FOR HELP YOU WILL GET MORE HELPIS BEST WAY TO PASS. YOU GET MORE INFO ON TEST.iF YOU DONT NEED THIS CLASS DONT TAKE IT
Hard course!! Alot of memorizing!! Don't recommend it at all...Stay away!!
Not an easy class at all

Name: Gaut Ragsdale
Comment: He is very unclear on grading criteria. Most everything is done in your group (since it's group comm lol) He doesn't make a whole lot of sense on anything. You have a lot of quizzes, but he never covers anything that will be on them.
Doesn't explain very well what he wants from the final projects but grades you hard anyway

He is such a nice guy, but an awful professor. He was a tough grader and his tests were so difficult. I am an "A" student and found it very difficult to get above a "C+" on any of his tests. You never knew what to study. The only thing that saved me was the project at the end.

Dr. Ragsdale was a really good teacher because he knows so much about the field, but he can get a little confused sometimes. You never really know what to study specifically, so try to get a good hold on the material and learn the definitions. The group projects kind of suck.
Gaut is a really really tough grader and doesn't let things slide easily. With that being said, I actually would recommend the class because I learned a lot of really great things from this course.

This professor is not clear at all for what he wants on speeches. He grades ridiculously hard and takes off a lot of points for minor issues. I would not recommend this professor. If I had to retake the course, I would request a different professor. I got the grade that I did by working my butt off.

Ragsdale is a really great guy. He's very nice and willing to help if confused. This class is extremely confusing at first, but you'll get the hang of it as you go. Attend class every day because he takes roll. If I could retake class again, I would  READ READ READ the book more. Ragsdale is a great guy, but won't grade you easily.

I had him for 2 classes in one semester. He's a great guy, but not the greatest professor. He in very unclear on assignments and will take off points for incredibly stupid things. I honestly haven't learned anything in either class, and most of his classes are group work. He's a great guy, and he'll do whatever he can to help. Good luck.

Had him during the first semester he returned to teaching, after serving an administrative position for the comm. dept. Obviously out of touch with today's students. Very dry teaching style, with a somewhat incoherent lecture style. Enforced a time limit on our final exam without giving us prior notice; literally told us halfway through to be done.

I like him as a person but not as a professor. He is extremely dry and has a hard time explaining the different concepts. He also tends to talk for the first 30 mins of class about useless things and then go over what we need to know in 10 mins. His class is so hard, that 6/25 people in my class got above a 75% on our first exam.
While I only had him for half a semester, he was one of the best professor's I ever had. If you pay attention in class, and put forth the effort, it will pay off.

Very warm personality. You will learn if you apply yourself. More work than you think but Gaut gets a bad rap for expecting students to excel! The world is not easy and neither is getting an A. Will answer any question asked and help in any way possible. Just a bit disorganized at times, not always clear on instruction.

Horrible professor. "No one will get an A in my class" Sure showed you, didn't I Ragsy? Very pompous, never lucid, never actually explains concepts. Luckily I had several years of speech experience prior to this class. What a waste of my time!
Clear, straight by the book, but easy class, must attend class and participate

I had him for his first semester in a couple of years, and he was a jerk! He didn't teach us anything about speeches, but expected us to know it all for the tests?!? Very unapproachable and fasicious when you didn't understand something or had a question.
They don't come any better than Dr. Ragsdale.
A great professor, and nice guy too.
He was the greatest teacher i've ever had.  I learned SO much in this class.

Name: Larry Giesmann
Comment: Best bio professor I've ever had. He curved his exams. All you have to do is go to class and take a few notes. He gives you the power points online. Study the slides and do good in lab and BAM I got an A in his class. He is a delightful professor it's too bad he retired.

Dr. G is an excellent profesor he taught the entire class with enthusiasm other raters mention his "tangents" well these made the class even more interesting Whoever says that this class is hard really should choose a new major if you try come to class and study the powerpoints you will get atleast a B, studying=A dont buy the book you dont need it
Very nice guy, but very difficult to follow in lecture. He rambles alot and jumps subjects often. Would not recommend.

He is a interesting professor, to say the least.  He tends to ramble through the lecture slides before performing the lab, and his ramble is incredibly boring.  He does joke quite a bit, and most of them are pretty funny.  He is a pretty tough grader on his quizzes.  I don't think I would recommend taking his class if you can get passed it.
He teaches things and then says, "oh, by the way, you don't need to know that."

I find him difficult at times, but if you are going to the lecture, it shouldn't be that bad. He teaches little things outside of the material that makes it easier to understand.  He ALWAYS makes sure that you understand it, IF you ask. If there's a problem, he is understanding. On quizzes, he gives clues to the questions. I enjoy having lab with h

Fantastic professor! His little lecture tangents actually help you understand the study of Biology, rather than just the material needed to pass the course.  He posted his leture notes online & gave a sample test & answer key before each exam - what other aids do you need? Those who say he is too difficult need to re-evaluate their Bio major.
Very nice however,Very difficult to follow in his lecture.

He's a difficult teacher but if you really pay attention and keep up with the reading (powerpoints and book), you'll understand everything. Tests aren't that bad if you know the material. He's very detailed about the questions.

This man is so very boring and confusing. He loves the subject but teaches way over the level of a beginner. He ruined my appreciation of this subject and I can truly say I changed majors because of this man. I feel bad saying all this because he is so nice but he just sucks! Test = Impossible!!!!

very tough teacher and extremely hard to understand. very monotone but tries to goof off. results in you getting more confused actually. Thompson is a hundred times better. do your best to find another professor. anyone is better than him.

He'll go for about 20 minutes on a topic while you're taking copius notes and then all of sudden say "oh by the way, you don't need to know any of that." He does it so often it's hard to follow his lectures. I personally found him to be a HORRIBLE teacher.

A very nice professor. His lectures can be a little over your head but if you ask for help he is more than willing to give it! Tests are somewhat difficult but with studying you should do fine! Keeps class interesting. His love of Biology is contagious! Overall I would say he is great!

Absolutly loved this class.  Had a blast and enjoyed having him as a professor.  Quizes and Tests are hard but if you study you will be fine.  Know details of labs and do labwork completely will help a lot.  ASK QUESTIONS!!  He will take time to answer. Very Helpful.
He was funny, but I fell asleep a lot in the class.  Nice, but didn't really prepare you for the tests.

He is pretty nice and really into Biology overall, but he tends to talk too smart.  He can't bring down what he is saying to our level so it's hard to understand.  He also wastes lab time talking a LOT.

He made this class way harder than it needed to be.  He's a brilliant man and his lectures are incredible, but he does not give structured notes, only posts powerpoints...which are just pictures from the book with no text.  His tests are brutally hard, even if you study.  I study for a week before his exams and still never got an A

Very good teacher who brings some humor to class...it is a lot easier to stay awake in his class than other professors who teach the same class.  Test are difficult, but if you study they aren't too bad.

He was very funny.  He made a 7:50AM lab interesting.  He is probably one of the harder profs to take, but you will learn more with him than with most of the other professors.  His level of structure suited me perfectly.
Nit-picky... way too anal about what you right.  Married to SPSS

Name: Jennifer Davis
Comment: I really enjoyed this online class. I found the work to be easy but did require a couple hours of time each week. If you don't leave the work till the end of the week the class is very manageable.
Worst teacher I've ever had.
I do not even know where to begin. do not take this class

She is the most random teacher ever. She can't stay on a topic for very long and zones out often. Never clear on when things are due or what is even going on. She told us to buy a book that we did not even use once. There are never due dates on any assignments. Saddest excuse for a class ever. She is funny though in a weird way.

Saddest excuse for a professor I've ever had. It seems like she has no clue what she's doing at all. Her lesson plan is there but you can completely ignore it and pass the class, turn things whenever you want. But if you plan to learn anything though don't take her class. I facepalm every time I remember NKU pays her to "teach".

She is horrible about grading papers and getting them back. She doesn't seem like she has any idea about what she's talking about and just sits there and stares at people. She's very unorganized. I definitely would avoid taking her class.

JD is an embarrassment to NKU and academia in general. It escapes me how NKU could ever hire such an incompetent, ill-prepared, disorganized, unhelpful, unclear, inconsistent, unprofessional, perennially late, control freak "teacher". Her "Advanced" Writing class is a joke--a complete waste of time, money, and energy.

Simply put, she should not be teaching at NKU. Her assignments are totally pointless and she has NO lesson plan at all. She's never prepared. I don't know how many times she just didn't show up for class and then tell us it was because her dog got sick. SERIOUSLY! NO JOKE! She said that!
No Comments

Yeah, she is crazy! but she's so funny. NO DUE DATES ON ANYTHING until the end of the semester. I went most of the time just because i knew i could goof off without her saying stuff. She needs more experience.

This woman was crazy. there was no meaning to any of her assignments or even to coming to class. She was always late and had stupid reasons.  There was no reason for her to teach. Most of the classes we spent in there for 20 minutes at the most. She sucks as a teacher. I suggest you DO NOT take her class

Name: Nicole Mechler
Comment: Nicci gives us three major assignments throughout the semester and has the class workshop. There's fiction, poetry, and creative non-fiction. So far, the class has been very interactive and interesting. We laugh a lot and it's very casual. If you're taking a creative writing course, I would recommend Nicci as she can answer a lot of publication ?s.

Name: Jeane Pettit
Comment: Literally my hardest class and I got my lowest grade in it...

DO NOT take this class with her, she is unhelpful and she is not clear. Every day she has hard HW and you don't know what she want exactly!!!. I think she wrote the comment which said she is great teacher !!!!!

She is an absolutely AMAZING professor! She is always there to help you no matter what. I honestly think taking university 101 is very helpful! It helps you meet new people as a freshman, and to also make a network for yourself. It's very easy, and the class is really nice to get along with. Jeanne is super friendly and nice! And just AWESOME! (:
Great person and teach it is university 101 that is useless. They sell it really big during orientation do not take it. It was my hardest class there is something wrong about that.

Jeanne is a wonderful professor. She really cares about her students. If you put in the effort and still don't understand something, she is willing to work with you and help. However, if you don't show up to class and don't participate, she may not help as much. It is important to show up and do your work!

her class was not useful.wasted all of my time. you will put sooo much in her class than other class. everyday projects and hmw next day quiz n test. unv 101 is suppose to be fun her class NOOOOO. TRUST ME
Amazing teacher!! I enjoyed her class so much as a freshman!! I still go to her to this day for advice and help with school stuff! she is willing to help her students anyway she can!!
AWESOME!!!!  Don't listen to the other dude Jeanne rocks!
She will not work with her students. She will not tell you when you're in danger of failing. I feel sorry for anyone who ever has to take a class with her.

Name: Judith Taylor
Comment: Easy A honestly.  Yeah there is a ton of homework that will overwhelm you at times.  But all you have to do is turn it in and you get an A.  You turn in every homework assignment and you will get a perfect score.  She's very passionate about reading.
Dont even try to take her. Her work is very long and she will keep finding mistakes in every word you wrote. Whatever you do is wrong.

I don't think many students take this class seriously.Most are freshly 18 and do not take anything seriously.Prof. takes time out of her day to help you.If you got a bad grade, you deserved it b/c you didnt follow what she has asked. It is a lot of work- but all remedial classes are. The prof. doesnt have guidelines for the class, NKU does.

This class is terrible. There is no help, everything that you do in this class is wrong and it is hard to feel like you are getting anything done in the class because u are over-loaded with so much work. I am so mad that i didnt drop this class when i could because i feel like i am going to fail. Ms. Taylor is no help and shes not a good professor.

She talks in circles and at times its almost impossible to keep up.The work is alot for a remedial class but easy, that is when you figure out what you have to do. I wouldnt take her again. She's nice but I don't she realized students usually have other classes besides her own.
Worst professor ever!! Do not register for her class! Her expectations are ridiculous for a class that you don't even get credit for!!

I liked Judith a lot. I feel like she was helpful and tries her best to help you understand what she is teaching. One thing is she sometimes talks in cirlces and it is a little difficult to keep up. She is not afraid to argue with you either.

WORST TEACHER EVER! Do not, do not, do not take her class. This class is a remedial class to help you get into College writing and she will make sure you don't. I contacted her about my grade many times and she told me to refer to the syllabus. Her syllabus does NOT tell you your grade. She is no help when you don't understand things, she jsut keep

SHE IS BY FAR THE WORST INSTRUCTOR I EVER HAD IN MY LIFE! IF YOU GET HER RUN/ TRANSFER INTO ANOTHER CLASS!!! SHE WILL INSULT YOU FOR ASKING A QUESTION "AND THATS WHAT TEACHERS ARE FOR?" SHE DOES NOT GRADE SHE GRADES OFF FAVORTISM!I TURNED IN ALL MY WORK, CAME TO CLASS EVERYDAY, AND STILL GOT A POOR GRADE!!! I WASTED MY MONEY, TIME INTO THIS CLASS!

SHE IS BY FAR THE WORST INSTRUCTOR I EVER HAD IN MY LIFE!!!!.... IF YOU GET HER RUN/ TRANSFER INTO ANOTHER CLASS!!! SHE WILL INSULT YOU FOR ASKING A QUESTION AND MAKE YOU FEEL LIKE A IDOT FOR JUST ASKING A QUESTION!!.... SHE DOES NOT GRADE, SHE TAKES NOTES, AND GIVES YOU A GRADE OF FAVORTISM!!.... I WISH I WOULD KNEW BEFORE I TOOK THIS CLASS. TURNE

This teacher is horrible. You read too many books, and every week you have to do a summary, analysis, and interpretation on each chapter. It's so annoying. She gives you way to much work for a silly reading class, and she is always right. If you state your opinion... YOUR WRONG. Her tinted glasses were more interesting than her.
absolutely horrible and rude, she always thinks she's right and nobody else.. she doesnt teach or explain she gets mad when you share your opinion.
I absolute love this professor. She was great I would take her again if I could. She was always helpful. If you have a question don't be shy just ask and she will help!!

Kicked me out of class for expressing my view. Insulted students in the class when they did not understand the material. Incompetent and should not be teaching. Extemely ignorant and the only person she believes is correct or will ever be correct is her. Never take her class.
interesting class but ver incomprehensible. very bad at explaining what is due when. no syllabus.

I love her! She was so much fun to talk to and really helped me with my papers. I would enjoy taking her over and over again. She was so understanding. After we got done doing the papers we ended up talking, about anything and everything. She is the best!!
Great Women! She is very nice and I liked her very much all you have to do is your work!
She is really great. If you ever need help she is willing to stay after with you and do it. She really helped me express what I feel through words. I couldn't have asked for a better professor!!
Nice lady, just can't follow what she si trying to teach. write to many papaers for a reading class.

She was very helpful and creative. She was encouraging and helped motivate me to become a better writer instead of marking up my paper like another professor I had.  She is funny and interesting to listen to.

Name: John Metz
Comment: Great Professor, but you have to listen. Listen actively and class will be a blast. You'll learn a lot and he'll respect you. Yeah, his lectures are all over the place, but that's because he lectures on what fascinates himself. He's not afraid to push you out of your comfort zone either. Worth it purely for knowledge's sake.

Professor Metz is a nice guy, but when it comes to his teaching, he is all over the place with his lecture. The quizzes he gives out before test are almost 30 questions and are harder than the test. I failed almost all of his quizzes but passed the test with As and Bs. He relies on PowerPoint slides and lecture became very boring.

Don't take him. His lectures are terrible and they don't make sense. The majority of his assignments are only worth a handful of points. He also grades differently for every student. Someone will get a question wrong, but then another student will put the same answer but get it correct. He also does not help you outside of class.

He tests on things he hasnt taught, only reads off his powerpoint and never fully answers questions. He doesnt seem too aware of whats going on. Tests genuinely make no sense, somehow i have the grade I do, but ive had to work very very hard for it. He never grades clearly...

DO NOT TAKE THis class . Hes the only professor for this class unfortantley. Hes very all over the place . His tests are hard and he quizzes you on things before he teaches you . Hardest class ever . Hes a good guy in general just not a good professor . Ive asked him 6 times for extra credit . Wouldnt give it to me.

sadly he is the only teacher for this class and i had a good grade at the start otherwise i would have dropped this class. He has a habit of never really answering the question you asked and going around it completely. hes a very nice guy but when it comes to his ability to teach he is just too robotic and relies on his powerpoint too much.

He terrible, but everyone has to take GEO 100 but avoid getting him if you can, a horrible teacher, the worse I ever had, taught me nothing. You have to be motivated to do work on your own to learn if you want to pass his class. He looks and acts like a mad professor. Best of luck if you get him

He is the prof. that teaches this subject which stinks because I feel like it could be an interesting subject. He is very disorganized in his lectures and blackboard. Will go off on tangents. Just talks at you, doesn't go off slides or anything. Tests are incredibly long and essay heavy. Nice guy, lousy teacher.

Professor Metz seems to be all over the place, and he makes you work hard for your grade. His tests are easy though if you write the note cards to help you. It's about 2 pages of homework every week, so not too bad. Just have to study his Powerpoint Slides and you'll be fine. Try to attend class, because he gives in-class assignments.
He is a good guy. Hard to follow his lectures some times but overall an okay class. I am a good student on not skipping class but if you are in the habit of skipping, I wouldn't take this class.

He is the only prof. at NKU for this subject, so that, u need to learn how to survive his class... Nice prof. but an terrible prof. Makes zero sense, critical of everything u do, does not inspire students in the class room, very disorganized, and when he tries to organize it, he makes it worse. If you have trouble to sleep well come to this class.
Nice professor but an awful professor. Makes zero sense, critical of everything you do, does not inspire students in the class room.
He is very smart, has a hard time bringing that knowledge down to a undergrad level. Lectures are not very helpful unless you have read and understand the material before coming to class.

He is way to smart to teach this class. He isn't clear about what he is saying, and there are no clear notes. The book and himself does not match. Says Um a lot, and his classes are very boring. Don't take this class with him, higher level courses with him are fine.

He honestly made no sense during class. If you are thinking of taking him, think again! did so much work in this class and hardly made it out with a C. You do get note cards for the tests, but his wording on all tests and worksheets are VERY unclear. Choose a different professor.
Crazy unorganized. Have to take a GEO 300 course for history major? DO NOT TAKE HIM. You will regret it, as I and many others have. Nice enough guy, bad professor.

Professor Metz is a very nice guy and is very passionate about the subject. I would strongly advise against taking his classes because he is too smart to teach. He knows everything there is to know which makes it hard for him to go slow enough for students to process. His lectures are so unorganized it's close to impossible to follow along.

Professor Metz is a genuinely caring guy, but he makes his class unnecessarily difficult.  The homework he assigns is unorganized and you usually have to search 4 or 5 different places to find the answers.  He rambles in class... bounces all over the place.. and tends to get flustered.  Exams are hard and his guides don't do much to help.

Great guy but he does ramble a lot. Just a few reaction papers, everything you write is opinion based so very simple. Though unclear about whats on the tests during the class, he sends out documents with EVERYTHING you need to know for the test (and you can use notecards on all exams).  Go to office hours and you'll breeze through!

Metz is a good teacher is is very passionate about what he teaches. Yes, he isn't 100% clear for those of us who like to be babied through class but its not rocket science to figure him out. He is always there for help and loves it when you come to his office with questions which 1% of the class does. He even offers E.C. just for asking for help!

Name: Don Kazee
Comment: Professor does not seem to like female students... enough said. The department is male dominated and the student body reflects that.

Professor requires students to attend class sessions on days where their class is canceled. Do not count on the curve, he adjusts grades and how he grades so that the curve has no impact on your letter grade (if you had a D without the curve you will be graded in a manner that ensures you have a D after the curve). Not technically inclined.
I liked him and thought his lectures were clear and well organized.

If you've been assigned this professor, ask to be changed out of his class. He is extremely moody. He picks 10-15 people in the class who are favorites -- everyone else is left behind. His grading scale is a completely joke and changes from person to person.
I-R-A-C-C/A-R-O/C. Heavy on the formulaic method. Professor is to legal writing as Mr. Miyagi is to martial arts.

Kazee is the best professor at Chase. He loves his students and his job. It shows. If you pay attention in class, he'll teach you how to argue law the way it's supposed to be done both in written and oral form. His humor is top notch for those with enough brain cells to keep up with him. The man walks the line between genius and insanity.

He is so confusing. Everything is a joke. I would have really liked to learn something from him. I had all A's and B's until I took 2 classes from him and now I have a D- (which I have to retake) and a C-, both from him!

He is not an easy prof but this is law school - not undergrad anymore. If you get past that, I think he is a very bright professor who takes his role and the legal profession very seriously. He expects a lot from his students, but also works very hard for them. If you do the work, pay attention, and participate in class you will do well with KZ.

DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!  One of the rudest people I have ever met.  I am mystified as to how this man is still employed.  Will pick about 2 people he likes and their life is cake, for everyone else, hell.  Probably practiced law for about a week until he was canned for being a disheveled weirdo.

One of the worst professors I've ever seen.  Uses movies instead of writing his own fact patterns.  He does give insanely high grades (lowest my class was a B-), but HIGHLY favors night students.  If you're one of his favorite his class is a piece of cake, but if not it will be the worst semester of your life.  Avoid at all costs.
Unbelievably rude to students.  Not helpful.  His mood changes drastically from day to day.
Unbelievably rude to students.  Not helpful.  His mood changes drastically from day to day.
Kazee is a great professor who helps students a lot his lectures are as clear as they get and you learn a lot from him.

very self absorbed - dysfunctional dresser - wears same thing almost every day - is very smart but has no level of normal social tact or skill - its his world we are all hear to amuse him - avoid if possible
Nice!!
Great Professor!

KZ likes to lecture, and isn't so big on the socratic method. Often his lecturing can be boring, and confusing. Those are the negatives. Once you get past them, you see a professor that cares about his students, is well prepared, loves his job, and will work very hard to help you succeed. Those that can't (or refuse to) see this, might not like KZ.
Extremely helpful, once the outer shell is cracked!  High expectations, but willing to help students succeed.
He has a dry sense of humor that only an intelligent person could appreciate! He is a great teacher who expects a lot, but give a lot in return.
Thinks very high of himself and little of anyone else. Thinks logic problems are a fun way to teach writing. Hasen't a clue on people skills. Avoid at all cost

Name: Amal Said
Comment: She uses Mcgraw Hill, there is lots of homework. Not a difficult class, but very time consuming. Several group projects, which doesn't go well with the online format. Tests are proctored but quite easy if you know the formulas. Lots of material to study for each week. Prof Said is kind, and will give you help/an extension if you send her an email.

Assigned about 10-15 assignments per week... weekends aren't exclusions, either.  Super unorganized workflow throughout the course that caused many students confusion, even my group members.  Homework assignments are usually incorrect.  I had to contact her multiple times about McGraw assignment errors.  Don't take her class if you value free time.

WAY too much work.  The material is not hard, but the assignments are way too long and involved, even if you only do the graded ones - so much so that I grew to hate the class and the topic.  Take this from another professor if you can.

I think Dr. Said is a great teacher. This was an online class so there was more work however she is very accommodating and is always willing to help you out. She offers a lot of extra credit and prepares you very well for the exams the notes are very helpful and there is a lot of review. There are a lot of group assignments too.

She seems like she really means well, but her teaching style doesn't mix well with an online asynchronous format. I think if I had taken her class in person I would have had a better experience. Overall though, she is an effective professor if you can attend her lectures, and if you ask her for help she'll work to accommodate you.

Dr. Said places a lot of effort into her course - more so than any other professor in online course - so her students can maximize their learning. She always mean well, is accessible, and caring. She knows the material exceptionally well. She encourages participation frequently. Take her if you care about your career.

I took this class because it was required for my major. This professor assigns A LOT of assignments. You also have a lot of group projects. The end of the semester was extremely stressful because of the amount of things due. I do not recommend this professor unless it is your only option. She is extremely nice though and means well.

This class was one of the hardest classes I have even take, but with that being said Dr. Said was very helpful. Anytime I needed anything she was there to help. She is very kind and a great professor.

When she finally answers emails, she cannot answer questions. Not sure she even knows the topic. Use the online resources. Do not recommend taking her class. If you cannot take it with someone else, take it somewhere else and transfer it.

Dr. Said is awful. I took her in an all online class where she required us to do group work, and come to weekly hour long meetings that no one was made aware of when they signed up for her class. She has does discussion board leaders that are never mentioned in her syllabus. Do not take any class with her if you want to actually learn.
You will learn more watching YouTube

This is one of the hardest classes I have ever taken. Managerial accounting is supposed to be easier than financial. You are required for the entire semester to be in a group and meet with them weekly and complete several assignments together. I have never had such a large workload for one single class and I regret taking it with this professor.

Name: Philip Moberg
Comment: Zero transparency when it comes to grading assignments. Will send out grades at end of semester without giving students feedback or communication. Recommend a different I/O program.

Dr. M is a great professor who loves teaching IO psych. I had him for numerous classes in the MSIO program and will say he grows on you the more classes you take. His classes are difficult BUT he does so to challenge and motivate you to get through the program. Classes do take a lot of work but are worth it when you see how much you have learned.
Lectures off of powerpoints the ENTIRE time, monotone voice, no study guides, fend for yourself

Dr. Mo teaches a hard subject. Most students do not enjoy statistics and he does the best he can to keep it interesting and easy to understand. He is available outside of class & truly cares that his students not only do well in his class, but also understand the material. Yes, you have to work for your grade but DMo will make you laugh throughout!

Dr. Moberg comes off as intimidating in the initial stats sequence courses for the MSIO program. However, if you stick with stats and show him you're interested in completing the relevant research projects for research methods and capstone, you will do a lot better. He is very helpful when it comes to designing research projects and analyzing data.

Don't be fooled by "only a few" homework problems... they have a-e and c might have 6 steps which each involve several steps etc.  Pretty tough grading on homework. Inconsistent with things like where to round to. Exams are NOTHING LIKE THE HOMEWORK; no computation, requires a deep understanding of the material so study accordingly.

He doesn't teach you what you need to know to do the homework. You need 95% to get an A. He takes off points for everything, even when you are right. If you point it out to him that you are right, he ignores you. And he changes assignments last minute.

He doesn't teach you what you need to know to do the homework. You need 95% to get an A. He takes off points for everything, even when you are right. If you point it out to him that you are right, he ignores you. And he changes assignments last minute.  I discourage attending the MSIO program at NKU until they get someone else to teach stats.

He doesn't teach you what you need to know to do the homework, and his tests are really hard. You need 95% to get an A. He takes off points for everything, even when you are right. If you point it out to him that you are right, he ignores you. I strongly discourage attending the MSIO program at NKU until they get someone else to teach stats.
He wrote the tests WAY too hard, and knew it, but continued to write them difficult. He was pretty boring and not as understanding as he acted.
unclear. unimaginative. same old method of teaching/passive learning. should be more creative, its I/O

Puts notes on powerpoint but you better come to class for clarification of them. Read the book if you miss class. Come to class for after-test review to score tons of extra points! Always available to clarify anything you need!

Name: Shawn Brown
Comment: Quizzes over every chapter. Tests come straight from the quizzes. Had to read but not hard.

The worst professor I've had during my college career. I emailed him numerous times with no response. Exams were not over the chapter we were on. Marked my answers wrong even though they were right. I sent him screenshots of proof and still didn't change my grade. Always late on opening assignments due to crazy excuses. Won't take him again.

Don't know why people would complain. Homework is easily found in the book. Quizzes each week and exams cover the quizzes that we already had. Had to read a lot but learned. Professor was available when I asked questions.  I'd take him again.
One of the worst professors I had. Did not teach at all, completely self-taught myself. The amount of busy-work was crazy.
Completely self-taught, and loaded with meaningless busy-work.

Name: Kareen Monteyne
Comment: I love, love, love Dr. Monteyne!  I haven't met a professor at NKU that doesn't meet Dr. Monteyne's caliber.  She will go out of her way to help students that are slacking.  (And those students who are slacking are the one's that never go to lecture or lab).  It's easy material, you just need to go to class and do your homework!

Although there was a TON of material covered- I found this class to be interesting, challenging, and fun.  Dr. Monteyne is an outstanding professor and will go out of her way to help. Read the book, do the reviews, and study with flashcards.  There's no reason why anyone shouldn't pass this class.

She was a really nice person and better understood if she teaches you one on one if you have the time for that. She moved really fast and taught us a lot in one class period and it was hard to comprehend it. You barley use your book she teaches off notes and gives you owl work. The lab she at first just throws you into it, it seemed.

I had her for Che 120 and Che 120L. She is a really good teacher, she does a lot of worksheets and problems for participation points to help you learn concepts. You do a lot fo examples, which help. Although her tests are hard, she holds study sessions before the tests that really help.

She is a hard teacher and she does give a lot of homework, but she is a great professor.   You will pass the class if you do the homework.  You only need a 64% to get a C in her class.  You can get that by failing every test.  Test are hard but the class is easy!

She is a difficult teacher especially for lab. If you are a quick learner or are willing to put in a lot of time into studying, this is the class for you but this is not an easy class or teacher to take especially for a gen Ed. Some things are taught too quickly or not thoroughly enough for comprehension, this is when you must teach yourself.

She really isn't that bad. She does move fast, and the material is hard, so I wouldn't take it as a Gen Ed.  Her tests are really hard though, but she does study sessions before. The textbook is hardly used, but I bought it and use it when I need to review myself.

Monteyne teaches as if she has never been in the real world,as flies through the material at an incomprehensible rate. Concepts that take weeks to master are taught in one class session and expected to have it masterede by the following test. She expects to already know what she is teaching and therefore spends no time on any particular section.

WOW...she's the worst professor ever! She tests on concepts that have only been taught a few days before, even very complex material! The material takes awhile to understand; it cannot be learned in a matter of days! Most of the students agree that her class is WAY too hard; it's not fair for the whole class to suffer because of her bad teaching!
Challenging but learned a lot. Her lectures are dependent on students keeping up with reading and assignments. She will help with questions if you ask. Critical thinking is necessary for exams.

Not a good teacher... she is very knowledgeable about what she is teaching but she flies through everything. If you fall behind even a little its almost impossible to catch back up. The examples she does in class are usually totally different than ones on tests and quizes...I would NOT recommend this teacher.

Nice Lady and very knowledgeable about her subject however not a very good teacher. She doesnt know how to relate material to students most fail and if you fall behind it is basically impossible to catch up. Class seems easy then tests are difficult and not only is your answers graded but the work that led to the answers

She is literally the worst teacher or professor I have ever had. She speeds through everything (including complex concepts) without explaining them very much at all. Good explanations and foundations are important in understanding chemistry, and she makes learning the subject very difficult. I do NOT recommend her as a chemistry professor.
The worst teacher I've ever had. She talks too fast and doesn't care that the majority of the class is failing. If you want to pass chemistry do not take her.

Name: William Gartig
Comment: Mr. Gartig is a nice man however, you will never understand what he is trying to convey. He doesn't know what he is lecturing on and flippantly skips over material and assigns tests and quizzes almost weekly. Information used is completely unrelated to the religion you study. DO NOT pay for this class or take it.

Dr. Gartig was totally uninformed of the material and all religions besides his own. He cites Wikipedia in his PowerPoint, and spoke so fast it was impossible to take notes. Gartig pushes his personal religious opinion, even when it is totally irrelevant to the class. I think that he is a TERRIBLE teacher. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!!
I don't understand all of the negative comments, he's a really cool guy that obviously loves what he's teaching. Show up and read the textbook and you'll do great!

I absolutely despise this class and I dread going to it everyday. He is an nice guy but I absolutely have no idea what is going on. He teaches poorly and isn't organized. The tests aren't based off of the lecture either. Also, he calls people out in front of the class if they're doing bad. Don't do it.

LOVED his class, one of the best professors. i dont understand people who say bad things about him just because they did bad, they have to blame themselves not the professor. if you pay attention and read the book you will get an easy A. quizes are based on the book and almost every week. finally, he is a really nice guy and a great professor.

Do yourself a favor, and just don't. He absolutely never knew what was going on, I always was left day dreaming about random things in the class, and then I would snap out of it a minute later and he'd be 20 slides into a powerpoint because he talks faster than anyone in the world, and is click happy with the slides. Can't take notes or anything.

Avoid if at all possible. He's a very nice man with alot of passion for the class, but is completely disorganized. He overloads PowerPoints with too much information that isn't even needed to know, and also goes through the notes so quickly that you are unable to write or take any kinds of notes.
Very knowledgeable about the subject. Can go of in tangents, but you can really learn a lot. Read the book and take notes and you will do fine. Really nice guy.

Terrible lecturer. Bored me to death,I don't even remember most of the class cause I daydreamed most of the time. AVOID! Tests and quizzes aren't terrible,he just gives a massive amount of information in short periods of times. Just reading the book will help.

I took this class because I was very interested in the subject and already new some about it. He knows absolutely NOTHING about what he's teaching. If you ask questions or contradict what he is saying with the FACTS he just ignores it or casually sweeps over it. I am mad I paid for this class when i just needed the book.

He's not the greatest lecturer, but he is quite knowlegable about the subjects he teaches.  People who do poorly in his class don't attend class or read the material.  If you study, you'll get an easy A; if you don't, you'll get what you deserve.
I took his world religions class. Very informative, very passionate. Tests based on notes mainly...

TERRIBLE. hate this class with a passion. He has little to no idea what he is talking about. the class failed half the tests and he blames us. yet the power points he gives do not go with the book so you are left with conflicting material. he will yell at you if you leave class early, or text. i would not take him, if i were you!

I really enjoyed this class - it was interesting and Professor Gartig was extremely passionate about religions and stressed that the class was for learning about and respecting religions not pitting one religion against another and choosing who is right. As long as you study his powerpoints and review the chaters you'll do fine!

He's rude.  He consistently breaks the student- professor relationship by telling the whole class what grades people received on their exams/ chapter quizzes.  Most of what he says in class is incomprehensible because he consistently jumps subjects.  He also talks down to you, which I abhor.

I don't understand how students have ranked Dr. Gartig as difficult. His tests and quizzes (indeed there are many) are based entirely on the textbook! Show up to class, read the chapter the night before each test, and any person of average intelligence should find an A well within reach. Note: He can be sexually perverse and rude but only seldomly.

Moody, confusing professor.  He is unclear and sometimes very mean.  The class is not extremely hard because he lets you use notes on the quizzes.  He's defintely not as horrible as people make him out to be but he's definitely NOT that good of a professor.  If there are other classes open take them, there are better professors.
Do not take this class! Lecutures were confusing and made no sense.I learned nothing and he is a very rude professor!

Nice guy, easy class.  Lets you make up tests all the way up until the last day.  I didn't read the book, but mostly relied on his notes which are on blackboard and his review sheets, which test is mostly based off of.  You have to try and fail.

He is a horrible professor. He cares about nothing but himself.He needs to learn how to teach.  I can't comprehend what he is saying half the time.If you ask him a question he doesn't know the answer. You do nothing but take tests in the class. There is a test per week, sometimes two.  DO NOT TAKE HIM!!

Name: Nathan De Lee
Comment: The actual textbook isn't really needed, but you do need to get the lecture tutorials. This was a really easy class and labs weren't bad.
