Dr. Dee Lee is a nice man and will help any student who shows interest! Many students refer to him as the "Physics Dad". Unfortunately, this class had a textbook that didn't apply to his lectures. They were more used as a very general light outline. This made it difficult because he is a tough grader on homework, even if you don't understand.

Name: Rob Pasquinucci
Comment: Rob is a great guy and a really good professor. Has a lot of knowledge and know how. You can tell he really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. Extremely helpful, I would take him for the rest of my PR courses if I could.
A good guy, not a bad teacher, but not a great one either. Needs a few more years of experience. Has a passion for his students.
No Comments

Name: Elizabeth Powell
Comment: Betsy is a nice lady, but this class is very challenging! Write your speeches early and PRACTICE them. Read the book because there are quizzes and she makes you write 4 papers on ethos, logos, and pathos which only has one chapter in the book (which is ridiculous).

Betsy is good at teaching public speaking. If you pay attention in class, she is very willing to help with any questions you ask. She does give a lot of homework for a a 101. It is a bit more work than other public speaking classes, but I'm sure you'll learn more. If you want to learn something, this is a good class. Not particluarly easy though.

Name: Nancy Firak
Comment: Very smart lady. Kind and fair. I did well on her exams - other students complained about their grades. Torts is an abstract subject so I'm not sure that its the teacher as much as it is the subject matter. Laptop usage in class is limited to longer lectures for note taking so bring paper and a pen!

Torts I was not bad. she took the time to really drill the concepts into your head. But Torts II was a cluster. She gets confused. She uses terms that no other supplement uses, so good luck w that. Her test for Torts II was not proportionate to the time she spent on the material. It wasn't hard persay but concepts were confusing coming from her.
Firak is a great teacher and keeps torts interesting. She loves "Understanding Torts" by Diamond and wants you to use his exact wording.

Firak is a good professor. No other professor who teaches 1L's at Chase will give you as many Restatement sections or spend as much time on theory as she does. Read Palsgraf through about 25 times and tell me what the proximate cause of her awesomeness is. Giving her a bad review would be tortious.

Name: Marissa Williams
Comment: I felt that the class was very thorough which is a good thing for any student wishing to become a professional. She was very funny and down to earth. Our topics were very diverse and interesting. We only had to write a handful of papers. Helped me a lot with grammar usage. Overall enjoyable class.
she was hard. we had papers pretty much every month  maybe two a month and she uses the book a lot. she doesnt really give grades except for on papers and they are hard grades too

She is a very good teacher. There is a lot of work involved, like reading every night and papers at least twice a month. But she is very helpful and her classes are fun. If you do the work, ask for help, ect... you will be fine!

Interesting topics and extremley helpful. The workshops and conferences about our papers were amazing. Didn't cover the same old boring cirriculum like many English classes. One of the best English classes I've had.
Very hard. Kinda ruined my love for english. Everything was related to the one book you read. Only gave letter grades and didnt tell you what you did wrong.

She requires a lot of work for the class...and every paper has to do with the same thing. It's hard to know where you stand in the class as far as grades cause she only gives you a letter grade on papers and homework. Also with grades I feel like I'll get an A on one thing and a C on another and not know what I did differently!

Name: Susan Houben
Comment: Be prepared to read and share experiences relating to the readings. Like any college level course, expect to work for your grade. Ms. Houben's class is no exception. Review the syllabus in advance to know the work load and time frames - if you can't meet them, then drop the class. Ms. Houben is a delight and willing to help if asked.
This course contained A LOT of assignments. Multiple quizzes weekly and many writing assignments that are very strictly graded. Be ready to work for your A.

This class was a joke. Lectures were completely pointless, but when it comes to a discussion board she expects a novel with correct grammar and punctuation. Her final paper is a joke. It says 5-7 pages total, but will end up failing you if you don't do it perfectly. Don't take her. Coming from a 4.0 student, this class destroyed my GPA.

Name: Chelo Diaz Martin
Comment: She favorites students that actually speaks spanish and she is so nice to them but she targets some kids she yells at one kid when they do something even though everyone is doing it she favorites and targets lids

She really seems to love teaching spanish. She is a little hard, but I feel like I've actually learned something from this class. She grades based on effort and growth, instead of scores on tests. Quite a bit of homework.
Love the way she  teaches Spanish!!

Name: James Canfield
Comment: Let down.

Name: Bill Epps
Comment: Does not care whether or not you pass or fail. Very dry humor. Very arrogant.

Hard Teacher, Hard Class and Very boring. He goes off and rambles on things that arent helpful and he goes over things sooo fast and never repeats anything so note taking is impossible. Good Luck if your taking him, i wont again.
DO NOT TAKE. His class is sooo hard, hardest class I have ever taken. Hes words are so hard to understand and he doesnt let you ask question at all. I feel bad for the international kids.
We try to learn about the subject and more, but the terms used in it are so scientific and hard it is almost impossible to follow. The test are really hard and you dont expect it to be that hard.

Mr. Epps (don't call his Doctor!) is great as long as you show up to class. If you don't show up, you have to take notes from the book and the book is huge, so show up. He doesn't take attendance, but a lot of the work comes from the lectures, not the book, so show up. He's very funny and talks really fast, but likable.

Took him for a dual credit class while I was still in high school, and he really turned me off to not only psychology but to college in general.  There was a lot that could've been done with the material, but it never really reached potential.  Pretty boring.

DO NOT MISS CLASS. Attendance is not required by the Professor but you will get very behind. I went to class and paid attention for the most part. Studied outside of class once for about 20 minutes. I got a B. Go to class and pay attention and take good notes and you should be fine. Still, more difficult than you'd want for a gen ed.
Terrible class!

This class is tough. His exams had questions linked to minor parts of class discussion, and the class average is barely passing as of now. However, he's a very smart man and his lectures were interesting. Just be prepared.

I had Prof Epps last semester and the class was just okay. Expect to attend class regularly, otherwise we will be clueless. He does not review for tests at all, so make sure you go to class and take notes. All of his tests are multiple choise and 3 exams make up your entire grade. Be prepared!!

Hard class, tons of reading, will take questions only at end of 3 hours lectures. Extremely good lecturer, though not very friendly by nature, and is surprised that students do not approach him for help outside of class.
very smart

The class was alot of writing.  He doesn't require attendance but, if you miss you are hurt.  The study guide helps alot.  The tests aren't just on the notes.  Some of the questions I don't even remember from the book or notes.  Getting a C I was happy with and I am a Psych major.  There was so many different topics.  It was ridiculous.
No Comments

The class was really difficult and you can't afford to miss or you get WAY behind he goes over tons of stuff not in the book. LEctures NON STOP over really boring stuff so if you're takin him grab a red bull before you go

I would recommend him if you're ready to work.  This is not an easy class.  He outlines everything before each class.  His tests are hard and he doesnt give study guides.  And he DOES let you ask questions, I dont know what the other guy was talking about.
No Comments
He teaches mainly night classes and he never lets you ask a question.  He lectures for three hours straight and leaves.  DO NOT TAKE.

Name: Gary Clayton
Comment: Worse online teacher, past his prime. He claims the final, which more than half the class tanked dropped grade, said that Canvas didnt take the weight into account, even though his canvas grades were not weighted. Never answers emails, post the wrong information, syllabus, and due date times for assignments.

He is a professor who has been around forever so he relies on Mcgraw hill to do his grading. Everything is straight forward. But lots of technical errors with assignments or syllabus not being posted and he took forever to post final grades. If you can take the online class I suggest it.

He would confuse himself while talking about the subject. He would deviate from the actual subject and almost never talk about economics, he would just talk about himself. He also only lectured with no visual aids. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!
Only grades are exams which are impossible. Often makes mistakes in lecture and follows it up with oops ignore all of that

The tests were so difficult I was studying a week before them and still getting a low C at best on them. The class average on them was so low I was shocked by how difficult this macro class was. If you want to pass the class just skip the notes and read every page of the textbook.

Dr. Clayton shows PowerPoint where he reads verbatim and then rambles off topic. He does not teach the a majority material that you are tested on, you must thoroughly read the text book and essentially memorize the text to do well on the exams. The exams are multiple choice scan-tron with no room for error. There are extra credit opportunities.

Awful! His tests are extremely difficult!!! You must read the entire textbook before each test, and know every single word in it to get a good grade on his tests. Very boring lectures, and the class drags on. He does give 10 points of extra credit for doing very easy assignments, and allows you to drop the lowest test grade out of 3 tests.
The lectures are irrelevant and don't actually teach you what you need to know. The class is very boring and I didn't actually learn from him.
Need to go to class because he tells you things that will be on test but it is hard to pay attention. All he does is lecture

Dr. Clayton is a very nice man but is a very poor professor. If I had skipped class and simply studied for the exam, I think I would have done better. His lectures do not fully prepare you for the exams. The one upside is that he provides you with all of the exam questions at the beginning of the chapter, so you ca study those outside of class.

I will not be taking any more of Clayton's classes. He says to use what's on the powerpoints and not what's in the book, but the tests hardly reflect what is on the powerpoints. He also talks about random things that aren't going to be on the tests and it just makes class so boring. You only need the book for the Connect assignments.

ATTENDANCE IS NOT MANDATORY AT ALL!  He goes over power-points EVERY class. The power-points are on blackboard as well which makes it easy to want to skip and teach yourself... DON'T! The power-points are simply the foundation of what you'll see on the test. You need to be able to understand situations and match them up! There are only 4 grades.

Many people on here are complaining how difficult his class is and him explaining things. Simply put, majority of people on here are complainers because they failed themselves, it's there own fault!! If you read and study, I can guarantee you can do well in this course Eco 200. He gives extra credit and many are stupid to take advantage of it.

Lectures are not required, and he puts all the stuff on blackboard. But he passes out quizzes in class that aren't for credit but the questions are exactly the same on the exam. He also drops your lowest exam score of 4 exams. The lectures were long and sometime boring, but it helped.

Rough class. Lectures were painful. I enjoyed the content... However, his lectures provided little benefit to my learning experience. 90% of my success was due to VERY thorough text-book reading.. There's only 3 grades for the class... and they are the exams. On a bright note, after each exam he goes through each problem and we can discuss it.
Lectures about politics and irrelevant stuff during class. Never actually teaches the class on what Macroeconomics truly is. DO NOT TAKE HIM.

His lectures had nothing to do with any of the material you were tested on.  His whole class centered around you reading the textbook completely.  He was not helpful at all when someone asked a question.  Gives a lot of extra credit which was nice but you needed it because you had no idea what the tests would cover.  Terrible.
Incredibly intelligent, but sadly he has a hard time explaining things to a novice — which most of us are — in a meaningful way.  As a person, he's great.  As a professor, he's difficult.

Very knowledgeable professor.  He's willing to help students when they ask.  Sometimes he has difficulty explaining the topics but he'll help the best he can as long as students ask.  Also very fair with grading and scheduling tests.  As long as you keep up with him, you'll do just fine

If you can take any other professor, do so. He is a nice guy, but does not know how to explain the material. His tests are ridiculous and almost impossible to do well on. Halfway through the semester and 65% of the class has dropped.

Name: Frederick Schneider
Comment: Great professor. Expects a lot of work but class is worth it. Big on Socratic/Case method. Final is tough. Fairly certain he teaches school only to weed out the weak & prevent them from practicing.
He's a tough professor, and he loves to torture 1Ls. However, I learned a lot in his class. Come prepared and you'll do well.

I'm fairly certain this man is the greatest law professor in the Cincinnati area. He's an institution in himself, "old school" to the core, and a wealth of knowledge. I consider myself blessed to have been taught by this man. I only hope that when he retires he doesn't completely stay away from Chase.

This guy is a tough Professor. He teaches old school. Come to class prepared. His exams are very tough. Try to avoid his class if you can.I didn't chose to take his class. I still think he's kind of a jerk even though sometimes he's helpful outside of class.

This guy is a tough Professor. He teaches old school. Come to class prepared. His exams are very tough. Try to avoid his class if you can.I didn't chose to take his class. I still think he's kind of a jerk even though sometimes he's helpful outside of class.
No Comments

Kind of an ass. Likes to torture students in class. Outside of class very nice and very helpful, not helpful during class. His personality changes when he is not teaching property. Upper level classes he is much nicer. Almost seems like he feels it is his duty to torture 1st year students. Exam was long. Have tried to avoid him.

Name: Robert Langenderfer
Comment: Bob is an awesome professor. He knows a lot about respiratory and is very willing to help. His tests are difficult and require studying.
Great teacher, very helpful. Tests are hard if you don't study. Best respiratory teacher

Name: Majed Dabdoub
Comment: For the structural class there are a minimum of 4 exam grades. The 5th exam is optional, however, your grade will not be up to date when you are told you have to commit to taking the 5th. He lectured us about taking notes and passively makes fun of students who do not understand. He states there are no dumb questions, then makes students feel dumb.

Dr. Dabdoub actually teaches this class fairly well. Unfortunately, he still has an attitude which makes it difficult to ask questions. He grades only from tests, so make sure you are in class and paying attention. He does not explain the small math steps, so make sure you understand where he gets all of his numbers and constants.

You get graded off of 2 tests, and 2 projects. Does not teach the content, only lectures on it. He has incredibly high expectations of your knowledge for the projects that is beyond unreasonable considering that the extent of instructions he gives you is a couple sentences in the syllabus. Is very hard to approach if you are confused on something.

He is very heavy on lectures and only has a few assignments that you are graded on the whole semester. He is not very clear in his lectures and he is so uninteresting when he talks it is hard to understand and follow. He also explains things from a point of view of already understanding them and does not have patience for people who do not know.
Three test that is it. He just reads his power-point slides and does not try to teach his students. I wish that there was another professor to take besides him

He teaches in his own way believing that he is doing a great job. However, this guy is not giving any student valuable knowledge to common field practices. Maybe if you're working across seas you may find him more likable. Prepare yourself to stare at the wall and count the white bricks. NKU's CM program is a joke with him as the chair

Classes are long. Lectures do not follow any sort of structure. However, do like having students do lectures/presentations every other week. Get to learn about other's experiences. Often leads to good conversation.
Have him late night. Makes his own rules-even if he is clearly wrong (against building codes) he is still right. Very confusing-even when you can understand what he says.

He is a nice and funny professor and tries to joke around. He really explains the chapters and goes over the questions at the end of the chapter to help you some more. He doesn't give any homework though so a majority of your grade comes from tests.

The worse professor that I have taken class with. Very boring, doesn't help students at all, bad attitude towards the students. Very stupid test questions! No doubt that he may ask you about the number of the book pages! If you can get rid of him, do so!
Dabdoub is a great teacher even he is a strict, he is very helpful.
Terrible representation for NKU, he needs to find another profession

yells at you when you ask questions, hates to see you taking notes. yes you did read that right, he hates when people take notes.Dont have to come to class but if you want to try and keep on top of things in my opinion you should go to every class. Only somewhat good thing about the class is that the test are open book, open notes, and you might ge

His teaching methods are not where they need to be. He goes way too fast and gets upset when we don't necessarily "memorize" everything that was taught in the previous lecture. Then gives his same little "speech" that he gives every time we don't answer a question quick enough or we don't understand something. Unfortunate that he's the only teacher

This is one of the most difficult teachers to understand and get help from. He tells stories and than dismisses you from class. I would not suggest taking his class, but unfortunately he is the only one who teaches it. I think his ego gets in the way of his teaching.
He is suprisingly better in this class than others that I have had with him. He actually smiles and cracks a couple of jokes.

Very bad professor.  Doesn't really care about the students too much he is just there to get paid.  Very hard to understand and doesn't explain very well.  Moves too fast and just isn't very good at making sure the students understand what is going on.
One of the hardest professors I've ever had. He just doesn't seem to care much about the students either.
No Comments

Name: Edward Kwon
Comment: Don't take a class with him its horrible. You can't understand a word he says and all of the assignments are busy work and pointless. You won't use the textbook except for one assignment but you have to buy it. Just avoid at all costs or you'll regret it.

He is a very nice man, but that's it. He is not good with technology, and he assigns one essay every other week, all with 1000 words required. His study guide just had terms, some of them spelled wrong, with no clarification on what to do with them. None of them had anything to do with the exam. He does not respond to emails AT ALL.

Dr. Kwon is a nice guy who has good intentions but does not really stick to the class criteria. Rather than going into depth about the politics in countries around the world, he spent his lectures explaining common sense. You are graded on 4 assignments: a powerpoint presentation, 2 exams, and attendance. I would not recommend.

Legitimately one of if not the worst teacher I've ever had. I could not understand a single word he said the entire semester I had his class and the stuff I did manage to remember and learn is useless material that won't actually be useful in the real world.

Long lectures and student interaction in class (questions and presentations) are difficult with the professor. He will interrupt presenters during presentations and not fully address questions asked in class.
Bad

This class made a negative amount of sense. He never explained assignments well, the lecture slides were always insanely long, and I learned nothing in the time I was taking his class. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS IF YOU CAN AVOID IT. It is not worth it just to have an online class.

He has one big group project the whole year that most of your grade is based on, he gives good feedback on papers and gives time to edit it and pretty much tells you exactly what he wants on it so you'll most likely do fine if you follow his instructions, and he's kind of quirky but you can tell he actually cares about his students
He's really nice, and genuinely cares about students. But there is few things that you're graded on, so the pressure for each assignment is much higher.

I took this class in spring 2020. The further I get in my college career, the more I'm realizing that having 1,000-word essays each week is not normal for a *100-level-class*. Even if you do all of these essays perfectly, if you do not do well on the difficult midterm and final, then you will not get the grade you want.

DO NOT TAKE AN ONLINE CLASS. No attempt at actually teaching. He assigns essays on topics with no context in book. Most of them are 1000+ words but could be done in 500 words. 10/10 grade if you do enough words. No feedback given. No lectures or readings given and expects you to know the content for exams.

Edward Kwon is a god-awful professor. Instead of teaching in a meaningful way, he assigns papers to substitute actually teaching content. It doesn't help that the prompts of said paper are so specific and out of left field that you wonder how in God's name he came up with them in the first place. Absolutely garbage class and an even worse teacher.

Very difficult to understand and does not know how Canvas works. Refused to come to campus and moved class from in person to online even though he struggles terribly with the use of online learning software.

This man is not a professor, he is simply someone who assigns you several thousand word essays without teaching you anything, he expects you to either already know everything or google it as his essays are asking questions that have never been discussed in class or the assigned readings.

I was hesitant to take Dr. Kwon in class because of his negative reviews, but he really is an amazing professor. He's very animated and clearly loves teaching. Pay attention and you can understand him- please don't let his accent be a deciding factor. Print your notes, ask to meet outside of class, and participate in discussions and you'll be good.

He was a nice guy, but goes off on rants. Didn't really go off the books and is very hard to understand. He does not offer feedback, but does grade on a curve. I did not learn anything from his class and would not take another class with him.

I would NOT take his class at all!!!! He runs a 100 level course like it is a 400 or 500 level course. He goes into long unrelated rants. With the in person class, you have four grades for the semester; midterm, final, powerpoint, and presentation. He is a really nice person but All he does is lecture right from the PP from the books website.

Dr. Kwon is so kind but unfortunately he is hard to understand. The only grades are the midterm, final, and one project. The tests are curved but they are still extremely difficult because of all of the content. The class is lecture but he will call on people randomly.

I took the online class. He gave an online "discussion" every other week where you basically write 1000 words about whatever power point he shares. The discussions are easy and he almost always gives 100. He gives a midterm and final exam though that have nothing to do with any of the material gone over. These two tests ruined my grade :/

For the first couple of weeks, it is a little hard to understand him because of his accent, so just read the book that first week and you should be fine after that, because it is easier to understand the longer you are in the class. Everything on the tests are exactly what is on the PowerPoints. Don't ask a lot of questions during the lectures.

Name: Max Gise
Comment: Gise is very passionate about what he teaches. He would often dance while lecturing. Sometimes he played his jazz music so loud that you couldn't even hear what he was saying.

Not willing to work with students at all. Took this class as FOK course and now have to retake. In the first week of class he asked who was music majors, most of the class raised their hand, so he decided to treat this as an upper level music class not a gen ed. Not helpful and very rude if you need testing services, talks down to nonmusic students

Name: Ed Brewer
Comment: Very student oriented.  Is willing to stick neck out on the line for students.

He assigns more than we ever get too, but other than that he is willing to help people who are having problems and wants to give students a broad understanding of the material which can sometimes be construed as disorganization.
unorganized, not available to students, semi-combatative
Class was a train wreck - managed to make it through only half our casebook in 2 semesters.

Brewer is unable to plan a schedule; week by week he would changed it, and then failed to meet the new schedule. He didn't cover half the material he should have, but tested on it anyway. His knowledge of the material is suspect as well. When asked about a topic in a review session, asked for the page number of the topic, he then read the material.

Can not stay on subject.He needs to take some initiative and tell students who either ask stupid questions or ask questions/make comments to show how smart they are that there is no time for that crap and that the class needs to move on.We were not able to cover a FEW CHAPTERS b/c he cant keep the class rolling.And dont read to me Brew, I know how.

His main flaw is lacks organization. Following this flaw, is that he teaches Civ Pro while in Torts class. Teaching of the second course results in not covering the Torts material. The material that was not covered laters appears on the exam compromising about 90% of the MC quesitons (which was a high % of the exam). Brewer should not be teaching.
EB should not be teaching!!  Failed to cover required material.

Has great difficulty keeping on schedule. Turned in mid-term and both finals late. Did not have enough time to cover defamation at the end of the second semester, which leaves us looking elsewhere to learn the material. Is prone to allowing himself and the class go far off the day's topic.

Name: Grant Edwards
Comment: Took him for 340L and I will say, I definitely had to work for the grade I got. Very tough grader when it comes to lab notebooks, expects a lot from the student for each notebook. But, he is a great professor and does care about the students. Expect very high expectations from Day 1.

There are many students that will say that Dr. Edwards is not a good professor. Those students, either do not care enough to put in the effort or are just lazy. Dr. Edwards is by far the best teacher I have had at NKU. He is sarcastic and funny and makes class enjoyable. I took him for Che 120L and passed easily. I am taking him again now.
WOULD NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE.  HARDEST CLASS EVER.
Super hard grader.. I failed by 1% .. I always tried by best and it still wasn't enough
Terrible. Never actually teaches and when he attempts to explain something he makes it far more difficult and complicated. Also rude and condescending.

Dr. Edwards is a highly inconsistent and unclear professor. Oftentimes students in the class didn't understand what was desired of them and, if asked, Dr. Edwards would only repeat his confusing directions. I feel he would be better suited to teaching a higher level course and not a course designed as an introduction into college chemistry.

hes awesome!!!!!!!! people complain about him but he's a really smart dude and really wants to help if you just ask him. Personable and i wish he taught 121L!!! makes sense of everything I didn't catch in lecture. Grades hard but he wants what he wants you to understand what you're doing so just listen to him and everythings cool :)

Dr. Edwards is very helpful and is one of my favorite professors at NKU. He does have a sarcastic sense of humor but,if you actually do what you are supposed to do and put some effort into the class, he will go out of his way to help you. The only people he treats like kids are  people that act like kids.

Let's see, you can spend twice the amount of time on a lab report as someone in Dr. Bullen's Lab and get a 60 or go with Dr Bullen and get a 90.  If you're in his section and there are seats open in the other one then you're an idiot, and your F is your own damn fault. I got ABOVE the mean grade for the class and got a D+.  I can't imagine...

because of Dr Bullen was out, so he substituted my labs and lecture. He is a very nice but funny guy that always mean to people. But he explained thing very clear in easy words. He is a very picky teacher, and pick on something that I don't think is important. once you get his style of grading,follow it you never get a bad grade! take his CHE340L

Everybody has bad things to say here, I thought he was actually a great teacher.  He does come off a little rough at first, but just talk to him.  He's a nice guy and really knows his stuff.  He's got a very dry sense of humor that I don't think most students appreciate, but I've learned a lot from him.  I would definitely take another class of his

When he explains something, he acts VERY CONDESCENDING.  If you ask a question, he treats you like a child.  He is an EXTREMELY HARSH grader. If you leave out a tiny part - you lose 10 points instantly.  I've always been an A/B student, and I will barely pass this class with a C... AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

rude, mean, and inconsiderate. this man needs to be fired. he deliberately lashes out at students and refuses to help. if you ask him a question he says that he already told you that or to figure it out. DO NOT TAKE HIM

Horrible professor. He was a sub for my actual lab prof and I couldn't stand him. He treated us all like 4 year olds and whenever you asked a question he would give you a look as if to say "you are completely stupid". Don't ever take him if you have a choice. I only had him for 3 weeks, can't imagine a whole semester.

Worst professor i ever had in my life. Not fair doesnt care about students. Always in a bad mood and annoying.Never take him ever for analytical lab. He also have problems as well.I totally recommend that he find another profession other than teaching.

Name: Sherry Tippey
Comment: avoid this professor , she grades way to hard and makes the class harder than it should be. She tends to not explain anything well leaving you to assume and hope for the best. her feedback is very disrespectful half the time as she believes everyone needs help. overall avoid she makes this class hard when it shouldnt be.

While she is a nice person her class is way more difficult than it needs to be. She doesn't do too good of a job explaining assignments or making them easy to understand. Be sure to attend class otherwise you will easily fall behind. The amount of papers and extra parts she adds on to assignments is a bit ridiculous to me.

TERRIBLE teacher. I wouldn't recommend this AWFUL professor to my worst enemy. Assignments are very confusing and she never gives good instruction about what you are actually supposed to do. She cannot grade to save her life and made my college experience 10x worse with her constant nonsense. NEVER take this professor!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Very Boring and doesn't inform class of anything.

She gave great feedback on submitted work, it made revisions for the final draft a breeze. It was her first time using canvas so her page was a confusing mess and easy to get lost in. The whole class was often times confused on what was expected for that day. I got emails after midnight telling me what was expected for the following morning.

One of the worst professors I've had. Her canvas page is messy and a lot of the times the links don't work. The essay topics were bad and she tried to connect them when she didn't need to. Made things ways too complicated and I almost never knew what she wanted of us.

Name: Elizabeth McMillian Mcartney
Comment: This Professor is the worst teacher/professor I've ever had and will have. If you are not the best in math never take a class with her and if you know you have her drop or change the class immediately. She's horrible at teaching, when you have a question she never answers it clearly, gives grades for not important things and grades tests very hard

Two assignments due a day. Very confusing. Textbook is online, wouldn't recommend buying it, I would just buy the Pearson code. There are like 5-6 tests, each question is worth 5 points, so you get credit for trying. Also you can do corrections on every test. She is very strict on attendance, you get points taken off, I skipped two classes.
This class is absolutely terrible, this was a remedial class for me.. I completely changed my major so that I didn't have to take her! I would recommend any other professor, just do NOT take her!

She is a horrible professor. She doesn't help or accommodate to her students needs. If you have disability services she doesn't care and does what she think she should for you. She stares and writes on the board the whole time and basically talks to herself and is confusing. I HIGHLY reccomend getting another professor.

This woman should not be a teacher. I literally couldn't go to class because I knew that I would either be sleeping or trying to pay attention. Her voice is mono tone and she acts as if she doesn't want to be there. She doesn't teach, she's totally dependent on the online material. I should have said this was an online class. I DROPPED!
Worst teacher I've ever had!! Only reason I new anything was from remembering everything from high school.

By far the worse teacher I have ever had! I am farther behind in math now then I was at the beginning of the semester. She rarely explains things, and when she does, she makes no sense of it and gets way off topic. She should not be teaching! I showed up every day and still dont understand what she is saying.
She isn't very helpful and is really confusing. Mymathlab teaches you better than she does.
she teaches way too fast, i couldnt even take notes before the problem would be erased on the board. She is helpful if you dont understand.

I'm no better with math having taken this course, the professor was unhelpful, teaches new material an hour before you take exams, doesn't  explain things well, she even told me that it was no big deal if I didn't pass it because then I would understand it even more the second time around. Don't take her if you value your sanity.

the class was easy because I already knew Algebra. But if I didn't know Algebra, I'm sure I will have failed in her class. Good things: she is innocent. Bad things: boring class, take the grade out with any sill mistake, I'm a great student in Algebra and I didn't get A because she puts X for whole answer if there is a very very small mistake.
Easy class anyways, but even though shes a very nice person she is not very good at explaining math. I never went to class, the online textbook explained things much better than her.

Stupid class, don't attend just do the work online. (Pace Program) She's mean and doesn't help you when you're behind. Although if you do bad on a test or quiz she will go over it with you and change your grade to something higher. Don't take her.

This class was probably the worst experience of my first semester in college. Don't get me wrong, she's a very nice person but her teaching methods weren't the best. She'd lecture non-stop for 2 hours straight. She'd get mad if you had to leave her class even the least bit early. I just wouldn't recommend this class at all
She is a pretty good teacher. She does teacher rather fast sometimes and it does get a bit confusing. For the most part if you attend class regularly and use the resources you will pass.
Very hard, not helpful can be mean. Don't know what she is teaching and give homework everyday

very unhelpful, didn't seem to care about students grasping the material and would just move right along. It's almost as if she got pleasure from watching the students struggle(with a smerk on her face) wish I would have known about Rate my professor before I took the class! Eatton is a huge help!!!
Very poor ability to connect with those behind.

This class is the worst and sucks so much I want to strangle myself and her. I would rather be locked in a room watching barney than go to this class another day! Stop the madness by not going to her class and do something worth your time. I wish I would never had heard of this class or her.
VERY BORING, MEAN, AND UNHELPFUL.  DON'T TAKE HER. PLEASE TAKE PROFESSOR EATON INSTEAD. I AM TELLING YOU NOW....RUN RUN RUN!

Name: Sara Eisenhardt
Comment: She's intimidating at first, but she is not as bad as she seems. She ended up being one of my favorite professors in Pro II. My only criticism is the midterm and final... she chooses random sentences in the textbooks and blanks out random words. They're not multiple choice, it takes about 4-6 hours per test. But they are take home & you have a week

Name: Kristi Martines
Comment: Terrible professor.  Didn't explain material and exams were just a guess. Can't prepare for exams because you have no idea what will be on them.  Very fun person, but should not be a professor.
Doesnt email you back. If she does, its a week later. Notes are from the book. She didn't even include all of the notes for the test. Makes getting an a hard because she is unprepared.

Notes are scattered and straight from the book but she doesn't explain it very well.  Tests have random questions that don't relate to actual material.  There was no explanation of lab, and they don't help you learn the material.  DON'T TAKE HER!  Nice person outside of class, but should not be teaching!  Makes you do her research as well

The course is extremely hard.  Instead of testing general concepts, tests were over minor details.  First quiz had questions from unassigned chapters.  Assignments were confusing as she had two assignments called assignment one and assignment two and if you are like me it would seem assignment one would be due before assignment two but it isn?t.

She loves her job. That is why she is a hard professor. She expects you to have the same passion as she does. Therefore, if you are looking for an easy A, don't take her, but if you want to learn, take this professor.
Very nice person, and very fun, but the lecture was definitely a mess.  You have to be able to sort thru everything to figure out what you really need to know.  It was frustrating.

A good likeable person but not the greatest teacher. Basically, you have to get 90% of the information from the book on your own. She did start posting her complete notes on blackboard but each chapeter consisted of about 20 pages worth of notes. Went through a chapter per class. Class was fun but memorize, memorize, memorize!
I think she is a wonderful teacher.  At least in comparison to the other lab teachers.  She was very helpful for me and she explained things really well before and after labs.

She knows the subject very well and makes the class really interesting. Though the class was challenging, she was really fair and made herself available for those who needed help. Highly recommend the class!

She is really smart, but she expects you to be on the same level as her. She teaches on a level too high for an intro class, and doesn't understand why everyone in the class is having a hard time understanding the material, and especially her tests.
don't take her. Never helps, short on time, busy teacher.

She loved to talk about Anatomy and you could tell that she was really smart. She was a fun teacher to listen to but her tests were very hard and I feel that she thought of herself a lot higher than her students and she never would help us out by letting us know what would be on her tricky tests.

The notes she has is all on powerpoint which makes it easy to follow but she goes through them way too fast, and forget trying to write it all down. You are better off memorizing the entire book. Test were way too difficult, especially for an intro class! Avoid taking her class or else you will be taking this class over again like me!

Avoid!  Uses textbook notes (too lazy to make her own), always has to give pts because of unfair questions on exams, and lab?  Well, lets just say she does NOTHING to help you.  Ignores student emails, and won't see you during office hours.  Always worried about being the next brain surgeon.  F!

Name: Seth Adjei
Comment: He does not know what he is teaching. Data mining is supposed to be an interesting class but none of his lecture was interesting. Covered a lot of things but mostly just read off the slide. Ridiculous biased :D just fire him, i don't know why NKU still have him teaching here. I have learnt nothing from his classes, including DSC101, DSC411, DSC200
RUNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNN! Flat out frustrating.

If you want good grades and want your scholarship just avoid him. I just wanted to let you know that I don't want to mention any other time. Remember that "Professor matters a lot" Best of luck if you are taking his class.
Get ready for this one. 30% of your final grade will be on the final. Fail it, fail the course. Oh, and he doesn't make it easy by any stretch of the imagination.

I had this class in person, if it was online I doubt I would have passed. If I had to do the labs and final project by myself instead of in groups the same also applies. A lot was covered in every lecture but we didn't go too in depth on everything. Definitely have a decent grasp on python beforehand.
WHO LETS THIS GUY TEACH? he doesnt even know what teaching is. reads off slides and doesn't care if you dont understand. he enjoys making things really hard. i hope nku lets him go. DO NOT TAKE!!!!
Fire him now. Worst teacher in NKU computer history. total waste of money....
Terrible, needs to be fired now. A general bad time.
So aweful. hope i never have to run into this horrible teacher ever again.
Ive never been so lost or frustrated in any class at nku. seth has the highest fail rate at nku. avoid at all cost if you can.

Seth takes a hard subject and makes it even harder. He has no flex. Acts like he cares, but zooms right over top of the subject matter to the next thing, regardless if you don't understand. Just horrible.
WORST TEACHER AT NKU! i don't even know where to start. please fire this guy so he doesn't ruin anymore lives. no compassion what so ever.

HORRIBLE! doesnt speak good english. super tough grader. tells you everything will be okay and it will get easier and then makes the class as hard as he can. Tears. Thats All you'll get from his classes. so frustrating.

You will get so frustrated with this professor that you will want to cry. Never met a single student who enjoyed his teaching. all positive reviews on here are most likely the teacher himself. Complete joke. DO NOT TAKE IF YOU CAN AVOID IT!!!!!!

Had a B the whole semester, failed the final (which he made impossible) and ended up getting a D. Totally incompetent teacher. Expect no help, bad explanations, and super difficult work. Grades very harshly and gives no breaks. DO NOT TAKE! Absolutely horrible experience.

I'm not sure who let this guy "teach." he is absolutely horrible. You get no help. Not sure why he has to make the class so complicated. If you have any other options, take it. Avoid him at all costs unless you like wasting your time and money. AVOID! AVOID!
Arbitrary grading practices, sincerely doubt he even understands the lessons he teaches.
Expect an email response or a graded assignment after a month.

Avoid this professor at all costs. Poor communication, makes many errors when grading labs, and sometimes I wonder if he even knows what he is teaching. Took over a month to grade one lab. He even made changes to the final project the day it was due. Save yourself the headache and if you can't find another professor, change your major.

SUPER HARD! Better know scripting and python before this class. He throws material at you so fast that you'll feel (and will be) lost and will forever be behind with the non stop lab and project assignments he gives. Don't except him to do any actual teaching. One of, if not the worst, profs I've ever had. His class sucks, find another teacher!

Name: Aref Bsisu
Comment: Very knowledgeable, interesting lectures, challenging class.

PACE Course-Worst professor I've ever had. Lectures for 12 hour per chapter, expects you to understand from this and just reading. Won't work problems, tells you to "google it" for help. Tests are beyond difficult, he doesn't work the problems on them. Doesn't return tests to you, doesn't grade homework. You have no idea if you're doing it right.

This teacher gives NO FEEDBACK even when requested. He assigned homework that was not graded & we took three three tests which we never saw so we did not know what we missed. His lectures were confusing and when asked to demonstrate, he said "I don't teach that way, read the book".   If possible, find another professor, if not take the class later.

I took this as an 8 week PACE class and it was my worst experience at NKU.  Out of our weekly 3.5 hour classes, he hurried through his lectures and we were rarely, if ever, there past 2 hours.  When students in the class asked questions, they were belittled.  We were told straight up that he would not work through problems on the board.  Terrible!

If you can conceptualize the subject matter through a textbook then you should be fine. If you learn better through being showed problems and someone walking you through them, you won't get that from this guy. He never walked us through any of the problems we were tested on.
If you have the option to take another professor for Finance 305 at NKU, please do!  I took this class in the NKU PACE program for 8 weeks, and there was zero assistance from the professor.

Name: Amira Hollingsworth
Comment: very sweet. often late for class,but is kind and will stay after if you need to make something up. She is good about returning emails. She is helpful if you don't understand something. Id say overall she is a good teacher with a great attitude!

She is a really nice lady. The class is difficult because the language is difficult but she does a pretty good job of teaching it. This is not a class you can just show up to and expect to do well. You must exert some effort and you will do well.

Not the easiest class I have taken but not the hardest. Much easier to learn a language with summer classes which this was. Would recommend if you are serious about learning a language, she is helpful, fun, but expects you to pay attention and try your best to understand.

She obviously knows Arabic, but can she teach it? Not really. I took 2 semesters of Arabic from her and I can say "Hello." I bought a lot of other books and CD's other than the text to try to teach myself because I was learning nothing. She is helpful, but only when she has the time to be. It's a hard class for sure, but somehow i got a B?
The woman is insane. She canceled a dozen classes, but refused to change test dates listed on the syllabus. DO NOT TAKE HER. She is unwilling to help at all.

I think she's great. She is willing to help students understand homework, pronunciation, vocabulary and the textbook. It's important to know that arabic is not an easy language and that's where things get complicated. To learn a new language you have to work hard. Class is fun once she gets to know the group.

Horrible!!! Expects you to be able to take dictation in Arabic only after a couple of weeks. Many times we told her she was going too fast but she did not care and kept piling it on. Over half of the class dropped. Do not take this prof!!!!!!
Entirely too difficult for FRE 102. Very confusing and irrtating. All grading was completely subjective and unfair. Don't take her. Take Klaw instead if you have to take FRE. Otherwise, take SPANISH!

Name: Nan Littleton
Comment: Sucked

I have had Nan for many of my HSR classes. I have never had  better teacher. She is so helpful and truly cares about every single student. She is always willing to answer questions. She is the one thing that I miss about NKU.

Name: Mark Lancaster
Comment: He is a good teacher for people who are good at math. For myself, I am not and basically spent a lot of time in tutoring for this class. He does majority of the work on StatCrunch, but you cannot use that for tests. I do all the work and go to every class and I still might fail.

Professor Lancaster's a great teacher. He isn't a tough grader, and his in class exams are fairly easy. He takes  bit of time to respond to emails and submit grades for the online portion of the exams. Take notes on how he demonstrates how to do things in stat crunch, because they will come in handy for the group labs and the take away exams.

Name: Carol Yzenbaard
Comment: I've seen the other comments and could not disagree more vehemently.  I find her lectures to be unorganized and her manner of speech very distracting.  Most importantly, she answers questions by repeating her original statement and takes a negative tone when the inevitable follow-up question comes.  I would avoid this professor like the plague.
A bit spastic, but she taught the material well. She knows her stuff!

Good teacher, but exam was scary.  She gave us 40 long, bar exam-style multiple choice questions to do in one hour whereas other profs give you 15-20 questions.  I didn't come close to finishing her exam.

Name: Prince Brown
Comment: Dr. Brown is a difficult but wonderful professor who has high expectations for his students.  He is incredibly knowledgeable and enjoys teaching. I thoroughly enjoyed his American Pluralism class and would take him again!
He was really great. His class was pretty difficult. He uses the text everyday. You will have notes, papers, and hard tests but what you learn in his class and from him is worth the hard work.

They still let hime teach here? He is not good at all. Being in his class is a waste of time. He is rude to the students and gets upset when you ask him to explain anything. He actually discourages class discussion. Avoid any class he may be teaching. If you end up taking ine, you will regret it.

Don't waste your time taking any of his classes. He prides himself on forcing students to drop his class. He doesn't explain anything. He assumes you already know everything there is to know about sociology. If you want to learn something about sociology, take another professor, not this one.
Very knowledgable and friendly.  Research and material he teaches is very interesting.  Papers were difficult and test were very hard.
He makes you think. You need to study for his test but they are all scan tron test he will remember you forvere and he will meet with you to talk about problems you are having in class

One of the worst professors at NKU. He doesn't explain anything. He expects you to already know it. He teaches an introductory class as if he were teaching graduate students. DO NOT TAKE ANY OF HIS CLASSES. He is awful.

Name: Jeffrey Stewart
Comment: If this is the right professor (RWC in Winter 2010), his class was quite tough but worth it. Had an overview in the beginning on Labor Theory of Value (Smith>Ricardo>Marx), but then proceeded on with the typical neo-classical economics lectures (macro stuff).  He knows his stuff, and his class forces you to learn.
The class is difficult! The essays are graded from his subjective point of view. You will need to participate every class period to succeed. Don't take him if you want a good grade!

Stewart is awesome, but you have to be ready to work.  He has strong opinions and doesn't mind sharing them, but he grades on the work you do, not your beliefs.  Be warned he will challenge you to think different.

A vile creature. He is condescending and rude. Did nothing but bash Capitalism and quote Marx. I have taken Econ classes and listened to lectures on Marx in the past and enjoyed both. However... his class was in no way educational and far too difficult. His teaching style is ridiculous and counterproductive. Avoid at all costs.
Very hard but very loyal professor. Stick with him through day one and you succeed. Miss class and lectures and your done.
He was horrible I wanted to kill myself. He is a conservative person only likes you if you kiss his bum

This professor was horrible and bias with his views and indoctrinating students to share his alleged disdain for America and that he grades based on an individual's political views. I think he would love to raise karl Marx from the dead.
There are a lot of people who didn't like him in our class.  If you just do the reading he assigns, the study questions, and participate in class, it's not hard.

His grading system is haphazard at best.  Most students received C's for the class. You'll be penalized for papers if you don't tow the Marxian/Socialist line. There's a lot of work and it's not reflected in your grade. U spend most of the course reviewing his PhD thesis. Which is irrelevant to the class topic. If GPA is a concern 4get this guy.

This class was very challenging.  I did not like the fact that we purchased a book that cost over $150 and only used a couple chapters.  His exams cover too much material to have the small amount of questions he has on them.  It was hard for me to prepare for his exams because of the broad spectrum of material we covered.

Very knowledgeable on the subject.  His economic views lean toward Socialism and tend to be anti capitalist so if you're an easily offended conservative don't bother. Be prepared to do a lot of reading from handouts.  Also, a 10 page paper along with a few tests.  U will participate in every class so be prepared. But be warned u will work hard!
Professor did not teach to course objectives. Used class to advance his own political agenda.  Criticizes students beliefs in class, should not be teaching in an MBA program.

The course is labeled "Managerial Econonomics," yet Professor Stewart barely mentioned anything having to do with management. Instead, the course was little more than an attack on capitalist and classical economics and a push for Marxian economics and socialism. The course would have been fine for comparative economics but not for managerial econ.
Very hard!!!!!!!!11

Wow. I took him the semester after 9/11 @ Miami (OH) and he actually led a class discussion about how if Al Gore would have been elected president 9/11 never would have happened. I learned a lot about Macro, but the average grade for our class was a 1.1 out of 4

Horrible teacher, who pushes his views on the class, and insults those who do not agree with him politically.  I even think I lost points on some papers because my political views are the opposite of his.  AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE.

Horrible teacher. Uses class as a political forum for his opinions which he forces on you. Any opposition offered to his opinions is met with insults. Very immature guy that abuses his status as a teacher to convert his student to his ways of thinking under the guise of enlightenment. Made the class alot harder then it should be.

TONS of readings in this class!  Packets & packets.  He knows his economics, but tends to teach his views.  Likes students who participate a lot.  My class was 200 level, but seemed more like a 500 level.

I completely hate this guy. He literally thinks that everyone has 10-15 hours each week (or more)  to read his course material twice and prepare study questions before class & if you don't do it then you must not really want to do well. He's is helpful but only after he's laughed at you or argued with you til you see it his way.

this guy is the hardest teach i have ever had he tries to make an effort to teach but in order to take him as a teach you litterally have to study outside of class over 10 hours a week he is very hardcore when it comes to economics. he also only has on outfit that he wears every week.

Name: Ruth Hemmer
Comment: She is good at explaining complicated biological things. Test are not too difficult if you study. She is pretty uptight about being quiet and leaving early or late entrances but other than that she's pretty helpful. I'd recommend her.

She's disorganized, sometimes makes mistakes in her powerpoints and doesn't realize it until she is lecturing class. I'd recommend taking a laptop to type your notes b/c she goes through them fast. She'll call you out if you try to leave class early, she's very anal. The only good thing is she gives you detailed study guides.
Very unorganized teacher. She can't keep her information straight. I don't recommend her at all.
She seems disorganized. Goes through notes a little too fast sometimes. Gives 3 HW assigments- 2 requ and 1 xtra cred. Very anal. Not a difficult class but I don't highly recommend her.

Took her in her first year as a college professor. Seemed devoted and encouraging. Good notes. Class isn't mandatory but I'd suggest going. Cons: Doesn't post notes on Blackboard, didn't curve grades even when they were really bad, grades homework fairly harsh, and takes TOO LONG to return assignments. Pros: Extra credit, DETAILED Study Guides.

Name: Stephan Groschwitz
Comment: Hated this class. Not sure if it was him or just the class but it was soooo boring. 3 quizzes were basically the exams which were only 10 questions but they are very tricky questions. You must Study!!!1 project paper due at end of semester where you interview a foreign student. This paper was huge toward grade and was very unorganized.
Great dude. Entertaining, but also very interesting.
This guy was an absolute joke. Do not take any of his classes.

Name: Debra Lusczynski-Tarka
Comment: Took her for UNV 101 which is an easy class as is. Some assignments require you to attend campus events, but nothing major. Some quizzes, very manageable. Frequent group work, I received a grade above 100%. Do not use contractions (don't, aren't, couldn't, etc) in your assignments as you will get points deducted. Would take her class again.

Name: Christa Speights
Comment: Nice professor. She's always willing to answer questions and help you when needed. Seems eager to teach and explains thoroughly. Decently lenient and understanding.

This class was HARD. It was especially hard to complete online with a lab. There was a point where I was accused of just plugging numbers into the blanks. That was my snapping point. She finally understood that I really needed help and worked hard to help me. She went above and beyond and met with me on Saturdays, one on one to help me.

Please, do not take AST115 for your gen ed. This class takes so much time each week, pointless assignments take hours, doesn't help that she loves to hand out 0.9 out of 1 point on many assignments, that is just petty. Very unorganized online class, easy to miss things.

I took her online class with the weekly lab. The online class was very disorganized and the quizzes did not match up with the confusing lectures. Tests often covered four or five chapters at once with no study guide. Test questions did not correspond to the lectures. Online lectures did not match the lab. It was way too hard for a gen-ed class.

Do not take this professor. She does not know how to teach. I took her for online and everything was disorganized and hectic. It takes weeks for grades to get put in and she does a bunch of grade changes during finals week when you cant do anything to fix it. Unless you are majoring in astronomy avoid her & this class. crazy hard for entry level.

This was an online course. Was not organized at all. Quizzes had didn't match her lectures at all. tests were hard and no study guides were ever given. went over 5 chapters in three weeks. completely disorganized. nothing we learned in the online lectures correlated with the labs that we had once a week. online course was super disorganized

I took her online class and in class lab. This class was the biggest joke. Her lectures made absolutely no sense. We would get tested over material and then learn it the next week. Half her assignments don't work. My best advice, unless you're going into astronomy, do not take this professor and do not take astronomy at all.
Christa was very eager to help students understand physics. I don't know why these other people gave her such a bad rating, I thought she was great

Awful professor! She never came prepared for class, never did what she said she would and she made everything so much more confusing than it had to be! I could look up an equation online and just use it to solve a problem. She tries to make you ge through 20 steps for one easy problem! Will not take her again if I can help it.

Going in to this class, I knew I would have my work cut out for me and was fully prepared for that. From the very first class, we all knew this professor was no where near qualified to be teaching this course. She was very unorganized with labs, paperwork, and lectures. She didn't know how to teach the subject. Avoid this professor at all costs!!

Name: Mary Jacobs
Comment: She is super nice, but just very unclear while using the book. Also, she grades pretty harsh.

Easy class made difficult. If you are not one of her favorites you are going no where in her class. She grades very hard!! If you need help with something go to her. Good luck if you are in her class!
WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD! BASICALLY IF SHE DOESNT LIKE YOU THEN YOUR GOING TO FAIL! SHE DOESNT GRADE FAIRLY AT ALL! DO NOT TAKE HER!!

Professor Jacobs was very moody and ALWAYS had an attitude. She challenges your intellect if she sees that you are of higher learning, she takes off points without giving clear,concise reasons, she gives you the grade that "she" feels that you should have. She made it seem like I NEEDED her class when I really did not, I feel like I wasted my time.

She is a very hard teacher. She is a good teacher and you do actually learn in her class. She helps you if you have questions and she will check up on you if your not doing so great in her class. She can sometimes seem unapproachable, but she is not. She takes no crap and she does prepare you for the next level and college.

ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE! Do not take! Unfair grading, takes points off for stuff she never told you about. Treats 101 like it's a 300 level course. Can't explain one bit, and homework every class. Let me repeat DO NOT TAKE!
Aweful! I did not have a good experience, and she's not very helpful when you ask her for help, and she's not very understanding and doesnt except excuses for anything!
She was extremely strict on due dates, no leeway, you do it her way or she will fail you. If you're having trouble, get help, or you will fail. Assignments everyday, finals are research papers.
Kicked me out of class for saying "he told me to lie down on the bed"
not a friendly person at all.

Name: Eric Chatterjeep
Comment: So I would just like to say that I took this class TWICE!! I am currently taking it for the second time and Eric is a terrible professor. He doesn't seem to care about the students at all , he's not very pleasing to talk to. The class is sort of tough for a 200 level class there is 1 test at the end and a huge 35 page script final.

Not a great professor. Seems to be doing this as his "other" job. Dislikes interacting with students. Surprisingly difficult for a low level course and in a trite way, not a challenging way. Avoid him and take one of Chris Strobel's classes, he's a far better, nicer professor.

He is different but in a good way.In his class we had to write a movie script.It takes up alot of time but it's not really that hard.He gives at the end a 100 question test that sucks because you don't have any tests other then that.But I wouldn't ever NOT recommend him to someone.Just takes time to write a script!

Name: Elizabeth McMillan-Mccartney
Comment: This professor was usually 10 to 20 minutes late to class. She would hand out roughly 5 to 10 handouts per class and graded you on keeping track of them. She is disrespectful to students when they ask questions and moves too fast without actually teaching. I should have taken an online course. MyMathLab is where I had to teach myself.

This professor does not move slowly enough for anyone in this course. This course is made for people who are not strong at math at all,  and she treats it like this class is our major. It is very hard to stay for the full time because she drags on and will hop from material to material, without giving anytime for it to soak in.

Math is not my strong suit so I do have to work harder to understand the material. With her it is nearly impossible. She talks & goes through the material way too fast. If you politely ask her to wait she gets irritated. I have A's & B's in other classes and I'm a double major so it's not that I'm incapable of comprehending. It's her teaching style

During a class she told me to shut up because I was the only student answering and she got "annoyed" when I answered. I am not terrible at math and I knew how to do everything but she actually confused me. She has no organization and she moves way to fast even though we tell her. She will work with you and is very nice just not a good professor.
I have trouble with math already, and she is not helpful. She goes through the material way too fast and barely explains anything.
Don't take this class just because they suggest it for people not strong in math. It's 98% riddles and I still don't know where the math comes in

She moves from subject to subject quickly which doesn't help when you already don't understand the subject. She also doesnt use Blackboard. She also has these lame and corny jokes she puts on papers. She doesn't have any style and her hair is a hot mess also. She is basically lame!!

Dislike this teacher very much. Almost every student in the class I was in dropped it. Does not go through material at all. Rushes through things and will not explain well. When asked how to do things she has replied "maybe you should come to class" when only a day has been missed. Worst math teacher to have. Do not take her class.

She's generally a good teacher.  She doesn't really seem to handle questions well and you have to coax a "yes or no" out of her.  She's very, very willing to give extra credit though so if you need E.C. then you're in luck.  She's fair as well and quite nice. If you're nice to her, she'll be nice to you.

Name: Rick Breault
Comment: Doesn't respond to emails, has no ability to think on his feet, doesn't stick to the syllabus.  Halfway through the semester he changed the final project, yet didn't give us a rubric until after he graded our projects.  He gets very defensive when he knows he has been proven wrong. Not the best person to be teaching assessment; his lectures ramble.

If you can avoid taking him, then please do.  He does not respond to emails, he does not set clear expectations.  If you ask him a question, he gives you a very broad response.  He has issues sticking to the syllabus, and his lectures are just kind of rambling.

Name: Thomas David Baxter
Comment: Easily the worst professor I've had in 147 cumulative credit hours! Extremely unprofessional. Thoroughly understands respiratory therapy care/science but, is just down right horrible at teaching, grading and giving helpful guidance or feedback. Don't worry though, he manipulates grades to make sure every student passes to make himself look good.

You can ask for help, but it might be a while before you receive feedback and it probably won't be clear. The assignments are interesting and he grades fairly. I would recommend taking him, but expect to write a lot! I would average about 8 papers (including long discussion boards) a week for this class.

Name: Laura Canter
Comment: tests are pretty difficult, complicated questions that can be hard to understand. grades labs very easily. 100 points though if you just show up to class. tests are in person but online so bring laptop.

Name: Adam Funk
Comment: Awful. The first exam was roughly 28 essay/short answer questions. Each lecture is a completely new topic from presentations created by other people. He does not respond to emails. We took the 2nd exam at the beginning of November and he has yet to grade it. We have our final exam in 3 days. The director of the program had to come in and help us.

Do not take this professor.  He will post assignments less than 24 hours before the due date.  He is condescending in emails.  He does not teach the material, and he will not answer basic questions with any level of clarity.

Dr. Funk doesn't post assignments until less than 24hrs before they are due. Expects us to take two hours to read a journal article and answer questions about it, but usually won't upload the assignment/the reading until the day before the assignment is due.

Does not actually teach anything. All of the tests are about the readings and discussions from the readings that he leads. The test questions are supposed to be objective but if you don't put exactly what he wants you won't pass. The main focus is the Mayerson project and no real guidance is given

AVOID THIS PROFESSOR IF YOU TAKE NEU-101!!!! he talks about everything besides the material. Group project called mayerson thats all he focuses then throws an exam at you. doesnt go over the powerpoint material you have to learn on your own. Grades very hardly with little assignments given. overall avoid this class and professor at all costs!!!!!

Name: Beverly Lawry
Comment: Lawry is strict. She said she wanted a copy of the funeral card to count you as absent.
one of the worst classes. Very boring and a lot of work. Not hard work but it is hard to go to class and staying awake

Name: Julie Kunselman
Comment: She grades really hard. I changed the way I did every assignment by taking her advice and she always found multiple things wrong with my work. She wasn't helpful at all and the videos she provided were very short and did not have much info in them. The power points did not help at all.

Material was challenging, especially the theory and models, but I learned a lot. Use of videos, audio, power point, and discussions were great. Lots of interaction. I would definitely take another class with Dr. Kunselman.

Do not take Dr. Kunselman's course. Awful professor. The book is very hard to understand/comprehend and she provides only power-points to supplement her teachings. The power-points have no information about the chapters. She also grades very very very hard. WARNING!!!

Name: Joan Simunic
Comment: HORRIBLE experience with her. Do not take her you will regret it. She doesn't know what she is talking about, expects a lot of work, isn't able to answer questions clearly, very unorganized, loses papers ALL the time and takes weeks to respond to e mails if you're LUCKY. Most of the time she never responds. I repeat do not take her.

I absolutely dread coming to this class. She barely teaches, had to have OPEN NOTE TESTS because she knew we wouldn't pass the tests and I STILL GOT Ds. This class was one of the worst experiences of college yet. I wish I dropped this class when I could.
Dr. Simunic doesn't teach, she gives speeches using powerpoint and from there you are on your own. Frustration and misery await the next batch of her students.

Although i took her during her first semester teaching, i STRONGLY suggest not taking her. Work is abundant and help is practically absent.Expects the class to know what to do despite her not even remotely attempting to teach the subject. Grading is inconsistent.

Absolutely terrible. She doesn't teach AT all, nor does she explain the lab you're about to do.  A lot of out of class work is expected, and this is only for the lab! But don't expect her to keep track of it either. So unhelpful and unorganized. She creates the most complex, ridiculous examples for your very simple questions. Do not take her.
She is literally the most unhelpful professor I have ever taken. She does not answer questions or clarify questions when you ask her. I DO NOT recommend this professor.

DO NOT TAKE! I took her for lab she is extremely unhelpful and when asked a direct question she contractidicts her answers. Your pretty much on your on to learn the lab. Also will take of points for the most random reasons impossible to receive 100%.

Name: julie morrill
Comment: Super harsh grader for a foundations course and her feedback was inconsistent with the grade at best. She would write "Great Job" on the comments but then give low C grades. She heavily enforced a strict attendance policy of only 2 absenses or you will do terrible. Wouldn't take her class again unless it was absolutely required. Decent chef tho.

This professor wasn't for me. I thought she graded to harshly for a intro art class or "foundations" class. She also never really gave any good feedback and didn't help me grow my skills. I would not take this professor again if I didn't have to.

I wish I could give a zero. I've had my fair share of bad teachers, but Julie is beyond the worst that I've had ever. She grades way too harsh for just a foundations art class. She also doesn't give any good feedback on what you can do better, and has really bad explanations on why she gave you the grade she did. She makes people feel really bad.
Very passive aggressive and seems biased with certain students. Assignment instructions can be unclear but then she grades harshly.
Grades based on if she likes you or not. Doesn't grade on work quality.

Does not give clear assignment criteria, then grades harsh. Poor feedback, bullies/intimidates students. Purpose of teaching was a power grab. Has no intention of helping students learn or grow. Inequal time per critiques. Does not house a comfortable or safe environment. Learned more about her private chef life in Hawaii than any art techniques.

Told me I would never recover from being five minutes late to class, reason I switched my major, wasted so much class time with pointless two hour lectures, very rude to students, appears uninterested in art topics. Overall super rude and made my life a living hell.
She grades to harsh but doesn't give any good feedback. Also doesn't help students get prepared for the more advanced classes later on in their college career.

She doesn't explain assignments very well and when she does, it's very long and drawn out and takes away a lot of class time. The class is meant to be three hours, but she waste majority of the time doing a two hour presentation and leaves the rest of the class with one hour to work on assignments. She also sucks at giving feedback on assignments.

Vague with assignment criteria, harsh with grades. Strict with attendance to point of students showing up sick to avoid their grade getting docked beyond repair. Told me I would "never recover" when I had missed an assignment, which was false. I'm only in this class for the prereq I need.

Name: Bruce Smith
Comment: For a class that is mandatory, he made it so much more difficult than it needed to be. The grading was ridiculous and he was so harsh on timing your speeches. If you went 3 seconds over there was an automatic 10 point deduction. Personally, I didn't learn much except to time my speeches better.

Name: Martha  Ferguson
Comment: SHE RETEACHES THINGS BECAUSE SHE TAUGHT THEM WRONG THE FIRST TIME!!!

Name: Hannah Bergren
Comment: Try to avoid.

Never take her unless ABSOLUTELY necessary.  She'll take off points if you don't write in complete sentences, put a period at the end of sentences, etc. and you rarely understand what you're going to lose points for until you actually start taking the assessments. Impossible to get an A with her, expect B+ at absolute best.

I would do my absolute hardest to avoid her. You will save yourself so much stress and time. It's hard to stay afloat when grading is based on extreme technicalities - points are deducted for punctuation and everything must be written in complete sentences to receive credit. Never seen a force working against students when they're trying so hard.

She did not do a very good job of explaining the material that we were covering. She is a HARSH grader, and you must show EVERY step you do or you will not get credit at all. Just be warned, and if you can avoid taking her, I would avoid it at all costs.

Bergren has trouble making material clear from her lectures. However, she is more than happy to meet with you during office hours or any time you need help. The class is what you make of it; if you know the material, you'll do well. If not, you'll struggle. Lots of quizzes and lots of exams, but she gives a review sheet the week before the exam

Name: Yong Xue
Comment: DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!! JUST DON'T!!!!

Just to list a few things he has said to me and other students, “you should know this already” “ if you don't understand study” “talk to your team members if you don't understand, i can't help you”. He just assumes everyone is good at physics and should understand everything.

let me list off some things that were said during the lectures, "you should know how to do this already", "you shouldn't be asking me that question", "just by looking at this question, I already know what to do". Smart but cant teach the material to you. Labs are a joke. Extra credit is practically nonexistent. Avoid if possible.

Professor Xue has clear material, but the material taught in lecture does not match any of the questions on the homework. He is very intelligent but doesn't know how to help students and makes students feel bad when they don't know the answer. He back tracks a lot in class and his labs are fairly difficult to do unless he is doing it himself.

Name: Threasa Wesley
Comment: Assignments are fairly straightforward, but are spaced very closely together, so you constantly have to rush through them. Her lectures and assignments are jargon-filled, which makes them confusing and unnecessarily difficult to read. She frequently has errors on tests, so be prepared to re-check your test after it has been graded.

Name: J. Lilly
Comment: He is very rude when you as a question. Not clear on directions. Exam every week, homework every week. A lot of reading, mostly really hard to talk to professor.

Name: Jen Stansbury Koenig
Comment: This instructor is the worst teacher that  I have ever had. As a Masters student who has a professional job I could not believe how unprofessional the teacher was. She is rude and unresponsive to your needs. When students would ask clarifying questions she became argumentative and downright rude. I would not recommend this class or this instructor.

She is not a teacher of Program Eval, she is a facilitator of TED talks. This is why I'm paying NKU tuition? She is condescending to students, uses absurdly complicated grading rubrics, and provides students with so much pointless busy work you would think it was an 8th grade classroom. AVOID her unless you like a lot of work with little return.
